Bug Summary

File:eval.c
Location:line 6960, column 1
Description:Null pointer passed as an argument to a 'nonnull' parameter

93#define DICT_MAXNEST100 100 /* maximum nesting of lists and dicts */
94
95#define DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999 99999 /* refcount for dict or list that should not
96 be freed. */

98#define AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#' '#' /* Character used as separator in autoload
99 function/variable names. */
100
101/*
102 * Structure returned by get_lval() and used by set_var_lval().
103 * For a plain name:
104 * "name" points to the variable name.
105 * "exp_name" is NULL.
106 * "tv" is NULL
107 * For a magic braces name:
108 * "name" points to the expanded variable name.
109 * "exp_name" is non-NULL, to be freed later.
110 * "tv" is NULL
111 * For an index in a list:
112 * "name" points to the (expanded) variable name.
113 * "exp_name" NULL or non-NULL, to be freed later.
114 * "tv" points to the (first) list item value
115 * "li" points to the (first) list item
116 * "range", "n1", "n2" and "empty2" indicate what items are used.
117 * For an existing Dict item:
118 * "name" points to the (expanded) variable name.
119 * "exp_name" NULL or non-NULL, to be freed later.
120 * "tv" points to the dict item value
121 * "newkey" is NULL
122 * For a non-existing Dict item:
123 * "name" points to the (expanded) variable name.
124 * "exp_name" NULL or non-NULL, to be freed later.
125 * "tv" points to the Dictionary typval_T
126 * "newkey" is the key for the new item.
127 */
128typedef struct lval_S {
129 char_u *ll_name; /* start of variable name (can be NULL) */
130 char_u *ll_exp_name; /* NULL or expanded name in allocated memory. */
131 typval_T *ll_tv; /* Typeval of item being used. If "newkey"
132 isn't NULL it's the Dict to which to add
133 the item. */
134 listitem_T *ll_li; /* The list item or NULL. */
135 list_T *ll_list; /* The list or NULL. */
136 int ll_range; /* TRUE when a [i:j] range was used */
137 long ll_n1; /* First index for list */
138 long ll_n2; /* Second index for list range */
139 int ll_empty2; /* Second index is empty: [i:] */
140 dict_T *ll_dict; /* The Dictionary or NULL */
141 dictitem_T *ll_di; /* The dictitem or NULL */
142 char_u *ll_newkey; /* New key for Dict in alloc. mem or NULL. */
143} lval_T;
144
145/// Structure defining state for read_from_list()
146typedef struct {
147 const listitem_T *li; ///< Item currently read.
148 size_t offset; ///< Byte offset inside the read item.
149 size_t li_length; ///< Length of the string inside the read item.
150} ListReaderState;
151

168static char *e_funcref = N_("E718: Funcref required")"E718: Funcref required";

170static char *e_letwrong = N_("E734: Wrong variable type for %s=")"E734: Wrong variable type for %s=";
171static char *e_nofunc = N_("E130: Unknown function: %s")"E130: Unknown function: %s";
172static char *e_illvar = N_("E461: Illegal variable name: %s")"E461: Illegal variable name: %s";
173static char *e_float_as_string = N_("E806: using Float as a String")"E806: using Float as a String";

180/*
181 * Old Vim variables such as "v:version" are also available without the "v:".
182 * Also in functions. We need a special hashtable for them.
183 */
184static hashtab_T compat_hashtab;

186/*
187 * When recursively copying lists and dicts we need to remember which ones we
188 * have done to avoid endless recursiveness. This unique ID is used for that.
189 * The last bit is used for previous_funccal, ignored when comparing.
190 */
191static int current_copyID = 0;
192#define COPYID_INC2 2
193#define COPYID_MASK(~0x1) (~0x1)
194
195/// Abort conversion to string after a recursion error.
196static bool_Bool did_echo_string_emsg = false0;

198/*
199 * Array to hold the hashtab with variables local to each sourced script.
200 * Each item holds a variable (nameless) that points to the dict_T.
201 */
202typedef struct {
203 dictitem_T sv_var;
204 dict_T sv_dict;
205} scriptvar_T;
206
207static garray_T ga_scripts = {0, 0, sizeof(scriptvar_T *), 4, NULL((void*)0)};
208#define SCRIPT_SV(id)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(id) - 1]) (((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(id) - 1])
209#define SCRIPT_VARS(id)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(id) - 1])->sv_dict
.dv_hashtab) (SCRIPT_SV(id)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(id) - 1])->sv_dict.dv_hashtab)

213/* Values for trans_function_name() argument: */
214#define TFN_INT1 1 /* internal function name OK */
215#define TFN_QUIET2 2 /* no error messages */
216#define TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD4 4 /* do not use script autoloading */
217

220#define GLV_NO_AUTOLOAD4 TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD4 /* do not use script autoloading */

223#define FC_ABORT1 1 /* abort function on error */
224#define FC_RANGE2 2 /* function accepts range */
225#define FC_DICT4 4 /* Dict function, uses "self" */

231static dict_T *first_dict = NULL((void*)0); /* list of all dicts */

234#define FUNCARG(fp, j)((char_u **)(fp->uf_args.ga_data))[j] ((char_u **)(fp->uf_args.ga_data))[j]
235#define FUNCLINE(fp, j)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[j] ((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[j]

237#define VAR_SHORT_LEN20 20 /* short variable name length */
238#define FIXVAR_CNT12 12 /* number of fixed variables */
239
240/* structure to hold info for a function that is currently being executed. */
241typedef struct funccall_S funccall_T;
242
243struct funccall_S {
244 ufunc_T *func; /* function being called */
245 int linenr; /* next line to be executed */
246 int returned; /* ":return" used */
247 struct /* fixed variables for arguments */
248 {
249 dictitem_T var; /* variable (without room for name) */
250 char_u room[VAR_SHORT_LEN20]; /* room for the name */
251 } fixvar[FIXVAR_CNT12];
252 dict_T l_vars; /* l: local function variables */
253 dictitem_T l_vars_var; /* variable for l: scope */
254 dict_T l_avars; /* a: argument variables */
255 dictitem_T l_avars_var; /* variable for a: scope */
256 list_T l_varlist; /* list for a:000 */
257 listitem_T l_listitems[MAX_FUNC_ARGS20]; /* listitems for a:000 */
258 typval_T *rettv; /* return value */
259 linenr_T breakpoint; /* next line with breakpoint or zero */
260 int dbg_tick; /* debug_tick when breakpoint was set */
261 int level; /* top nesting level of executed function */
262 proftime_T prof_child; /* time spent in a child */
263 funccall_T *caller; /* calling function or NULL */
264};
265
266/*
267 * Info used by a ":for" loop.
268 */
269typedef struct {
270 int fi_semicolon; /* TRUE if ending in '; var]' */
271 int fi_varcount; /* nr of variables in the list */
272 listwatch_T fi_lw; /* keep an eye on the item used. */
273 list_T *fi_list; /* list being used */
274} forinfo_T;

276/*
277 * Struct used by trans_function_name()
278 */
279typedef struct {
280 dict_T *fd_dict; /* Dictionary used */
281 char_u *fd_newkey; /* new key in "dict" in allocated memory */
282 dictitem_T *fd_di; /* Dictionary item used */
283} funcdict_T;

285/*
286 * enum used by var_flavour()
287 */
288typedef enum {
289 VAR_FLAVOUR_DEFAULT, /* doesn't start with uppercase */
290 VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION, /* starts with uppercase, some lower */
291 VAR_FLAVOUR_SHADA /* all uppercase */
292} var_flavour_T;

294/* values for vv_flags: */
295#define VV_COMPAT1 1 /* compatible, also used without "v:" */
296#define VV_RO2 2 /* read-only */
297#define VV_RO_SBX4 4 /* read-only in the sandbox */
298
299#define VV_NAME(s, t)s, {{t, 0, {0}}, 0, {0}}, {0} s, {{t, 0, {0}}, 0, {0}}, {0}
300
301// Array to hold the value of v: variables.
302// The value is in a dictitem, so that it can also be used in the v: scope.
303// The reason to use this table anyway is for very quick access to the
304// variables with the VV_ defines.
305static struct vimvar {
306 char *vv_name; /* name of variable, without v: */
307 dictitem_T vv_di; /* value and name for key */
308 char vv_filler[16]; /* space for LONGEST name below!!! */
309 char vv_flags; /* VV_COMPAT, VV_RO, VV_RO_SBX */
310} vimvars[VV_LEN] =
311{
312 /*
313 * The order here must match the VV_ defines in eval.h!
314 * Initializing a union does not work, leave tv.vval empty to get zero's.
315 */

385#define vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number

393#define vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab vimvardict.dv_hashtab

395typedef struct {
396 union {
397 LibuvProcess uv;
398 PtyProcess pty;
399 } proc;
400 Stream in, out, err;
401 Terminal *term;
402 bool_Bool stopped;
403 bool_Bool exited;
404 int refcount;
405 ufunc_T *on_stdout, *on_stderr, *on_exit;
406 dict_T *self;
407 int *status_ptr;
408 uint64_t id;
409 Queue *events;
410} TerminalJobData;
411
412typedef struct dict_watcher {
413 ufunc_T *callback;
414 char *key_pattern;
415 QUEUE node;
416 bool_Bool busy; // prevent recursion if the dict is changed in the callback
417} DictWatcher;
418
419/// Structure representing current VimL to messagepack conversion state
420typedef struct {
421 enum {
422 kMPConvDict, ///< Convert dict_T *dictionary.
423 kMPConvList, ///< Convert list_T *list.
424 kMPConvPairs, ///< Convert mapping represented as a list_T* of pairs.
425 } type;
426 union {
427 struct {
428 dict_T *dict; ///< Currently converted dictionary.
429 hashitem_T *hi; ///< Currently converted dictionary item.
430 size_t todo; ///< Amount of items left to process.
431 } d; ///< State of dictionary conversion.
432 struct {
433 list_T *list; ///< Currently converted list.
434 listitem_T *li; ///< Currently converted list item.
435 } l; ///< State of list or generic mapping conversion.
436 } data; ///< Data to convert.
437} MPConvStackVal;
438
439/// Stack used to convert VimL values to messagepack.
440typedef kvec_t(MPConvStackVal)struct { size_t size, capacity; MPConvStackVal *items; } MPConvStack;
441
442typedef struct {
443 TerminalJobData *data;
444 ufunc_T *callback;
445 const char *type;
446 list_T *received;
447 int status;
448} JobEvent;
449
450#ifdef INCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS1
451# include "eval.c.generated.h"
452#endif
453
454#define FNE_INCL_BR1 1 /* find_name_end(): include [] in name */
455#define FNE_CHECK_START2 2 /* find_name_end(): check name starts with
456 valid character */
457static uint64_t current_job_id = 1;
458static PMap(uint64_t)Map_uint64_t_ptr_t *jobs = NULL((void*)0);
459
460typedef enum {
461 kMPNil,
462 kMPBoolean,
463 kMPInteger,
464 kMPFloat,
465 kMPString,
466 kMPBinary,
467 kMPArray,
468 kMPMap,
469 kMPExt,
470} MessagePackType;
471static const char *const msgpack_type_names[] = {
472 [kMPNil] = "nil",
473 [kMPBoolean] = "boolean",
474 [kMPInteger] = "integer",
475 [kMPFloat] = "float",
476 [kMPString] = "string",
477 [kMPBinary] = "binary",
478 [kMPArray] = "array",
479 [kMPMap] = "map",
480 [kMPExt] = "ext",
481};
482static const list_T *msgpack_type_lists[] = {
483 [kMPNil] = NULL((void*)0),
484 [kMPBoolean] = NULL((void*)0),
485 [kMPInteger] = NULL((void*)0),
486 [kMPFloat] = NULL((void*)0),
487 [kMPString] = NULL((void*)0),
488 [kMPBinary] = NULL((void*)0),
489 [kMPArray] = NULL((void*)0),
490 [kMPMap] = NULL((void*)0),
491 [kMPExt] = NULL((void*)0),
492};
493
494/*
495 * Initialize the global and v: variables.
496 */
497void eval_init(void)
498{
499 jobs = pmap_new(uint64_t)map_uint64_t_ptr_t_new();
500 int i;
501 struct vimvar *p;
502
503 init_var_dict(&globvardict, &globvars_var, VAR_DEF_SCOPE2);
504 init_var_dict(&vimvardict, &vimvars_var, VAR_SCOPE1);
505 vimvardict.dv_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
506 hash_init(&compat_hashtab);
507 hash_init(&func_hashtab);
508
509 for (i = 0; i < VV_LEN; ++i) {
510 p = &vimvars[i];
511 STRCPY(p->vv_di.di_key, p->vv_name)strcpy((char *)(p->vv_di.di_key), (char *)(p->vv_name));
512 if (p->vv_flags & VV_RO2)
513 p->vv_di.di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
514 else if (p->vv_flags & VV_RO_SBX4)
515 p->vv_di.di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO_SBX2 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
516 else
517 p->vv_di.di_flags = DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
518
519 /* add to v: scope dict, unless the value is not always available */
520 if (p->vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0)
521 hash_add(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, p->vv_di.di_key);
522 if (p->vv_flags & VV_COMPAT1)
523 /* add to compat scope dict */
524 hash_add(&compat_hashtab, p->vv_di.di_key);
525 }
526
527 dict_T *const msgpack_types_dict = dict_alloc();
528 for (size_t i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(msgpack_type_names)((sizeof(msgpack_type_names)/sizeof((msgpack_type_names)[0]))
/ ((size_t)(!(sizeof(msgpack_type_names) % sizeof((msgpack_type_names
)[0]))))); i++) {
529 list_T *const type_list = list_alloc();
530 type_list->lv_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
531 type_list->lv_refcount = 1;
532 dictitem_T *const di = dictitem_alloc((char_u *) msgpack_type_names[i]);
533 di->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
534 di->di_tv = (typval_T) {
535 .v_type = VAR_LIST4,
536 .vval = { .v_list = type_list, },
537 };
538 msgpack_type_lists[i] = type_list;
539 if (dict_add(msgpack_types_dict, di) == FAIL0) {
540 // There must not be duplicate items in this dictionary by definition.
541 assert(false)((0) ? (void) (0) : __assert_fail ("0", "/home/travis/build/neovim/bot-ci/build/neovim/src/nvim/eval.c"
, 541, __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
542 }
543 }
544 msgpack_types_dict->dv_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
545
546 set_vim_var_dict(VV_MSGPACK_TYPES, msgpack_types_dict);
547 set_vim_var_dict(VV_COMPLETED_ITEM, dict_alloc());
548 set_vim_var_list(VV_ERRORS, list_alloc());
549 set_vim_var_nr(VV_SEARCHFORWARD, 1L);
550 set_vim_var_nr(VV_HLSEARCH, 1L);
551 set_reg_var(0); /* default for v:register is not 0 but '"' */
552}
553
554#if defined(EXITFREE)
555void eval_clear(void)
556{
557 struct vimvar *p;
558
559 for (int i = 0; i < VV_LEN; ++i) {
560 p = &vimvars[i];
561 if (p->vv_di.di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2) {
562 xfree(p->vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string);
563 p->vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
564 } else if (p->vv_di.di_tv.v_type == VAR_LIST4) {
565 list_unref(p->vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list);
566 p->vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list = NULL((void*)0);
567 }
568 }
569 hash_clear(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab);
570 hash_init(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab); /* garbage_collect() will access it */
571 hash_clear(&compat_hashtab);
572
573 free_scriptnames();
574 free_locales();
575
576 /* global variables */
577 vars_clear(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab);
578
579 /* autoloaded script names */
580 ga_clear_strings(&ga_loaded);
581
582 /* Script-local variables. First clear all the variables and in a second
583 * loop free the scriptvar_T, because a variable in one script might hold
584 * a reference to the whole scope of another script. */
585 for (int i = 1; i <= ga_scripts.ga_len; ++i)
586 vars_clear(&SCRIPT_VARS(i)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1])->sv_dict.
dv_hashtab));
587 for (int i = 1; i <= ga_scripts.ga_len; ++i)
588 xfree(SCRIPT_SV(i)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1]));
589 ga_clear(&ga_scripts);
590
591 /* unreferenced lists and dicts */
592 (void)garbage_collect();
593
594 /* functions */
595 free_all_functions();
596 hash_clear(&func_hashtab);
597}
598
599#endif
600
601/*
602 * Return the name of the executed function.
603 */
604char_u *func_name(void *cookie)
605{
606 return ((funccall_T *)cookie)->func->uf_name;
607}
608
609/*
610 * Return the address holding the next breakpoint line for a funccall cookie.
611 */
612linenr_T *func_breakpoint(void *cookie)
613{
614 return &((funccall_T *)cookie)->breakpoint;
615}
616
617/*
618 * Return the address holding the debug tick for a funccall cookie.
619 */
620int *func_dbg_tick(void *cookie)
621{
622 return &((funccall_T *)cookie)->dbg_tick;
623}
624
625/*
626 * Return the nesting level for a funccall cookie.
627 */
628int func_level(void *cookie)
629{
630 return ((funccall_T *)cookie)->level;
631}
632
633/* pointer to funccal for currently active function */
634funccall_T *current_funccal = NULL((void*)0);
635
636/* pointer to list of previously used funccal, still around because some
637 * item in it is still being used. */
638funccall_T *previous_funccal = NULL((void*)0);
639
640/*
641 * Return TRUE when a function was ended by a ":return" command.
642 */
643int current_func_returned(void)
644{
645 return current_funccal->returned;
646}
647
648/*
649 * Set an internal variable to a string value. Creates the variable if it does
650 * not already exist.
651 */
652void set_internal_string_var(char_u *name, char_u *value)
653{
654 char_u *val = vim_strsave(value);
655 typval_T *tvp = xcalloc(1, sizeof(typval_T));
656
657 tvp->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
658 tvp->vval.v_string = val;
659 set_var(name, tvp, FALSE0);
660 free_tv(tvp);
661}
662
663static lval_T *redir_lval = NULL((void*)0);
664static garray_T redir_ga; /* only valid when redir_lval is not NULL */
665static char_u *redir_endp = NULL((void*)0);
666static char_u *redir_varname = NULL((void*)0);
667
668/*
669 * Start recording command output to a variable
670 * Returns OK if successfully completed the setup. FAIL otherwise.
671 */
672int
673var_redir_start (
674 char_u *name,
675 int append /* append to an existing variable */
676)
677{
678 int save_emsg;
679 int err;
680 typval_T tv;
681
682 /* Catch a bad name early. */
683 if (!eval_isnamec1(*name)) {
684 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
685 return FAIL0;
686 }
687
688 /* Make a copy of the name, it is used in redir_lval until redir ends. */
689 redir_varname = vim_strsave(name);
690
691 redir_lval = xcalloc(1, sizeof(lval_T));
692
693 /* The output is stored in growarray "redir_ga" until redirection ends. */
694 ga_init(&redir_ga, (int)sizeof(char), 500);
695
696 /* Parse the variable name (can be a dict or list entry). */
697 redir_endp = get_lval(redir_varname, NULL((void*)0), redir_lval, FALSE0, FALSE0, 0,
698 FNE_CHECK_START2);
699 if (redir_endp == NULL((void*)0) || redir_lval->ll_name == NULL((void*)0) || *redir_endp !=
700 NUL'\000') {
701 clear_lval(redir_lval);
702 if (redir_endp != NULL((void*)0) && *redir_endp != NUL'\000')
703 /* Trailing characters are present after the variable name */
704 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
705 else
706 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
707 redir_endp = NULL((void*)0); /* don't store a value, only cleanup */
708 var_redir_stop();
709 return FAIL0;
710 }
711
712 /* check if we can write to the variable: set it to or append an empty
713 * string */
714 save_emsg = did_emsg;
715 did_emsg = FALSE0;
716 tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
717 tv.vval.v_string = (char_u *)"";
718 if (append)
719 set_var_lval(redir_lval, redir_endp, &tv, TRUE1, (char_u *)".");
720 else
721 set_var_lval(redir_lval, redir_endp, &tv, TRUE1, (char_u *)"=");
722 clear_lval(redir_lval);
723 err = did_emsg;
724 did_emsg |= save_emsg;
725 if (err) {
726 redir_endp = NULL((void*)0); /* don't store a value, only cleanup */
727 var_redir_stop();
728 return FAIL0;
729 }
730
731 return OK1;
732}
733
734/*
735 * Append "value[value_len]" to the variable set by var_redir_start().
736 * The actual appending is postponed until redirection ends, because the value
737 * appended may in fact be the string we write to, changing it may cause freed
738 * memory to be used:
739 * :redir => foo
740 * :let foo
741 * :redir END
742 */
743void var_redir_str(char_u *value, int value_len)
744{
745 int len;
746
747 if (redir_lval == NULL((void*)0))
748 return;
749
750 if (value_len == -1)
751 len = (int)STRLEN(value)strlen((char *)(value)); /* Append the entire string */
752 else
753 len = value_len; /* Append only "value_len" characters */
754
755 ga_grow(&redir_ga, len);
756 memmove((char *)redir_ga.ga_data + redir_ga.ga_len, value, len);
757 redir_ga.ga_len += len;
758}
759
760/*
761 * Stop redirecting command output to a variable.
762 * Frees the allocated memory.
763 */
764void var_redir_stop(void)
765{
766 typval_T tv;
767
768 if (redir_lval != NULL((void*)0)) {
769 /* If there was no error: assign the text to the variable. */
770 if (redir_endp != NULL((void*)0)) {
771 ga_append(&redir_ga, NUL'\000'); /* Append the trailing NUL. */
772 tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
773 tv.vval.v_string = redir_ga.ga_data;
774 /* Call get_lval() again, if it's inside a Dict or List it may
775 * have changed. */
776 redir_endp = get_lval(redir_varname, NULL((void*)0), redir_lval,
777 FALSE0, FALSE0, 0, FNE_CHECK_START2);
778 if (redir_endp != NULL((void*)0) && redir_lval->ll_name != NULL((void*)0))
779 set_var_lval(redir_lval, redir_endp, &tv, FALSE0, (char_u *)".");
780 clear_lval(redir_lval);
781 }
782
783 /* free the collected output */
784 xfree(redir_ga.ga_data);
785 redir_ga.ga_data = NULL((void*)0);
786
787 xfree(redir_lval);
788 redir_lval = NULL((void*)0);
789 }
790 xfree(redir_varname);
791 redir_varname = NULL((void*)0);
792}
793
794int eval_charconvert(char_u *enc_from, char_u *enc_to, char_u *fname_from, char_u *fname_to)
795{
796 int err = FALSE0;
797
798 set_vim_var_string(VV_CC_FROM, enc_from, -1);
799 set_vim_var_string(VV_CC_TO, enc_to, -1);
800 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, fname_from, -1);
801 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, fname_to, -1);
802 if (eval_to_bool(p_ccv, &err, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0))
803 err = TRUE1;
804 set_vim_var_string(VV_CC_FROM, NULL((void*)0), -1);
805 set_vim_var_string(VV_CC_TO, NULL((void*)0), -1);
806 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, NULL((void*)0), -1);
807 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, NULL((void*)0), -1);
808
809 if (err)
810 return FAIL0;
811 return OK1;
812}
813
814int eval_printexpr(char_u *fname, char_u *args)
815{
816 int err = FALSE0;
817
818 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, fname, -1);
819 set_vim_var_string(VV_CMDARG, args, -1);
820 if (eval_to_bool(p_pexpr, &err, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0))
821 err = TRUE1;
822 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, NULL((void*)0), -1);
823 set_vim_var_string(VV_CMDARG, NULL((void*)0), -1);
824
825 if (err) {
826 os_remove((char *)fname);
827 return FAIL0;
828 }
829 return OK1;
830}
831
832void eval_diff(char_u *origfile, char_u *newfile, char_u *outfile)
833{
834 int err = FALSE0;
835
836 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, origfile, -1);
837 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_NEW, newfile, -1);
838 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, outfile, -1);
839 (void)eval_to_bool(p_dex, &err, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
840 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, NULL((void*)0), -1);
841 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_NEW, NULL((void*)0), -1);
842 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, NULL((void*)0), -1);
843}
844
845void eval_patch(char_u *origfile, char_u *difffile, char_u *outfile)
846{
847 int err;
848
849 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, origfile, -1);
850 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_DIFF, difffile, -1);
851 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, outfile, -1);
852 (void)eval_to_bool(p_pex, &err, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
853 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, NULL((void*)0), -1);
854 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_DIFF, NULL((void*)0), -1);
855 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, NULL((void*)0), -1);
856}
857
858/*
859 * Top level evaluation function, returning a boolean.
860 * Sets "error" to TRUE if there was an error.
861 * Return TRUE or FALSE.
862 */
863int
864eval_to_bool (
865 char_u *arg,
866 int *error,
867 char_u **nextcmd,
868 int skip /* only parse, don't execute */
869)
870{
871 typval_T tv;
872 int retval = FALSE0;
873
874 if (skip)
875 ++emsg_skip;
876 if (eval0(arg, &tv, nextcmd, !skip) == FAIL0)
877 *error = TRUE1;
878 else {
879 *error = FALSE0;
880 if (!skip) {
881 retval = (get_tv_number_chk(&tv, error) != 0);
882 clear_tv(&tv);
883 }
884 }
885 if (skip)
886 --emsg_skip;
887
888 return retval;
889}
890
891/*
892 * Top level evaluation function, returning a string. If "skip" is TRUE,
893 * only parsing to "nextcmd" is done, without reporting errors. Return
894 * pointer to allocated memory, or NULL for failure or when "skip" is TRUE.
895 */
896char_u *
897eval_to_string_skip (
898 char_u *arg,
899 char_u **nextcmd,
900 int skip /* only parse, don't execute */
901)
902{
903 typval_T tv;
904 char_u *retval;
905
906 if (skip)
907 ++emsg_skip;
908 if (eval0(arg, &tv, nextcmd, !skip) == FAIL0 || skip)
909 retval = NULL((void*)0);
910 else {
911 retval = vim_strsave(get_tv_string(&tv));
912 clear_tv(&tv);
913 }
914 if (skip)
915 --emsg_skip;
916
917 return retval;
918}
919
920/*
921 * Skip over an expression at "*pp".
922 * Return FAIL for an error, OK otherwise.
923 */
924int skip_expr(char_u **pp)
925{
926 typval_T rettv;
927
928 *pp = skipwhite(*pp);
929 return eval1(pp, &rettv, FALSE0);
930}
931
932/*
933 * Top level evaluation function, returning a string.
934 * When "convert" is TRUE convert a List into a sequence of lines and convert
935 * a Float to a String.
936 * Return pointer to allocated memory, or NULL for failure.
937 */
938char_u *eval_to_string(char_u *arg, char_u **nextcmd, int convert)
939{
940 typval_T tv;
941 char_u *retval;
942 garray_T ga;
943 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN65];
944
945 if (eval0(arg, &tv, nextcmd, TRUE1) == FAIL0)
946 retval = NULL((void*)0);
947 else {
948 if (convert && tv.v_type == VAR_LIST4) {
949 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char), 80);
950 if (tv.vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
951 list_join(&ga, tv.vval.v_list, "\n");
952 if (tv.vval.v_list->lv_len > 0)
953 ga_append(&ga, NL'\012');
954 }
955 ga_append(&ga, NUL'\000');
956 retval = (char_u *)ga.ga_data;
957 } else if (convert && tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
958 vim_snprintf((char *)numbuf, NUMBUFLEN65, "%g", tv.vval.v_float);
959 retval = vim_strsave(numbuf);
960 } else
961 retval = vim_strsave(get_tv_string(&tv));
962 clear_tv(&tv);
963 }
964
965 return retval;
966}
967
968/*
969 * Call eval_to_string() without using current local variables and using
970 * textlock. When "use_sandbox" is TRUE use the sandbox.
971 */
972char_u *eval_to_string_safe(char_u *arg, char_u **nextcmd, int use_sandbox)
973{
974 char_u *retval;
975 void *save_funccalp;
976
977 save_funccalp = save_funccal();
978 if (use_sandbox)
979 ++sandbox;
980 ++textlock;
981 retval = eval_to_string(arg, nextcmd, FALSE0);
982 if (use_sandbox)
983 --sandbox;
984 --textlock;
985 restore_funccal(save_funccalp);
986 return retval;
987}
988
989/*
990 * Top level evaluation function, returning a number.
991 * Evaluates "expr" silently.
992 * Returns -1 for an error.
993 */
994int eval_to_number(char_u *expr)
995{
996 typval_T rettv;
997 int retval;
998 char_u *p = skipwhite(expr);
999
1000 ++emsg_off;
1001
1002 if (eval1(&p, &rettv, TRUE1) == FAIL0)
1003 retval = -1;
1004 else {
1005 retval = get_tv_number_chk(&rettv, NULL((void*)0));
1006 clear_tv(&rettv);
1007 }
1008 --emsg_off;
1009
1010 return retval;
1011}
1012
1013
1014/*
1015 * Prepare v: variable "idx" to be used.
1016 * Save the current typeval in "save_tv".
1017 * When not used yet add the variable to the v: hashtable.
1018 */
1019static void prepare_vimvar(int idx, typval_T *save_tv)
1020{
1021 *save_tv = vimvars[idx].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv;
1022 if (vimvars[idx].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0)
1023 hash_add(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, vimvars[idx].vv_di.di_key);
1024}
1025
1026/*
1027 * Restore v: variable "idx" to typeval "save_tv".
1028 * When no longer defined, remove the variable from the v: hashtable.
1029 */
1030static void restore_vimvar(int idx, typval_T *save_tv)
1031{
1032 hashitem_T *hi;
1033
1034 vimvars[idx].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv = *save_tv;
1035 if (vimvars[idx].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
1036 hi = hash_find(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, vimvars[idx].vv_di.di_key);
1037 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
1038 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "restore_vimvar()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("restore_vimvar()"
));
1039 else
1040 hash_remove(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, hi);
1041 }
1042}
1043
1044/*
1045 * Evaluate an expression to a list with suggestions.
1046 * For the "expr:" part of 'spellsuggest'.
1047 * Returns NULL when there is an error.
1048 */
1049list_T *eval_spell_expr(char_u *badword, char_u *expr)
1050{
1051 typval_T save_val;
1052 typval_T rettv;
1053 list_T *list = NULL((void*)0);
1054 char_u *p = skipwhite(expr);
1055
1056 /* Set "v:val" to the bad word. */
1057 prepare_vimvar(VV_VAL, &save_val);
1058 vimvars[VV_VAL].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
1059 vimvars[VV_VAL].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = badword;
1060 if (p_verbose == 0)
1061 ++emsg_off;
1062
1063 if (eval1(&p, &rettv, TRUE1) == OK1) {
1064 if (rettv.v_type != VAR_LIST4)
1065 clear_tv(&rettv);
1066 else
1067 list = rettv.vval.v_list;
1068 }
1069
1070 if (p_verbose == 0)
1071 --emsg_off;
1072 restore_vimvar(VV_VAL, &save_val);
1073
1074 return list;
1075}
1076
1077/*
1078 * "list" is supposed to contain two items: a word and a number. Return the
1079 * word in "pp" and the number as the return value.
1080 * Return -1 if anything isn't right.
1081 * Used to get the good word and score from the eval_spell_expr() result.
1082 */
1083int get_spellword(list_T *list, char_u **pp)
1084{
1085 listitem_T *li;
1086
1087 li = list->lv_first;
1088 if (li == NULL((void*)0))
1089 return -1;
1090 *pp = get_tv_string(&li->li_tv);
1091
1092 li = li->li_next;
1093 if (li == NULL((void*)0))
1094 return -1;
1095 return get_tv_number(&li->li_tv);
1096}
1097
1098/*
1099 * Top level evaluation function.
1100 * Returns an allocated typval_T with the result.
1101 * Returns NULL when there is an error.
1102 */
1103typval_T *eval_expr(char_u *arg, char_u **nextcmd)
1104{
1105 typval_T *tv = xmalloc(sizeof(typval_T));
1106
1107 if (eval0(arg, tv, nextcmd, TRUE1) == FAIL0) {
1108 xfree(tv);
1109 return NULL((void*)0);
1110 }
1111
1112 return tv;
1113}
1114
1115
1116// Call some vimL function and return the result in "*rettv".
1117// Uses argv[argc] for the function arguments. Only Number and String
1118// arguments are currently supported.
1119//
1120// Return OK or FAIL.
1121int call_vim_function(
1122 char_u *func,
1123 int argc,
1124 char_u **argv,
1125 int safe, // use the sandbox
1126 int str_arg_only, // all arguments are strings
1127 typval_T *rettv
1128)
1129{
1130 long n;
1131 int len;
1132 int doesrange;
1133 void *save_funccalp = NULL((void*)0);
1134 int ret;
1135
1136 typval_T *argvars = xmalloc((argc + 1) * sizeof(typval_T));
1137
1138 for (int i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
1139 // Pass a NULL or empty argument as an empty string
1140 if (argv[i] == NULL((void*)0) || *argv[i] == NUL'\000') {
1141 argvars[i].v_type = VAR_STRING2;
1142 argvars[i].vval.v_string = (char_u *)"";
1143 continue;
1144 }
1145
1146 if (str_arg_only) {
1147 len = 0;
1148 } else {
1149 // Recognize a number argument, the others must be strings.
1150 vim_str2nr(argv[i], NULL((void*)0), &len, STR2NR_ALL(1 + 2 + 4), &n, NULL((void*)0), 0);
1151 }
1152 if (len != 0 && len == (int)STRLEN(argv[i])strlen((char *)(argv[i]))) {
1153 argvars[i].v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
1154 argvars[i].vval.v_number = n;
1155 } else {
1156 argvars[i].v_type = VAR_STRING2;
1157 argvars[i].vval.v_string = argv[i];
1158 }
1159 }
1160
1161 if (safe) {
1162 save_funccalp = save_funccal();
1163 ++sandbox;
1164 }
1165
1166 rettv->v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0; /* clear_tv() uses this */
1167 ret = call_func(func, (int)STRLEN(func)strlen((char *)(func)), rettv, argc, argvars,
1168 curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
1169 &doesrange, true1, NULL((void*)0));
1170 if (safe) {
1171 --sandbox;
1172 restore_funccal(save_funccalp);
1173 }
1174 xfree(argvars);
1175
1176 if (ret == FAIL0) {
1177 clear_tv(rettv);
1178 }
1179
1180 return ret;
1181}
1182
1183/*
1184 * Call vimL function "func" and return the result as a number.
1185 * Returns -1 when calling the function fails.
1186 * Uses argv[argc] for the function arguments.
1187 */
1188long
1189call_func_retnr (
1190 char_u *func,
1191 int argc,
1192 char_u **argv,
1193 int safe /* use the sandbox */
1194)
1195{
1196 typval_T rettv;
1197 long retval;
1198
1199 /* All arguments are passed as strings, no conversion to number. */
1200 if (call_vim_function(func, argc, argv, safe, TRUE1, &rettv) == FAIL0)
1201 return -1;
1202
1203 retval = get_tv_number_chk(&rettv, NULL((void*)0));
1204 clear_tv(&rettv);
1205 return retval;
1206}
1207
1208/*
1209 * Call vimL function "func" and return the result as a string.
1210 * Returns NULL when calling the function fails.
1211 * Uses argv[argc] for the function arguments.
1212 */
1213void *
1214call_func_retstr (
1215 char_u *func,
1216 int argc,
1217 char_u **argv,
1218 int safe /* use the sandbox */
1219)
1220{
1221 typval_T rettv;
1222 char_u *retval;
1223
1224 /* All arguments are passed as strings, no conversion to number. */
1225 if (call_vim_function(func, argc, argv, safe, TRUE1, &rettv) == FAIL0)
1226 return NULL((void*)0);
1227
1228 retval = vim_strsave(get_tv_string(&rettv));
1229 clear_tv(&rettv);
1230 return retval;
1231}
1232
1233/*
1234 * Call vimL function "func" and return the result as a List.
1235 * Uses argv[argc] for the function arguments.
1236 * Returns NULL when there is something wrong.
1237 */
1238void *
1239call_func_retlist (
1240 char_u *func,
1241 int argc,
1242 char_u **argv,
1243 int safe /* use the sandbox */
1244)
1245{
1246 typval_T rettv;
1247
1248 /* All arguments are passed as strings, no conversion to number. */
1249 if (call_vim_function(func, argc, argv, safe, TRUE1, &rettv) == FAIL0)
1250 return NULL((void*)0);
1251
1252 if (rettv.v_type != VAR_LIST4) {
1253 clear_tv(&rettv);
1254 return NULL((void*)0);
1255 }
1256
1257 return rettv.vval.v_list;
1258}
1259
1260/*
1261 * Save the current function call pointer, and set it to NULL.
1262 * Used when executing autocommands and for ":source".
1263 */
1264void *save_funccal(void)
1265{
1266 funccall_T *fc = current_funccal;
1267
1268 current_funccal = NULL((void*)0);
1269 return (void *)fc;
1270}
1271
1272void restore_funccal(void *vfc)
1273{
1274 funccall_T *fc = (funccall_T *)vfc;
1275
1276 current_funccal = fc;
1277}
1278
1279/*
1280 * Prepare profiling for entering a child or something else that is not
1281 * counted for the script/function itself.
1282 * Should always be called in pair with prof_child_exit().
1283 */
1284void prof_child_enter(proftime_T *tm /* place to store waittime */
1285 )
1286{
1287 funccall_T *fc = current_funccal;
1288
1289 if (fc != NULL((void*)0) && fc->func->uf_profiling) {
1290 fc->prof_child = profile_start();
1291 }
1292
1293 script_prof_save(tm);
1294}
1295
1296/*
1297 * Take care of time spent in a child.
1298 * Should always be called after prof_child_enter().
1299 */
1300void prof_child_exit(proftime_T *tm /* where waittime was stored */
1301 )
1302{
1303 funccall_T *fc = current_funccal;
1304
1305 if (fc != NULL((void*)0) && fc->func->uf_profiling) {
1306 fc->prof_child = profile_end(fc->prof_child);
1307 // don't count waiting time
1308 fc->prof_child = profile_sub_wait(*tm, fc->prof_child);
1309 fc->func->uf_tm_children =
1310 profile_add(fc->func->uf_tm_children, fc->prof_child);
1311 fc->func->uf_tml_children =
1312 profile_add(fc->func->uf_tml_children, fc->prof_child);
1313 }
1314 script_prof_restore(tm);
1315}
1316
1317
1318/*
1319 * Evaluate 'foldexpr'. Returns the foldlevel, and any character preceding
1320 * it in "*cp". Doesn't give error messages.
1321 */
1322int eval_foldexpr(char_u *arg, int *cp)
1323{
1324 typval_T tv;
1325 int retval;
1326 char_u *s;
1327 int use_sandbox = was_set_insecurely((char_u *)"foldexpr",
1328 OPT_LOCAL4);
1329
1330 ++emsg_off;
1331 if (use_sandbox)
1332 ++sandbox;
1333 ++textlock;
1334 *cp = NUL'\000';
1335 if (eval0(arg, &tv, NULL((void*)0), TRUE1) == FAIL0)
1336 retval = 0;
1337 else {
1338 /* If the result is a number, just return the number. */
1339 if (tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER1)
1340 retval = tv.vval.v_number;
1341 else if (tv.v_type != VAR_STRING2 || tv.vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0))
1342 retval = 0;
1343 else {
1344 /* If the result is a string, check if there is a non-digit before
1345 * the number. */
1346 s = tv.vval.v_string;
1347 if (!ascii_isdigit(*s) && *s != '-')
1348 *cp = *s++;
1349 retval = atol((char *)s);
1350 }
1351 clear_tv(&tv);
1352 }
1353 --emsg_off;
1354 if (use_sandbox)
1355 --sandbox;
1356 --textlock;
1357
1358 return retval;
1359}
1360
1361/*
1362 * ":let" list all variable values
1363 * ":let var1 var2" list variable values
1364 * ":let var = expr" assignment command.
1365 * ":let var += expr" assignment command.
1366 * ":let var -= expr" assignment command.
1367 * ":let var .= expr" assignment command.
1368 * ":let [var1, var2] = expr" unpack list.
1369 */
1370void ex_let(exarg_T *eap)
1371{
1372 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
1373 char_u *expr = NULL((void*)0);
1374 typval_T rettv;
1375 int i;
1376 int var_count = 0;
1377 int semicolon = 0;
1378 char_u op[2];
1379 char_u *argend;
1380 int first = TRUE1;
1381
1382 argend = skip_var_list(arg, &var_count, &semicolon);
1383 if (argend == NULL((void*)0))
1384 return;
1385 if (argend > arg && argend[-1] == '.') /* for var.='str' */
1386 --argend;
1387 expr = skipwhite(argend);
1388 if (*expr != '=' && !(vim_strchr((char_u *)"+-.", *expr) != NULL((void*)0)
1389 && expr[1] == '=')) {
1390 // ":let" without "=": list variables
1391 if (*arg == '[')
1392 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
1393 else if (!ends_excmd(*arg))
1394 /* ":let var1 var2" */
1395 arg = list_arg_vars(eap, arg, &first);
1396 else if (!eap->skip) {
1397 /* ":let" */
1398 list_glob_vars(&first);
1399 list_buf_vars(&first);
1400 list_win_vars(&first);
1401 list_tab_vars(&first);
1402 list_script_vars(&first);
1403 list_func_vars(&first);
1404 list_vim_vars(&first);
1405 }
1406 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
1407 } else {
1408 op[0] = '=';
1409 op[1] = NUL'\000';
1410 if (*expr != '=') {
1411 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"+-.", *expr) != NULL((void*)0)) {
1412 op[0] = *expr; // +=, -=, .=
1413 }
1414 expr = skipwhite(expr + 2);
1415 } else {
1416 expr = skipwhite(expr + 1);
1417 }
1418
1419 if (eap->skip)
1420 ++emsg_skip;
1421 i = eval0(expr, &rettv, &eap->nextcmd, !eap->skip);
1422 if (eap->skip) {
1423 if (i != FAIL0)
1424 clear_tv(&rettv);
1425 --emsg_skip;
1426 } else if (i != FAIL0) {
1427 (void)ex_let_vars(eap->arg, &rettv, FALSE0, semicolon, var_count,
1428 op);
1429 clear_tv(&rettv);
1430 }
1431 }
1432}
1433
1434/*
1435 * Assign the typevalue "tv" to the variable or variables at "arg_start".
1436 * Handles both "var" with any type and "[var, var; var]" with a list type.
1437 * When "nextchars" is not NULL it points to a string with characters that
1438 * must appear after the variable(s). Use "+", "-" or "." for add, subtract
1439 * or concatenate.
1440 * Returns OK or FAIL;
1441 */
1442static int
1443ex_let_vars (
1444 char_u *arg_start,
1445 typval_T *tv,
1446 int copy, /* copy values from "tv", don't move */
1447 int semicolon, /* from skip_var_list() */
1448 int var_count, /* from skip_var_list() */
1449 char_u *nextchars
1450)
1451{
1452 char_u *arg = arg_start;
1453 list_T *l;
1454 int i;
1455 listitem_T *item;
1456 typval_T ltv;
1457
1458 if (*arg != '[') {
1459 /*
1460 * ":let var = expr" or ":for var in list"
1461 */
1462 if (ex_let_one(arg, tv, copy, nextchars, nextchars) == NULL((void*)0))
1463 return FAIL0;
1464 return OK1;
1465 }
1466
1467 /*
1468 * ":let [v1, v2] = list" or ":for [v1, v2] in listlist"
1469 */
1470 if (tv->v_type != VAR_LIST4 || (l = tv->vval.v_list) == NULL((void*)0)) {
1471 EMSG(_(e_listreq))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listreq))));
1472 return FAIL0;
1473 }
1474
1475 i = list_len(l);
1476 if (semicolon == 0 && var_count < i) {
1477 EMSG(_("E687: Less targets than List items"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E687: Less targets than List items"
))));
1478 return FAIL0;
1479 }
1480 if (var_count - semicolon > i) {
1481 EMSG(_("E688: More targets than List items"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E688: More targets than List items"
))));
1482 return FAIL0;
1483 }
1484
1485 item = l->lv_first;
1486 while (*arg != ']') {
1487 arg = skipwhite(arg + 1);
1488 arg = ex_let_one(arg, &item->li_tv, TRUE1, (char_u *)",;]", nextchars);
1489 item = item->li_next;
1490 if (arg == NULL((void*)0))
1491 return FAIL0;
1492
1493 arg = skipwhite(arg);
1494 if (*arg == ';') {
1495 /* Put the rest of the list (may be empty) in the var after ';'.
1496 * Create a new list for this. */
1497 l = list_alloc();
1498 while (item != NULL((void*)0)) {
1499 list_append_tv(l, &item->li_tv);
1500 item = item->li_next;
1501 }
1502
1503 ltv.v_type = VAR_LIST4;
1504 ltv.v_lock = 0;
1505 ltv.vval.v_list = l;
1506 l->lv_refcount = 1;
1507
1508 arg = ex_let_one(skipwhite(arg + 1), &ltv, FALSE0,
1509 (char_u *)"]", nextchars);
1510 clear_tv(&ltv);
1511 if (arg == NULL((void*)0))
1512 return FAIL0;
1513 break;
1514 } else if (*arg != ',' && *arg != ']') {
1515 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "ex_let_vars()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("ex_let_vars()"
));
1516 return FAIL0;
1517 }
1518 }
1519
1520 return OK1;
1521}
1522
1523/*
1524 * Skip over assignable variable "var" or list of variables "[var, var]".
1525 * Used for ":let varvar = expr" and ":for varvar in expr".
1526 * For "[var, var]" increment "*var_count" for each variable.
1527 * for "[var, var; var]" set "semicolon".
1528 * Return NULL for an error.
1529 */
1530static char_u *skip_var_list(char_u *arg, int *var_count, int *semicolon)
1531{
1532 char_u *p, *s;
1533
1534 if (*arg == '[') {
1535 /* "[var, var]": find the matching ']'. */
1536 p = arg;
1537 for (;; ) {
1538 p = skipwhite(p + 1); /* skip whites after '[', ';' or ',' */
1539 s = skip_var_one(p);
1540 if (s == p) {
1541 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), p)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(p)
);
1542 return NULL((void*)0);
1543 }
1544 ++*var_count;
1545
1546 p = skipwhite(s);
1547 if (*p == ']')
1548 break;
1549 else if (*p == ';') {
1550 if (*semicolon == 1) {
1551 EMSG(_("Double ; in list of variables"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("Double ; in list of variables"
))));
1552 return NULL((void*)0);
1553 }
1554 *semicolon = 1;
1555 } else if (*p != ',') {
1556 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), p)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(p)
);
1557 return NULL((void*)0);
1558 }
1559 }
1560 return p + 1;
1561 } else
1562 return skip_var_one(arg);
1563}
1564
1565/*
1566 * Skip one (assignable) variable name, including @r, $VAR, &option, d.key,
1567 * l[idx].
1568 */
1569static char_u *skip_var_one(char_u *arg)
1570{
1571 if (*arg == '@' && arg[1] != NUL'\000')
1572 return arg + 2;
1573 return find_name_end(*arg == '$' || *arg == '&' ? arg + 1 : arg,
1574 NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FNE_INCL_BR1 | FNE_CHECK_START2);
1575}
1576
1577/*
1578 * List variables for hashtab "ht" with prefix "prefix".
1579 * If "empty" is TRUE also list NULL strings as empty strings.
1580 */
1581static void list_hashtable_vars(hashtab_T *ht, char_u *prefix, int empty, int *first)
1582{
1583 hashitem_T *hi;
1584 dictitem_T *di;
1585 int todo;
1586
1587 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
1588 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi) {
1589 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
1590 --todo;
1591 di = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
1592 if (empty || di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_STRING2
1593 || di->di_tv.vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0))
1594 list_one_var(di, prefix, first);
1595 }
1596 }
1597}
1598
1599/*
1600 * List global variables.
1601 */
1602static void list_glob_vars(int *first)
1603{
1604 list_hashtable_vars(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab, (char_u *)"", TRUE1, first);
1605}
1606
1607/*
1608 * List buffer variables.
1609 */
1610static void list_buf_vars(int *first)
1611{
1612 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN65];
1613
1614 list_hashtable_vars(&curbuf->b_vars->dv_hashtab, (char_u *)"b:",
1615 TRUE1, first);
1616
1617 sprintf((char *)numbuf, "%" PRId64"l" "d", (int64_t)curbuf->b_changedtick);
1618 list_one_var_a((char_u *)"b:", (char_u *)"changedtick", VAR_NUMBER1,
1619 numbuf, first);
1620}
1621
1622/*
1623 * List window variables.
1624 */
1625static void list_win_vars(int *first)
1626{
1627 list_hashtable_vars(&curwin->w_vars->dv_hashtab,
1628 (char_u *)"w:", TRUE1, first);
1629}
1630
1631/*
1632 * List tab page variables.
1633 */
1634static void list_tab_vars(int *first)
1635{
1636 list_hashtable_vars(&curtab->tp_vars->dv_hashtab,
1637 (char_u *)"t:", TRUE1, first);
1638}
1639
1640/*
1641 * List Vim variables.
1642 */
1643static void list_vim_vars(int *first)
1644{
1645 list_hashtable_vars(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, (char_u *)"v:", FALSE0, first);
1646}
1647
1648/*
1649 * List script-local variables, if there is a script.
1650 */
1651static void list_script_vars(int *first)
1652{
1653 if (current_SID > 0 && current_SID <= ga_scripts.ga_len)
1654 list_hashtable_vars(&SCRIPT_VARS(current_SID)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(current_SID) - 1])->
sv_dict.dv_hashtab),
1655 (char_u *)"s:", FALSE0, first);
1656}
1657
1658/*
1659 * List function variables, if there is a function.
1660 */
1661static void list_func_vars(int *first)
1662{
1663 if (current_funccal != NULL((void*)0))
1664 list_hashtable_vars(&current_funccal->l_vars.dv_hashtab,
1665 (char_u *)"l:", FALSE0, first);
1666}
1667
1668/*
1669 * List variables in "arg".
1670 */
1671static char_u *list_arg_vars(exarg_T *eap, char_u *arg, int *first)
1672{
1673 int error = FALSE0;
1674 int len;
1675 char_u *name;
1676 char_u *name_start;
1677 char_u *arg_subsc;
1678 char_u *tofree;
1679 typval_T tv;
1680
1681 while (!ends_excmd(*arg) && !got_int) {
1682 if (error || eap->skip) {
1683 arg = find_name_end(arg, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FNE_INCL_BR1 | FNE_CHECK_START2);
1684 if (!ascii_iswhite(*arg) && !ends_excmd(*arg)) {
1685 emsg_severe = TRUE1;
1686 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
1687 break;
1688 }
1689 } else {
1690 /* get_name_len() takes care of expanding curly braces */
1691 name_start = name = arg;
1692 len = get_name_len(&arg, &tofree, TRUE1, TRUE1);
1693 if (len <= 0) {
1694 /* This is mainly to keep test 49 working: when expanding
1695 * curly braces fails overrule the exception error message. */
1696 if (len < 0 && !aborting()) {
1697 emsg_severe = TRUE1;
1698 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(arg
));
1699 break;
1700 }
1701 error = TRUE1;
1702 } else {
1703 if (tofree != NULL((void*)0)) {
1704 name = tofree;
1705 }
1706 if (get_var_tv(name, len, &tv, NULL((void*)0), true1, false0) == FAIL0) {
1707 error = true1;
1708 } else {
1709 // handle d.key, l[idx], f(expr)
1710 arg_subsc = arg;
1711 if (handle_subscript(&arg, &tv, TRUE1, TRUE1) == FAIL0)
1712 error = TRUE1;
1713 else {
1714 if (arg == arg_subsc && len == 2 && name[1] == ':') {
1715 switch (*name) {
1716 case 'g': list_glob_vars(first); break;
1717 case 'b': list_buf_vars(first); break;
1718 case 'w': list_win_vars(first); break;
1719 case 't': list_tab_vars(first); break;
1720 case 'v': list_vim_vars(first); break;
1721 case 's': list_script_vars(first); break;
1722 case 'l': list_func_vars(first); break;
1723 default:
1724 EMSG2(_("E738: Can't list variables for %s"), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E738: Can't list variables for %s"
))), (char_u *)(name));
1725 }
1726 } else {
1727 int c;
1728
1729 char_u *s = (char_u *) echo_string(&tv, NULL((void*)0));
1730 c = *arg;
1731 *arg = NUL'\000';
1732 list_one_var_a((char_u *)"",
1733 arg == arg_subsc ? name : name_start,
1734 tv.v_type,
1735 s == NULL((void*)0) ? (char_u *)"" : s,
1736 first);
1737 *arg = c;
1738 xfree(s);
1739 }
1740 clear_tv(&tv);
1741 }
1742 }
1743 }
1744
1745 xfree(tofree);
1746 }
1747
1748 arg = skipwhite(arg);
1749 }
1750
1751 return arg;
1752}
1753
1754/*
1755 * Set one item of ":let var = expr" or ":let [v1, v2] = list" to its value.
1756 * Returns a pointer to the char just after the var name.
1757 * Returns NULL if there is an error.
1758 */
1759static char_u *
1760ex_let_one (
1761 char_u *arg, /* points to variable name */
1762 typval_T *tv, /* value to assign to variable */
1763 int copy, /* copy value from "tv" */
1764 char_u *endchars, /* valid chars after variable name or NULL */
1765 char_u *op /* "+", "-", "." or NULL*/
1766)
1767{
1768 int c1;
1769 char_u *name;
1770 char_u *p;
1771 char_u *arg_end = NULL((void*)0);
1772 int len;
1773 int opt_flags;
1774 char_u *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
1775
1776 /*
1777 * ":let $VAR = expr": Set environment variable.
1778 */
1779 if (*arg == '$') {
1780 /* Find the end of the name. */
1781 ++arg;
1782 name = arg;
1783 len = get_env_len(&arg);
1784 if (len == 0)
1785 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), name - 1)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(name
- 1));
1786 else {
1787 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && (*op == '+' || *op == '-'))
1788 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (char_u *)(op
));
1789 else if (endchars != NULL((void*)0)
1790 && vim_strchr(endchars, *skipwhite(arg)) == NULL((void*)0))
1791 EMSG(_(e_letunexp))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letunexp))));
1792 else if (!check_secure()) {
1793 c1 = name[len];
1794 name[len] = NUL'\000';
1795 p = get_tv_string_chk(tv);
1796 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && op != NULL((void*)0) && *op == '.') {
1797 char *s = vim_getenv((char *)name);
1798
1799 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
1800 p = tofree = concat_str((char_u *)s, p);
1801 xfree(s);
1802 }
1803 }
1804 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
1805 vim_setenv((char *)name, (char *)p);
1806 if (STRICMP(name, "HOME")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("HOME")) == 0)
1807 init_homedir();
1808 else if (didset_vim && STRICMP(name, "VIM")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("VIM")) == 0)
1809 didset_vim = FALSE0;
1810 else if (didset_vimruntime
1811 && STRICMP(name, "VIMRUNTIME")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("VIMRUNTIME")) == 0)
1812 didset_vimruntime = FALSE0;
1813 arg_end = arg;
1814 }
1815 name[len] = c1;
1816 xfree(tofree);
1817 }
1818 }
1819 }
1820 /*
1821 * ":let &option = expr": Set option value.
1822 * ":let &l:option = expr": Set local option value.
1823 * ":let &g:option = expr": Set global option value.
1824 */
1825 else if (*arg == '&') {
1826 /* Find the end of the name. */
1827 p = find_option_end(&arg, &opt_flags);
1828 if (p == NULL((void*)0) || (endchars != NULL((void*)0)
1829 && vim_strchr(endchars, *skipwhite(p)) == NULL((void*)0)))
1830 EMSG(_(e_letunexp))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letunexp))));
1831 else {
1832 long n;
1833 int opt_type;
1834 long numval;
1835 char_u *stringval = NULL((void*)0);
1836 char_u *s;
1837
1838 c1 = *p;
1839 *p = NUL'\000';
1840
1841 n = get_tv_number(tv);
1842 s = get_tv_string_chk(tv); /* != NULL if number or string */
1843 if (s != NULL((void*)0) && op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
1844 opt_type = get_option_value(arg, &numval,
1845 &stringval, opt_flags);
1846 if ((opt_type == 1 && *op == '.')
1847 || (opt_type == 0 && *op != '.'))
1848 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (char_u *)(op
));
1849 else {
1850 if (opt_type == 1) { /* number */
1851 if (*op == '+')
1852 n = numval + n;
1853 else
1854 n = numval - n;
1855 } else if (opt_type == 0 && stringval != NULL((void*)0)) { /* string */
1856 s = concat_str(stringval, s);
1857 xfree(stringval);
1858 stringval = s;
1859 }
1860 }
1861 }
1862 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
1863 set_option_value(arg, n, s, opt_flags);
1864 arg_end = p;
1865 }
1866 *p = c1;
1867 xfree(stringval);
1868 }
1869 }
1870 /*
1871 * ":let @r = expr": Set register contents.
1872 */
1873 else if (*arg == '@') {
1874 ++arg;
1875 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && (*op == '+' || *op == '-'))
1876 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (char_u *)(op
));
1877 else if (endchars != NULL((void*)0)
1878 && vim_strchr(endchars, *skipwhite(arg + 1)) == NULL((void*)0))
1879 EMSG(_(e_letunexp))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letunexp))));
1880 else {
1881 char_u *ptofree = NULL((void*)0);
1882 char_u *s;
1883
1884 p = get_tv_string_chk(tv);
1885 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && op != NULL((void*)0) && *op == '.') {
1886 s = get_reg_contents(*arg == '@' ? '"' : *arg, kGRegExprSrc);
1887 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
1888 p = ptofree = concat_str(s, p);
1889 xfree(s);
1890 }
1891 }
1892 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
1893 write_reg_contents(*arg == '@' ? '"' : *arg, p, -1, FALSE0);
1894 arg_end = arg + 1;
1895 }
1896 xfree(ptofree);
1897 }
1898 }
1899 /*
1900 * ":let var = expr": Set internal variable.
1901 * ":let {expr} = expr": Idem, name made with curly braces
1902 */
1903 else if (eval_isnamec1(*arg) || *arg == '{') {
1904 lval_T lv;
1905
1906 p = get_lval(arg, tv, &lv, FALSE0, FALSE0, 0, FNE_CHECK_START2);
1907 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && lv.ll_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
1908 if (endchars != NULL((void*)0) && vim_strchr(endchars, *skipwhite(p)) == NULL((void*)0))
1909 EMSG(_(e_letunexp))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letunexp))));
1910 else {
1911 set_var_lval(&lv, p, tv, copy, op);
1912 arg_end = p;
1913 }
1914 }
1915 clear_lval(&lv);
1916 } else
1917 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(arg
));
1918
1919 return arg_end;
1920}
1921
1922/*
1923 * If "arg" is equal to "b:changedtick" give an error and return TRUE.
1924 */
1925static int check_changedtick(char_u *arg)
1926{
1927 if (STRNCMP(arg, "b:changedtick", 13)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("b:changedtick"), (size_t)(13
)) == 0 && !eval_isnamec(arg[13])) {
1928 EMSG2(_(e_readonlyvar), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_readonlyvar))), (char_u *
)(arg));
1929 return TRUE1;
1930 }
1931 return FALSE0;
1932}
1933
1934/*
1935 * Get an lval: variable, Dict item or List item that can be assigned a value
1936 * to: "name", "na{me}", "name[expr]", "name[expr:expr]", "name[expr][expr]",
1937 * "name.key", "name.key[expr]" etc.
1938 * Indexing only works if "name" is an existing List or Dictionary.
1939 * "name" points to the start of the name.
1940 * If "rettv" is not NULL it points to the value to be assigned.
1941 * "unlet" is TRUE for ":unlet": slightly different behavior when something is
1942 * wrong; must end in space or cmd separator.
1943 *
1944 * flags:
1945 * GLV_QUIET: do not give error messages
1946 * GLV_NO_AUTOLOAD: do not use script autoloading
1947 *
1948 * Returns a pointer to just after the name, including indexes.
1949 * When an evaluation error occurs "lp->ll_name" is NULL;
1950 * Returns NULL for a parsing error. Still need to free items in "lp"!
1951 */
1952static char_u *
1953get_lval (
1954 char_u *name,
1955 typval_T *rettv,
1956 lval_T *lp,
1957 int unlet,
1958 int skip,
1959 int flags, /* GLV_ values */
1960 int fne_flags /* flags for find_name_end() */
1961)
1962{
1963 char_u *p;
1964 char_u *expr_start, *expr_end;
1965 int cc;
1966 dictitem_T *v;
1967 typval_T var1;
1968 typval_T var2;
1969 int empty1 = FALSE0;
1970 listitem_T *ni;
1971 char_u *key = NULL((void*)0);
1972 int len;
1973 hashtab_T *ht;
1974 int quiet = flags & GLV_QUIET2;
1975
1976 /* Clear everything in "lp". */
1977 memset(lp, 0, sizeof(lval_T));
1978
1979 if (skip) {
1980 /* When skipping just find the end of the name. */
1981 lp->ll_name = name;
1982 return find_name_end(name, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FNE_INCL_BR1 | fne_flags);
1983 }
1984
1985 /* Find the end of the name. */
1986 p = find_name_end(name, &expr_start, &expr_end, fne_flags);
1987 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0)) {
1988 /* Don't expand the name when we already know there is an error. */
1989 if (unlet && !ascii_iswhite(*p) && !ends_excmd(*p)
1990 && *p != '[' && *p != '.') {
1991 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
1992 return NULL((void*)0);
1993 }
1994
1995 lp->ll_exp_name = make_expanded_name(name, expr_start, expr_end, p);
1996 if (lp->ll_exp_name == NULL((void*)0)) {
1997 /* Report an invalid expression in braces, unless the
1998 * expression evaluation has been cancelled due to an
1999 * aborting error, an interrupt, or an exception. */
2000 if (!aborting() && !quiet) {
2001 emsg_severe = TRUE1;
2002 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(name
));
2003 return NULL((void*)0);
2004 }
2005 }
2006 lp->ll_name = lp->ll_exp_name;
2007 } else
2008 lp->ll_name = name;
2009
2010 /* Without [idx] or .key we are done. */
2011 if ((*p != '[' && *p != '.') || lp->ll_name == NULL((void*)0))
2012 return p;
2013
2014 cc = *p;
2015 *p = NUL'\000';
2016 v = find_var(lp->ll_name, &ht, flags & GLV_NO_AUTOLOAD4);
2017 if (v == NULL((void*)0) && !quiet)
2018 EMSG2(_(e_undefvar), lp->ll_name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_undefvar))), (char_u *)(lp
->ll_name));
2019 *p = cc;
2020 if (v == NULL((void*)0))
2021 return NULL((void*)0);
2022
2023 /*
2024 * Loop until no more [idx] or .key is following.
2025 */
2026 lp->ll_tv = &v->di_tv;
2027 while (*p == '[' || (*p == '.' && lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_DICT5)) {
2028 if (!(lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_LIST4 && lp->ll_tv->vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0))
2029 && !(lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_DICT5
2030 && lp->ll_tv->vval.v_dict != NULL((void*)0))) {
2031 if (!quiet)
2032 EMSG(_("E689: Can only index a List or Dictionary"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E689: Can only index a List or Dictionary"
))));
2033 return NULL((void*)0);
2034 }
2035 if (lp->ll_range) {
2036 if (!quiet)
2037 EMSG(_("E708: [:] must come last"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E708: [:] must come last"))
));
2038 return NULL((void*)0);
2039 }
2040
2041 len = -1;
2042 if (*p == '.') {
2043 key = p + 1;
2044 for (len = 0; ASCII_ISALNUM(key[len])((((unsigned)(key[len]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(key[len
]) <= 'Z') || ((unsigned)(key[len]) >= 'a' && (
unsigned)(key[len]) <= 'z')) || ascii_isdigit(key[len])) || key[len] == '_'; ++len)
2045 ;
2046 if (len == 0) {
2047 if (!quiet)
2048 EMSG(_(e_emptykey))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_emptykey))));
2049 return NULL((void*)0);
2050 }
2051 p = key + len;
2052 } else {
2053 /* Get the index [expr] or the first index [expr: ]. */
2054 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
2055 if (*p == ':')
2056 empty1 = TRUE1;
2057 else {
2058 empty1 = FALSE0;
2059 if (eval1(&p, &var1, TRUE1) == FAIL0) /* recursive! */
2060 return NULL((void*)0);
2061 if (get_tv_string_chk(&var1) == NULL((void*)0)) {
2062 /* not a number or string */
2063 clear_tv(&var1);
2064 return NULL((void*)0);
2065 }
2066 }
2067
2068 /* Optionally get the second index [ :expr]. */
2069 if (*p == ':') {
2070 if (lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_DICT5) {
2071 if (!quiet)
2072 EMSG(_(e_dictrange))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictrange))));
2073 if (!empty1)
2074 clear_tv(&var1);
2075 return NULL((void*)0);
2076 }
2077 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0) && (rettv->v_type != VAR_LIST4
2078 || rettv->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0))) {
2079 if (!quiet)
2080 EMSG(_("E709: [:] requires a List value"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E709: [:] requires a List value"
))));
2081 if (!empty1)
2082 clear_tv(&var1);
2083 return NULL((void*)0);
2084 }
2085 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
2086 if (*p == ']')
2087 lp->ll_empty2 = TRUE1;
2088 else {
2089 lp->ll_empty2 = FALSE0;
2090 if (eval1(&p, &var2, TRUE1) == FAIL0) { /* recursive! */
2091 if (!empty1)
2092 clear_tv(&var1);
2093 return NULL((void*)0);
2094 }
2095 if (get_tv_string_chk(&var2) == NULL((void*)0)) {
2096 /* not a number or string */
2097 if (!empty1)
2098 clear_tv(&var1);
2099 clear_tv(&var2);
2100 return NULL((void*)0);
2101 }
2102 }
2103 lp->ll_range = TRUE1;
2104 } else
2105 lp->ll_range = FALSE0;
2106
2107 if (*p != ']') {
2108 if (!quiet)
2109 EMSG(_(e_missbrac))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_missbrac))));
2110 if (!empty1)
2111 clear_tv(&var1);
2112 if (lp->ll_range && !lp->ll_empty2)
2113 clear_tv(&var2);
2114 return NULL((void*)0);
2115 }
2116
2117 /* Skip to past ']'. */
2118 ++p;
2119 }
2120
2121 if (lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_DICT5) {
2122 if (len == -1) {
2123 /* "[key]": get key from "var1" */
2124 key = get_tv_string(&var1); /* is number or string */
2125 if (*key == NUL'\000') {
2126 if (!quiet)
2127 EMSG(_(e_emptykey))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_emptykey))));
2128 clear_tv(&var1);
2129 return NULL((void*)0);
2130 }
2131 }
2132 lp->ll_list = NULL((void*)0);
2133 lp->ll_dict = lp->ll_tv->vval.v_dict;
2134 lp->ll_di = dict_find(lp->ll_dict, key, len);
2135
2136 /* When assigning to a scope dictionary check that a function and
2137 * variable name is valid (only variable name unless it is l: or
2138 * g: dictionary). Disallow overwriting a builtin function. */
2139 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0) && lp->ll_dict->dv_scope != 0) {
2140 int prevval;
2141 int wrong;
2142
2143 if (len != -1) {
2144 prevval = key[len];
2145 key[len] = NUL'\000';
2146 } else
2147 prevval = 0; /* avoid compiler warning */
2148 wrong = (lp->ll_dict->dv_scope == VAR_DEF_SCOPE2
2149 && rettv->v_type == VAR_FUNC3
2150 && var_check_func_name(key, lp->ll_di == NULL((void*)0)))
2151 || !valid_varname(key);
2152 if (len != -1)
2153 key[len] = prevval;
2154 if (wrong)
2155 return NULL((void*)0);
2156 }
2157
2158 if (lp->ll_di == NULL((void*)0)) {
2159 /* Can't add "v:" variable. */
2160 if (lp->ll_dict == &vimvardict) {
2161 EMSG2(_(e_illvar), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_illvar))), (char_u *)(name
));
2162 return NULL((void*)0);
2163 }
2164
2165 /* Key does not exist in dict: may need to add it. */
2166 if (*p == '[' || *p == '.' || unlet) {
2167 if (!quiet)
2168 EMSG2(_(e_dictkey), key)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictkey))), (char_u *)(key
));
2169 if (len == -1)
2170 clear_tv(&var1);
2171 return NULL((void*)0);
2172 }
2173 if (len == -1)
2174 lp->ll_newkey = vim_strsave(key);
2175 else
2176 lp->ll_newkey = vim_strnsave(key, len);
2177 if (len == -1)
2178 clear_tv(&var1);
2179 break;
2180 } else if (var_check_ro(lp->ll_di->di_flags, name, false0)) {
2181 // existing variable, need to check if it can be changed
2182 return NULL((void*)0);
2183 }
2184
2185 if (len == -1)
2186 clear_tv(&var1);
2187 lp->ll_tv = &lp->ll_di->di_tv;
2188 } else {
2189 /*
2190 * Get the number and item for the only or first index of the List.
2191 */
2192 if (empty1)
2193 lp->ll_n1 = 0;
2194 else {
2195 lp->ll_n1 = get_tv_number(&var1); /* is number or string */
2196 clear_tv(&var1);
2197 }
2198 lp->ll_dict = NULL((void*)0);
2199 lp->ll_list = lp->ll_tv->vval.v_list;
2200 lp->ll_li = list_find(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_n1);
2201 if (lp->ll_li == NULL((void*)0)) {
2202 if (lp->ll_n1 < 0) {
2203 lp->ll_n1 = 0;
2204 lp->ll_li = list_find(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_n1);
2205 }
2206 }
2207 if (lp->ll_li == NULL((void*)0)) {
2208 if (lp->ll_range && !lp->ll_empty2)
2209 clear_tv(&var2);
2210 if (!quiet)
2211 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), lp->ll_n1)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t)(lp->
ll_n1));
2212 return NULL((void*)0);
2213 }
2214
2215 /*
2216 * May need to find the item or absolute index for the second
2217 * index of a range.
2218 * When no index given: "lp->ll_empty2" is TRUE.
2219 * Otherwise "lp->ll_n2" is set to the second index.
2220 */
2221 if (lp->ll_range && !lp->ll_empty2) {
2222 lp->ll_n2 = get_tv_number(&var2); /* is number or string */
2223 clear_tv(&var2);
2224 if (lp->ll_n2 < 0) {
2225 ni = list_find(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_n2);
2226 if (ni == NULL((void*)0)) {
2227 if (!quiet)
2228 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), lp->ll_n2)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t)(lp->
ll_n2));
2229 return NULL((void*)0);
2230 }
2231 lp->ll_n2 = list_idx_of_item(lp->ll_list, ni);
2232 }
2233
2234 /* Check that lp->ll_n2 isn't before lp->ll_n1. */
2235 if (lp->ll_n1 < 0)
2236 lp->ll_n1 = list_idx_of_item(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_li);
2237 if (lp->ll_n2 < lp->ll_n1) {
2238 if (!quiet)
2239 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), lp->ll_n2)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t)(lp->
ll_n2));
2240 return NULL((void*)0);
2241 }
2242 }
2243
2244 lp->ll_tv = &lp->ll_li->li_tv;
2245 }
2246 }
2247
2248 return p;
2249}
2250
2251/*
2252 * Clear lval "lp" that was filled by get_lval().
2253 */
2254static void clear_lval(lval_T *lp)
2255{
2256 xfree(lp->ll_exp_name);
2257 xfree(lp->ll_newkey);
2258}
2259
2260/*
2261 * Set a variable that was parsed by get_lval() to "rettv".
2262 * "endp" points to just after the parsed name.
2263 * "op" is NULL, "+" for "+=", "-" for "-=", "." for ".=" or "=" for "=".
2264 */
2265static void set_var_lval(lval_T *lp, char_u *endp, typval_T *rettv, int copy, char_u *op)
2266{
2267 int cc;
2268 listitem_T *ri;
2269 dictitem_T *di;
2270
2271 if (lp->ll_tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
2272 if (!check_changedtick(lp->ll_name)) {
2273 cc = *endp;
2274 *endp = NUL'\000';
2275 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
2276 typval_T tv;
2277
2278 // handle +=, -= and .=
2279 di = NULL((void*)0);
2280 if (get_var_tv(lp->ll_name, (int)STRLEN(lp->ll_name)strlen((char *)(lp->ll_name)),
2281 &tv, &di, true1, false0) == OK1) {
2282 if ((di == NULL((void*)0)
2283 || (!var_check_ro(di->di_flags, lp->ll_name, false0) &&
2284 !tv_check_lock(di->di_tv.v_lock, lp->ll_name, false0)))
2285 && tv_op(&tv, rettv, op) == OK1) {
2286 set_var(lp->ll_name, &tv, false0);
2287 }
2288 clear_tv(&tv);
2289 }
2290 } else
2291 set_var(lp->ll_name, rettv, copy);
2292 *endp = cc;
2293 }
2294 } else if (tv_check_lock(lp->ll_newkey == NULL((void*)0)
2295 ? lp->ll_tv->v_lock
2296 : lp->ll_tv->vval.v_dict->dv_lock,
2297 lp->ll_name, false0)) {
2298 } else if (lp->ll_range) {
2299 listitem_T *ll_li = lp->ll_li;
2300 int ll_n1 = lp->ll_n1;
2301
2302 // Check whether any of the list items is locked
2303 for (listitem_T *ri = rettv->vval.v_list->lv_first;
2304 ri != NULL((void*)0) && ll_li != NULL((void*)0); ) {
2305 if (tv_check_lock(ll_li->li_tv.v_lock, lp->ll_name, false0)) {
2306 return;
2307 }
2308 ri = ri->li_next;
2309 if (ri == NULL((void*)0) || (!lp->ll_empty2 && lp->ll_n2 == ll_n1)) {
2310 break;
2311 }
2312 ll_li = ll_li->li_next;
2313 ll_n1++;
2314 }
2315
2316 /*
2317 * Assign the List values to the list items.
2318 */
2319 for (ri = rettv->vval.v_list->lv_first; ri != NULL((void*)0); ) {
2320 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=')
2321 tv_op(&lp->ll_li->li_tv, &ri->li_tv, op);
2322 else {
2323 clear_tv(&lp->ll_li->li_tv);
2324 copy_tv(&ri->li_tv, &lp->ll_li->li_tv);
2325 }
2326 ri = ri->li_next;
2327 if (ri == NULL((void*)0) || (!lp->ll_empty2 && lp->ll_n2 == lp->ll_n1))
2328 break;
2329 if (lp->ll_li->li_next == NULL((void*)0)) {
2330 /* Need to add an empty item. */
2331 list_append_number(lp->ll_list, 0);
2332 assert(lp->ll_li->li_next)((lp->ll_li->li_next) ? (void) (0) : __assert_fail ("lp->ll_li->li_next"
, "/home/travis/build/neovim/bot-ci/build/neovim/src/nvim/eval.c"
, 2332, __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
2333 }
2334 lp->ll_li = lp->ll_li->li_next;
2335 ++lp->ll_n1;
2336 }
2337 if (ri != NULL((void*)0))
2338 EMSG(_("E710: List value has more items than target"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E710: List value has more items than target"
))));
2339 else if (lp->ll_empty2
2340 ? (lp->ll_li != NULL((void*)0) && lp->ll_li->li_next != NULL((void*)0))
2341 : lp->ll_n1 != lp->ll_n2)
2342 EMSG(_("E711: List value has not enough items"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E711: List value has not enough items"
))));
2343 } else {
2344 typval_T oldtv;
2345 dict_T *dict = lp->ll_dict;
2346 bool_Bool watched = is_watched(dict);
2347
2348 if (watched) {
2349 init_tv(&oldtv);
2350 }
2351
2352 /*
2353 * Assign to a List or Dictionary item.
2354 */
2355 if (lp->ll_newkey != NULL((void*)0)) {
2356 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
2357 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (char_u *)(op
));
2358 return;
2359 }
2360
2361 /* Need to add an item to the Dictionary. */
2362 di = dictitem_alloc(lp->ll_newkey);
2363 if (dict_add(lp->ll_tv->vval.v_dict, di) == FAIL0) {
2364 xfree(di);
2365 return;
2366 }
2367 lp->ll_tv = &di->di_tv;
2368 } else {
2369 if (watched) {
2370 copy_tv(lp->ll_tv, &oldtv);
2371 }
2372
2373 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
2374 tv_op(lp->ll_tv, rettv, op);
2375 goto notify;
2376 } else {
2377 clear_tv(lp->ll_tv);
2378 }
2379 }
2380
2381 // Assign the value to the variable or list item.
2382 if (copy) {
2383 copy_tv(rettv, lp->ll_tv);
2384 } else {
2385 *lp->ll_tv = *rettv;
2386 lp->ll_tv->v_lock = 0;
2387 init_tv(rettv);
2388 }
2389
2390notify:
2391 if (watched) {
2392 if (oldtv.v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
2393 dictwatcher_notify(dict, (char *)lp->ll_newkey, lp->ll_tv, NULL((void*)0));
2394 } else {
2395 dictitem_T *di = lp->ll_di;
2396 dictwatcher_notify(dict, (char *)di->di_key, lp->ll_tv, &oldtv);
2397 clear_tv(&oldtv);
2398 }
2399 }
2400 }
2401}
2402
2403/*
2404 * Handle "tv1 += tv2", "tv1 -= tv2" and "tv1 .= tv2"
2405 * Returns OK or FAIL.
2406 */
2407static int tv_op(typval_T *tv1, typval_T *tv2, char_u *op)
2408{
2409 long n;
2410 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN65];
2411 char_u *s;
2412
2413 /* Can't do anything with a Funcref or a Dict on the right. */
2414 if (tv2->v_type != VAR_FUNC3 && tv2->v_type != VAR_DICT5) {
2415 switch (tv1->v_type) {
2416 case VAR_DICT5:
2417 case VAR_FUNC3:
2418 break;
2419
2420 case VAR_LIST4:
2421 if (*op != '+' || tv2->v_type != VAR_LIST4)
2422 break;
2423 /* List += List */
2424 if (tv1->vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0) && tv2->vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0))
2425 list_extend(tv1->vval.v_list, tv2->vval.v_list, NULL((void*)0));
2426 return OK1;
2427
2428 case VAR_NUMBER1:
2429 case VAR_STRING2:
2430 if (tv2->v_type == VAR_LIST4)
2431 break;
2432 if (*op == '+' || *op == '-') {
2433 /* nr += nr or nr -= nr*/
2434 n = get_tv_number(tv1);
2435 if (tv2->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
2436 float_T f = n;
2437
2438 if (*op == '+')
2439 f += tv2->vval.v_float;
2440 else
2441 f -= tv2->vval.v_float;
2442 clear_tv(tv1);
2443 tv1->v_type = VAR_FLOAT6;
2444 tv1->vval.v_float = f;
2445 } else {
2446 if (*op == '+')
2447 n += get_tv_number(tv2);
2448 else
2449 n -= get_tv_number(tv2);
2450 clear_tv(tv1);
2451 tv1->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
2452 tv1->vval.v_number = n;
2453 }
2454 } else {
2455 if (tv2->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
2456 break;
2457
2458 /* str .= str */
2459 s = get_tv_string(tv1);
2460 s = concat_str(s, get_tv_string_buf(tv2, numbuf));
2461 clear_tv(tv1);
2462 tv1->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
2463 tv1->vval.v_string = s;
2464 }
2465 return OK1;
2466
2467 case VAR_FLOAT6:
2468 {
2469 float_T f;
2470
2471 if (*op == '.' || (tv2->v_type != VAR_FLOAT6
2472 && tv2->v_type != VAR_NUMBER1
2473 && tv2->v_type != VAR_STRING2))
2474 break;
2475 if (tv2->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
2476 f = tv2->vval.v_float;
2477 else
2478 f = get_tv_number(tv2);
2479 if (*op == '+')
2480 tv1->vval.v_float += f;
2481 else
2482 tv1->vval.v_float -= f;
2483 }
2484 return OK1;
2485 }
2486 }
2487
2488 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (char_u *)(op
));
2489 return FAIL0;
2490}
2491
2492/*
2493 * Add a watcher to a list.
2494 */
2495void list_add_watch(list_T *l, listwatch_T *lw)
2496{
2497 lw->lw_next = l->lv_watch;
2498 l->lv_watch = lw;
2499}
2500
2501/*
2502 * Remove a watcher from a list.
2503 * No warning when it isn't found...
2504 */
2505void list_rem_watch(list_T *l, listwatch_T *lwrem)
2506{
2507 listwatch_T *lw, **lwp;
2508
2509 lwp = &l->lv_watch;
2510 for (lw = l->lv_watch; lw != NULL((void*)0); lw = lw->lw_next) {
2511 if (lw == lwrem) {
2512 *lwp = lw->lw_next;
2513 break;
2514 }
2515 lwp = &lw->lw_next;
2516 }
2517}
2518
2519/*
2520 * Just before removing an item from a list: advance watchers to the next
2521 * item.
2522 */
2523static void list_fix_watch(list_T *l, listitem_T *item)
2524{
2525 listwatch_T *lw;
2526
2527 for (lw = l->lv_watch; lw != NULL((void*)0); lw = lw->lw_next)
2528 if (lw->lw_item == item)
2529 lw->lw_item = item->li_next;
2530}
2531
2532/*
2533 * Evaluate the expression used in a ":for var in expr" command.
2534 * "arg" points to "var".
2535 * Set "*errp" to TRUE for an error, FALSE otherwise;
2536 * Return a pointer that holds the info. Null when there is an error.
2537 */
2538void *eval_for_line(char_u *arg, int *errp, char_u **nextcmdp, int skip)
2539{
2540 forinfo_T *fi = xcalloc(1, sizeof(forinfo_T));
2541 char_u *expr;
2542 typval_T tv;
2543 list_T *l;
2544
2545 *errp = TRUE1; /* default: there is an error */
2546
2547 expr = skip_var_list(arg, &fi->fi_varcount, &fi->fi_semicolon);
2548 if (expr == NULL((void*)0))
2549 return fi;
2550
2551 expr = skipwhite(expr);
2552 if (expr[0] != 'i' || expr[1] != 'n' || !ascii_iswhite(expr[2])) {
2553 EMSG(_("E690: Missing \"in\" after :for"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E690: Missing \"in\" after :for"
))));
2554 return fi;
2555 }
2556
2557 if (skip)
2558 ++emsg_skip;
2559 if (eval0(skipwhite(expr + 2), &tv, nextcmdp, !skip) == OK1) {
2560 *errp = FALSE0;
2561 if (!skip) {
2562 l = tv.vval.v_list;
2563 if (tv.v_type != VAR_LIST4 || l == NULL((void*)0)) {
2564 EMSG(_(e_listreq))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listreq))));
2565 clear_tv(&tv);
2566 } else {
2567 /* No need to increment the refcount, it's already set for the
2568 * list being used in "tv". */
2569 fi->fi_list = l;
2570 list_add_watch(l, &fi->fi_lw);
2571 fi->fi_lw.lw_item = l->lv_first;
2572 }
2573 }
2574 }
2575 if (skip)
2576 --emsg_skip;
2577
2578 return fi;
2579}
2580
2581/*
2582 * Use the first item in a ":for" list. Advance to the next.
2583 * Assign the values to the variable (list). "arg" points to the first one.
2584 * Return TRUE when a valid item was found, FALSE when at end of list or
2585 * something wrong.
2586 */
2587int next_for_item(void *fi_void, char_u *arg)
2588{
2589 forinfo_T *fi = (forinfo_T *)fi_void;
2590 int result;
2591 listitem_T *item;
2592
2593 item = fi->fi_lw.lw_item;
2594 if (item == NULL((void*)0))
2595 result = FALSE0;
2596 else {
2597 fi->fi_lw.lw_item = item->li_next;
2598 result = (ex_let_vars(arg, &item->li_tv, TRUE1,
2599 fi->fi_semicolon, fi->fi_varcount, NULL((void*)0)) == OK1);
2600 }
2601 return result;
2602}
2603
2604/*
2605 * Free the structure used to store info used by ":for".
2606 */
2607void free_for_info(void *fi_void)
2608{
2609 forinfo_T *fi = (forinfo_T *)fi_void;
2610
2611 if (fi != NULL((void*)0) && fi->fi_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
2612 list_rem_watch(fi->fi_list, &fi->fi_lw);
2613 list_unref(fi->fi_list);
2614 }
2615 xfree(fi);
2616}
2617
2618
2619void set_context_for_expression(expand_T *xp, char_u *arg, cmdidx_T cmdidx)
2620{
2621 int got_eq = FALSE0;
2622 int c;
2623 char_u *p;
2624
2625 if (cmdidx == CMD_let) {
2626 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_USER_VARS;
2627 if (vim_strpbrk(arg, (char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#")(char_u *)strpbrk((char *)(arg), (char *)((char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#"
)) == NULL((void*)0)) {
2628 /* ":let var1 var2 ...": find last space. */
2629 for (p = arg + STRLEN(arg)strlen((char *)(arg)); p >= arg; ) {
2630 xp->xp_pattern = p;
2631 mb_ptr_back(arg, p)(p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)((char_u *)arg, (char_u *)p -
1) + 1) : 1);
2632 if (ascii_iswhite(*p))
2633 break;
2634 }
2635 return;
2636 }
2637 } else
2638 xp->xp_context = cmdidx == CMD_call ? EXPAND_FUNCTIONS
2639 : EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2640 while ((xp->xp_pattern = vim_strpbrk(arg,(char_u *)strpbrk((char *)(arg), (char *)((char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#"
))
2641 (char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#")(char_u *)strpbrk((char *)(arg), (char *)((char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#"
))) != NULL((void*)0)) {
2642 c = *xp->xp_pattern;
2643 if (c == '&') {
2644 c = xp->xp_pattern[1];
2645 if (c == '&') {
2646 ++xp->xp_pattern;
2647 xp->xp_context = cmdidx != CMD_let || got_eq
2648 ? EXPAND_EXPRESSION : EXPAND_NOTHING;
2649 } else if (c != ' ') {
2650 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_SETTINGS;
2651 if ((c == 'l' || c == 'g') && xp->xp_pattern[2] == ':')
2652 xp->xp_pattern += 2;
2653
2654 }
2655 } else if (c == '$') {
2656 /* environment variable */
2657 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_ENV_VARS;
2658 } else if (c == '=') {
2659 got_eq = TRUE1;
2660 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2661 } else if ((c == '<' || c == '#')
2662 && xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FUNCTIONS
2663 && vim_strchr(xp->xp_pattern, '(') == NULL((void*)0)) {
2664 /* Function name can start with "<SNR>" and contain '#'. */
2665 break;
2666 } else if (cmdidx != CMD_let || got_eq) {
2667 if (c == '"') { /* string */
2668 while ((c = *++xp->xp_pattern) != NUL'\000' && c != '"')
2669 if (c == '\\' && xp->xp_pattern[1] != NUL'\000')
2670 ++xp->xp_pattern;
2671 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
2672 } else if (c == '\'') { /* literal string */
2673 /* Trick: '' is like stopping and starting a literal string. */
2674 while ((c = *++xp->xp_pattern) != NUL'\000' && c != '\'')
2675 /* skip */;
2676 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
2677 } else if (c == '|') {
2678 if (xp->xp_pattern[1] == '|') {
2679 ++xp->xp_pattern;
2680 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2681 } else
2682 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_COMMANDS;
2683 } else
2684 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2685 } else
2686 /* Doesn't look like something valid, expand as an expression
2687 * anyway. */
2688 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2689 arg = xp->xp_pattern;
2690 if (*arg != NUL'\000')
2691 while ((c = *++arg) != NUL'\000' && (c == ' ' || c == '\t'))
2692 /* skip */;
2693 }
2694 xp->xp_pattern = arg;
2695}
2696
2697
2698/*
2699 * ":1,25call func(arg1, arg2)" function call.
2700 */
2701void ex_call(exarg_T *eap)
2702{
2703 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
2704 char_u *startarg;
2705 char_u *name;
2706 char_u *tofree;
2707 int len;
2708 typval_T rettv;
2709 linenr_T lnum;
2710 int doesrange;
2711 int failed = FALSE0;
2712 funcdict_T fudi;
2713
2714 if (eap->skip) {
2715 /* trans_function_name() doesn't work well when skipping, use eval0()
2716 * instead to skip to any following command, e.g. for:
2717 * :if 0 | call dict.foo().bar() | endif */
2718 ++emsg_skip;
2719 if (eval0(eap->arg, &rettv, &eap->nextcmd, FALSE0) != FAIL0)
2720 clear_tv(&rettv);
2721 --emsg_skip;
2722 return;
2723 }
2724
2725 tofree = trans_function_name(&arg, eap->skip, TFN_INT1, &fudi);
2726 if (fudi.fd_newkey != NULL((void*)0)) {
2727 /* Still need to give an error message for missing key. */
2728 EMSG2(_(e_dictkey), fudi.fd_newkey)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictkey))), (char_u *)(fudi
.fd_newkey));
2729 xfree(fudi.fd_newkey);
2730 }
2731 if (tofree == NULL((void*)0))
2732 return;
2733
2734 /* Increase refcount on dictionary, it could get deleted when evaluating
2735 * the arguments. */
2736 if (fudi.fd_dict != NULL((void*)0))
2737 ++fudi.fd_dict->dv_refcount;
2738
2739 /* If it is the name of a variable of type VAR_FUNC use its contents. */
2740 len = (int)STRLEN(tofree)strlen((char *)(tofree));
2741 name = deref_func_name(tofree, &len, FALSE0);
2742
2743 /* Skip white space to allow ":call func ()". Not good, but required for
2744 * backward compatibility. */
2745 startarg = skipwhite(arg);
2746 rettv.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0; /* clear_tv() uses this */
2747
2748 if (*startarg != '(') {
2749 EMSG2(_("E107: Missing parentheses: %s"), eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E107: Missing parentheses: %s"
))), (char_u *)(eap->arg));
2750 goto end;
2751 }
2752
2753 /*
2754 * When skipping, evaluate the function once, to find the end of the
2755 * arguments.
2756 * When the function takes a range, this is discovered after the first
2757 * call, and the loop is broken.
2758 */
2759 if (eap->skip) {
2760 ++emsg_skip;
2761 lnum = eap->line2; /* do it once, also with an invalid range */
2762 } else
2763 lnum = eap->line1;
2764 for (; lnum <= eap->line2; ++lnum) {
2765 if (!eap->skip && eap->addr_count > 0) {
2766 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum;
2767 curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
2768 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
2769 }
2770 arg = startarg;
2771 if (get_func_tv(name, (int)STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)), &rettv, &arg,
2772 eap->line1, eap->line2, &doesrange,
2773 !eap->skip, fudi.fd_dict) == FAIL0) {
2774 failed = TRUE1;
2775 break;
2776 }
2777
2778 /* Handle a function returning a Funcref, Dictionary or List. */
2779 if (handle_subscript(&arg, &rettv, !eap->skip, TRUE1) == FAIL0) {
2780 failed = TRUE1;
2781 break;
2782 }
2783
2784 clear_tv(&rettv);
2785 if (doesrange || eap->skip)
2786 break;
2787
2788 /* Stop when immediately aborting on error, or when an interrupt
2789 * occurred or an exception was thrown but not caught.
2790 * get_func_tv() returned OK, so that the check for trailing
2791 * characters below is executed. */
2792 if (aborting())
2793 break;
2794 }
2795 if (eap->skip)
2796 --emsg_skip;
2797
2798 if (!failed) {
2799 /* Check for trailing illegal characters and a following command. */
