2800 if (!ends_excmd(*arg)) {
2801 emsg_severe = TRUE1;
2802 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
2803 } else
2804 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
2805 }
2806
2807end:
2808 dict_unref(fudi.fd_dict);
2809 xfree(tofree);
2810}
2811
2812/*
2813 * ":unlet[!] var1 ... " command.
2814 */
2815void ex_unlet(exarg_T *eap)
2816{
2817 ex_unletlock(eap, eap->arg, 0);
2818}
2819
2820/*
2821 * ":lockvar" and ":unlockvar" commands
2822 */
2823void ex_lockvar(exarg_T *eap)
2824{
2825 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
2826 int deep = 2;
2827
2828 if (eap->forceit)
2829 deep = -1;
2830 else if (ascii_isdigit(*arg)) {
2831 deep = getdigits_int(&arg);
2832 arg = skipwhite(arg);
2833 }
2834
2835 ex_unletlock(eap, arg, deep);
2836}
2837
2838/*
2839 * ":unlet", ":lockvar" and ":unlockvar" are quite similar.
2840 */
2841static void ex_unletlock(exarg_T *eap, char_u *argstart, int deep)
2842{
2843 char_u *arg = argstart;
2844 char_u *name_end;
2845 int error = FALSE0;
2846 lval_T lv;
2847
2848 do {
2849 /* Parse the name and find the end. */
2850 name_end = get_lval(arg, NULL((void*)0), &lv, TRUE1, eap->skip || error, 0,
2851 FNE_CHECK_START2);
2852 if (lv.ll_name == NULL((void*)0))
2853 error = TRUE1; /* error but continue parsing */
2854 if (name_end == NULL((void*)0) || (!ascii_iswhite(*name_end)
2855 && !ends_excmd(*name_end))) {
2856 if (name_end != NULL((void*)0)) {
2857 emsg_severe = TRUE1;
2858 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
2859 }
2860 if (!(eap->skip || error))
2861 clear_lval(&lv);
2862 break;
2863 }
2864
2865 if (!error && !eap->skip) {
2866 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_unlet) {
2867 if (do_unlet_var(&lv, name_end, eap->forceit) == FAIL0)
2868 error = TRUE1;
2869 } else {
2870 if (do_lock_var(&lv, name_end, deep,
2871 eap->cmdidx == CMD_lockvar) == FAIL0)
2872 error = TRUE1;
2873 }
2874 }
2875
2876 if (!eap->skip)
2877 clear_lval(&lv);
2878
2879 arg = skipwhite(name_end);
2880 } while (!ends_excmd(*arg));
2881
2882 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
2883}
2884
2885static int do_unlet_var(lval_T *lp, char_u *name_end, int forceit)
2886{
2887 int ret = OK1;
2888 int cc;
2889
2890 if (lp->ll_tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
2891 cc = *name_end;
2892 *name_end = NUL'\000';
2893
2894 /* Normal name or expanded name. */
2895 if (check_changedtick(lp->ll_name))
2896 ret = FAIL0;
2897 else if (do_unlet(lp->ll_name, forceit) == FAIL0)
2898 ret = FAIL0;
2899 *name_end = cc;
2900 } else if ((lp->ll_list != NULL((void*)0)
2901 && tv_check_lock(lp->ll_list->lv_lock, lp->ll_name, false0))
2902 || (lp->ll_dict != NULL((void*)0)
2903 && tv_check_lock(lp->ll_dict->dv_lock, lp->ll_name, false0))) {
2904 return FAIL0;
2905 } else if (lp->ll_range) {
2906 listitem_T *li;
2907 listitem_T *ll_li = lp->ll_li;
2908 int ll_n1 = lp->ll_n1;
2909
2910 while (ll_li != NULL((void*)0) && (lp->ll_empty2 || lp->ll_n2 >= ll_n1)) {
2911 li = ll_li->li_next;
2912 if (tv_check_lock(ll_li->li_tv.v_lock, lp->ll_name, false0)) {
2913 return false0;
2914 }
2915 ll_li = li;
2916 ll_n1++;
2917 }
2918
2919 /* Delete a range of List items. */
2920 while (lp->ll_li != NULL((void*)0) && (lp->ll_empty2 || lp->ll_n2 >= lp->ll_n1)) {
2921 li = lp->ll_li->li_next;
2922 listitem_remove(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_li);
2923 lp->ll_li = li;
2924 ++lp->ll_n1;
2925 }
2926 } else {
2927 if (lp->ll_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
2928 // unlet a List item.
2929 listitem_remove(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_li);
2930 } else {
2931 // unlet a Dictionary item.
2932 dict_T *d = lp->ll_dict;
2933 dictitem_T *di = lp->ll_di;
2934 bool_Bool watched = is_watched(d);
2935 char *key = NULL((void*)0);
2936 typval_T oldtv;
2937
2938 if (watched) {
2939 copy_tv(&di->di_tv, &oldtv);
2940 // need to save key because dictitem_remove will free it
2941 key = xstrdup((char *)di->di_key);
2942 }
2943
2944 dictitem_remove(d, di);
2945
2946 if (watched) {
2947 dictwatcher_notify(d, key, NULL((void*)0), &oldtv);
2948 clear_tv(&oldtv);
2949 xfree(key);
2950 }
2951 }
2952 }
2953
2954 return ret;
2955}
2956
2957/*
2958 * "unlet" a variable. Return OK if it existed, FAIL if not.
2959 * When "forceit" is TRUE don't complain if the variable doesn't exist.
2960 */
2961int do_unlet(char_u *name, int forceit)
2962{
2963 hashtab_T *ht;
2964 hashitem_T *hi;
2965 char_u *varname;
2966 dict_T *d;
2967 dictitem_T *di;
2968 dict_T *dict;
2969 ht = find_var_ht_dict(name, &varname, &dict);
2970
2971 if (ht != NULL((void*)0) && *varname != NUL'\000') {
2972 if (ht == &globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab) {
2973 d = &globvardict;
2974 } else if (current_funccal != NULL((void*)0)
2975 && ht == &current_funccal->l_vars.dv_hashtab) {
2976 d = &current_funccal->l_vars;
2977 } else {
2978 di = find_var_in_ht(ht, *name, (char_u *)"", false0);
2979 d = di->di_tv.vval.v_dict;
2980 }
2981
2982 hi = hash_find(ht, varname);
2983 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
2984 di = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
2985 if (var_check_fixed(di->di_flags, name, false0)
2986 || var_check_ro(di->di_flags, name, false0)
2987 || tv_check_lock(d->dv_lock, name, false0)) {
2988 return FAIL0;
2989 }
2990 typval_T oldtv;
2991 bool_Bool watched = is_watched(dict);
2992
2993 if (watched) {
2994 copy_tv(&di->di_tv, &oldtv);
2995 }
2996
2997 delete_var(ht, hi);
2998
2999 if (watched) {
3000 dictwatcher_notify(dict, (char *)varname, NULL((void*)0), &oldtv);
3001 clear_tv(&oldtv);
3002 }
3003 return OK1;
3004 }
3005 }
3006 if (forceit)
3007 return OK1;
3008 EMSG2(_("E108: No such variable: \"%s\""), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E108: No such variable: \"%s\""
))), (char_u *)(name));
3009 return FAIL0;
3010}
3011
3012/*
3013 * Lock or unlock variable indicated by "lp".
3014 * "deep" is the levels to go (-1 for unlimited);
3015 * "lock" is TRUE for ":lockvar", FALSE for ":unlockvar".
3016 */
3017static int do_lock_var(lval_T *lp, char_u *name_end, int deep, int lock)
3018{
3019 int ret = OK1;
3020 int cc;
3021 dictitem_T *di;
3022
3023 if (deep == 0) /* nothing to do */
3024 return OK1;
3025
3026 if (lp->ll_tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
3027 cc = *name_end;
3028 *name_end = NUL'\000';
3029
3030 /* Normal name or expanded name. */
3031 if (check_changedtick(lp->ll_name))
3032 ret = FAIL0;
3033 else {
3034 di = find_var(lp->ll_name, NULL((void*)0), TRUE1);
3035 if (di == NULL((void*)0))
3036 ret = FAIL0;
3037 else {
3038 if (lock)
3039 di->di_flags |= DI_FLAGS_LOCK8;
3040 else
3041 di->di_flags &= ~DI_FLAGS_LOCK8;
3042 item_lock(&di->di_tv, deep, lock);
3043 }
3044 }
3045 *name_end = cc;
3046 } else if (lp->ll_range) {
3047 listitem_T *li = lp->ll_li;
3048
3049 /* (un)lock a range of List items. */
3050 while (li != NULL((void*)0) && (lp->ll_empty2 || lp->ll_n2 >= lp->ll_n1)) {
3051 item_lock(&li->li_tv, deep, lock);
3052 li = li->li_next;
3053 ++lp->ll_n1;
3054 }
3055 } else if (lp->ll_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
3056 // (un)lock a List item.
3057 item_lock(&lp->ll_li->li_tv, deep, lock);
3058 } else {
3059 // (un)lock a Dictionary item.
3060 item_lock(&lp->ll_di->di_tv, deep, lock);
3061 }
3062
3063 return ret;
3064}
3065
3066/*
3067 * Lock or unlock an item. "deep" is nr of levels to go.
3068 */
3069static void item_lock(typval_T *tv, int deep, int lock)
3070{
3071 static int recurse = 0;
3072 list_T *l;
3073 listitem_T *li;
3074 dict_T *d;
3075 hashitem_T *hi;
3076 int todo;
3077
3078 if (recurse >= DICT_MAXNEST100) {
3079 EMSG(_("E743: variable nested too deep for (un)lock"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E743: variable nested too deep for (un)lock"
))));
3080 return;
3081 }
3082 if (deep == 0)
3083 return;
3084 ++recurse;
3085
3086 /* lock/unlock the item itself */
3087 if (lock)
3088 tv->v_lock |= VAR_LOCKED1;
3089 else
3090 tv->v_lock &= ~VAR_LOCKED1;
3091
3092 switch (tv->v_type) {
3093 case VAR_LIST4:
3094 if ((l = tv->vval.v_list) != NULL((void*)0)) {
3095 if (lock)
3096 l->lv_lock |= VAR_LOCKED1;
3097 else
3098 l->lv_lock &= ~VAR_LOCKED1;
3099 if (deep < 0 || deep > 1)
3100 /* recursive: lock/unlock the items the List contains */
3101 for (li = l->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0); li = li->li_next)
3102 item_lock(&li->li_tv, deep - 1, lock);
3103 }
3104 break;
3105 case VAR_DICT5:
3106 if ((d = tv->vval.v_dict) != NULL((void*)0)) {
3107 if (lock)
3108 d->dv_lock |= VAR_LOCKED1;
3109 else
3110 d->dv_lock &= ~VAR_LOCKED1;
3111 if (deep < 0 || deep > 1) {
3112 /* recursive: lock/unlock the items the List contains */
3113 todo = (int)d->dv_hashtab.ht_used;
3114 for (hi = d->dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
3115 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
3116 --todo;
3117 item_lock(&HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)))->di_tv, deep - 1, lock);
3118 }
3119 }
3120 }
3121 }
3122 }
3123 --recurse;
3124}
3125
3126/*
3127 * Return TRUE if typeval "tv" is locked: Either that value is locked itself
3128 * or it refers to a List or Dictionary that is locked.
3129 */
3130static int tv_islocked(typval_T *tv)
3131{
3132 return (tv->v_lock & VAR_LOCKED1)
3133 || (tv->v_type == VAR_LIST4
3134 && tv->vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0)
3135 && (tv->vval.v_list->lv_lock & VAR_LOCKED1))
3136 || (tv->v_type == VAR_DICT5
3137 && tv->vval.v_dict != NULL((void*)0)
3138 && (tv->vval.v_dict->dv_lock & VAR_LOCKED1));
3139}
3140
3141/*
3142 * Delete all "menutrans_" variables.
3143 */
3144void del_menutrans_vars(void)
3145{
3146 hashitem_T *hi;
3147 int todo;
3148
3149 hash_lock(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab);
3150 todo = (int)globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_used;
3151 for (hi = globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi) {
3152 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
3153 --todo;
3154 if (STRNCMP(HI2DI(hi)->di_key, "menutrans_", 10)strncmp((char *)(((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key)))->di_key), (char *)("menutrans_"), (
size_t)(10)) == 0)
3155 delete_var(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab, hi);
3156 }
3157 }
3158 hash_unlock(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab);
3159}
3160
3161/*
3162 * Local string buffer for the next two functions to store a variable name
3163 * with its prefix. Allocated in cat_prefix_varname(), freed later in
3164 * get_user_var_name().
3165 */
3166
3167
3168static char_u *varnamebuf = NULL((void*)0);
3169static size_t varnamebuflen = 0;
3170
3171/*
3172 * Function to concatenate a prefix and a variable name.
3173 */
3174static char_u *cat_prefix_varname(int prefix, char_u *name)
3175{
3176 size_t len = STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)) + 3;
3177
3178 if (len > varnamebuflen) {
3179 xfree(varnamebuf);
3180 len += 10; /* some additional space */
3181 varnamebuf = xmalloc(len);
3182 varnamebuflen = len;
3183 }
3184 *varnamebuf = prefix;
3185 varnamebuf[1] = ':';
3186 STRCPY(varnamebuf + 2, name)strcpy((char *)(varnamebuf + 2), (char *)(name));
3187 return varnamebuf;
3188}
3189
3190/*
3191 * Function given to ExpandGeneric() to obtain the list of user defined
3192 * (global/buffer/window/built-in) variable names.
3193 */
3194char_u *get_user_var_name(expand_T *xp, int idx)
3195{
3196 static size_t gdone;
3197 static size_t bdone;
3198 static size_t wdone;
3199 static size_t tdone;
3200 static int vidx;
3201 static hashitem_T *hi;
3202 hashtab_T *ht;
3203
3204 if (idx == 0) {
3205 gdone = bdone = wdone = vidx = 0;
3206 tdone = 0;
3207 }
3208
3209 /* Global variables */
3210 if (gdone < globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_used) {
3211 if (gdone++ == 0)
3212 hi = globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_array;
3213 else
3214 ++hi;
3215 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
3216 ++hi;
3217 if (STRNCMP("g:", xp->xp_pattern, 2)strncmp((char *)("g:"), (char *)(xp->xp_pattern), (size_t)
(2)) == 0)
3218 return cat_prefix_varname('g', hi->hi_key);
3219 return hi->hi_key;
3220 }
3221
3222 /* b: variables */
3223 ht = &curbuf->b_vars->dv_hashtab;
3224 if (bdone < ht->ht_used) {
3225 if (bdone++ == 0)
3226 hi = ht->ht_array;
3227 else
3228 ++hi;
3229 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
3230 ++hi;
3231 return cat_prefix_varname('b', hi->hi_key);
3232 }
3233 if (bdone == ht->ht_used) {
3234 ++bdone;
3235 return (char_u *)"b:changedtick";
3236 }
3237
3238 /* w: variables */
3239 ht = &curwin->w_vars->dv_hashtab;
3240 if (wdone < ht->ht_used) {
3241 if (wdone++ == 0)
3242 hi = ht->ht_array;
3243 else
3244 ++hi;
3245 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
3246 ++hi;
3247 return cat_prefix_varname('w', hi->hi_key);
3248 }
3249
3250 /* t: variables */
3251 ht = &curtab->tp_vars->dv_hashtab;
3252 if (tdone < ht->ht_used) {
3253 if (tdone++ == 0)
3254 hi = ht->ht_array;
3255 else
3256 ++hi;
3257 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
3258 ++hi;
3259 return cat_prefix_varname('t', hi->hi_key);
3260 }
3261
3262 /* v: variables */
3263 if (vidx < VV_LEN)
3264 return cat_prefix_varname('v', (char_u *)vimvars[vidx++].vv_name);
3265
3266 xfree(varnamebuf);
3267 varnamebuf = NULL((void*)0);
3268 varnamebuflen = 0;
3269 return NULL((void*)0);
3270}
3271
3272
3273/*
3274 * types for expressions.
3275 */
3276typedef enum {
3277 TYPE_UNKNOWN = 0
3278 , TYPE_EQUAL /* == */
3279 , TYPE_NEQUAL /* != */
3280 , TYPE_GREATER /* > */
3281 , TYPE_GEQUAL /* >= */
3282 , TYPE_SMALLER /* < */
3283 , TYPE_SEQUAL /* <= */
3284 , TYPE_MATCH /* =~ */
3285 , TYPE_NOMATCH /* !~ */
3286} exptype_T;
3287
3288/*
3289 * The "evaluate" argument: When FALSE, the argument is only parsed but not
3290 * executed. The function may return OK, but the rettv will be of type
3291 * VAR_UNKNOWN. The function still returns FAIL for a syntax error.
3292 */
3293
3294/*
3295 * Handle zero level expression.
3296 * This calls eval1() and handles error message and nextcmd.
3297 * Put the result in "rettv" when returning OK and "evaluate" is TRUE.
3298 * Note: "rettv.v_lock" is not set.
3299 * Return OK or FAIL.
3300 */
3301static int eval0(char_u *arg, typval_T *rettv, char_u **nextcmd, int evaluate)
3302{
3303 int ret;
3304 char_u *p;
3305
3306 p = skipwhite(arg);
3307 ret = eval1(&p, rettv, evaluate);
3308 if (ret == FAIL0 || !ends_excmd(*p)) {
3309 if (ret != FAIL0)
3310 clear_tv(rettv);
3311 /*
3312 * Report the invalid expression unless the expression evaluation has
3313 * been cancelled due to an aborting error, an interrupt, or an
3314 * exception.
3315 */
3316 if (!aborting())
3317 EMSG2(_(e_invexpr2), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2))), (char_u *)(arg
));
3318 ret = FAIL0;
3319 }
3320 if (nextcmd != NULL((void*)0))
3321 *nextcmd = check_nextcmd(p);
3322
3323 return ret;
3324}
3325
3326/*
3327 * Handle top level expression:
3328 * expr2 ? expr1 : expr1
3329 *
3330 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3331 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3332 *
3333 * Note: "rettv.v_lock" is not set.
3334 *
3335 * Return OK or FAIL.
3336 */
3337static int eval1(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3338{
3339 int result;
3340 typval_T var2;
3341
3342 /*
3343 * Get the first variable.
3344 */
3345 if (eval2(arg, rettv, evaluate) == FAIL0)
3346 return FAIL0;
3347
3348 if ((*arg)[0] == '?') {
3349 result = FALSE0;
3350 if (evaluate) {
3351 int error = FALSE0;
3352
3353 if (get_tv_number_chk(rettv, &error) != 0)
3354 result = TRUE1;
3355 clear_tv(rettv);
3356 if (error)
3357 return FAIL0;
3358 }
3359
3360 /*
3361 * Get the second variable.
3362 */
3363 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3364 if (eval1(arg, rettv, evaluate && result) == FAIL0) /* recursive! */
3365 return FAIL0;
3366
3367 /*
3368 * Check for the ":".
3369 */
3370 if ((*arg)[0] != ':') {
3371 EMSG(_("E109: Missing ':' after '?'"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E109: Missing ':' after '?'"
))));
3372 if (evaluate && result)
3373 clear_tv(rettv);
3374 return FAIL0;
3375 }
3376
3377 /*
3378 * Get the third variable.
3379 */
3380 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3381 if (eval1(arg, &var2, evaluate && !result) == FAIL0) { /* recursive! */
3382 if (evaluate && result)
3383 clear_tv(rettv);
3384 return FAIL0;
3385 }
3386 if (evaluate && !result)
3387 *rettv = var2;
3388 }
3389
3390 return OK1;
3391}
3392
3393/*
3394 * Handle first level expression:
3395 * expr2 || expr2 || expr2 logical OR
3396 *
3397 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3398 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3399 *
3400 * Return OK or FAIL.
3401 */
3402static int eval2(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3403{
3404 typval_T var2;
3405 long result;
3406 int first;
3407 int error = FALSE0;
3408
3409 /*
3410 * Get the first variable.
3411 */
3412 if (eval3(arg, rettv, evaluate) == FAIL0)
3413 return FAIL0;
3414
3415 /*
3416 * Repeat until there is no following "||".
3417 */
3418 first = TRUE1;
3419 result = FALSE0;
3420 while ((*arg)[0] == '|' && (*arg)[1] == '|') {
3421 if (evaluate && first) {
3422 if (get_tv_number_chk(rettv, &error) != 0)
3423 result = TRUE1;
3424 clear_tv(rettv);
3425 if (error)
3426 return FAIL0;
3427 first = FALSE0;
3428 }
3429
3430 /*
3431 * Get the second variable.
3432 */
3433 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 2);
3434 if (eval3(arg, &var2, evaluate && !result) == FAIL0)
3435 return FAIL0;
3436
3437 /*
3438 * Compute the result.
3439 */
3440 if (evaluate && !result) {
3441 if (get_tv_number_chk(&var2, &error) != 0)
3442 result = TRUE1;
3443 clear_tv(&var2);
3444 if (error)
3445 return FAIL0;
3446 }
3447 if (evaluate) {
3448 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
3449 rettv->vval.v_number = result;
3450 }
3451 }
3452
3453 return OK1;
3454}
3455
3456/*
3457 * Handle second level expression:
3458 * expr3 && expr3 && expr3 logical AND
3459 *
3460 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3461 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3462 *
3463 * Return OK or FAIL.
3464 */
3465static int eval3(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3466{
3467 typval_T var2;
3468 long result;
3469 int first;
3470 int error = FALSE0;
3471
3472 /*
3473 * Get the first variable.
3474 */
3475 if (eval4(arg, rettv, evaluate) == FAIL0)
3476 return FAIL0;
3477
3478 /*
3479 * Repeat until there is no following "&&".
3480 */
3481 first = TRUE1;
3482 result = TRUE1;
3483 while ((*arg)[0] == '&' && (*arg)[1] == '&') {
3484 if (evaluate && first) {
3485 if (get_tv_number_chk(rettv, &error) == 0)
3486 result = FALSE0;
3487 clear_tv(rettv);
3488 if (error)
3489 return FAIL0;
3490 first = FALSE0;
3491 }
3492
3493 /*
3494 * Get the second variable.
3495 */
3496 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 2);
3497 if (eval4(arg, &var2, evaluate && result) == FAIL0)
3498 return FAIL0;
3499
3500 /*
3501 * Compute the result.
3502 */
3503 if (evaluate && result) {
3504 if (get_tv_number_chk(&var2, &error) == 0)
3505 result = FALSE0;
3506 clear_tv(&var2);
3507 if (error)
3508 return FAIL0;
3509 }
3510 if (evaluate) {
3511 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
3512 rettv->vval.v_number = result;
3513 }
3514 }
3515
3516 return OK1;
3517}
3518
3519/*
3520 * Handle third level expression:
3521 * var1 == var2
3522 * var1 =~ var2
3523 * var1 != var2
3524 * var1 !~ var2
3525 * var1 > var2
3526 * var1 >= var2
3527 * var1 < var2
3528 * var1 <= var2
3529 * var1 is var2
3530 * var1 isnot var2
3531 *
3532 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3533 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3534 *
3535 * Return OK or FAIL.
3536 */
3537static int eval4(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3538{
3539 typval_T var2;
3540 char_u *p;
3541 int i;
3542 exptype_T type = TYPE_UNKNOWN;
3543 int type_is = FALSE0; /* TRUE for "is" and "isnot" */
3544 int len = 2;
3545 long n1, n2;
3546 char_u *s1, *s2;
3547 char_u buf1[NUMBUFLEN65], buf2[NUMBUFLEN65];
3548 regmatch_T regmatch;
3549 int ic;
3550 char_u *save_cpo;
3551
3552 /*
3553 * Get the first variable.
3554 */
3555 if (eval5(arg, rettv, evaluate) == FAIL0)
3556 return FAIL0;
3557
3558 p = *arg;
3559 switch (p[0]) {
3560 case '=': if (p[1] == '=')
3561 type = TYPE_EQUAL;
3562 else if (p[1] == '~')
3563 type = TYPE_MATCH;
3564 break;
3565 case '!': if (p[1] == '=')
3566 type = TYPE_NEQUAL;
3567 else if (p[1] == '~')
3568 type = TYPE_NOMATCH;
3569 break;
3570 case '>': if (p[1] != '=') {
3571 type = TYPE_GREATER;
3572 len = 1;
3573 } else
3574 type = TYPE_GEQUAL;
3575 break;
3576 case '<': if (p[1] != '=') {
3577 type = TYPE_SMALLER;
3578 len = 1;
3579 } else
3580 type = TYPE_SEQUAL;
3581 break;
3582 case 'i': if (p[1] == 's') {
3583 if (p[2] == 'n' && p[3] == 'o' && p[4] == 't') {
3584 len = 5;
3585 }
3586 if (!isalnum(p[len])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((p[len]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISalnum) && p[len] != '_') {
3587 type = len == 2 ? TYPE_EQUAL : TYPE_NEQUAL;
3588 type_is = TRUE1;
3589 }
3590 }
3591 break;
3592 }
3593
3594 /*
3595 * If there is a comparative operator, use it.
3596 */
3597 if (type != TYPE_UNKNOWN) {
3598 /* extra question mark appended: ignore case */
3599 if (p[len] == '?') {
3600 ic = TRUE1;
3601 ++len;
3602 }
3603 /* extra '#' appended: match case */
3604 else if (p[len] == '#') {
3605 ic = FALSE0;
3606 ++len;
3607 }
3608 /* nothing appended: use 'ignorecase' */
3609 else
3610 ic = p_ic;
3611
3612 /*
3613 * Get the second variable.
3614 */
3615 *arg = skipwhite(p + len);
3616 if (eval5(arg, &var2, evaluate) == FAIL0) {
3617 clear_tv(rettv);
3618 return FAIL0;
3619 }
3620
3621 if (evaluate) {
3622 if (type_is && rettv->v_type != var2.v_type) {
3623 /* For "is" a different type always means FALSE, for "notis"
3624 * it means TRUE. */
3625 n1 = (type == TYPE_NEQUAL);
3626 } else if (rettv->v_type == VAR_LIST4 || var2.v_type == VAR_LIST4) {
3627 if (type_is) {
3628 n1 = (rettv->v_type == var2.v_type
3629 && rettv->vval.v_list == var2.vval.v_list);
3630 if (type == TYPE_NEQUAL)
3631 n1 = !n1;
3632 } else if (rettv->v_type != var2.v_type
3633 || (type != TYPE_EQUAL && type != TYPE_NEQUAL)) {
3634 if (rettv->v_type != var2.v_type) {
3635 EMSG(_("E691: Can only compare List with List"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E691: Can only compare List with List"
))));
3636 } else {
3637 EMSG(_("E692: Invalid operation for List"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E692: Invalid operation for List"
))));
3638 }
3639 clear_tv(rettv);
3640 clear_tv(&var2);
3641 return FAIL0;
3642 } else {
3643 /* Compare two Lists for being equal or unequal. */
3644 n1 = list_equal(rettv->vval.v_list, var2.vval.v_list,
3645 ic, FALSE0);
3646 if (type == TYPE_NEQUAL)
3647 n1 = !n1;
3648 }
3649 } else if (rettv->v_type == VAR_DICT5 || var2.v_type == VAR_DICT5) {
3650 if (type_is) {
3651 n1 = (rettv->v_type == var2.v_type
3652 && rettv->vval.v_dict == var2.vval.v_dict);
3653 if (type == TYPE_NEQUAL)
3654 n1 = !n1;
3655 } else if (rettv->v_type != var2.v_type
3656 || (type != TYPE_EQUAL && type != TYPE_NEQUAL)) {
3657 if (rettv->v_type != var2.v_type)
3658 EMSG(_("E735: Can only compare Dictionary with Dictionary"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E735: Can only compare Dictionary with Dictionary"
))));
3659 else
3660 EMSG(_("E736: Invalid operation for Dictionary"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E736: Invalid operation for Dictionary"
))));
3661 clear_tv(rettv);
3662 clear_tv(&var2);
3663 return FAIL0;
3664 } else {
3665 /* Compare two Dictionaries for being equal or unequal. */
3666 n1 = dict_equal(rettv->vval.v_dict, var2.vval.v_dict,
3667 ic, FALSE0);
3668 if (type == TYPE_NEQUAL)
3669 n1 = !n1;
3670 }
3671 } else if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FUNC3 || var2.v_type == VAR_FUNC3) {
3672 if (rettv->v_type != var2.v_type
3673 || (type != TYPE_EQUAL && type != TYPE_NEQUAL)) {
3674 if (rettv->v_type != var2.v_type)
3675 EMSG(_("E693: Can only compare Funcref with Funcref"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E693: Can only compare Funcref with Funcref"
))));
3676 else
3677 EMSG(_("E694: Invalid operation for Funcrefs"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E694: Invalid operation for Funcrefs"
))));
3678 clear_tv(rettv);
3679 clear_tv(&var2);
3680 return FAIL0;
3681 } else {
3682 /* Compare two Funcrefs for being equal or unequal. */
3683 if (rettv->vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0)
3684 || var2.vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0))
3685 n1 = FALSE0;
3686 else
3687 n1 = STRCMP(rettv->vval.v_string,strcmp((char *)(rettv->vval.v_string), (char *)(var2.vval.
v_string))
3688 var2.vval.v_string)strcmp((char *)(rettv->vval.v_string), (char *)(var2.vval.
v_string)) == 0;
3689 if (type == TYPE_NEQUAL)
3690 n1 = !n1;
3691 }
3692 }
3693 /*
3694 * If one of the two variables is a float, compare as a float.
3695 * When using "=~" or "!~", always compare as string.
3696 */
3697 else if ((rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6 || var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
3698 && type != TYPE_MATCH && type != TYPE_NOMATCH) {
3699 float_T f1, f2;
3700
3701 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
3702 f1 = rettv->vval.v_float;
3703 else
3704 f1 = get_tv_number(rettv);
3705 if (var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
3706 f2 = var2.vval.v_float;
3707 else
3708 f2 = get_tv_number(&var2);
3709 n1 = FALSE0;
3710 switch (type) {
3711 case TYPE_EQUAL: n1 = (f1 == f2); break;
3712 case TYPE_NEQUAL: n1 = (f1 != f2); break;
3713 case TYPE_GREATER: n1 = (f1 > f2); break;
3714 case TYPE_GEQUAL: n1 = (f1 >= f2); break;
3715 case TYPE_SMALLER: n1 = (f1 < f2); break;
3716 case TYPE_SEQUAL: n1 = (f1 <= f2); break;
3717 case TYPE_UNKNOWN:
3718 case TYPE_MATCH:
3719 case TYPE_NOMATCH: break; /* avoid gcc warning */
3720 }
3721 }
3722 /*
3723 * If one of the two variables is a number, compare as a number.
3724 * When using "=~" or "!~", always compare as string.
3725 */
3726 else if ((rettv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER1 || var2.v_type == VAR_NUMBER1)
3727 && type != TYPE_MATCH && type != TYPE_NOMATCH) {
3728 n1 = get_tv_number(rettv);
3729 n2 = get_tv_number(&var2);
3730 switch (type) {
3731 case TYPE_EQUAL: n1 = (n1 == n2); break;
3732 case TYPE_NEQUAL: n1 = (n1 != n2); break;
3733 case TYPE_GREATER: n1 = (n1 > n2); break;
3734 case TYPE_GEQUAL: n1 = (n1 >= n2); break;
3735 case TYPE_SMALLER: n1 = (n1 < n2); break;
3736 case TYPE_SEQUAL: n1 = (n1 <= n2); break;
3737 case TYPE_UNKNOWN:
3738 case TYPE_MATCH:
3739 case TYPE_NOMATCH: break; /* avoid gcc warning */
3740 }
3741 } else {
3742 s1 = get_tv_string_buf(rettv, buf1);
3743 s2 = get_tv_string_buf(&var2, buf2);
3744 if (type != TYPE_MATCH && type != TYPE_NOMATCH)
3745 i = ic ? mb_stricmp(s1, s2) : STRCMP(s1, s2)strcmp((char *)(s1), (char *)(s2));
3746 else
3747 i = 0;
3748 n1 = FALSE0;
3749 switch (type) {
3750 case TYPE_EQUAL: n1 = (i == 0); break;
3751 case TYPE_NEQUAL: n1 = (i != 0); break;
3752 case TYPE_GREATER: n1 = (i > 0); break;
3753 case TYPE_GEQUAL: n1 = (i >= 0); break;
3754 case TYPE_SMALLER: n1 = (i < 0); break;
3755 case TYPE_SEQUAL: n1 = (i <= 0); break;
3756
3757 case TYPE_MATCH:
3758 case TYPE_NOMATCH:
3759 /* avoid 'l' flag in 'cpoptions' */
3760 save_cpo = p_cpo;
3761 p_cpo = (char_u *)"";
3762 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(s2,
3763 RE_MAGIC1 + RE_STRING2);
3764 regmatch.rm_ic = ic;
3765 if (regmatch.regprog != NULL((void*)0)) {
3766 n1 = vim_regexec_nl(&regmatch, s1, (colnr_T)0);
3767 vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
3768 if (type == TYPE_NOMATCH)
3769 n1 = !n1;
3770 }
3771 p_cpo = save_cpo;
3772 break;
3773
3774 case TYPE_UNKNOWN: break; /* avoid gcc warning */
3775 }
3776 }
3777 clear_tv(rettv);
3778 clear_tv(&var2);
3779 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
3780 rettv->vval.v_number = n1;
3781 }
3782 }
3783
3784 return OK1;
3785}
3786
3787/*
3788 * Handle fourth level expression:
3789 * + number addition
3790 * - number subtraction
3791 * . string concatenation
3792 *
3793 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3794 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3795 *
3796 * Return OK or FAIL.
3797 */
3798static int eval5(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3799{
3800 typval_T var2;
3801 typval_T var3;
3802 int op;
3803 long n1, n2;
3804 float_T f1 = 0, f2 = 0;
3805 char_u *s1, *s2;
3806 char_u buf1[NUMBUFLEN65], buf2[NUMBUFLEN65];
3807 char_u *p;
3808
3809 /*
3810 * Get the first variable.
3811 */
3812 if (eval6(arg, rettv, evaluate, FALSE0) == FAIL0)
3813 return FAIL0;
3814
3815 /*
3816 * Repeat computing, until no '+', '-' or '.' is following.
3817 */
3818 for (;; ) {
3819 op = **arg;
3820 if (op != '+' && op != '-' && op != '.')
3821 break;
3822
3823 if ((op != '+' || rettv->v_type != VAR_LIST4)
3824 && (op == '.' || rettv->v_type != VAR_FLOAT6)
3825 ) {
3826 /* For "list + ...", an illegal use of the first operand as
3827 * a number cannot be determined before evaluating the 2nd
3828 * operand: if this is also a list, all is ok.
3829 * For "something . ...", "something - ..." or "non-list + ...",
3830 * we know that the first operand needs to be a string or number
3831 * without evaluating the 2nd operand. So check before to avoid
3832 * side effects after an error. */
3833 if (evaluate && get_tv_string_chk(rettv) == NULL((void*)0)) {
3834 clear_tv(rettv);
3835 return FAIL0;
3836 }
3837 }
3838
3839 /*
3840 * Get the second variable.
3841 */
3842 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3843 if (eval6(arg, &var2, evaluate, op == '.') == FAIL0) {
3844 clear_tv(rettv);
3845 return FAIL0;
3846 }
3847
3848 if (evaluate) {
3849 /*
3850 * Compute the result.
3851 */
3852 if (op == '.') {
3853 s1 = get_tv_string_buf(rettv, buf1); /* already checked */
3854 s2 = get_tv_string_buf_chk(&var2, buf2);
3855 if (s2 == NULL((void*)0)) { /* type error ? */
3856 clear_tv(rettv);
3857 clear_tv(&var2);
3858 return FAIL0;
3859 }
3860 p = concat_str(s1, s2);
3861 clear_tv(rettv);
3862 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
3863 rettv->vval.v_string = p;
3864 } else if (op == '+' && rettv->v_type == VAR_LIST4
3865 && var2.v_type == VAR_LIST4) {
3866 /* concatenate Lists */
3867 if (list_concat(rettv->vval.v_list, var2.vval.v_list,
3868 &var3) == FAIL0) {
3869 clear_tv(rettv);
3870 clear_tv(&var2);
3871 return FAIL0;
3872 }
3873 clear_tv(rettv);
3874 *rettv = var3;
3875 } else {
3876 int error = FALSE0;
3877
3878 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
3879 f1 = rettv->vval.v_float;
3880 n1 = 0;
3881 } else {
3882 n1 = get_tv_number_chk(rettv, &error);
3883 if (error) {
3884 /* This can only happen for "list + non-list". For
3885 * "non-list + ..." or "something - ...", we returned
3886 * before evaluating the 2nd operand. */
3887 clear_tv(rettv);
3888 return FAIL0;
3889 }
3890 if (var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
3891 f1 = n1;
3892 }
3893 if (var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
3894 f2 = var2.vval.v_float;
3895 n2 = 0;
3896 } else {
3897 n2 = get_tv_number_chk(&var2, &error);
3898 if (error) {
3899 clear_tv(rettv);
3900 clear_tv(&var2);
3901 return FAIL0;
3902 }
3903 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
3904 f2 = n2;
3905 }
3906 clear_tv(rettv);
3907
3908 /* If there is a float on either side the result is a float. */
3909 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6 || var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
3910 if (op == '+')
3911 f1 = f1 + f2;
3912 else
3913 f1 = f1 - f2;
3914 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT6;
3915 rettv->vval.v_float = f1;
3916 } else {
3917 if (op == '+')
3918 n1 = n1 + n2;
3919 else
3920 n1 = n1 - n2;
3921 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
3922 rettv->vval.v_number = n1;
3923 }
3924 }
3925 clear_tv(&var2);
3926 }
3927 }
3928 return OK1;
3929}
3930
3931/*
3932 * Handle fifth level expression:
3933 * * number multiplication
3934 * / number division
3935 * % number modulo
3936 *
3937 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3938 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3939 *
3940 * Return OK or FAIL.
3941 */
3942static int
3943eval6 (
3944 char_u **arg,
3945 typval_T *rettv,
3946 int evaluate,
3947 int want_string /* after "." operator */
3948)
3949{
3950 typval_T var2;
3951 int op;
3952 long n1, n2;
3953 int use_float = FALSE0;
3954 float_T f1 = 0, f2;
3955 int error = FALSE0;
3956
3957 /*
3958 * Get the first variable.
3959 */
3960 if (eval7(arg, rettv, evaluate, want_string) == FAIL0)
3961 return FAIL0;
3962
3963 /*
3964 * Repeat computing, until no '*', '/' or '%' is following.
3965 */
3966 for (;; ) {
3967 op = **arg;
3968 if (op != '*' && op != '/' && op != '%')
3969 break;
3970
3971 if (evaluate) {
3972 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
3973 f1 = rettv->vval.v_float;
3974 use_float = TRUE1;
3975 n1 = 0;
3976 } else
3977 n1 = get_tv_number_chk(rettv, &error);
3978 clear_tv(rettv);
3979 if (error)
3980 return FAIL0;
3981 } else
3982 n1 = 0;
3983
3984 /*
3985 * Get the second variable.
3986 */
3987 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3988 if (eval7(arg, &var2, evaluate, FALSE0) == FAIL0)
3989 return FAIL0;
3990
3991 if (evaluate) {
3992 if (var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
3993 if (!use_float) {
3994 f1 = n1;
3995 use_float = TRUE1;
3996 }
3997 f2 = var2.vval.v_float;
3998 n2 = 0;
3999 } else {
4000 n2 = get_tv_number_chk(&var2, &error);
4001 clear_tv(&var2);
4002 if (error)
4003 return FAIL0;
4004 if (use_float)
4005 f2 = n2;
4006 }
4007
4008 /*
4009 * Compute the result.
4010 * When either side is a float the result is a float.
4011 */
4012 if (use_float) {
4013 if (op == '*')
4014 f1 = f1 * f2;
4015 else if (op == '/') {
4016 /* We rely on the floating point library to handle divide
4017 * by zero to result in "inf" and not a crash. */
4018 f1 = f2 != 0 ? f1 / f2 : INFINITY(__builtin_inff());
4019 } else {
4020 EMSG(_("E804: Cannot use '%' with Float"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E804: Cannot use '%' with Float"
))));
4021 return FAIL0;
4022 }
4023 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT6;
4024 rettv->vval.v_float = f1;
4025 } else {
4026 if (op == '*')
4027 n1 = n1 * n2;
4028 else if (op == '/') {
4029 if (n2 == 0) { /* give an error message? */
4030 if (n1 == 0)
4031 n1 = -0x7fffffffL - 1L; /* similar to NaN */
4032 else if (n1 < 0)
4033 n1 = -0x7fffffffL;
4034 else
4035 n1 = 0x7fffffffL;
4036 } else
4037 n1 = n1 / n2;
4038 } else {
4039 if (n2 == 0) /* give an error message? */
4040 n1 = 0;
4041 else
4042 n1 = n1 % n2;
4043 }
4044 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
4045 rettv->vval.v_number = n1;
4046 }
4047 }
4048 }
4049
4050 return OK1;
4051}
4052
4053// Handle sixth level expression:
4054// number number constant
4055// "string" string constant
4056// 'string' literal string constant
4057// &option-name option value
4058// @r register contents
4059// identifier variable value
4060// function() function call
4061// $VAR environment variable
4062// (expression) nested expression
4063// [expr, expr] List
4064// {key: val, key: val} Dictionary
4065//
4066// Also handle:
4067// ! in front logical NOT
4068// - in front unary minus
4069// + in front unary plus (ignored)
4070// trailing [] subscript in String or List
4071// trailing .name entry in Dictionary
4072//
4073// "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
4074// "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
4075//
4076// Return OK or FAIL.
4077static int eval7(
4078 char_u **arg,
4079 typval_T *rettv,
4080 int evaluate,
4081 int want_string // after "." operator
4082)
4083{
4084 long n;
4085 int len;
4086 char_u *s;
4087 char_u *start_leader, *end_leader;
4088 int ret = OK1;
4089 char_u *alias;
4090
4091 // Initialise variable so that clear_tv() can't mistake this for a
4092 // string and free a string that isn't there.
4093 rettv->v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0;
4094
4095 // Skip '!' and '-' characters. They are handled later.
4096 start_leader = *arg;
4097 while (**arg == '!' || **arg == '-' || **arg == '+') {
4098 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4099 }
4100 end_leader = *arg;
4101
4102 switch (**arg) {
4103 // Number constant.
4104 case '0':
4105 case '1':
4106 case '2':
4107 case '3':
4108 case '4':
4109 case '5':
4110 case '6':
4111 case '7':
4112 case '8':
4113 case '9':
4114 {
4115 char_u *p = skipdigits(*arg + 1);
4116 int get_float = false0;
4117
4118 // We accept a float when the format matches
4119 // "[0-9]\+\.[0-9]\+\([eE][+-]\?[0-9]\+\)\?". This is very
4120 // strict to avoid backwards compatibility problems.
4121 // Don't look for a float after the "." operator, so that
4122 // ":let vers = 1.2.3" doesn't fail.
4123 if (!want_string && p[0] == '.' && ascii_isdigit(p[1])) {
4124 get_float = true1;
4125 p = skipdigits(p + 2);
4126 if (*p == 'e' || *p == 'E') {
4127 ++p;
4128 if (*p == '-' || *p == '+') {
4129 ++p;
4130 }
4131 if (!ascii_isdigit(*p)) {
4132 get_float = false0;
4133 } else {
4134 p = skipdigits(p + 1);
4135 }
4136 }
4137 if (ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z')) || *p == '.') {
4138 get_float = false0;
4139 }
4140 }
4141 if (get_float) {
4142 float_T f;
4143
4144 *arg += string2float(*arg, &f);
4145 if (evaluate) {
4146 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT6;
4147 rettv->vval.v_float = f;
4148 }
4149 } else {
4150 vim_str2nr(*arg, NULL((void*)0), &len, STR2NR_ALL(1 + 2 + 4), &n, NULL((void*)0), 0);
4151 *arg += len;
4152 if (evaluate) {
4153 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
4154 rettv->vval.v_number = n;
4155 }
4156 }
4157 break;
4158 }
4159
4160 // String constant: "string".
4161 case '"': ret = get_string_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
4162 break;
4163
4164 // Literal string constant: 'str''ing'.
4165 case '\'': ret = get_lit_string_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
4166 break;
4167
4168 // List: [expr, expr]
4169 case '[': ret = get_list_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
4170 break;
4171
4172 // Dictionary: {key: val, key: val}
4173 case '{': ret = get_dict_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
4174 break;
4175
4176 // Option value: &name
4177 case '&': ret = get_option_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
4178 break;
4179
4180 // Environment variable: $VAR.
4181 case '$': ret = get_env_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
4182 break;
4183
4184 // Register contents: @r.
4185 case '@': ++*arg;
4186 if (evaluate) {
4187 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
4188 rettv->vval.v_string = get_reg_contents(**arg, kGRegExprSrc);
4189 }
4190 if (**arg != NUL'\000') {
4191 ++*arg;
4192 }
4193 break;
4194
4195 // nested expression: (expression).
4196 case '(': *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4197 ret = eval1(arg, rettv, evaluate); // recursive!
4198 if (**arg == ')') {
4199 ++*arg;
4200 } else if (ret == OK1) {
4201 EMSG(_("E110: Missing ')'"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E110: Missing ')'"))));
4202 clear_tv(rettv);
4203 ret = FAIL0;
4204 }
4205 break;
4206
4207 default: ret = NOTDONE2;
4208 break;
4209 }
4210
4211 if (ret == NOTDONE2) {
4212 // Must be a variable or function name.
4213 // Can also be a curly-braces kind of name: {expr}.
4214 s = *arg;
4215 len = get_name_len(arg, &alias, evaluate, true1);
4216 if (alias != NULL((void*)0)) {
4217 s = alias;
4218 }
4219
4220 if (len <= 0) {
4221 ret = FAIL0;
4222 } else {
4223 if (**arg == '(') { // recursive!
4224 // If "s" is the name of a variable of type VAR_FUNC
4225 // use its contents.
4226 s = deref_func_name(s, &len, !evaluate);
4227
4228 // Invoke the function.
4229 ret = get_func_tv(s, len, rettv, arg,
4230 curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
4231 &len, evaluate, NULL((void*)0));
4232
4233 // If evaluate is false rettv->v_type was not set in
4234 // get_func_tv, but it's needed in handle_subscript() to parse
4235 // what follows. So set it here.
4236 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0 && !evaluate && **arg == '(') {
4237 rettv->vval.v_string = empty_string;
4238 rettv->v_type = VAR_FUNC3;
4239 }
4240
4241 // Stop the expression evaluation when immediately
4242 // aborting on error, or when an interrupt occurred or
4243 // an exception was thrown but not caught.
4244 if (aborting()) {
4245 if (ret == OK1) {
4246 clear_tv(rettv);
4247 }
4248 ret = FAIL0;
4249 }
4250 } else if (evaluate) {
4251 ret = get_var_tv(s, len, rettv, NULL((void*)0), true1, false0);
4252 } else {
4253 ret = OK1;
4254 }
4255 }
4256 xfree(alias);
4257 }
4258
4259 *arg = skipwhite(*arg);
4260
4261 // Handle following '[', '(' and '.' for expr[expr], expr.name,
4262 // expr(expr).
4263 if (ret == OK1) {
4264 ret = handle_subscript(arg, rettv, evaluate, true1);
4265 }
4266
4267 // Apply logical NOT and unary '-', from right to left, ignore '+'.
4268 if (ret == OK1 && evaluate && end_leader > start_leader) {
4269 int error = false0;
4270 int val = 0;
4271 float_T f = 0.0;
4272
4273 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
4274 f = rettv->vval.v_float;
4275 } else {
4276 val = get_tv_number_chk(rettv, &error);
4277 }
4278 if (error) {
4279 clear_tv(rettv);
4280 ret = FAIL0;
4281 } else {
4282 while (end_leader > start_leader) {
4283 --end_leader;
4284 if (*end_leader == '!') {
4285 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
4286 f = !f;
4287 } else {
4288 val = !val;
4289 }
4290 } else if (*end_leader == '-') {
4291 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
4292 f = -f;
4293 } else {
4294 val = -val;
4295 }
4296 }
4297 }
4298 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
4299 clear_tv(rettv);
4300 rettv->vval.v_float = f;
4301 } else {
4302 clear_tv(rettv);
4303 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
4304 rettv->vval.v_number = val;
4305 }
4306 }
4307 }
4308
4309 return ret;
4310}
4311
4312/*
4313 * Evaluate an "[expr]" or "[expr:expr]" index. Also "dict.key".
4314 * "*arg" points to the '[' or '.'.
4315 * Returns FAIL or OK. "*arg" is advanced to after the ']'.
4316 */
4317static int
4318eval_index (
4319 char_u **arg,
4320 typval_T *rettv,
4321 int evaluate,
4322 int verbose /* give error messages */
4323)
4324{
4325 int empty1 = FALSE0, empty2 = FALSE0;
4326 typval_T var1, var2;
4327 long n1, n2 = 0;
4328 long len = -1;
4329 int range = FALSE0;
4330 char_u *s;
4331 char_u *key = NULL((void*)0);
4332
4333 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FUNC3) {
4334 if (verbose)
4335 EMSG(_("E695: Cannot index a Funcref"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E695: Cannot index a Funcref"
))));
4336 return FAIL0;
4337 } else if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
4338 if (verbose)
4339 EMSG(_(e_float_as_string))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_float_as_string))));
4340 return FAIL0;
4341 }
4342
4343 init_tv(&var1);
4344 init_tv(&var2);
4345 if (**arg == '.') {
4346 /*
4347 * dict.name
4348 */
4349 key = *arg + 1;
4350 for (len = 0; ASCII_ISALNUM(key[len])((((unsigned)(key[len]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(key[len
]) <= 'Z') || ((unsigned)(key[len]) >= 'a' && (
unsigned)(key[len]) <= 'z')) || ascii_isdigit(key[len])) || key[len] == '_'; ++len)
4351 ;
4352 if (len == 0)
4353 return FAIL0;
4354 *arg = skipwhite(key + len);
4355 } else {
4356 /*
4357 * something[idx]
4358 *
4359 * Get the (first) variable from inside the [].
4360 */
4361 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4362 if (**arg == ':')
4363 empty1 = TRUE1;
4364 else if (eval1(arg, &var1, evaluate) == FAIL0) /* recursive! */
4365 return FAIL0;
4366 else if (evaluate && get_tv_string_chk(&var1) == NULL((void*)0)) {
4367 /* not a number or string */
4368 clear_tv(&var1);
4369 return FAIL0;
4370 }
4371
4372 /*
4373 * Get the second variable from inside the [:].
4374 */
4375 if (**arg == ':') {
4376 range = TRUE1;
4377 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4378 if (**arg == ']')
4379 empty2 = TRUE1;
4380 else if (eval1(arg, &var2, evaluate) == FAIL0) { /* recursive! */
4381 if (!empty1)
4382 clear_tv(&var1);
4383 return FAIL0;
4384 } else if (evaluate && get_tv_string_chk(&var2) == NULL((void*)0)) {
4385 /* not a number or string */
4386 if (!empty1)
4387 clear_tv(&var1);
4388 clear_tv(&var2);
4389 return FAIL0;
4390 }
4391 }
4392
4393 /* Check for the ']'. */
4394 if (**arg != ']') {
4395 if (verbose)
4396 EMSG(_(e_missbrac))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_missbrac))));
4397 clear_tv(&var1);
4398 if (range)
4399 clear_tv(&var2);
4400 return FAIL0;
4401 }
4402 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1); /* skip the ']' */
4403 }
4404
4405 if (evaluate) {
4406 n1 = 0;
4407 if (!empty1 && rettv->v_type != VAR_DICT5) {
4408 n1 = get_tv_number(&var1);
4409 clear_tv(&var1);
4410 }
4411 if (range) {
4412 if (empty2)
4413 n2 = -1;
4414 else {
4415 n2 = get_tv_number(&var2);
4416 clear_tv(&var2);
4417 }
4418 }
4419
4420 switch (rettv->v_type) {
4421 case VAR_NUMBER1:
4422 case VAR_STRING2:
4423 s = get_tv_string(rettv);
4424 len = (long)STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s));
4425 if (range) {
4426 /* The resulting variable is a substring. If the indexes
4427 * are out of range the result is empty. */
4428 if (n1 < 0) {
4429 n1 = len + n1;
4430 if (n1 < 0)
4431 n1 = 0;
4432 }
4433 if (n2 < 0)
4434 n2 = len + n2;
4435 else if (n2 >= len)
4436 n2 = len;
4437 if (n1 >= len || n2 < 0 || n1 > n2)
4438 s = NULL((void*)0);
4439 else
4440 s = vim_strnsave(s + n1, (int)(n2 - n1 + 1));
4441 } else {
4442 /* The resulting variable is a string of a single
4443 * character. If the index is too big or negative the
4444 * result is empty. */
4445 if (n1 >= len || n1 < 0)
4446 s = NULL((void*)0);
4447 else
4448 s = vim_strnsave(s + n1, 1);
4449 }
4450 clear_tv(rettv);
4451 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
4452 rettv->vval.v_string = s;
4453 break;
4454
4455 case VAR_LIST4:
4456 len = list_len(rettv->vval.v_list);
4457 if (n1 < 0)
4458 n1 = len + n1;
4459 if (!empty1 && (n1 < 0 || n1 >= len)) {
4460 /* For a range we allow invalid values and return an empty
4461 * list. A list index out of range is an error. */
4462 if (!range) {
4463 if (verbose)
4464 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), n1)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t)(n1)
);
4465 return FAIL0;
4466 }
4467 n1 = len;
4468 }
4469 if (range) {
4470 list_T *l;
4471 listitem_T *item;
4472
4473 if (n2 < 0)
4474 n2 = len + n2;
4475 else if (n2 >= len)
4476 n2 = len - 1;
4477 if (!empty2 && (n2 < 0 || n2 + 1 < n1))
4478 n2 = -1;
4479 l = list_alloc();
4480 item = list_find(rettv->vval.v_list, n1);
4481 while (n1++ <= n2) {
4482 list_append_tv(l, &item->li_tv);
4483 item = item->li_next;
4484 }
4485 clear_tv(rettv);
4486 rettv->v_type = VAR_LIST4;
4487 rettv->vval.v_list = l;
4488 ++l->lv_refcount;
4489 } else {
4490 copy_tv(&list_find(rettv->vval.v_list, n1)->li_tv, &var1);
4491 clear_tv(rettv);
4492 *rettv = var1;
4493 }
4494 break;
4495
4496 case VAR_DICT5:
4497 if (range) {
4498 if (verbose)
4499 EMSG(_(e_dictrange))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictrange))));
4500 if (len == -1)
4501 clear_tv(&var1);
4502 return FAIL0;
4503 }
4504 {
4505 dictitem_T *item;
4506
4507 if (len == -1) {
4508 key = get_tv_string(&var1);
4509 if (*key == NUL'\000') {
4510 if (verbose)
4511 EMSG(_(e_emptykey))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_emptykey))));
4512 clear_tv(&var1);
4513 return FAIL0;
4514 }
4515 }
4516
4517 item = dict_find(rettv->vval.v_dict, key, (int)len);
4518
4519 if (item == NULL((void*)0) && verbose)
4520 EMSG2(_(e_dictkey), key)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictkey))), (char_u *)(key
));
4521 if (len == -1)
4522 clear_tv(&var1);
4523 if (item == NULL((void*)0))
4524 return FAIL0;
4525
4526 copy_tv(&item->di_tv, &var1);
4527 clear_tv(rettv);
4528 *rettv = var1;
4529 }
4530 break;
4531 }
4532 }
4533
4534 return OK1;
4535}
4536
4537/*
4538 * Get an option value.
4539 * "arg" points to the '&' or '+' before the option name.
4540 * "arg" is advanced to character after the option name.
4541 * Return OK or FAIL.
4542 */
4543static int
4544get_option_tv (
4545 char_u **arg,
4546 typval_T *rettv, /* when NULL, only check if option exists */
4547 int evaluate
4548)
4549{
4550 char_u *option_end;
4551 long numval;
4552 char_u *stringval;
4553 int opt_type;
4554 int c;
4555 int working = (**arg == '+'); /* has("+option") */
4556 int ret = OK1;
4557 int opt_flags;
4558
4559 /*
4560 * Isolate the option name and find its value.
4561 */
4562 option_end = find_option_end(arg, &opt_flags);
4563 if (option_end == NULL((void*)0)) {
4564 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0))
4565 EMSG2(_("E112: Option name missing: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E112: Option name missing: %s"
))), (char_u *)(*arg));
4566 return FAIL0;
4567 }
4568
4569 if (!evaluate) {
4570 *arg = option_end;
4571 return OK1;
4572 }
4573
4574 c = *option_end;
4575 *option_end = NUL'\000';
4576 opt_type = get_option_value(*arg, &numval,
4577 rettv == NULL((void*)0) ? NULL((void*)0) : &stringval, opt_flags);
4578
4579 if (opt_type == -3) { /* invalid name */
4580 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0))
4581 EMSG2(_("E113: Unknown option: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E113: Unknown option: %s")
)), (char_u *)(*arg));
4582 ret = FAIL0;
4583 } else if (rettv != NULL((void*)0)) {
4584 if (opt_type == -2) { /* hidden string option */
4585 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
4586 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
4587 } else if (opt_type == -1) { /* hidden number option */
4588 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
4589 rettv->vval.v_number = 0;
4590 } else if (opt_type == 1) { /* number option */
4591 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
4592 rettv->vval.v_number = numval;
4593 } else { /* string option */
4594 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
4595 rettv->vval.v_string = stringval;
4596 }
4597 } else if (working && (opt_type == -2 || opt_type == -1))
4598 ret = FAIL0;
4599
4600 *option_end = c; /* put back for error messages */
4601 *arg = option_end;
4602
4603 return ret;
4604}
4605
4606/*
4607 * Allocate a variable for a string constant.
4608 * Return OK or FAIL.
4609 */
4610static int get_string_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
4611{
4612 char_u *p;
4613 char_u *name;
4614 unsigned int extra = 0;
4615
4616 /*
4617 * Find the end of the string, skipping backslashed characters.
4618 */
4619 for (p = *arg + 1; *p != NUL'\000' && *p != '"'; mb_ptr_adv(p)(p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)((char_u *)p) : 1)) {
4620 if (*p == '\\' && p[1] != NUL'\000') {
4621 ++p;
4622 /* A "\<x>" form occupies at least 4 characters, and produces up
4623 * to 6 characters: reserve space for 2 extra */
4624 if (*p == '<')
4625 extra += 2;
4626 }
4627 }
4628
4629 if (*p != '"') {
4630 EMSG2(_("E114: Missing quote: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E114: Missing quote: %s"))
), (char_u *)(*arg));
4631 return FAIL0;
4632 }
4633
4634 /* If only parsing, set *arg and return here */
4635 if (!evaluate) {
4636 *arg = p + 1;
4637 return OK1;
4638 }
4639
4640 /*
4641 * Copy the string into allocated memory, handling backslashed
4642 * characters.
4643 */
4644 name = xmalloc(p - *arg + extra);
4645 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
4646 rettv->vval.v_string = name;
4647
4648 for (p = *arg + 1; *p != NUL'\000' && *p != '"'; ) {
4649 if (*p == '\\') {
4650 switch (*++p) {
4651 case 'b': *name++ = BS'\010'; ++p; break;
4652 case 'e': *name++ = ESC'\033'; ++p; break;
4653 case 'f': *name++ = FF'\014'; ++p; break;
4654 case 'n': *name++ = NL'\012'; ++p; break;
4655 case 'r': *name++ = CAR'\015'; ++p; break;
4656 case 't': *name++ = TAB'\011'; ++p; break;
4657
4658 case 'X': /* hex: "\x1", "\x12" */
4659 case 'x':
4660 case 'u': /* Unicode: "\u0023" */
4661 case 'U':
4662 if (ascii_isxdigit(p[1])) {
4663 int n, nr;
4664 int c = toupper(*p);
4665
4666 if (c == 'X') {
4667 n = 2;
4668 } else if (*p == 'u') {
4669 n = 4;
4670 } else {
4671 n = 8;
4672 }
4673 nr = 0;
4674 while (--n >= 0 && ascii_isxdigit(p[1])) {
4675 ++p;
4676 nr = (nr << 4) + hex2nr(*p);
4677 }
4678 ++p;
4679 /* For "\u" store the number according to
4680 * 'encoding'. */
4681 if (c != 'X')
4682 name += (*mb_char2bytes)(nr, name);
4683 else
4684 *name++ = nr;
4685 }
4686 break;
4687
4688 /* octal: "\1", "\12", "\123" */
4689 case '0':
4690 case '1':
4691 case '2':
4692 case '3':
4693 case '4':
4694 case '5':
4695 case '6':
4696 case '7': *name = *p++ - '0';
4697 if (*p >= '0' && *p <= '7') {
4698 *name = (*name << 3) + *p++ - '0';
4699 if (*p >= '0' && *p <= '7')
4700 *name = (*name << 3) + *p++ - '0';
4701 }
4702 ++name;
4703 break;
4704
4705 /* Special key, e.g.: "\<C-W>" */
4706 case '<': extra = trans_special(&p, name, TRUE1);
4707 if (extra != 0) {
4708 name += extra;
4709 break;
4710 }
4711 /* FALLTHROUGH */
4712
4713 default: MB_COPY_CHAR(p, name)if (has_mbyte) mb_copy_char((const char_u **)(&p), &name
); else *name++ = *p++;
4714 break;
4715 }
4716 } else
4717 MB_COPY_CHAR(p, name)if (has_mbyte) mb_copy_char((const char_u **)(&p), &name
); else *name++ = *p++;
4718
4719 }
4720 *name = NUL'\000';
4721 *arg = p + 1;
4722
4723 return OK1;
4724}
4725
4726/*
4727 * Allocate a variable for a 'str''ing' constant.
4728 * Return OK or FAIL.
4729 */
4730static int get_lit_string_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
4731{
4732 char_u *p;
4733 char_u *str;
4734 int reduce = 0;
4735
4736 /*
4737 * Find the end of the string, skipping ''.
4738 */
4739 for (p = *arg + 1; *p != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(p)(p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)((char_u *)p) : 1)) {
4740 if (*p == '\'') {
4741 if (p[1] != '\'')
4742 break;
4743 ++reduce;
4744 ++p;
4745 }
4746 }
4747
4748 if (*p != '\'') {
4749 EMSG2(_("E115: Missing quote: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E115: Missing quote: %s"))
), (char_u *)(*arg));
4750 return FAIL0;
4751 }
4752
4753 /* If only parsing return after setting "*arg" */
4754 if (!evaluate) {
4755 *arg = p + 1;
4756 return OK1;
4757 }
4758
4759 /*
4760 * Copy the string into allocated memory, handling '' to ' reduction.
4761 */
4762 str = xmalloc((p - *arg) - reduce);
4763 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
4764 rettv->vval.v_string = str;
4765
4766 for (p = *arg + 1; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
4767 if (*p == '\'') {
4768 if (p[1] != '\'')
4769 break;
4770 ++p;
4771 }
4772 MB_COPY_CHAR(p, str)if (has_mbyte) mb_copy_char((const char_u **)(&p), &str
); else *str++ = *p++;
4773 }
4774 *str = NUL'\000';
4775 *arg = p + 1;
4776
4777 return OK1;
4778}
4779
4780/*
4781 * Allocate a variable for a List and fill it from "*arg".
4782 * Return OK or FAIL.
4783 */
4784static int get_list_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
4785{
4786 list_T *l = NULL((void*)0);
4787 typval_T tv;
4788 listitem_T *item;
4789
4790 if (evaluate) {
4791 l = list_alloc();
4792 }
4793
4794 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4795 while (**arg != ']' && **arg != NUL'\000') {
4796 if (eval1(arg, &tv, evaluate) == FAIL0) /* recursive! */
4797 goto failret;
4798 if (evaluate) {
4799 item = listitem_alloc();
4800 item->li_tv = tv;
4801 item->li_tv.v_lock = 0;
4802 list_append(l, item);
4803 }
4804
4805 if (**arg == ']')
4806 break;
4807 if (**arg != ',') {
4808 EMSG2(_("E696: Missing comma in List: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E696: Missing comma in List: %s"
))), (char_u *)(*arg));
4809 goto failret;
4810 }
4811 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4812 }
4813
4814 if (**arg != ']') {
4815 EMSG2(_("E697: Missing end of List ']': %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E697: Missing end of List ']': %s"
))), (char_u *)(*arg));
4816failret:
4817 if (evaluate)
4818 list_free(l, TRUE1);
4819 return FAIL0;
4820 }
4821
4822 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4823 if (evaluate) {
4824 rettv->v_type = VAR_LIST4;
4825 rettv->vval.v_list = l;
4826 ++l->lv_refcount;
4827 }
4828
4829 return OK1;
4830}
4831
4832/*
4833 * Allocate an empty header for a list.
4834 * Caller should take care of the reference count.
4835 */
4836list_T *list_alloc(void) FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
4837{
4838 list_T *list = xcalloc(1, sizeof(list_T));
4839
4840 /* Prepend the list to the list of lists for garbage collection. */
4841 if (first_list != NULL((void*)0))
4842 first_list->lv_used_prev = list;
4843 list->lv_used_prev = NULL((void*)0);
4844 list->lv_used_next = first_list;
4845 first_list = list;
4846 return list;
4847}
4848
4849/*
4850 * Allocate an empty list for a return value.
4851 */
4852static list_T *rettv_list_alloc(typval_T *rettv)
4853{
4854 list_T *l = list_alloc();
4855 rettv->vval.v_list = l;
4856 rettv->v_type = VAR_LIST4;
4857 ++l->lv_refcount;
4858 return l;
4859}
4860
4861/*
4862 * Unreference a list: decrement the reference count and free it when it
4863 * becomes zero.
4864 */
4865void list_unref(list_T *l)
4866{
4867 if (l != NULL((void*)0) && --l->lv_refcount <= 0)
4868 list_free(l, TRUE1);
4869}
4870
4871/*
4872 * Free a list, including all items it points to.
4873 * Ignores the reference count.
4874 */
4875void
4876list_free (
4877 list_T *l,
4878 int recurse /* Free Lists and Dictionaries recursively. */
4879)
4880{
4881 listitem_T *item;
4882
4883 /* Remove the list from the list of lists for garbage collection. */
4884 if (l->lv_used_prev == NULL((void*)0))
4885 first_list = l->lv_used_next;
4886 else
4887 l->lv_used_prev->lv_used_next = l->lv_used_next;
4888 if (l->lv_used_next != NULL((void*)0))
4889 l->lv_used_next->lv_used_prev = l->lv_used_prev;
4890
4891 for (item = l->lv_first; item != NULL((void*)0); item = l->lv_first) {
4892 /* Remove the item before deleting it. */
4893 l->lv_first = item->li_next;
4894 if (recurse || (item->li_tv.v_type != VAR_LIST4
4895 && item->li_tv.v_type != VAR_DICT5))
4896 clear_tv(&item->li_tv);
4897 xfree(item);
4898 }
4899 xfree(l);
4900}
4901
4902/*
4903 * Allocate a list item.
4904 * It is not initialized, don't forget to set v_lock.
4905 */
4906listitem_T *listitem_alloc(void) FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
4907{
4908 return xmalloc(sizeof(listitem_T));
4909}
4910
4911/*
4912 * Free a list item. Also clears the value. Does not notify watchers.
4913 */
4914void listitem_free(listitem_T *item)
4915{
4916 clear_tv(&item->li_tv);
4917 xfree(item);
4918}
4919
4920/*
4921 * Remove a list item from a List and free it. Also clears the value.
4922 */
4923void listitem_remove(list_T *l, listitem_T *item)
4924{
4925 vim_list_remove(l, item, item);
4926 listitem_free(item);
4927}
4928
4929/*
4930 * Get the number of items in a list.
4931 */
4932static long list_len(list_T *l)
4933{
4934 if (l == NULL((void*)0))
4935 return 0L;
4936 return l->lv_len;
4937}
4938
4939/*
4940 * Return TRUE when two lists have exactly the same values.
4941 */
4942static int
4943list_equal (
4944 list_T *l1,
4945 list_T *l2,
4946 int ic, /* ignore case for strings */
4947 int recursive /* TRUE when used recursively */
4948)
4949{
4950 listitem_T *item1, *item2;
4951
4952 if (l1 == NULL((void*)0) || l2 == NULL((void*)0))
4953 return FALSE0;
4954 if (l1 == l2)
4955 return TRUE1;
4956 if (list_len(l1) != list_len(l2))
4957 return FALSE0;
4958
4959 for (item1 = l1->lv_first, item2 = l2->lv_first;
4960 item1 != NULL((void*)0) && item2 != NULL((void*)0);
4961 item1 = item1->li_next, item2 = item2->li_next)
4962 if (!tv_equal(&item1->li_tv, &item2->li_tv, ic, recursive))
4963 return FALSE0;
4964 return item1 == NULL((void*)0) && item2 == NULL((void*)0);
4965}
4966
4967/*
4968 * Return the dictitem that an entry in a hashtable points to.
4969 */
4970dictitem_T *dict_lookup(hashitem_T *hi)
4971{
4972 return HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
4973}
4974
4975/*
4976 * Return TRUE when two dictionaries have exactly the same key/values.
4977 */
4978static int
4979dict_equal (
4980 dict_T *d1,
4981 dict_T *d2,
4982 int ic, /* ignore case for strings */
4983 int recursive /* TRUE when used recursively */
4984)
4985{
4986 hashitem_T *hi;
4987 dictitem_T *item2;
4988 int todo;
4989
4990 if (d1 == NULL((void*)0) || d2 == NULL((void*)0))
4991 return FALSE0;
4992 if (d1 == d2)
4993 return TRUE1;
4994 if (dict_len(d1) != dict_len(d2))
4995 return FALSE0;
4996
4997 todo = (int)d1->dv_hashtab.ht_used;
4998 for (hi = d1->dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
4999 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
5000 item2 = dict_find(d2, hi->hi_key, -1);
5001 if (item2 == NULL((void*)0))
5002 return FALSE0;
5003 if (!tv_equal(&HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)))->di_tv, &item2->di_tv, ic, recursive))
5004 return FALSE0;
5005 --todo;
5006 }
5007 }
5008 return TRUE1;
5009}
5010
5011static int tv_equal_recurse_limit;
5012
5013/*
5014 * Return TRUE if "tv1" and "tv2" have the same value.
5015 * Compares the items just like "==" would compare them, but strings and
5016 * numbers are different. Floats and numbers are also different.
5017 */
5018static int
5019tv_equal (
5020 typval_T *tv1,
5021 typval_T *tv2,
5022 int ic, /* ignore case */
5023 int recursive /* TRUE when used recursively */
5024)
5025{
5026 char_u buf1[NUMBUFLEN65], buf2[NUMBUFLEN65];
5027 char_u *s1, *s2;
5028 static int recursive_cnt = 0; /* catch recursive loops */
5029 int r;
5030
5031 if (tv1->v_type != tv2->v_type)
5032 return FALSE0;
5033
5034 /* Catch lists and dicts that have an endless loop by limiting
5035 * recursiveness to a limit. We guess they are equal then.
5036 * A fixed limit has the problem of still taking an awful long time.
5037 * Reduce the limit every time running into it. That should work fine for
5038 * deeply linked structures that are not recursively linked and catch
5039 * recursiveness quickly. */
5040 if (!recursive)
5041 tv_equal_recurse_limit = 1000;
5042 if (recursive_cnt >= tv_equal_recurse_limit) {
5043 --tv_equal_recurse_limit;
5044 return TRUE1;
5045 }
5046
5047 switch (tv1->v_type) {
5048 case VAR_LIST4:
5049 ++recursive_cnt;
5050 r = list_equal(tv1->vval.v_list, tv2->vval.v_list, ic, TRUE1);
5051 --recursive_cnt;
5052 return r;
5053
5054 case VAR_DICT5:
5055 ++recursive_cnt;
5056 r = dict_equal(tv1->vval.v_dict, tv2->vval.v_dict, ic, TRUE1);
5057 --recursive_cnt;
5058 return r;
5059
5060 case VAR_FUNC3:
5061 return tv1->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)
5062 && tv2->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)
5063 && STRCMP(tv1->vval.v_string, tv2->vval.v_string)strcmp((char *)(tv1->vval.v_string), (char *)(tv2->vval
.v_string)) == 0;
5064
5065 case VAR_NUMBER1:
5066 return tv1->vval.v_number == tv2->vval.v_number;
5067
5068 case VAR_FLOAT6:
5069 return tv1->vval.v_float == tv2->vval.v_float;
5070
5071 case VAR_STRING2:
5072 s1 = get_tv_string_buf(tv1, buf1);
5073 s2 = get_tv_string_buf(tv2, buf2);
5074 return (ic ? mb_stricmp(s1, s2) : STRCMP(s1, s2)strcmp((char *)(s1), (char *)(s2))) == 0;
5075 }
5076
5077 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "tv_equal()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("tv_equal()"
));
5078 return TRUE1;
5079}
5080
5081/*
5082 * Locate item with index "n" in list "l" and return it.
5083 * A negative index is counted from the end; -1 is the last item.
5084 * Returns NULL when "n" is out of range.
5085 */
5086listitem_T *list_find(list_T *l, long n)
5087{
5088 listitem_T *item;
5089 long idx;
5090
5091 if (l == NULL((void*)0))
5092 return NULL((void*)0);
5093
5094 /* Negative index is relative to the end. */
5095 if (n < 0)
5096 n = l->lv_len + n;
5097
5098 /* Check for index out of range. */
5099 if (n < 0 || n >= l->lv_len)
5100 return NULL((void*)0);
5101
5102 /* When there is a cached index may start search from there. */
5103 if (l->lv_idx_item != NULL((void*)0)) {
5104 if (n < l->lv_idx / 2) {
5105 /* closest to the start of the list */
5106 item = l->lv_first;
5107 idx = 0;
5108 } else if (n > (l->lv_idx + l->lv_len) / 2) {
5109 /* closest to the end of the list */
5110 item = l->lv_last;
5111 idx = l->lv_len - 1;
5112 } else {
5113 /* closest to the cached index */
5114 item = l->lv_idx_item;
5115 idx = l->lv_idx;
5116 }
5117 } else {
5118 if (n < l->lv_len / 2) {
5119 /* closest to the start of the list */
5120 item = l->lv_first;
5121 idx = 0;
5122 } else {
5123 /* closest to the end of the list */
5124 item = l->lv_last;
5125 idx = l->lv_len - 1;
5126 }
5127 }
5128
5129 while (n > idx) {
5130 /* search forward */
5131 item = item->li_next;
5132 ++idx;
5133 }
5134 while (n < idx) {
5135 /* search backward */
5136 item = item->li_prev;
5137 --idx;
5138 }
5139
5140 /* cache the used index */
5141 l->lv_idx = idx;
5142 l->lv_idx_item = item;
5143
5144 return item;
5145}
5146
5147/*
5148 * Get list item "l[idx]" as a number.
5149 */
5150static long
5151list_find_nr (
5152 list_T *l,
5153 long idx,
5154 int *errorp /* set to TRUE when something wrong */
5155)
5156{
5157 listitem_T *li;
5158
5159 li = list_find(l, idx);
5160 if (li == NULL((void*)0)) {
5161 if (errorp != NULL((void*)0))
5162 *errorp = TRUE1;
5163 return -1L;
5164 }
5165 return get_tv_number_chk(&li->li_tv, errorp);
5166}
5167
5168/*
5169 * Get list item "l[idx - 1]" as a string. Returns NULL for failure.
5170 */
5171char_u *list_find_str(list_T *l, long idx)
5172{
5173 listitem_T *li;
5174
5175 li = list_find(l, idx - 1);
5176 if (li == NULL((void*)0)) {
5177 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), idx)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t)(idx
));
5178 return NULL((void*)0);
5179 }
5180 return get_tv_string(&li->li_tv);
5181}
5182
5183/*
5184 * Locate "item" list "l" and return its index.
5185 * Returns -1 when "item" is not in the list.
5186 */
5187static long list_idx_of_item(list_T *l, listitem_T *item)
5188{
5189 long idx = 0;
5190 listitem_T *li;
5191
5192 if (l == NULL((void*)0))
5193 return -1;
5194 idx = 0;
5195 for (li = l->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0) && li != item; li = li->li_next)
5196 ++idx;
5197 if (li == NULL((void*)0))
5198 return -1;
5199 return idx;
5200}
5201
5202/*
5203 * Append item "item" to the end of list "l".
5204 */
5205void list_append(list_T *l, listitem_T *item)
5206{
5207 if (l->lv_last == NULL((void*)0)) {
5208 /* empty list */
5209 l->lv_first = item;
5210 l->lv_last = item;
5211 item->li_prev = NULL((void*)0);
5212 } else {
5213 l->lv_last->li_next = item;
5214 item->li_prev = l->lv_last;
5215 l->lv_last = item;
5216 }
5217 ++l->lv_len;
5218 item->li_next = NULL((void*)0);
5219}
5220
5221/*
5222 * Append typval_T "tv" to the end of list "l".
5223 */
5224void list_append_tv(list_T *l, typval_T *tv)
5225{
5226 listitem_T *li = listitem_alloc();
5227 copy_tv(tv, &li->li_tv);
5228 list_append(l, li);
5229}
5230
5231/*
5232 * Add a list to a list.
5233 */
5234void list_append_list(list_T *list, list_T *itemlist)
5235{
5236 listitem_T *li = listitem_alloc();
5237
5238 li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_LIST4;
5239 li->li_tv.v_lock = 0;
5240 li->li_tv.vval.v_list = itemlist;
5241 list_append(list, li);
5242 ++itemlist->lv_refcount;
5243}
5244
5245/*
5246 * Add a dictionary to a list. Used by getqflist().
5247 */
5248void list_append_dict(list_T *list, dict_T *dict)
5249{
5250 listitem_T *li = listitem_alloc();
5251
5252 li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_DICT5;
5253 li->li_tv.v_lock = 0;
5254 li->li_tv.vval.v_dict = dict;
5255 list_append(list, li);
5256 ++dict->dv_refcount;
5257}
5258
5259/// Make a copy of "str" and append it as an item to list "l"
5260///
5261/// @param[out] l List to append to.
5262/// @param[in] str String to append.
5263/// @param[in] len Length of the appended string. May be negative, in this
5264/// case string is considered to be usual zero-terminated
5265/// string.
5266void list_append_string(list_T *l, const char_u *str, int len)
5267 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1)
5268{
5269 if (str == NULL((void*)0)) {
5270 list_append_allocated_string(l, NULL((void*)0));
5271 } else {
5272 list_append_allocated_string(l, (len >= 0
5273 ? xmemdupz((char *) str, len)
5274 : xstrdup((char *) str)));
5275 }
5276}
5277
5278/// Append given string to the list
5279///
5280/// Unlike list_append_string this function does not copy the string.
5281///
5282/// @param[out] l List to append to.
5283/// @param[in] str String to append.
5284void list_append_allocated_string(list_T *l, char *const str)
5285 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1)
5286{
5287 listitem_T *li = listitem_alloc();
5288
5289 list_append(l, li);
5290 li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
5291 li->li_tv.v_lock = 0;
5292 li->li_tv.vval.v_string = (char_u *) str;
5293}
5294
5295/*
5296 * Append "n" to list "l".
5297 */
5298void list_append_number(list_T *l, varnumber_T n)
5299{
5300 listitem_T *li = listitem_alloc();
5301 li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
5302 li->li_tv.v_lock = 0;
5303 li->li_tv.vval.v_number = n;
5304 list_append(l, li);
5305}
5306
5307/*
5308 * Insert typval_T "tv" in list "l" before "item".
5309 * If "item" is NULL append at the end.
5310 */
5311void list_insert_tv(list_T *l, typval_T *tv, listitem_T *item)
5312{
5313 listitem_T *ni = listitem_alloc();
5314
5315 copy_tv(tv, &ni->li_tv);
5316 list_insert(l, ni, item);
5317}
5318
5319void list_insert(list_T *l, listitem_T *ni, listitem_T *item)
5320{
5321 if (item == NULL((void*)0))
5322 /* Append new item at end of list. */
5323 list_append(l, ni);
5324 else {
5325 /* Insert new item before existing item. */
5326 ni->li_prev = item->li_prev;
5327 ni->li_next = item;
5328 if (item->li_prev == NULL((void*)0)) {
5329 l->lv_first = ni;
5330 ++l->lv_idx;
5331 } else {
5332 item->li_prev->li_next = ni;
5333 l->lv_idx_item = NULL((void*)0);
5334 }
5335 item->li_prev = ni;
5336 ++l->lv_len;
5337 }
5338}
5339
5340/*
5341 * Extend "l1" with "l2".
5342 * If "bef" is NULL append at the end, otherwise insert before this item.
5343 */
5344static void list_extend(list_T *l1, list_T *l2, listitem_T *bef)
5345{
5346 listitem_T *item;
5347 int todo = l2->lv_len;
5348
5349 /* We also quit the loop when we have inserted the original item count of
5350 * the list, avoid a hang when we extend a list with itself. */
5351 for (item = l2->lv_first; item != NULL((void*)0) && --todo >= 0; item = item->li_next) {
5352 list_insert_tv(l1, &item->li_tv, bef);
5353 }
5354}
5355
5356/*
5357 * Concatenate lists "l1" and "l2" into a new list, stored in "tv".
5358 * Return FAIL on failure to copy.
5359 */
5360static int list_concat(list_T *l1, list_T *l2, typval_T *tv)
5361{
5362 list_T *l;
5363
5364 if (l1 == NULL((void*)0) || l2 == NULL((void*)0))
5365 return FAIL0;
5366
5367 /* make a copy of the first list. */
5368 l = list_copy(NULL((void*)0), l1, false0, 0);
5369 if (l == NULL((void*)0))
5370 return FAIL0;
5371 tv->v_type = VAR_LIST4;
5372 tv->vval.v_list = l;
5373
5374 /* append all items from the second list */
5375 list_extend(l, l2, NULL((void*)0));
5376 return OK1;
5377}
5378
5379/// Make a copy of list
5380///
5381/// @param[in] conv If non-NULL, then all internal strings will be converted.
5382/// @param[in] orig Original list to copy.
5383/// @param[in] deep If false, then shallow copy will be done.
5384/// @param[in] copyID See var_item_copy().
5385///
5386/// @return Copied list. May be NULL in case original list is NULL or some
5387/// failure happens. The refcount of the new list is set to 1.
5388static list_T *list_copy(const vimconv_T *const conv,
5389 list_T *const orig,
5390 const bool_Bool deep,
5391 const int copyID)
5392 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
5393{
5394 listitem_T *item;
5395 listitem_T *ni;
5396
5397 if (orig == NULL((void*)0))
5398 return NULL((void*)0);
5399
5400 list_T *copy = list_alloc();
5401 if (copyID != 0) {
5402 /* Do this before adding the items, because one of the items may
5403 * refer back to this list. */
5404 orig->lv_copyID = copyID;
5405 orig->lv_copylist = copy;
5406 }
5407 for (item = orig->lv_first; item != NULL((void*)0) && !got_int;
5408 item = item->li_next) {
5409 ni = listitem_alloc();
5410 if (deep) {
5411 if (var_item_copy(conv, &item->li_tv, &ni->li_tv, deep, copyID) == FAIL0) {
5412 xfree(ni);
5413 break;
5414 }
5415 } else
5416 copy_tv(&item->li_tv, &ni->li_tv);
5417 list_append(copy, ni);
5418 }
5419 ++copy->lv_refcount;
5420 if (item != NULL((void*)0)) {
5421 list_unref(copy);
5422 copy = NULL((void*)0);
5423 }
5424
5425 return copy;
5426}
5427
5428/// Remove items "item" to "item2" from list "l".
5429/// @warning Does not free the listitem or the value!
5430void vim_list_remove(list_T *l, listitem_T *item, listitem_T *item2)
5431{
5432 // notify watchers
5433 for (listitem_T *ip = item; ip != NULL((void*)0); ip = ip->li_next) {
5434 --l->lv_len;
5435 list_fix_watch(l, ip);
5436 if (ip == item2) {
5437 break;
5438 }
5439 }
5440
5441 if (item2->li_next == NULL((void*)0)) {
5442 l->lv_last = item->li_prev;
5443 } else {
5444 item2->li_next->li_prev = item->li_prev;
5445 }
5446 if (item->li_prev == NULL((void*)0)) {
5447 l->lv_first = item2->li_next;
5448 } else {
5449 item->li_prev->li_next = item2->li_next;
5450 }
5451 l->lv_idx_item = NULL((void*)0);
5452}
5453
5454typedef struct join_S {
5455 char_u *s;
5456 char_u *tofree;
5457} join_T;
5458
5459/// Join list into a string, helper function
5460///
5461/// @param[out] gap Garray where result will be saved.
5462/// @param[in] l List to join.
5463/// @param[in] sep Used separator.
5464/// @param[in] join_gap Garray to keep each list item string.
5465///
5466/// @return OK in case of success, FAIL otherwise.
5467static int list_join_inner(garray_T *const gap, list_T *const l,
5468 const char *const sep, garray_T *const join_gap)
5469 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5470{
5471 int sumlen = 0;
5472 bool_Bool first = true1;
5473 listitem_T *item;
5474
5475 /* Stringify each item in the list. */
5476 for (item = l->lv_first; item != NULL((void*)0) && !got_int; item = item->li_next) {
5477 char *s;
5478 size_t len;
5479 s = echo_string(&item->li_tv, &len);
5480 if (s == NULL((void*)0))
5481 return FAIL0;
5482
5483 sumlen += (int) len;
5484
5485 join_T *const p = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(join_T, join_gap)ga_append_via_ptr(join_gap, sizeof(join_T));
5486 p->tofree = p->s = (char_u *) s;
5487
5488 line_breakcheck();
5489 if (did_echo_string_emsg) { // recursion error, bail out
5490 break;
5491 }
5492 }
5493
5494 /* Allocate result buffer with its total size, avoid re-allocation and
5495 * multiple copy operations. Add 2 for a tailing ']' and NUL. */
5496 if (join_gap->ga_len >= 2)
5497 sumlen += (int)STRLEN(sep)strlen((char *)(sep)) * (join_gap->ga_len - 1);
5498 ga_grow(gap, sumlen + 2);
5499
5500 for (int i = 0; i < join_gap->ga_len && !got_int; ++i) {
5501 if (first) {
5502 first = false0;
5503 } else {
5504 ga_concat(gap, (const char_u *) sep);
5505 }
5506 const join_T *const p = ((const join_T *)join_gap->ga_data) + i;
5507
5508 if (p->s != NULL((void*)0))
5509 ga_concat(gap, p->s);
5510 line_breakcheck();
5511 }
5512
5513 return OK1;
5514}
5515
5516/// Join list into a string using given separator
5517///
5518/// @param[out] gap Garray where result will be saved.
5519/// @param[in] l Joined list.
5520/// @param[in] sep Separator.
5521///
5522/// @return OK in case of success, FAIL otherwise.
5523static int list_join(garray_T *const gap, list_T *const l,
5524 const char *const sep)
5525 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5526{
5527 if (l->lv_len < 1) {
5528 return OK1;
5529 }
5530
5531 garray_T join_ga;
5532 int retval;
5533
5534 ga_init(&join_ga, (int)sizeof(join_T), l->lv_len);
5535 retval = list_join_inner(gap, l, sep, &join_ga);
5536
5537# define FREE_JOIN_TOFREE(join)xfree((join)->tofree) xfree((join)->tofree)
5538 GA_DEEP_CLEAR(&join_ga, join_T, FREE_JOIN_TOFREE)do { garray_T *_gap = (&join_ga); if (_gap->ga_data !=
((void*)0)) { for (int i = 0; i < _gap->ga_len; i++) {
join_T *_item = &(((join_T *)_gap->ga_data)[i]); xfree
((_item)->tofree); } } ga_clear(_gap); } while (0);
5539
5540 return retval;
5541}
5542
5543/*
5544 * Garbage collection for lists and dictionaries.
5545 *
5546 * We use reference counts to be able to free most items right away when they
5547 * are no longer used. But for composite items it's possible that it becomes
5548 * unused while the reference count is > 0: When there is a recursive
5549 * reference. Example:
5550 * :let l = [1, 2, 3]
5551 * :let d = {9: l}
5552 * :let l[1] = d
5553 *
5554 * Since this is quite unusual we handle this with garbage collection: every
5555 * once in a while find out which lists and dicts are not referenced from any
5556 * variable.
5557 *
5558 * Here is a good reference text about garbage collection (refers to Python
5559 * but it applies to all reference-counting mechanisms):
5560 * http://python.ca/nas/python/gc/
5561 */
5562
5563/// Do garbage collection for lists and dicts.
5564///
5565/// @returns true if some memory was freed.
5566bool_Bool garbage_collect(void)
5567{
5568 bool_Bool abort = false0;
5569#define ABORTING(func) abort = abort || func
5570
5571 // Only do this once.
5572 want_garbage_collect = false0;
5573 may_garbage_collect = false0;
5574 garbage_collect_at_exit = false0;
5575
5576 // We advance by two because we add one for items referenced through
5577 // previous_funccal.
5578 current_copyID += COPYID_INC2;
5579 int copyID = current_copyID;
5580
5581 // 1. Go through all accessible variables and mark all lists and dicts
5582 // with copyID.
5583
5584 // Don't free variables in the previous_funccal list unless they are only
5585 // referenced through previous_funccal. This must be first, because if
5586 // the item is referenced elsewhere the funccal must not be freed.
5587 for (funccall_T *fc = previous_funccal; fc != NULL((void*)0); fc = fc->caller) {
5588 ABORTING(set_ref_in_ht)(&fc->l_vars.dv_hashtab, copyID + 1, NULL((void*)0));
5589 ABORTING(set_ref_in_ht)(&fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab, copyID + 1, NULL((void*)0));
5590 }
5591
5592 // script-local variables
5593 for (int i = 1; i <= ga_scripts.ga_len; ++i) {
5594 ABORTING(set_ref_in_ht)(&SCRIPT_VARS(i)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1])->sv_dict.
dv_hashtab), copyID, NULL((void*)0));
5595 }
5596
5597 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for (buf_T *buf = firstbuf; buf != ((void*)0); buf = buf->
b_next) {
5598 // buffer-local variables
5599 ABORTING(set_ref_in_item)(&buf->b_bufvar.di_tv, copyID, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
5600 // buffer marks (ShaDa additional data)
5601 ABORTING(set_ref_in_fmark)(buf->b_last_cursor, copyID);
5602 ABORTING(set_ref_in_fmark)(buf->b_last_insert, copyID);
5603 ABORTING(set_ref_in_fmark)(buf->b_last_change, copyID);
5604 for (size_t i = 0; i < NMARKS('z' - 'a' + 1); i++) {
5605 ABORTING(set_ref_in_fmark)(buf->b_namedm[i], copyID);
5606 }
5607 // buffer change list (ShaDa additional data)
5608 for (int i = 0; i < buf->b_changelistlen; i++) {
5609 ABORTING(set_ref_in_fmark)(buf->b_changelist[i], copyID);
5610 }
5611 // buffer ShaDa additional data
5612 ABORTING(set_ref_dict)(buf->additional_data, copyID);
5613 }
5614
5615 FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)for (tabpage_T *tp = first_tabpage; tp != ((void*)0); tp = tp
->tp_next) for (win_T *wp = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin : (
tp)->tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
5616 // window-local variables
5617 ABORTING(set_ref_in_item)(&wp->w_winvar.di_tv, copyID, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
5618 // window jump list (ShaDa additional data)
5619 for (int i = 0; i < wp->w_jumplistlen; i++) {
5620 ABORTING(set_ref_in_fmark)(wp->w_jumplist[i].fmark, copyID);
5621 }
5622 }
5623 if (aucmd_win != NULL((void*)0)) {
5624 ABORTING(set_ref_in_item)(&aucmd_win->w_winvar.di_tv, copyID, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
5625 }
5626
5627 // registers (ShaDa additional data)
5628 {
5629 const void *reg_iter = NULL((void*)0);
5630 do {
5631 yankreg_T reg;
5632 char name = NUL'\000';
5633 reg_iter = op_register_iter(reg_iter, &name, &reg);
5634 if (name != NUL'\000') {
5635 ABORTING(set_ref_dict)(reg.additional_data, copyID);
5636 }
5637 } while (reg_iter != NULL((void*)0));
5638 }
5639
5640 // global marks (ShaDa additional data)
5641 {
5642 const void *mark_iter = NULL((void*)0);
5643 do {
5644 xfmark_T fm;
5645 char name = NUL'\000';
5646 mark_iter = mark_global_iter(mark_iter, &name, &fm);
5647 if (name != NUL'\000') {
5648 ABORTING(set_ref_dict)(fm.fmark.additional_data, copyID);
5649 }
5650 } while (mark_iter != NULL((void*)0));
5651 }
5652
5653 // tabpage-local variables
5654 FOR_ALL_TABS(tp)for (tabpage_T *tp = first_tabpage; tp != ((void*)0); tp = tp
->tp_next) {
5655 ABORTING(set_ref_in_item)(&tp->tp_winvar.di_tv, copyID, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
5656 }
5657
5658 // global variables
5659 ABORTING(set_ref_in_ht)(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab, copyID, NULL((void*)0));
5660
5661 // function-local variables
5662 for (funccall_T *fc = current_funccal; fc != NULL((void*)0); fc = fc->caller) {
5663 ABORTING(set_ref_in_ht)(&fc->l_vars.dv_hashtab, copyID, NULL((void*)0));
5664 ABORTING(set_ref_in_ht)(&fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab, copyID, NULL((void*)0));
5665 }
5666
5667 // Jobs
5668 {
5669 TerminalJobData *data;
5670 map_foreach_value(jobs, data, {{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((jobs->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((jobs->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
continue; (data) = ((jobs->table)->vals[__i]); { ABORTING
(set_ref_dict)(data->self, copyID); }; } }
5671 ABORTING(set_ref_dict)(data->self, copyID);{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((jobs->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((jobs->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
