12935 char *const idx_msg = _("index %i")gettext((char *)("index %i"));
12936 for (size_t i = 0; i < kv_size(*mpstack)((*mpstack).size); i++) {
12937 if (i != 0) {
12938 ga_concat(&msg_ga, (char_u *) ", ");
12939 }
12940 MPConvStackVal v = kv_A(*mpstack, i)((*mpstack).items[(i)]);
12941 switch (v.type) {
12942 case kMPConvDict: {
12943 typval_T key_tv = {
12944 .v_type = VAR_STRING2,
12945 .vval = { .v_string = (v.data.d.hi == NULL((void*)0)
12946 ? v.data.d.dict->dv_hashtab.ht_array
12947 : (v.data.d.hi - 1))->hi_key },
12948 };
12949 char *const key = tv2string(&key_tv, NULL((void*)0));
12950 vim_snprintf((char *) IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), key_msg, key);
12951 xfree(key);
12952 ga_concat(&msg_ga, IObuff);
12953 break;
12954 }
12955 case kMPConvPairs:
12956 case kMPConvList: {
12957 int idx = 0;
12958 const listitem_T *li;
12959 for (li = v.data.l.list->lv_first;
12960 li != NULL((void*)0) && li->li_next != v.data.l.li;
12961 li = li->li_next) {
12962 idx++;
12963 }
12964 if (v.type == kMPConvList
12965 || li == NULL((void*)0)
12966 || (li->li_tv.v_type != VAR_LIST4
12967 && li->li_tv.vval.v_list->lv_len <= 0)) {
12968 vim_snprintf((char *) IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), idx_msg, idx);
12969 ga_concat(&msg_ga, IObuff);
12970 } else {
12971 typval_T key_tv = li->li_tv.vval.v_list->lv_first->li_tv;
12972 char *const key = echo_string(&key_tv, NULL((void*)0));
12973 vim_snprintf((char *) IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), key_pair_msg, key, idx);
12974 xfree(key);
12975 ga_concat(&msg_ga, IObuff);
12976 }
12977 break;
12978 }
12979 }
12980 }
12981 EMSG3(msg, objname, (kv_size(*mpstack) == 0emsg3((char_u *)(msg), (char_u *)(objname), (char_u *)((((*mpstack
).size) == 0 ? gettext((char *)("itself")) : (char *) msg_ga.
ga_data)))
12982 ? _("itself")emsg3((char_u *)(msg), (char_u *)(objname), (char_u *)((((*mpstack
).size) == 0 ? gettext((char *)("itself")) : (char *) msg_ga.
ga_data)))
12983 : (char *) msg_ga.ga_data))emsg3((char_u *)(msg), (char_u *)(objname), (char_u *)((((*mpstack
).size) == 0 ? gettext((char *)("itself")) : (char *) msg_ga.
ga_data)));
12984 ga_clear(&msg_ga);
12985 return FAIL0;
12986}
12987
12988#define CONV_STRING(buf, len) \
12989 do { \
12990 if (buf == NULL((void*)0)) { \
12991 msgpack_pack_bin(packer, 0); \
12992 } else { \
12993 const size_t len_ = (len); \
12994 msgpack_pack_bin(packer, len_); \
12995 msgpack_pack_bin_body(packer, buf, len_); \
12996 } \
12997 } while (0)
12998
12999#define CONV_STR_STRING(buf, len) \
13000 do { \
13001 if (buf == NULL((void*)0)) { \
13002 msgpack_pack_str(packer, 0); \
13003 } else { \
13004 const size_t len_ = (len); \
13005 msgpack_pack_str(packer, len_); \
13006 msgpack_pack_str_body(packer, buf, len_); \
13007 } \
13008 } while (0)
13009
13010#define CONV_EXT_STRING(buf, len, type) \
13011 do { \
13012 if (buf == NULL((void*)0)) { \
13013 msgpack_pack_ext(packer, 0, type); \
13014 } else { \
13015 const size_t len_ = (len); \
13016 msgpack_pack_ext(packer, len_, (int8_t) type); \
13017 msgpack_pack_ext_body(packer, buf, len_); \
13018 } \
13019 } while (0)
13020
13021#define CONV_NUMBER(num) \
13022 msgpack_pack_int64(packer, (int64_t) (num))
13023
13024#define CONV_FLOAT(flt) \
13025 msgpack_pack_double(packer, (double) (flt))
13026
13027#define CONV_FUNC(fun) \
13028 return conv_error(_("E951: Error while dumping %s, %s: " \gettext((char *)("E951: Error while dumping %s, %s: " "attempt to dump function reference"
))
13029 "attempt to dump function reference")gettext((char *)("E951: Error while dumping %s, %s: " "attempt to dump function reference"
)), \
13030 mpstack, objname)
13031
13032#define CONV_EMPTY_LIST() \
13033 msgpack_pack_array(packer, 0)
13034
13035#define CONV_LIST_START(lst) \
13036 msgpack_pack_array(packer, (lst)->lv_len)
13037
13038#define CONV_EMPTY_DICT() \
13039 msgpack_pack_map(packer, 0)
13040
13041#define CONV_SPECIAL_NIL() \
13042 msgpack_pack_nil(packer)
13043
13044#define CONV_SPECIAL_BOOL(num) \
13045 do { \
13046 if ((num)) { \
13047 msgpack_pack_true(packer); \
13048 } else { \
13049 msgpack_pack_false(packer); \
13050 } \
13051 } while (0)
13052
13053#define CONV_UNSIGNED_NUMBER(num) \
13054 msgpack_pack_uint64(packer, (num))
13055
13056#define CONV_SPECIAL_MAP_START(lst) \
13057 msgpack_pack_map(packer, (lst)->lv_len)
13058
13059#define CONV_DICT_START(dct) \
13060 msgpack_pack_map(packer, (dct)->dv_hashtab.ht_used)
13061
13062#define CONV_DICT_END(dct)
13063
13064#define CONV_DICT_AFTER_KEY(dct)
13065
13066#define CONV_DICT_BETWEEN_ITEMS(dct)
13067
13068#define CONV_LIST_END(lst)
13069
13070#define CONV_LIST_BETWEEN_ITEMS(lst)
13071
13072#define CONV_RECURSE(val, conv_type) \
13073 return conv_error(_("E952: Unable to dump %s: " \gettext((char *)("E952: Unable to dump %s: " "container references itself in %s"
))
13074 "container references itself in %s")gettext((char *)("E952: Unable to dump %s: " "container references itself in %s"
)), \
13075 mpstack, objname)
13076
13077#define CONV_ALLOW_SPECIAL true1
13078
13079DEFINE_VIML_CONV_FUNCTIONS(, msgpack, msgpack_packer *const, packer)static int msgpack_convert_one_value(msgpack_packer *const packer
, MPConvStack *const mpstack, typval_T *const tv, const int copyID
, const char *const objname) { switch (tv->v_type) { case 2
: { CONV_STRING(tv->vval.v_string, strlen((char *)(tv->
vval.v_string))); break; } case 1: { CONV_NUMBER(tv->vval.
v_number); break; } case 6: { CONV_FLOAT(tv->vval.v_float)
; break; } case 3: { CONV_FUNC(tv->vval.v_string); break; }
case 4: { if (tv->vval.v_list == ((void*)0) || tv->vval
.v_list->lv_len == 0) { CONV_EMPTY_LIST(); break; } do { if
((tv->vval.v_list)->lv_copyID == copyID) { CONV_RECURSE
((tv->vval.v_list), kMPConvList); } (tv->vval.v_list)->
lv_copyID = copyID; } while (0); CONV_LIST_START(tv->vval.
v_list); do { if ((*mpstack).size == (*mpstack).capacity) { (
*mpstack).capacity = (*mpstack).capacity? (*mpstack).capacity
<<1 : 8; (*mpstack).items = (MPConvStackVal*)xrealloc((
*mpstack).items, sizeof(MPConvStackVal) * (*mpstack).capacity
); } (*mpstack).items[(*mpstack).size++] = (((MPConvStackVal)
{ .type = kMPConvList, .data = { .l = { .list = tv->vval.
v_list, .li = tv->vval.v_list->lv_first, }, }, })); } while
(0); break; } case 5: { if (tv->vval.v_dict == ((void*)0)
|| tv->vval.v_dict->dv_hashtab.ht_used == 0) { CONV_EMPTY_DICT
(); break; } const dictitem_T *type_di; const dictitem_T *val_di
; if (CONV_ALLOW_SPECIAL && tv->vval.v_dict->dv_hashtab
.ht_used == 2 && (type_di = dict_find((dict_T *) tv->
vval.v_dict, (char_u *) "_TYPE", -1)) != ((void*)0) &&
type_di->di_tv.v_type == 4 && (val_di = dict_find
((dict_T *) tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *) "_VAL", -1)) != ((
void*)0)) { size_t i; for (i = 0; i < ((sizeof(msgpack_type_lists
)/sizeof((msgpack_type_lists)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(msgpack_type_lists
) % sizeof((msgpack_type_lists)[0]))))); i++) { if (type_di->
di_tv.vval.v_list == msgpack_type_lists[i]) { break; } } if (
i == ((sizeof(msgpack_type_lists)/sizeof((msgpack_type_lists)
[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(msgpack_type_lists) % sizeof((msgpack_type_lists
)[0])))))) { goto msgpack_convert_one_value_regular_dict; } switch
((MessagePackType) i) { case kMPNil: { CONV_SPECIAL_NIL(); break
; } case kMPBoolean: { if (val_di->di_tv.v_type != 1) { goto
msgpack_convert_one_value_regular_dict; } CONV_SPECIAL_BOOL(
val_di->di_tv.vval.v_number); break; } case kMPInteger: { const
list_T *val_list; varnumber_T sign; varnumber_T highest_bits
; varnumber_T high_bits; varnumber_T low_bits; if (val_di->
di_tv.v_type != 4 || (val_list = val_di->di_tv.vval.v_list
) == ((void*)0) || val_list->lv_len != 4 || val_list->lv_first
->li_tv.v_type != 1 || (sign = val_list->lv_first->li_tv
.vval.v_number) == 0 || val_list->lv_first->li_next->
li_tv.v_type != 1 || (highest_bits = val_list->lv_first->
li_next->li_tv.vval.v_number) < 0 || val_list->lv_last
->li_prev->li_tv.v_type != 1 || (high_bits = val_list->
lv_last->li_prev->li_tv.vval.v_number) < 0 || val_list
->lv_last->li_tv.v_type != 1 || (low_bits = val_list->
lv_last->li_tv.vval.v_number) < 0) { goto msgpack_convert_one_value_regular_dict
; } uint64_t number = ((uint64_t) (((uint64_t) highest_bits) <<
62) | (uint64_t) (((uint64_t) high_bits) << 31) | (uint64_t
) low_bits); if (sign > 0) { CONV_UNSIGNED_NUMBER(number);
} else { CONV_NUMBER(-number); } break; } case kMPFloat: { if
(val_di->di_tv.v_type != 6) { goto msgpack_convert_one_value_regular_dict
; } CONV_FLOAT(val_di->di_tv.vval.v_float); break; } case kMPString
: case kMPBinary: { const _Bool is_string = ((MessagePackType
) i == kMPString); if (val_di->di_tv.v_type != 4) { goto msgpack_convert_one_value_regular_dict
; } size_t len; char *buf; if (!vim_list_to_buf(val_di->di_tv
.vval.v_list, &len, &buf)) { goto msgpack_convert_one_value_regular_dict
; } if (is_string) { CONV_STR_STRING(buf, len); } else { CONV_STRING
(buf, len); } xfree(buf); break; } case kMPArray: { if (val_di
->di_tv.v_type != 4) { goto msgpack_convert_one_value_regular_dict
; } do { if ((val_di->di_tv.vval.v_list)->lv_copyID == copyID
) { CONV_RECURSE((val_di->di_tv.vval.v_list), kMPConvList)
; } (val_di->di_tv.vval.v_list)->lv_copyID = copyID; } while
(0); CONV_LIST_START(val_di->di_tv.vval.v_list); do { if (
(*mpstack).size == (*mpstack).capacity) { (*mpstack).capacity
= (*mpstack).capacity? (*mpstack).capacity<<1 : 8; (*mpstack
).items = (MPConvStackVal*)xrealloc((*mpstack).items, sizeof(
MPConvStackVal) * (*mpstack).capacity); } (*mpstack).items[(*
mpstack).size++] = (((MPConvStackVal) { .type = kMPConvList, .
data = { .l = { .list = val_di->di_tv.vval.v_list, .li = val_di
->di_tv.vval.v_list->lv_first, }, }, })); } while (0); break
; } case kMPMap: { if (val_di->di_tv.v_type != 4) { goto msgpack_convert_one_value_regular_dict
; } if (val_di->di_tv.vval.v_list == ((void*)0)) { CONV_EMPTY_DICT
(); break; } list_T *const val_list = val_di->di_tv.vval.v_list
; for (const listitem_T *li = val_list->lv_first; li != ((
void*)0); li = li->li_next) { if (li->li_tv.v_type != 4
|| li->li_tv.vval.v_list->lv_len != 2) { goto msgpack_convert_one_value_regular_dict
; } } do { if ((val_list)->lv_copyID == copyID) { CONV_RECURSE
((val_list), kMPConvPairs); } (val_list)->lv_copyID = copyID
; } while (0); CONV_SPECIAL_MAP_START(val_list); do { if ((*mpstack
).size == (*mpstack).capacity) { (*mpstack).capacity = (*mpstack
).capacity? (*mpstack).capacity<<1 : 8; (*mpstack).items
= (MPConvStackVal*)xrealloc((*mpstack).items, sizeof(MPConvStackVal
) * (*mpstack).capacity); } (*mpstack).items[(*mpstack).size++
] = (((MPConvStackVal) { .type = kMPConvPairs, .data = { .l =
{ .list = val_list, .li = val_list->lv_first, }, }, })); }
while (0); break; } case kMPExt: { const list_T *val_list; varnumber_T
type; if (val_di->di_tv.v_type != 4 || (val_list = val_di
->di_tv.vval.v_list) == ((void*)0) || val_list->lv_len !=
2 || (val_list->lv_first->li_tv.v_type != 1) || (type =
val_list->lv_first->li_tv.vval.v_number) > (127) ||
type < (-128) || (val_list->lv_last->li_tv.v_type !=
4)) { goto msgpack_convert_one_value_regular_dict; } size_t len
; char *buf; if (!vim_list_to_buf(val_list->lv_last->li_tv
.vval.v_list, &len, &buf)) { goto msgpack_convert_one_value_regular_dict
; } CONV_EXT_STRING(buf, len, type); xfree(buf); break; } } break
; } msgpack_convert_one_value_regular_dict: do { if ((tv->
vval.v_dict)->dv_copyID == copyID) { CONV_RECURSE((tv->
vval.v_dict), kMPConvDict); } (tv->vval.v_dict)->dv_copyID
= copyID; } while (0); CONV_DICT_START(tv->vval.v_dict); do
{ if ((*mpstack).size == (*mpstack).capacity) { (*mpstack).capacity
= (*mpstack).capacity? (*mpstack).capacity<<1 : 8; (*mpstack
).items = (MPConvStackVal*)xrealloc((*mpstack).items, sizeof(
MPConvStackVal) * (*mpstack).capacity); } (*mpstack).items[(*
mpstack).size++] = (((MPConvStackVal) { .type = kMPConvDict, .
data = { .d = { .dict = tv->vval.v_dict, .hi = tv->vval
.v_dict->dv_hashtab.ht_array, .todo = tv->vval.v_dict->
dv_hashtab.ht_used, }, }, })); } while (0); break; } default:
{ emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)
("msgpack" "_convert_one_value()")); return 0; } } return 1; }
int vim_to_msgpack(msgpack_packer *const packer, typval_T *const
tv, const char *const objname) { current_copyID += 2; const int
copyID = current_copyID; MPConvStack mpstack; ((mpstack).size
= (mpstack).capacity = 0, (mpstack).items = 0); if ( msgpack_convert_one_value
(packer, &mpstack, tv, copyID, objname) == 0) { goto vim_to_msgpack_error_ret
; } while (((mpstack).size)) { MPConvStackVal *cur_mpsv = &
((mpstack).items[(((mpstack).size) - 1)]); typval_T *cur_tv =
((void*)0); switch (cur_mpsv->type) { case kMPConvDict: {
if (!cur_mpsv->data.d.todo) { (void) ((mpstack).items[--(
mpstack).size]); cur_mpsv->data.d.dict->dv_copyID = copyID
- 1; CONV_DICT_END(cur_mpsv->data.d.dict); continue; } else
if (cur_mpsv->data.d.todo != cur_mpsv->data.d.dict->
dv_hashtab.ht_used) { CONV_DICT_BETWEEN_ITEMS(cur_mpsv->data
.d.dict); } while (((cur_mpsv->data.d.hi)->hi_key == ((
void*)0) || (cur_mpsv->data.d.hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) { cur_mpsv->data.d.hi++; } dictitem_T *const di = ((dictitem_T
*)((cur_mpsv->data.d.hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(
dictitem_T, di_key))); cur_mpsv->data.d.todo--; cur_mpsv->
data.d.hi++; CONV_STR_STRING(&di->di_key[0], strlen((char
*)(&di->di_key[0]))); CONV_DICT_AFTER_KEY(cur_mpsv->
data.d.dict); cur_tv = &di->di_tv; break; } case kMPConvList
: { if (cur_mpsv->data.l.li == ((void*)0)) { (void) ((mpstack
).items[--(mpstack).size]); cur_mpsv->data.l.list->lv_copyID
= copyID - 1; CONV_LIST_END(cur_mpsv->data.l.list); continue
; } else if (cur_mpsv->data.l.li != cur_mpsv->data.l.list
->lv_first) { CONV_LIST_BETWEEN_ITEMS(cur_mpsv->data.l.
list); } cur_tv = &cur_mpsv->data.l.li->li_tv; cur_mpsv
->data.l.li = cur_mpsv->data.l.li->li_next; break; }
case kMPConvPairs: { if (cur_mpsv->data.l.li == ((void*)0
)) { (void) ((mpstack).items[--(mpstack).size]); cur_mpsv->
data.l.list->lv_copyID = copyID - 1; continue; } const list_T
*const kv_pair = cur_mpsv->data.l.li->li_tv.vval.v_list
; if ( msgpack_convert_one_value(packer, &mpstack, &kv_pair
->lv_first->li_tv, copyID, objname) == 0) { goto vim_to_msgpack_error_ret
; } cur_tv = &kv_pair->lv_last->li_tv; cur_mpsv->
data.l.li = cur_mpsv->data.l.li->li_next; break; } } if
( msgpack_convert_one_value(packer, &mpstack, cur_tv, copyID
, objname) == 0) { goto vim_to_msgpack_error_ret; } } xfree((
mpstack).items); return 1; vim_to_msgpack_error_ret: xfree((mpstack
).items); return 0; }
13080
13081#undef CONV_STRING
13082#undef CONV_STR_STRING
13083#undef CONV_EXT_STRING
13084#undef CONV_NUMBER
13085#undef CONV_FLOAT
13086#undef CONV_FUNC
13087#undef CONV_EMPTY_LIST
13088#undef CONV_LIST_START
13089#undef CONV_EMPTY_DICT
13090#undef CONV_SPECIAL_NIL
13091#undef CONV_SPECIAL_BOOL
13092#undef CONV_UNSIGNED_NUMBER
13093#undef CONV_SPECIAL_MAP_START
13094#undef CONV_DICT_START
13095#undef CONV_DICT_END
13096#undef CONV_DICT_AFTER_KEY
13097#undef CONV_DICT_BETWEEN_ITEMS
13098#undef CONV_LIST_END
13099#undef CONV_LIST_BETWEEN_ITEMS
13100#undef CONV_RECURSE
13101#undef CONV_ALLOW_SPECIAL
13102
13103/// "msgpackdump()" function
13104static void f_msgpackdump(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13105 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
13106{
13107 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_LIST4) {
13108 EMSG2(_(e_listarg), "msgpackdump()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listarg))), (char_u *)("msgpackdump()"
));
13109 return;
13110 }
13111 list_T *ret_list = rettv_list_alloc(rettv);
13112 const list_T *list = argvars[0].vval.v_list;
13113 if (list == NULL((void*)0)) {
13114 return;
13115 }
13116 msgpack_packer *lpacker = msgpack_packer_new(ret_list, &msgpack_list_write);
13117 const char *const msg = _("msgpackdump() argument, index %i")gettext((char *)("msgpackdump() argument, index %i"));
13118 // Assume that translation will not take more then 4 times more space
13119 char msgbuf[sizeof("msgpackdump() argument, index ") * 4 + NUMBUFLEN65];
13120 int idx = 0;
13121 for (listitem_T *li = list->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0); li = li->li_next) {
13122 vim_snprintf(msgbuf, sizeof(msgbuf), (char *) msg, idx);
13123 idx++;
13124 if (vim_to_msgpack(lpacker, &li->li_tv, msgbuf) == FAIL0) {
13125 break;
13126 }
13127 }
13128 msgpack_packer_free(lpacker);
13129}
13130
13131/// Read bytes from list
13132///
13133/// @param[in,out] state Structure describing position in list from which
13134/// reading should start. Is updated to reflect position
13135/// at which reading ended.
13136/// @param[out] buf Buffer to write to.
13137/// @param[in] nbuf Buffer length.
13138/// @param[out] read_bytes Is set to amount of bytes read.
13139///
13140/// @return OK when reading was finished, FAIL in case of error (i.e. list item
13141/// was not a string), NOTDONE if reading was successfull, but there are
13142/// more bytes to read.
13143static int read_from_list(ListReaderState *const state, char *const buf,
13144 const size_t nbuf, size_t *const read_bytes)
13145 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
13146{
13147 char *const buf_end = buf + nbuf;
13148 char *p = buf;
13149 while (p < buf_end) {
13150 for (size_t i = state->offset; i < state->li_length && p < buf_end; i++) {
13151 const char ch = state->li->li_tv.vval.v_string[state->offset++];
13152 *p++ = (ch == NL'\012' ? NUL'\000' : ch);
13153 }
13154 if (p < buf_end) {
13155 state->li = state->li->li_next;
13156 if (state->li == NULL((void*)0)) {
13157 *read_bytes = (size_t) (p - buf);
13158 return OK1;
13159 }
13160 *p++ = NL'\012';
13161 if (state->li->li_tv.v_type != VAR_STRING2) {
13162 *read_bytes = (size_t) (p - buf);
13163 return FAIL0;
13164 }
13165 state->offset = 0;
13166 state->li_length = (state->li->li_tv.vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0)
13167 ? 0
13168 : STRLEN(state->li->li_tv.vval.v_string)strlen((char *)(state->li->li_tv.vval.v_string)));
13169 }
13170 }
13171 *read_bytes = nbuf;
13172 return (state->offset < state->li_length || state->li->li_next != NULL((void*)0)
13173 ? NOTDONE2
13174 : OK1);
13175}
13176
13177/// Initialize ListReaderState structure
13178static inline ListReaderState init_lrstate(const list_T *const list)
13179 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
13180{
13181 return (ListReaderState) {
13182 .li = list->lv_first,
13183 .offset = 0,
13184 .li_length = (list->lv_first->li_tv.vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0)
13185 ? 0
13186 : STRLEN(list->lv_first->li_tv.vval.v_string)strlen((char *)(list->lv_first->li_tv.vval.v_string))),
13187 };
13188}
13189
13190/// Convert msgpack object to a VimL one
13191int msgpack_to_vim(const msgpack_object mobj, typval_T *const rettv)
13192 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
13193{
13194#define INIT_SPECIAL_DICT(tv, type, val) \
13195 do { \
13196 dict_T *const dict = dict_alloc(); \
13197 dictitem_T *const type_di = dictitem_alloc((char_u *) "_TYPE"); \
13198 type_di->di_tv.v_type = VAR_LIST4; \
13199 type_di->di_tv.v_lock = 0; \
13200 type_di->di_tv.vval.v_list = (list_T *) msgpack_type_lists[type]; \
13201 type_di->di_tv.vval.v_list->lv_refcount++; \
13202 dict_add(dict, type_di); \
13203 dictitem_T *const val_di = dictitem_alloc((char_u *) "_VAL"); \
13204 val_di->di_tv = val; \
13205 dict_add(dict, val_di); \
13206 tv->v_type = VAR_DICT5; \
13207 dict->dv_refcount++; \
13208 tv->vval.v_dict = dict; \
13209 } while (0)
13210 switch (mobj.type) {
13211 case MSGPACK_OBJECT_NIL: {
13212 INIT_SPECIAL_DICT(rettv, kMPNil, ((typval_T) {
13213 .v_type = VAR_NUMBER1,
13214 .v_lock = 0,
13215 .vval = { .v_number = 0 },
13216 }));
13217 break;
13218 }
13219 case MSGPACK_OBJECT_BOOLEAN: {
13220 INIT_SPECIAL_DICT(rettv, kMPBoolean,
13221 ((typval_T) {
13222 .v_type = VAR_NUMBER1,
13223 .v_lock = 0,
13224 .vval = {
13225 .v_number = (varnumber_T) mobj.via.boolean,
13226 },
13227 }));
13228 break;
13229 }
13230 case MSGPACK_OBJECT_POSITIVE_INTEGER: {
13231 if (mobj.via.u64 <= VARNUMBER_MAX2147483647) {
13232 *rettv = (typval_T) {
13233 .v_type = VAR_NUMBER1,
13234 .v_lock = 0,
13235 .vval = { .v_number = (varnumber_T) mobj.via.u64 },
13236 };
13237 } else {
13238 list_T *const list = list_alloc();
13239 list->lv_refcount++;
13240 INIT_SPECIAL_DICT(rettv, kMPInteger,
13241 ((typval_T) {
13242 .v_type = VAR_LIST4,
13243 .v_lock = 0,
13244 .vval = { .v_list = list },
13245 }));
13246 uint64_t n = mobj.via.u64;
13247 list_append_number(list, 1);
13248 list_append_number(list, (varnumber_T) ((n >> 62) & 0x3));
13249 list_append_number(list, (varnumber_T) ((n >> 31) & 0x7FFFFFFF));
13250 list_append_number(list, (varnumber_T) (n & 0x7FFFFFFF));
13251 }
13252 break;
13253 }
13254 case MSGPACK_OBJECT_NEGATIVE_INTEGER: {
13255 if (mobj.via.i64 >= VARNUMBER_MIN(-2147483647 -1)) {
13256 *rettv = (typval_T) {
13257 .v_type = VAR_NUMBER1,
13258 .v_lock = 0,
13259 .vval = { .v_number = (varnumber_T) mobj.via.i64 },
13260 };
13261 } else {
13262 list_T *const list = list_alloc();
13263 list->lv_refcount++;
13264 INIT_SPECIAL_DICT(rettv, kMPInteger,
13265 ((typval_T) {
13266 .v_type = VAR_LIST4,
13267 .v_lock = 0,
13268 .vval = { .v_list = list },
13269 }));
13270 uint64_t n = -((uint64_t) mobj.via.i64);
13271 list_append_number(list, -1);
13272 list_append_number(list, (varnumber_T) ((n >> 62) & 0x3));
13273 list_append_number(list, (varnumber_T) ((n >> 31) & 0x7FFFFFFF));
13274 list_append_number(list, (varnumber_T) (n & 0x7FFFFFFF));
13275 }
13276 break;
13277 }
13278 case MSGPACK_OBJECT_FLOAT: {
13279 *rettv = (typval_T) {
13280 .v_type = VAR_FLOAT6,
13281 .v_lock = 0,
13282 .vval = { .v_float = mobj.via.f64 },
13283 };
13284 break;
13285 }
13286 case MSGPACK_OBJECT_STR: {
13287 list_T *const list = list_alloc();
13288 list->lv_refcount++;
13289 INIT_SPECIAL_DICT(rettv, kMPString,
13290 ((typval_T) {
13291 .v_type = VAR_LIST4,
13292 .v_lock = 0,
13293 .vval = { .v_list = list },
13294 }));
13295 if (msgpack_list_write((void *) list, mobj.via.str.ptr, mobj.via.str.size)
13296 == -1) {
13297 return FAIL0;
13298 }
13299 break;
13300 }
13301 case MSGPACK_OBJECT_BIN: {
13302 if (memchr(mobj.via.bin.ptr, NUL'\000', mobj.via.bin.size) == NULL((void*)0)) {
13303 *rettv = (typval_T) {
13304 .v_type = VAR_STRING2,
13305 .v_lock = 0,
13306 .vval = { .v_string = xmemdupz(mobj.via.bin.ptr, mobj.via.bin.size) },
13307 };
13308 break;
13309 }
13310 list_T *const list = list_alloc();
13311 list->lv_refcount++;
13312 INIT_SPECIAL_DICT(rettv, kMPBinary,
13313 ((typval_T) {
13314 .v_type = VAR_LIST4,
13315 .v_lock = 0,
13316 .vval = { .v_list = list },
13317 }));
13318 if (msgpack_list_write((void *) list, mobj.via.bin.ptr, mobj.via.bin.size)
13319 == -1) {
13320 return FAIL0;
13321 }
13322 break;
13323 }
13324 case MSGPACK_OBJECT_ARRAY: {
13325 list_T *const list = list_alloc();
13326 list->lv_refcount++;
13327 *rettv = (typval_T) {
13328 .v_type = VAR_LIST4,
13329 .v_lock = 0,
13330 .vval = { .v_list = list },
13331 };
13332 for (size_t i = 0; i < mobj.via.array.size; i++) {
13333 listitem_T *const li = listitem_alloc();
13334 li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0;
13335 list_append(list, li);
13336 if (msgpack_to_vim(mobj.via.array.ptr[i], &li->li_tv) == FAIL0) {
13337 return FAIL0;
13338 }
13339 }
13340 break;
13341 }
13342 case MSGPACK_OBJECT_MAP: {
13343 for (size_t i = 0; i < mobj.via.map.size; i++) {
13344 if (mobj.via.map.ptr[i].key.type != MSGPACK_OBJECT_STR
13345 || mobj.via.map.ptr[i].key.via.str.size == 0
13346 || memchr(mobj.via.map.ptr[i].key.via.str.ptr, NUL'\000',
13347 mobj.via.map.ptr[i].key.via.str.size) != NULL((void*)0)) {
13348 goto msgpack_to_vim_generic_map;
13349 }
13350 }
13351 dict_T *const dict = dict_alloc();
13352 dict->dv_refcount++;
13353 *rettv = (typval_T) {
13354 .v_type = VAR_DICT5,
13355 .v_lock = 0,
13356 .vval = { .v_dict = dict },
13357 };
13358 for (size_t i = 0; i < mobj.via.map.size; i++) {
13359 dictitem_T *const di = xmallocz(offsetof(dictitem_T, di_key)__builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T, di_key)
13360 + mobj.via.map.ptr[i].key.via.str.size);
13361 memcpy(&di->di_key[0], mobj.via.map.ptr[i].key.via.str.ptr,
13362 mobj.via.map.ptr[i].key.via.str.size);
13363 di->di_tv.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0;
13364 if (dict_add(dict, di) == FAIL0) {
13365 // Duplicate key: fallback to generic map
13366 clear_tv(rettv);
13367 xfree(di);
13368 goto msgpack_to_vim_generic_map;
13369 }
13370 if (msgpack_to_vim(mobj.via.map.ptr[i].val, &di->di_tv) == FAIL0) {
13371 return FAIL0;
13372 }
13373 }
13374 break;
13375msgpack_to_vim_generic_map: {}
13376 list_T *const list = list_alloc();
13377 list->lv_refcount++;
13378 INIT_SPECIAL_DICT(rettv, kMPMap,
13379 ((typval_T) {
13380 .v_type = VAR_LIST4,
13381 .v_lock = 0,
13382 .vval = { .v_list = list },
13383 }));
13384 for (size_t i = 0; i < mobj.via.map.size; i++) {
13385 list_T *const kv_pair = list_alloc();
13386 list_append_list(list, kv_pair);
13387 listitem_T *const key_li = listitem_alloc();
13388 key_li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0;
13389 list_append(kv_pair, key_li);
13390 listitem_T *const val_li = listitem_alloc();
13391 val_li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0;
13392 list_append(kv_pair, val_li);
13393 if (msgpack_to_vim(mobj.via.map.ptr[i].key, &key_li->li_tv) == FAIL0) {
13394 return FAIL0;
13395 }
13396 if (msgpack_to_vim(mobj.via.map.ptr[i].val, &val_li->li_tv) == FAIL0) {
13397 return FAIL0;
13398 }
13399 }
13400 break;
13401 }
13402 case MSGPACK_OBJECT_EXT: {
13403 list_T *const list = list_alloc();
13404 list->lv_refcount++;
13405 list_append_number(list, mobj.via.ext.type);
13406 list_T *const ext_val_list = list_alloc();
13407 list_append_list(list, ext_val_list);
13408 INIT_SPECIAL_DICT(rettv, kMPExt,
13409 ((typval_T) {
13410 .v_type = VAR_LIST4,
13411 .v_lock = 0,
13412 .vval = { .v_list = list },
13413 }));
13414 if (msgpack_list_write((void *) ext_val_list, mobj.via.ext.ptr,
13415 mobj.via.ext.size) == -1) {
13416 return FAIL0;
13417 }
13418 break;
13419 }
13420 }
13421#undef INIT_SPECIAL_DICT
13422 return OK1;
13423}
13424
13425/// "msgpackparse" function
13426static void f_msgpackparse(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13427 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
13428{
13429 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_LIST4) {
13430 EMSG2(_(e_listarg), "msgpackparse()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listarg))), (char_u *)("msgpackparse()"
));
13431 return;
13432 }
13433 list_T *ret_list = rettv_list_alloc(rettv);
13434 const list_T *list = argvars[0].vval.v_list;
13435 if (list == NULL((void*)0) || list->lv_first == NULL((void*)0)) {
13436 return;
13437 }
13438 if (list->lv_first->li_tv.v_type != VAR_STRING2) {
13439 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), "List item is not a string")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)("List item is not a string"
));
13440 return;
13441 }
13442 ListReaderState lrstate = init_lrstate(list);
13443 msgpack_unpacker *const unpacker = msgpack_unpacker_new(IOSIZE(1024+1));
13444 if (unpacker == NULL((void*)0)) {
13445 EMSG(_(e_outofmem))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_outofmem))));
13446 return;
13447 }
13448 msgpack_unpacked unpacked;
13449 msgpack_unpacked_init(&unpacked);
13450 do {
13451 if (!msgpack_unpacker_reserve_buffer(unpacker, IOSIZE(1024+1))) {
13452 EMSG(_(e_outofmem))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_outofmem))));
13453 goto f_msgpackparse_exit;
13454 }
13455 size_t read_bytes;
13456 const int rlret = read_from_list(
13457 &lrstate, msgpack_unpacker_buffer(unpacker), IOSIZE(1024+1), &read_bytes);
13458 if (rlret == FAIL0) {
13459 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), "List item is not a string")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)("List item is not a string"
));
13460 goto f_msgpackparse_exit;
13461 }
13462 msgpack_unpacker_buffer_consumed(unpacker, read_bytes);
13463 if (read_bytes == 0) {
13464 break;
13465 }
13466 while (unpacker->off < unpacker->used) {
13467 const msgpack_unpack_return result = msgpack_unpacker_next(unpacker,
13468 &unpacked);
13469 if (result == MSGPACK_UNPACK_PARSE_ERROR) {
13470 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), "Failed to parse msgpack string")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)("Failed to parse msgpack string"
));
13471 goto f_msgpackparse_exit;
13472 }
13473 if (result == MSGPACK_UNPACK_NOMEM_ERROR) {
13474 EMSG(_(e_outofmem))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_outofmem))));
13475 goto f_msgpackparse_exit;
13476 }
13477 if (result == MSGPACK_UNPACK_SUCCESS) {
13478 listitem_T *li = listitem_alloc();
13479 li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0;
13480 list_append(ret_list, li);
13481 if (msgpack_to_vim(unpacked.data, &li->li_tv) == FAIL0) {
13482 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), "Failed to convert msgpack string")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)("Failed to convert msgpack string"
));
13483 goto f_msgpackparse_exit;
13484 }
13485 }
13486 if (result == MSGPACK_UNPACK_CONTINUE) {
13487 if (rlret == OK1) {
13488 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), "Incomplete msgpack string")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)("Incomplete msgpack string"
));
13489 }
13490 break;
13491 }
13492 }
13493 if (rlret == OK1) {
13494 break;
13495 }
13496 } while (true1);
13497
13498f_msgpackparse_exit:
13499 msgpack_unpacked_destroy(&unpacked);
13500 msgpack_unpacker_free(unpacker);
13501 return;
13502}
13503
13504/*
13505 * "nextnonblank()" function
13506 */
13507static void f_nextnonblank(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13508{
13509 linenr_T lnum;
13510
13511 for (lnum = get_tv_lnum(argvars);; ++lnum) {
13512 if (lnum < 0 || lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
13513 lnum = 0;
13514 break;
13515 }
13516 if (*skipwhite(ml_get(lnum)) != NUL'\000')
13517 break;
13518 }
13519 rettv->vval.v_number = lnum;
13520}
13521
13522/*
13523 * "nr2char()" function
13524 */
13525static void f_nr2char(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13526{
13527 char_u buf[NUMBUFLEN65];
13528
13529 if (has_mbyte) {
13530 int utf8 = 0;
13531
13532 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0)
13533 utf8 = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[1], NULL((void*)0));
13534 if (utf8)
13535 buf[(*utf_char2bytes)((int)get_tv_number(&argvars[0]), buf)] = NUL'\000';
13536 else
13537 buf[(*mb_char2bytes)((int)get_tv_number(&argvars[0]), buf)] = NUL'\000';
13538 } else {
13539 buf[0] = (char_u)get_tv_number(&argvars[0]);
13540 buf[1] = NUL'\000';
13541 }
13542 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
13543 rettv->vval.v_string = vim_strsave(buf);
13544}
13545
13546/*
13547 * "or(expr, expr)" function
13548 */
13549static void f_or(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13550{
13551 rettv->vval.v_number = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0))
13552 | get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[1], NULL((void*)0));
13553}
13554
13555/*
13556 * "pathshorten()" function
13557 */
13558static void f_pathshorten(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13559{
13560 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
13561 rettv->vval.v_string = get_tv_string_chk(&argvars[0]);
13562 if (!rettv->vval.v_string) {
13563 return;
13564 }
13565 rettv->vval.v_string = shorten_dir(vim_strsave(rettv->vval.v_string));
13566}
13567
13568/*
13569 * "pow()" function
13570 */
13571static void f_pow(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13572{
13573 float_T fx, fy;
13574
13575 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT6;
13576 if (get_float_arg(argvars, &fx) == OK1
13577 && get_float_arg(&argvars[1], &fy) == OK1)
13578 rettv->vval.v_float = pow(fx, fy);
13579 else
13580 rettv->vval.v_float = 0.0;
13581}
13582
13583/*
13584 * "prevnonblank()" function
13585 */
13586static void f_prevnonblank(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13587{
13588 linenr_T lnum;
13589
13590 lnum = get_tv_lnum(argvars);
13591 if (lnum < 1 || lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
13592 lnum = 0;
13593 else
13594 while (lnum >= 1 && *skipwhite(ml_get(lnum)) == NUL'\000')
13595 --lnum;
13596 rettv->vval.v_number = lnum;
13597}
13598
13599/* This dummy va_list is here because:
13600 * - passing a NULL pointer doesn't work when va_list isn't a pointer
13601 * - locally in the function results in a "used before set" warning
13602 * - using va_start() to initialize it gives "function with fixed args" error */
13603static va_list ap;
13604
13605/*
13606 * "printf()" function
13607 */
13608static void f_printf(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13609{
13610 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
13611 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
13612 {
13613 char_u buf[NUMBUFLEN65];
13614 int len;
13615 int saved_did_emsg = did_emsg;
13616 char *fmt;
13617
13618 /* Get the required length, allocate the buffer and do it for real. */
13619 did_emsg = FALSE0;
13620 fmt = (char *)get_tv_string_buf(&argvars[0], buf);
13621 len = vim_vsnprintf(NULL((void*)0), 0, fmt, ap, argvars + 1);
13622 if (!did_emsg) {
13623 char *s = xmalloc(len + 1);
13624 rettv->vval.v_string = (char_u *)s;
13625 (void)vim_vsnprintf(s, len + 1, fmt, ap, argvars + 1);
13626 }
13627 did_emsg |= saved_did_emsg;
13628 }
13629}
13630
13631/*
13632 * "pumvisible()" function
13633 */
13634static void f_pumvisible(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13635{
13636 if (pum_visible())
13637 rettv->vval.v_number = 1;
13638}
13639
13640/*
13641 * "pyeval()" function
13642 */
13643static void f_pyeval(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13644{
13645 script_host_eval("python", argvars, rettv);
13646}
13647
13648/*
13649 * "py3eval()" function
13650 */
13651static void f_py3eval(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13652{
13653 script_host_eval("python3", argvars, rettv);
13654}
13655
13656/*
13657 * "range()" function
13658 */
13659static void f_range(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13660{
13661 long start;
13662 long end;
13663 long stride = 1;
13664 long i;
13665 int error = FALSE0;
13666
13667 start = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[0], &error);
13668 if (argvars[1].v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
13669 end = start - 1;
13670 start = 0;
13671 } else {
13672 end = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[1], &error);
13673 if (argvars[2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0)
13674 stride = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[2], &error);
13675 }
13676
13677 if (error)
13678 return; /* type error; errmsg already given */
13679 if (stride == 0)
13680 EMSG(_("E726: Stride is zero"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E726: Stride is zero"))));
13681 else if (stride > 0 ? end + 1 < start : end - 1 > start)
13682 EMSG(_("E727: Start past end"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E727: Start past end"))));
13683 else {
13684 rettv_list_alloc(rettv);
13685 for (i = start; stride > 0 ? i <= end : i >= end; i += stride) {
13686 list_append_number(rettv->vval.v_list, (varnumber_T)i);
13687 }
13688 }
13689}
13690
13691/*
13692 * "readfile()" function
13693 */
13694static void f_readfile(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13695{
13696 int binary = FALSE0;
13697 char_u *fname;
13698 FILE *fd;
13699 char_u buf[(IOSIZE(1024+1)/256)*256]; /* rounded to avoid odd + 1 */
13700 int io_size = sizeof(buf);
13701 int readlen; /* size of last fread() */
13702 char_u *prev = NULL((void*)0); /* previously read bytes, if any */
13703 long prevlen = 0; /* length of data in prev */
13704 long prevsize = 0; /* size of prev buffer */
13705 long maxline = MAXLNUM0x7fffffff;
13706 long cnt = 0;
13707 char_u *p; /* position in buf */
13708 char_u *start; /* start of current line */
13709
13710 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
13711 if (STRCMP(get_tv_string(&argvars[1]), "b")strcmp((char *)(get_tv_string(&argvars[1])), (char *)("b"
)) == 0)
13712 binary = TRUE1;
13713 if (argvars[2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0)
13714 maxline = get_tv_number(&argvars[2]);
13715 }
13716
13717 rettv_list_alloc(rettv);
13718
13719 /* Always open the file in binary mode, library functions have a mind of
13720 * their own about CR-LF conversion. */
13721 fname = get_tv_string(&argvars[0]);
13722 if (*fname == NUL'\000' || (fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, READBIN)fopen(((char *)fname), ("rb"))) == NULL((void*)0)) {
13723 EMSG2(_(e_notopen), *fname == NUL ? (char_u *)_("<empty>") : fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notopen))), (char_u *)(*fname
== '\000' ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)("<empty>")) : fname
));
13724 return;
13725 }
13726
13727 while (cnt < maxline || maxline < 0) {
13728 readlen = (int)fread(buf, 1, io_size, fd);
13729
13730 /* This for loop processes what was read, but is also entered at end
13731 * of file so that either:
13732 * - an incomplete line gets written
13733 * - a "binary" file gets an empty line at the end if it ends in a
13734 * newline. */
13735 for (p = buf, start = buf;
13736 p < buf + readlen || (readlen <= 0 && (prevlen > 0 || binary));
13737 ++p) {
13738 if (*p == '\n' || readlen <= 0) {
13739 listitem_T *li;
13740 char_u *s = NULL((void*)0);
13741 size_t len = p - start;
13742
13743 /* Finished a line. Remove CRs before NL. */
13744 if (readlen > 0 && !binary) {
13745 while (len > 0 && start[len - 1] == '\r')
13746 --len;
13747 /* removal may cross back to the "prev" string */
13748 if (len == 0)
13749 while (prevlen > 0 && prev[prevlen - 1] == '\r')
13750 --prevlen;
13751 }
13752 if (prevlen == 0) {
13753 assert(len < INT_MAX)((len < 2147483647) ? (void) (0) : __assert_fail ("len < 2147483647"
, "/home/travis/build/neovim/bot-ci/build/neovim/src/nvim/eval.c"
, 13753, __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
13754 s = vim_strnsave(start, (int)len);
13755 } else {
13756 /* Change "prev" buffer to be the right size. This way
13757 * the bytes are only copied once, and very long lines are
13758 * allocated only once. */
13759 s = xrealloc(prev, prevlen + len + 1);
13760 memcpy(s + prevlen, start, len);
13761 s[prevlen + len] = NUL'\000';
13762 prev = NULL((void*)0); /* the list will own the string */
13763 prevlen = prevsize = 0;
13764 }
13765
13766 li = listitem_alloc();
13767 li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
13768 li->li_tv.v_lock = 0;
13769 li->li_tv.vval.v_string = s;
13770 list_append(rettv->vval.v_list, li);
13771
13772 start = p + 1; /* step over newline */
13773 if ((++cnt >= maxline && maxline >= 0) || readlen <= 0)
13774 break;
13775 } else if (*p == NUL'\000')
13776 *p = '\n';
13777 /* Check for utf8 "bom"; U+FEFF is encoded as EF BB BF. Do this
13778 * when finding the BF and check the previous two bytes. */
13779 else if (*p == 0xbf && enc_utf8 && !binary) {
13780 /* Find the two bytes before the 0xbf. If p is at buf, or buf
13781 * + 1, these may be in the "prev" string. */
13782 char_u back1 = p >= buf + 1 ? p[-1]
13783 : prevlen >= 1 ? prev[prevlen - 1] : NUL'\000';
13784 char_u back2 = p >= buf + 2 ? p[-2]
13785 : p == buf + 1 && prevlen >= 1 ? prev[prevlen - 1]
13786 : prevlen >= 2 ? prev[prevlen - 2] : NUL'\000';
13787
13788 if (back2 == 0xef && back1 == 0xbb) {
13789 char_u *dest = p - 2;
13790
13791 /* Usually a BOM is at the beginning of a file, and so at
13792 * the beginning of a line; then we can just step over it.
13793 */
13794 if (start == dest)
13795 start = p + 1;
13796 else {
13797 /* have to shuffle buf to close gap */
13798 int adjust_prevlen = 0;
13799
13800 if (dest < buf) {
13801 adjust_prevlen = (int)(buf - dest); /* must be 1 or 2 */
13802 dest = buf;
13803 }
13804 if (readlen > p - buf + 1)
13805 memmove(dest, p + 1, readlen - (p - buf) - 1);
13806 readlen -= 3 - adjust_prevlen;
13807 prevlen -= adjust_prevlen;
13808 p = dest - 1;
13809 }
13810 }
13811 }
13812 } /* for */
13813
13814 if ((cnt >= maxline && maxline >= 0) || readlen <= 0)
13815 break;
13816 if (start < p) {
13817 /* There's part of a line in buf, store it in "prev". */
13818 if (p - start + prevlen >= prevsize) {
13819
13820 /* A common use case is ordinary text files and "prev" gets a
13821 * fragment of a line, so the first allocation is made
13822 * small, to avoid repeatedly 'allocing' large and
13823 * 'reallocing' small. */
13824 if (prevsize == 0)
13825 prevsize = (long)(p - start);
13826 else {
13827 long grow50pc = (prevsize * 3) / 2;
13828 long growmin = (long)((p - start) * 2 + prevlen);
13829 prevsize = grow50pc > growmin ? grow50pc : growmin;
13830 }
13831 prev = xrealloc(prev, prevsize);
13832 }
13833 /* Add the line part to end of "prev". */
13834 memmove(prev + prevlen, start, p - start);
13835 prevlen += (long)(p - start);
13836 }
13837 } /* while */
13838
13839 /*
13840 * For a negative line count use only the lines at the end of the file,
13841 * free the rest.
13842 */
13843 if (maxline < 0)
13844 while (cnt > -maxline) {
13845 listitem_remove(rettv->vval.v_list, rettv->vval.v_list->lv_first);
13846 --cnt;
13847 }
13848
13849 xfree(prev);
13850 fclose(fd);
13851}
13852
13853
13854/// list2proftime - convert a List to proftime_T
13855///
13856/// @param arg The input list, must be of type VAR_LIST and have
13857/// exactly 2 items
13858/// @param[out] tm The proftime_T representation of `arg`
13859/// @return OK In case of success, FAIL in case of error
13860static int list2proftime(typval_T *arg, proftime_T *tm) FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
13861{
13862 if (arg->v_type != VAR_LIST4
13863 || arg->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0)
13864 || arg->vval.v_list->lv_len != 2) {
13865 return FAIL0;
13866 }
13867
13868 int error = false0;
13869 varnumber_T n1 = list_find_nr(arg->vval.v_list, 0L, &error);
13870 varnumber_T n2 = list_find_nr(arg->vval.v_list, 1L, &error);
13871 if (error) {
13872 return FAIL0;
13873 }
13874
13875 // in f_reltime() we split up the 64-bit proftime_T into two 32-bit
13876 // values, now we combine them again.
13877 union {
13878 struct { varnumber_T low, high; } split;
13879 proftime_T prof;
13880 } u = { .split.high = n1, .split.low = n2 };
13881
13882 *tm = u.prof;
13883
13884 return OK1;
13885}
13886
13887/// f_reltime - return an item that represents a time value
13888///
13889/// @param[out] rettv Without an argument it returns the current time. With
13890/// one argument it returns the time passed since the argument.
13891/// With two arguments it returns the time passed between
13892/// the two arguments.
13893static void f_reltime(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv) FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
13894{
13895 proftime_T res;
13896 proftime_T start;
13897
13898 if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
13899 // no arguments: get current time.
13900 res = profile_start();
13901 } else if (argvars[1].v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
13902 if (list2proftime(&argvars[0], &res) == FAIL0) {
13903 return;
13904 }
13905 res = profile_end(res);
13906 } else {
13907 // two arguments: compute the difference.
13908 if (list2proftime(&argvars[0], &start) == FAIL0
13909 || list2proftime(&argvars[1], &res) == FAIL0) {
13910 return;
13911 }
13912 res = profile_sub(res, start);
13913 }
13914
13915 // we have to store the 64-bit proftime_T inside of a list of int's
13916 // (varnumber_T is defined as int). For all our supported platforms, int's
13917 // are at least 32-bits wide. So we'll use two 32-bit values to store it.
13918 union {
13919 struct { varnumber_T low, high; } split;
13920 proftime_T prof;
13921 } u = { .prof = res };
13922
13923 // statically assert that the union type conv will provide the correct
13924 // results, if varnumber_T or proftime_T change, the union cast will need
13925 // to be revised.
13926 STATIC_ASSERT(sizeof(u.prof) == sizeof(u) && sizeof(u.split) == sizeof(u),clang diagnostic push clang diagnostic ignored "-Wc11-extensions"
_Static_assert(sizeof(u.prof) == sizeof(u) && sizeof
(u.split) == sizeof(u), "type punning will produce incorrect results on this platform"
); clang diagnostic pop
13927 "type punning will produce incorrect results on this platform")clang diagnostic push clang diagnostic ignored "-Wc11-extensions"
_Static_assert(sizeof(u.prof) == sizeof(u) && sizeof
(u.split) == sizeof(u), "type punning will produce incorrect results on this platform"
); clang diagnostic pop ;
13928
13929 rettv_list_alloc(rettv);
13930 list_append_number(rettv->vval.v_list, u.split.high);
13931 list_append_number(rettv->vval.v_list, u.split.low);
13932}
13933
13934/// f_reltimestr - return a string that represents the value of {time}
13935///
13936/// @return The string representation of the argument, the format is the
13937/// number of seconds followed by a dot, followed by the number
13938/// of microseconds.
13939static void f_reltimestr(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13940 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
13941{
13942 proftime_T tm;
13943
13944 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
13945 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
13946 if (list2proftime(&argvars[0], &tm) == OK1) {
13947 rettv->vval.v_string = (char_u *) xstrdup(profile_msg(tm));
13948 }
13949}
13950
13951/*
13952 * "remove()" function
13953 */
13954static void f_remove(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
13955{
13956 list_T *l;
13957 listitem_T *item, *item2;
13958 listitem_T *li;
13959 long idx;
13960 long end;
13961 char_u *key;
13962 dict_T *d;
13963 dictitem_T *di;
13964 char_u *arg_errmsg = (char_u *)N_("remove() argument")"remove() argument";
13965
13966 if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_DICT5) {
13967 if (argvars[2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
13968 EMSG2(_(e_toomanyarg), "remove()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_toomanyarg))), (char_u *)
("remove()"));
13969 } else if ((d = argvars[0].vval.v_dict) != NULL((void*)0)
13970 && !tv_check_lock(d->dv_lock, arg_errmsg, true1)) {
13971 key = get_tv_string_chk(&argvars[1]);
13972 if (key != NULL((void*)0)) {
13973 di = dict_find(d, key, -1);
13974 if (di == NULL((void*)0)) {
13975 EMSG2(_(e_dictkey), key)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictkey))), (char_u *)(key
));
13976 } else if (!var_check_fixed(di->di_flags, arg_errmsg, true1)
13977 && !var_check_ro(di->di_flags, arg_errmsg, true1)) {
13978 *rettv = di->di_tv;
13979 init_tv(&di->di_tv);
13980 dictitem_remove(d, di);
13981 if (is_watched(d)) {
13982 dictwatcher_notify(d, (char *)key, NULL((void*)0), rettv);
13983 }
13984 }
13985 }
13986 }
13987 } else if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_LIST4) {
13988 EMSG2(_(e_listdictarg), "remove()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listdictarg))), (char_u *
)("remove()"));
13989 } else if ((l = argvars[0].vval.v_list) != NULL((void*)0)
13990 && !tv_check_lock(l->lv_lock, arg_errmsg, true1)) {
13991 int error = (int)false0;
13992
13993 idx = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[1], &error);
13994 if (error)
13995 ; /* type error: do nothing, errmsg already given */
13996 else if ((item = list_find(l, idx)) == NULL((void*)0))
13997 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), idx)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t)(idx
));
13998 else {
13999 if (argvars[2].v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
14000 // Remove one item, return its value.
14001 vim_list_remove(l, item, item);
14002 *rettv = item->li_tv;
14003 xfree(item);
14004 } else {
14005 /* Remove range of items, return list with values. */
14006 end = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[2], &error);
14007 if (error)
14008 ; /* type error: do nothing */
14009 else if ((item2 = list_find(l, end)) == NULL((void*)0))
14010 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), end)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t)(end
));
14011 else {
14012 int cnt = 0;
14013
14014 for (li = item; li != NULL((void*)0); li = li->li_next) {
14015 ++cnt;
14016 if (li == item2)
14017 break;
14018 }
14019 if (li == NULL((void*)0)) /* didn't find "item2" after "item" */
14020 EMSG(_(e_invrange))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invrange))));
14021 else {
14022 vim_list_remove(l, item, item2);
14023 l = rettv_list_alloc(rettv);
14024 l->lv_first = item;
14025 l->lv_last = item2;
14026 item->li_prev = NULL((void*)0);
14027 item2->li_next = NULL((void*)0);
14028 l->lv_len = cnt;
14029 }
14030 }
14031 }
14032 }
14033 }
14034}
14035
14036/*
14037 * "rename({from}, {to})" function
14038 */
14039static void f_rename(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14040{
14041 char_u buf[NUMBUFLEN65];
14042
14043 if (check_restricted() || check_secure())
14044 rettv->vval.v_number = -1;
14045 else
14046 rettv->vval.v_number = vim_rename(get_tv_string(&argvars[0]),
14047 get_tv_string_buf(&argvars[1], buf));
14048}
14049
14050/*
14051 * "repeat()" function
14052 */
14053static void f_repeat(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14054{
14055 char_u *p;
14056 int n;
14057
14058 n = get_tv_number(&argvars[1]);
14059 if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_LIST4) {
14060 rettv_list_alloc(rettv);
14061 if (argvars[0].vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
14062 while (n-- > 0) {
14063 list_extend(rettv->vval.v_list, argvars[0].vval.v_list, NULL((void*)0));
14064 }
14065 }
14066 } else {
14067 p = get_tv_string(&argvars[0]);
14068 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
14069 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
14070
14071 int slen = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
14072 int len = slen * n;
14073 if (len <= 0)
14074 return;
14075
14076 char_u *r = xmallocz(len);
14077 for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
14078 memmove(r + i * slen, p, (size_t)slen);
14079
14080 rettv->vval.v_string = r;
14081 }
14082}
14083
14084/*
14085 * "resolve()" function
14086 */
14087static void f_resolve(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14088{
14089 char_u *p;
14090#ifdef HAVE_READLINK
14091 char_u *buf = NULL((void*)0);
14092#endif
14093
14094 p = get_tv_string(&argvars[0]);
14095#ifdef WIN32
14096 {
14097 char_u *v = NULL((void*)0);
14098
14099 v = mch_resolve_shortcut(p);
14100 if (v != NULL((void*)0))
14101 rettv->vval.v_string = v;
14102 else
14103 rettv->vval.v_string = vim_strsave(p);
14104 }
14105#else
14106# ifdef HAVE_READLINK
14107 {
14108 char_u *cpy;
14109 int len;
14110 char_u *remain = NULL((void*)0);
14111 char_u *q;
14112 int is_relative_to_current = FALSE0;
14113 int has_trailing_pathsep = FALSE0;
14114 int limit = 100;
14115
14116 p = vim_strsave(p);
14117
14118 if (p[0] == '.' && (vim_ispathsep(p[1])
14119 || (p[1] == '.' && (vim_ispathsep(p[2])))))
14120 is_relative_to_current = TRUE1;
14121
14122 len = STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
14123 if (len > 0 && after_pathsep((char *)p, (char *)p + len)) {
14124 has_trailing_pathsep = TRUE1;
14125 p[len - 1] = NUL'\000'; /* the trailing slash breaks readlink() */
14126 }
14127
14128 q = path_next_component(p);
14129 if (*q != NUL'\000') {
14130 /* Separate the first path component in "p", and keep the
14131 * remainder (beginning with the path separator). */
14132 remain = vim_strsave(q - 1);
14133 q[-1] = NUL'\000';
14134 }
14135
14136 buf = xmallocz(MAXPATHL4096);
14137
14138 for (;; ) {
14139 for (;; ) {
14140 len = readlink((char *)p, (char *)buf, MAXPATHL4096);
14141 if (len <= 0)
14142 break;
14143 buf[len] = NUL'\000';
14144
14145 if (limit-- == 0) {
14146 xfree(p);
14147 xfree(remain);
14148 EMSG(_("E655: Too many symbolic links (cycle?)"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E655: Too many symbolic links (cycle?)"
))));
14149 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
14150 goto fail;
14151 }
14152
14153 /* Ensure that the result will have a trailing path separator
14154 * if the argument has one. */
14155 if (remain == NULL((void*)0) && has_trailing_pathsep)
14156 add_pathsep((char *)buf);
14157
14158 /* Separate the first path component in the link value and
14159 * concatenate the remainders. */
14160 q = path_next_component(vim_ispathsep(*buf) ? buf + 1 : buf);
14161 if (*q != NUL'\000') {
14162 cpy = remain;
14163 remain = remain ?
14164 concat_str(q - 1, remain) : (char_u *) xstrdup((char *)q - 1);
14165 xfree(cpy);
14166 q[-1] = NUL'\000';
14167 }
14168
14169 q = path_tail(p);
14170 if (q > p && *q == NUL'\000') {
14171 /* Ignore trailing path separator. */
14172 q[-1] = NUL'\000';
14173 q = path_tail(p);
14174 }
14175 if (q > p && !path_is_absolute_path(buf)) {
14176 /* symlink is relative to directory of argument */
14177 cpy = xmalloc(STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) + STRLEN(buf)strlen((char *)(buf)) + 1);
14178 STRCPY(cpy, p)strcpy((char *)(cpy), (char *)(p));
14179 STRCPY(path_tail(cpy), buf)strcpy((char *)(path_tail(cpy)), (char *)(buf));
14180 xfree(p);
14181 p = cpy;
14182 } else {
14183 xfree(p);
14184 p = vim_strsave(buf);
14185 }
14186 }
14187
14188 if (remain == NULL((void*)0))
14189 break;
14190
14191 /* Append the first path component of "remain" to "p". */
14192 q = path_next_component(remain + 1);
14193 len = q - remain - (*q != NUL'\000');
14194 cpy = vim_strnsave(p, STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) + len);
14195 STRNCAT(cpy, remain, len)strncat((char *)(cpy), (char *)(remain), (size_t)(len));
14196 xfree(p);
14197 p = cpy;
14198
14199 /* Shorten "remain". */
14200 if (*q != NUL'\000')
14201 STRMOVE(remain, q - 1)memmove((remain), (q - 1), strlen((char *)(q - 1)) + 1);
14202 else {
14203 xfree(remain);
14204 remain = NULL((void*)0);
14205 }
14206 }
14207
14208 /* If the result is a relative path name, make it explicitly relative to
14209 * the current directory if and only if the argument had this form. */
14210 if (!vim_ispathsep(*p)) {
14211 if (is_relative_to_current
14212 && *p != NUL'\000'
14213 && !(p[0] == '.'
14214 && (p[1] == NUL'\000'
14215 || vim_ispathsep(p[1])
14216 || (p[1] == '.'
14217 && (p[2] == NUL'\000'
14218 || vim_ispathsep(p[2])))))) {
14219 /* Prepend "./". */
14220 cpy = concat_str((char_u *)"./", p);
14221 xfree(p);
14222 p = cpy;
14223 } else if (!is_relative_to_current) {
14224 /* Strip leading "./". */
14225 q = p;
14226 while (q[0] == '.' && vim_ispathsep(q[1]))
14227 q += 2;
14228 if (q > p)
14229 STRMOVE(p, p + 2)memmove((p), (p + 2), strlen((char *)(p + 2)) + 1);
14230 }
14231 }
14232
14233 /* Ensure that the result will have no trailing path separator
14234 * if the argument had none. But keep "/" or "//". */
14235 if (!has_trailing_pathsep) {
14236 q = p + STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
14237 if (after_pathsep((char *)p, (char *)q))
14238 *path_tail_with_sep(p) = NUL'\000';
14239 }
14240
14241 rettv->vval.v_string = p;
14242 }
14243# else
14244 rettv->vval.v_string = vim_strsave(p);
14245# endif
14246#endif
14247
14248 simplify_filename(rettv->vval.v_string);
14249
14250#ifdef HAVE_READLINK
14251fail:
14252 xfree(buf);
14253#endif
14254 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
14255}
14256
14257/*
14258 * "reverse({list})" function
14259 */
14260static void f_reverse(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14261{
14262 list_T *l;
14263 listitem_T *li, *ni;
14264
14265 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_LIST4) {
14266 EMSG2(_(e_listarg), "reverse()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listarg))), (char_u *)("reverse()"
));
14267 } else if ((l = argvars[0].vval.v_list) != NULL((void*)0)
14268 && !tv_check_lock(l->lv_lock,
14269 (char_u *)N_("reverse() argument")"reverse() argument", true1)) {
14270 li = l->lv_last;
14271 l->lv_first = l->lv_last = NULL((void*)0);
14272 l->lv_len = 0;
14273 while (li != NULL((void*)0)) {
14274 ni = li->li_prev;
14275 list_append(l, li);
14276 li = ni;
14277 }
14278 rettv->vval.v_list = l;
14279 rettv->v_type = VAR_LIST4;
14280 ++l->lv_refcount;
14281 l->lv_idx = l->lv_len - l->lv_idx - 1;
14282 }
14283}
14284
14285#define SP_NOMOVE0x01 0x01 /* don't move cursor */
14286#define SP_REPEAT0x02 0x02 /* repeat to find outer pair */
14287#define SP_RETCOUNT0x04 0x04 /* return matchcount */
14288#define SP_SETPCMARK0x08 0x08 /* set previous context mark */
14289#define SP_START0x10 0x10 /* accept match at start position */
14290#define SP_SUBPAT0x20 0x20 /* return nr of matching sub-pattern */
14291#define SP_END0x40 0x40 /* leave cursor at end of match */
14292
14293
14294/*
14295 * Get flags for a search function.
14296 * Possibly sets "p_ws".
14297 * Returns BACKWARD, FORWARD or zero (for an error).
14298 */
14299static int get_search_arg(typval_T *varp, int *flagsp)
14300{
14301 int dir = FORWARD1;
14302 char_u *flags;
14303 char_u nbuf[NUMBUFLEN65];
14304 int mask;
14305
14306 if (varp->v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
14307 flags = get_tv_string_buf_chk(varp, nbuf);
14308 if (flags == NULL((void*)0))
14309 return 0; /* type error; errmsg already given */
14310 while (*flags != NUL'\000') {
14311 switch (*flags) {
14312 case 'b': dir = BACKWARD(-1); break;
14313 case 'w': p_ws = true1; break;
14314 case 'W': p_ws = false0; break;
14315 default: mask = 0;
14316 if (flagsp != NULL((void*)0))
14317 switch (*flags) {
14318 case 'c': mask = SP_START0x10; break;
14319 case 'e': mask = SP_END0x40; break;
14320 case 'm': mask = SP_RETCOUNT0x04; break;
14321 case 'n': mask = SP_NOMOVE0x01; break;
14322 case 'p': mask = SP_SUBPAT0x20; break;
14323 case 'r': mask = SP_REPEAT0x02; break;
14324 case 's': mask = SP_SETPCMARK0x08; break;
14325 }
14326 if (mask == 0) {
14327 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), flags)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(flags
));
14328 dir = 0;
14329 } else
14330 *flagsp |= mask;
14331 }
14332 if (dir == 0)
14333 break;
14334 ++flags;
14335 }
14336 }
14337 return dir;
14338}
14339
14340/*
14341 * Shared by search() and searchpos() functions
14342 */
14343static int search_cmn(typval_T *argvars, pos_T *match_pos, int *flagsp)
14344{
14345 int flags;
14346 char_u *pat;
14347 pos_T pos;
14348 pos_T save_cursor;
14349 bool_Bool save_p_ws = p_ws;
14350 int dir;
14351 int retval = 0; /* default: FAIL */
14352 long lnum_stop = 0;
14353 proftime_T tm;
14354 long time_limit = 0;
14355 int options = SEARCH_KEEP0x400;
14356 int subpatnum;
14357
14358 pat = get_tv_string(&argvars[0]);
14359 dir = get_search_arg(&argvars[1], flagsp); /* may set p_ws */
14360 if (dir == 0)
14361 goto theend;
14362 flags = *flagsp;
14363 if (flags & SP_START0x10)
14364 options |= SEARCH_START0x100;
14365 if (flags & SP_END0x40)
14366 options |= SEARCH_END0x40;
14367
14368 /* Optional arguments: line number to stop searching and timeout. */
14369 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0 && argvars[2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
14370 lnum_stop = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[2], NULL((void*)0));
14371 if (lnum_stop < 0)
14372 goto theend;
14373 if (argvars[3].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
14374 time_limit = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[3], NULL((void*)0));
14375 if (time_limit < 0)
14376 goto theend;
14377 }
14378 }
14379
14380 /* Set the time limit, if there is one. */
14381 tm = profile_setlimit(time_limit);
14382
14383 /*
14384 * This function does not accept SP_REPEAT and SP_RETCOUNT flags.
14385 * Check to make sure only those flags are set.
14386 * Also, Only the SP_NOMOVE or the SP_SETPCMARK flag can be set. Both
14387 * flags cannot be set. Check for that condition also.
14388 */
14389 if (((flags & (SP_REPEAT0x02 | SP_RETCOUNT0x04)) != 0)
14390 || ((flags & SP_NOMOVE0x01) && (flags & SP_SETPCMARK0x08))) {
14391 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), get_tv_string(&argvars[1]))emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(get_tv_string
(&argvars[1])));
14392 goto theend;
14393 }
14394
14395 pos = save_cursor = curwin->w_cursor;
14396 subpatnum = searchit(curwin, curbuf, &pos, dir, pat, 1L,
14397 options, RE_SEARCH0, (linenr_T)lnum_stop, &tm);
14398 if (subpatnum != FAIL0) {
14399 if (flags & SP_SUBPAT0x20)
14400 retval = subpatnum;
14401 else
14402 retval = pos.lnum;
14403 if (flags & SP_SETPCMARK0x08)
14404 setpcmark();
14405 curwin->w_cursor = pos;
14406 if (match_pos != NULL((void*)0)) {
14407 /* Store the match cursor position */
14408 match_pos->lnum = pos.lnum;
14409 match_pos->col = pos.col + 1;
14410 }
14411 /* "/$" will put the cursor after the end of the line, may need to
14412 * correct that here */
14413 check_cursor();
14414 }
14415
14416 /* If 'n' flag is used: restore cursor position. */
14417 if (flags & SP_NOMOVE0x01)
14418 curwin->w_cursor = save_cursor;
14419 else
14420 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
14421theend:
14422 p_ws = save_p_ws;
14423
14424 return retval;
14425}
14426
14427/*
14428 * "round({float})" function
14429 */
14430static void f_round(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14431{
14432 float_op_wrapper(argvars, rettv, &round);
14433}
14434
14435// "rpcnotify()" function
14436static void f_rpcnotify(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14437{
14438 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
14439 rettv->vval.v_number = 0;
14440
14441 if (check_restricted() || check_secure()) {
14442 return;
14443 }
14444
14445 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_NUMBER1 || argvars[0].vval.v_number < 0) {
14446 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), "Channel id must be a positive integer")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)("Channel id must be a positive integer"
));
14447 return;
14448 }
14449
14450 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_STRING2) {
14451 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), "Event type must be a string")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)("Event type must be a string"
));
14452 return;
14453 }
14454
14455 Array args = ARRAY_DICT_INIT{.size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0)};
14456
14457 for (typval_T *tv = argvars + 2; tv->v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0; tv++) {
14458 ADD(args, vim_to_object(tv))do { if ((args).size == (args).capacity) { (args).capacity = (
args).capacity? (args).capacity<<1 : 8; (args).items = (
Object*)xrealloc((args).items, sizeof(Object) * (args).capacity
); } (args).items[(args).size++] = (vim_to_object(tv)); } while
(0);
14459 }
14460
14461 if (!channel_send_event((uint64_t)argvars[0].vval.v_number,
14462 (char *)get_tv_string(&argvars[1]),
14463 args)) {
14464 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), "Channel doesn't exist")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)("Channel doesn't exist"
));
14465 return;
14466 }
14467
14468 rettv->vval.v_number = 1;
14469}
14470
14471// "rpcrequest()" function
14472static void f_rpcrequest(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14473{
14474 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
14475 rettv->vval.v_number = 0;
14476 const int l_provider_call_nesting = provider_call_nesting;
14477
14478 if (check_restricted() || check_secure()) {
14479 return;
14480 }
14481
14482 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_NUMBER1 || argvars[0].vval.v_number <= 0) {
14483 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), "Channel id must be a positive integer")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)("Channel id must be a positive integer"
));
14484 return;
14485 }
14486
14487 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_STRING2) {
14488 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), "Method name must be a string")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)("Method name must be a string"
));
14489 return;
14490 }
14491
14492 Array args = ARRAY_DICT_INIT{.size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0)};
14493
14494 for (typval_T *tv = argvars + 2; tv->v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0; tv++) {
14495 ADD(args, vim_to_object(tv))do { if ((args).size == (args).capacity) { (args).capacity = (
args).capacity? (args).capacity<<1 : 8; (args).items = (
Object*)xrealloc((args).items, sizeof(Object) * (args).capacity
); } (args).items[(args).size++] = (vim_to_object(tv)); } while
(0);
14496 }
14497
14498 scid_T save_current_SID;
14499 uint8_t *save_sourcing_name, *save_autocmd_fname, *save_autocmd_match;
14500 linenr_T save_sourcing_lnum;
14501 int save_autocmd_fname_full, save_autocmd_bufnr;
14502 void *save_funccalp;
14503
14504 if (l_provider_call_nesting) {
14505 // If this is called from a provider function, restore the scope
14506 // information of the caller.
14507 save_current_SID = current_SID;
14508 save_sourcing_name = sourcing_name;
14509 save_sourcing_lnum = sourcing_lnum;
14510 save_autocmd_fname = autocmd_fname;
14511 save_autocmd_match = autocmd_match;
14512 save_autocmd_fname_full = autocmd_fname_full;
14513 save_autocmd_bufnr = autocmd_bufnr;
14514 save_funccalp = save_funccal();
14515 //
14516 current_SID = provider_caller_scope.SID;
14517 sourcing_name = provider_caller_scope.sourcing_name;
14518 sourcing_lnum = provider_caller_scope.sourcing_lnum;
14519 autocmd_fname = provider_caller_scope.autocmd_fname;
14520 autocmd_match = provider_caller_scope.autocmd_match;
14521 autocmd_fname_full = provider_caller_scope.autocmd_fname_full;
14522 autocmd_bufnr = provider_caller_scope.autocmd_bufnr;
14523 restore_funccal(provider_caller_scope.funccalp);
14524 }
14525
14526
14527 Error err = ERROR_INIT{ .set = 0 };
14528 Object result = channel_send_call((uint64_t)argvars[0].vval.v_number,
14529 (char *)get_tv_string(&argvars[1]),
14530 args,
14531 &err);
14532
14533 if (l_provider_call_nesting) {
14534 current_SID = save_current_SID;
14535 sourcing_name = save_sourcing_name;
14536 sourcing_lnum = save_sourcing_lnum;
14537 autocmd_fname = save_autocmd_fname;
14538 autocmd_match = save_autocmd_match;
14539 autocmd_fname_full = save_autocmd_fname_full;
14540 autocmd_bufnr = save_autocmd_bufnr;
14541 restore_funccal(save_funccalp);
14542 }
14543
14544 if (err.set) {
14545 vim_report_error(cstr_as_string(err.msg));
14546 goto end;
14547 }
14548
14549 if (!object_to_vim(result, rettv, &err)) {
14550 EMSG2(_("Error converting the call result: %s"), err.msg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("Error converting the call result: %s"
))), (char_u *)(err.msg));
14551 }
14552
14553end:
14554 api_free_object(result);
14555}
14556
14557// "rpcstart()" function
14558static void f_rpcstart(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14559{
14560 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
14561 rettv->vval.v_number = 0;
14562
14563 if (check_restricted() || check_secure()) {
14564 return;
14565 }
14566
14567 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_STRING2
14568 || (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_LIST4 && argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0)) {
14569 // Wrong argument types
14570 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
14571 return;
14572 }
14573
14574 list_T *args = NULL((void*)0);
14575 int argsl = 0;
14576 if (argvars[1].v_type == VAR_LIST4) {
14577 args = argvars[1].vval.v_list;
14578 argsl = args->lv_len;
14579 // Assert that all list items are strings
14580 for (listitem_T *arg = args->lv_first; arg != NULL((void*)0); arg = arg->li_next) {
14581 if (arg->li_tv.v_type != VAR_STRING2) {
14582 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
14583 return;
14584 }
14585 }
14586 }
14587
14588 if (argvars[0].vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0) || argvars[0].vval.v_string[0] == NUL'\000') {
14589 EMSG(_(e_api_spawn_failed))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_api_spawn_failed))));
14590 return;
14591 }
14592
14593 // Allocate extra memory for the argument vector and the NULL pointer
14594 int argvl = argsl + 2;
14595 char **argv = xmalloc(sizeof(char_u *) * argvl);
14596
14597 // Copy program name
14598 argv[0] = xstrdup((char *)argvars[0].vval.v_string);
14599
14600 int i = 1;
14601 // Copy arguments to the vector
14602 if (argsl > 0) {
14603 for (listitem_T *arg = args->lv_first; arg != NULL((void*)0); arg = arg->li_next) {
14604 argv[i++] = xstrdup((char *) get_tv_string(&arg->li_tv));
14605 }
14606 }
14607
14608 // The last item of argv must be NULL
14609 argv[i] = NULL((void*)0);
14610 uint64_t channel_id = channel_from_process(argv);
14611
14612 if (!channel_id) {
14613 EMSG(_(e_api_spawn_failed))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_api_spawn_failed))));
14614 }
14615
14616 rettv->vval.v_number = (varnumber_T)channel_id;
14617}
14618
14619// "rpcstop()" function
14620static void f_rpcstop(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14621{
14622 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
14623 rettv->vval.v_number = 0;
14624
14625 if (check_restricted() || check_secure()) {
14626 return;
14627 }
14628
14629 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_NUMBER1) {
14630 // Wrong argument types
14631 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
14632 return;
14633 }
14634
14635 rettv->vval.v_number = channel_close(argvars[0].vval.v_number);
14636}
14637
14638/*
14639 * "screenattr()" function
14640 */
14641static void f_screenattr(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14642{
14643 int row;
14644 int col;
14645 int c;
14646
14647 row = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0)) - 1;
14648 col = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[1], NULL((void*)0)) - 1;
14649 if (row < 0 || row >= screen_Rows
14650 || col < 0 || col >= screen_Columns)
14651 c = -1;
14652 else
14653 c = ScreenAttrs[LineOffset[row] + col];
14654 rettv->vval.v_number = c;
14655}
14656
14657/*
14658 * "screenchar()" function
14659 */
14660static void f_screenchar(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14661{
14662 int row;
14663 int col;
14664 int off;
14665 int c;
14666
14667 row = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0)) - 1;
14668 col = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[1], NULL((void*)0)) - 1;
14669 if (row < 0 || row >= screen_Rows
14670 || col < 0 || col >= screen_Columns)
14671 c = -1;
14672 else {
14673 off = LineOffset[row] + col;
14674 if (enc_utf8 && ScreenLinesUC[off] != 0)
14675 c = ScreenLinesUC[off];
14676 else
14677 c = ScreenLines[off];
14678 }
14679 rettv->vval.v_number = c;
14680}
14681
14682/*
14683 * "screencol()" function
14684 *
14685 * First column is 1 to be consistent with virtcol().
14686 */
14687static void f_screencol(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14688{
14689 rettv->vval.v_number = ui_current_col() + 1;
14690}
14691
14692/*
14693 * "screenrow()" function
14694 */
14695static void f_screenrow(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14696{
14697 rettv->vval.v_number = ui_current_row() + 1;
14698}
14699
14700/*
14701 * "search()" function
14702 */
14703static void f_search(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14704{
14705 int flags = 0;
14706
14707 rettv->vval.v_number = search_cmn(argvars, NULL((void*)0), &flags);
14708}
14709
14710/*
14711 * "searchdecl()" function
14712 */
14713static void f_searchdecl(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14714{
14715 int locally = 1;
14716 int thisblock = 0;
14717 int error = FALSE0;
14718
14719 rettv->vval.v_number = 1; /* default: FAIL */
14720
14721 char_u *name = get_tv_string_chk(&argvars[0]);
14722 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
14723 locally = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[1], &error) == 0;
14724 if (!error && argvars[2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0)
14725 thisblock = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[2], &error) != 0;
14726 }
14727 if (!error && name != NULL((void*)0))
14728 rettv->vval.v_number = find_decl(name, STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)), locally,
14729 thisblock, SEARCH_KEEP0x400) == FAIL0;
14730}
14731
14732/*
14733 * Used by searchpair() and searchpairpos()
14734 */
14735static int searchpair_cmn(typval_T *argvars, pos_T *match_pos)
14736{
14737 char_u *spat, *mpat, *epat;
14738 char_u *skip;
14739 bool_Bool save_p_ws = p_ws;
14740 int dir;
14741 int flags = 0;
14742 char_u nbuf1[NUMBUFLEN65];
14743 char_u nbuf2[NUMBUFLEN65];
14744 char_u nbuf3[NUMBUFLEN65];
14745 int retval = 0; /* default: FAIL */
14746 long lnum_stop = 0;
14747 long time_limit = 0;
14748
14749 /* Get the three pattern arguments: start, middle, end. */
14750 spat = get_tv_string_chk(&argvars[0]);
14751 mpat = get_tv_string_buf_chk(&argvars[1], nbuf1);
14752 epat = get_tv_string_buf_chk(&argvars[2], nbuf2);
14753 if (spat == NULL((void*)0) || mpat == NULL((void*)0) || epat == NULL((void*)0))
14754 goto theend; /* type error */
14755
14756 /* Handle the optional fourth argument: flags */
14757 dir = get_search_arg(&argvars[3], &flags); /* may set p_ws */
14758 if (dir == 0)
14759 goto theend;
14760
14761 /* Don't accept SP_END or SP_SUBPAT.
14762 * Only one of the SP_NOMOVE or SP_SETPCMARK flags can be set.
14763 */
14764 if ((flags & (SP_END0x40 | SP_SUBPAT0x20)) != 0
14765 || ((flags & SP_NOMOVE0x01) && (flags & SP_SETPCMARK0x08))) {
14766 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), get_tv_string(&argvars[3]))emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(get_tv_string
(&argvars[3])));
14767 goto theend;
14768 }
14769
14770 /* Using 'r' implies 'W', otherwise it doesn't work. */
14771 if (flags & SP_REPEAT0x02)
14772 p_ws = false0;
14773
14774 /* Optional fifth argument: skip expression */
14775 if (argvars[3].v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0
14776 || argvars[4].v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0)
14777 skip = (char_u *)"";
14778 else {
14779 skip = get_tv_string_buf_chk(&argvars[4], nbuf3);
14780 if (argvars[5].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
14781 lnum_stop = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[5], NULL((void*)0));
14782 if (lnum_stop < 0)
14783 goto theend;
14784 if (argvars[6].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
14785 time_limit = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[6], NULL((void*)0));
14786 if (time_limit < 0)
14787 goto theend;
14788 }
14789 }
14790 }
14791 if (skip == NULL((void*)0))
14792 goto theend; /* type error */
14793
14794 retval = do_searchpair(spat, mpat, epat, dir, skip, flags,
14795 match_pos, lnum_stop, time_limit);
14796
14797theend:
14798 p_ws = save_p_ws;
14799
14800 return retval;
14801}
14802
14803/*
14804 * "searchpair()" function
14805 */
14806static void f_searchpair(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14807{
14808 rettv->vval.v_number = searchpair_cmn(argvars, NULL((void*)0));
14809}
14810
14811/*
14812 * "searchpairpos()" function
14813 */
14814static void f_searchpairpos(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14815{
14816 pos_T match_pos;
14817 int lnum = 0;
14818 int col = 0;
14819
14820 rettv_list_alloc(rettv);
14821
14822 if (searchpair_cmn(argvars, &match_pos) > 0) {
14823 lnum = match_pos.lnum;
14824 col = match_pos.col;
14825 }
14826
14827 list_append_number(rettv->vval.v_list, (varnumber_T)lnum);
14828 list_append_number(rettv->vval.v_list, (varnumber_T)col);
14829}
14830
14831/*
14832 * Search for a start/middle/end thing.
14833 * Used by searchpair(), see its documentation for the details.
14834 * Returns 0 or -1 for no match,
14835 */
14836long
14837do_searchpair (
14838 char_u *spat, /* start pattern */
14839 char_u *mpat, /* middle pattern */
14840 char_u *epat, /* end pattern */
14841 int dir, /* BACKWARD or FORWARD */
14842 char_u *skip, /* skip expression */
14843 int flags, /* SP_SETPCMARK and other SP_ values */
14844 pos_T *match_pos,
14845 linenr_T lnum_stop, /* stop at this line if not zero */
14846 long time_limit /* stop after this many msec */
14847)
14848{
14849 char_u *save_cpo;
14850 char_u *pat, *pat2 = NULL((void*)0), *pat3 = NULL((void*)0);
14851 long retval = 0;
14852 pos_T pos;
14853 pos_T firstpos;
14854 pos_T foundpos;
14855 pos_T save_cursor;
14856 pos_T save_pos;
14857 int n;
14858 int r;
14859 int nest = 1;
14860 int err;
14861 int options = SEARCH_KEEP0x400;
14862 proftime_T tm;
14863
14864 /* Make 'cpoptions' empty, the 'l' flag should not be used here. */
14865 save_cpo = p_cpo;
14866 p_cpo = empty_option;
14867
14868 /* Set the time limit, if there is one. */
14869 tm = profile_setlimit(time_limit);
14870
14871 /* Make two search patterns: start/end (pat2, for in nested pairs) and
14872 * start/middle/end (pat3, for the top pair). */
14873 pat2 = xmalloc(STRLEN(spat)strlen((char *)(spat)) + STRLEN(epat)strlen((char *)(epat)) + 15);
14874 pat3 = xmalloc(STRLEN(spat)strlen((char *)(spat)) + STRLEN(mpat)strlen((char *)(mpat)) + STRLEN(epat)strlen((char *)(epat)) + 23);
14875 sprintf((char *)pat2, "\\(%s\\m\\)\\|\\(%s\\m\\)", spat, epat);
14876 if (*mpat == NUL'\000')
14877 STRCPY(pat3, pat2)strcpy((char *)(pat3), (char *)(pat2));
14878 else
14879 sprintf((char *)pat3, "\\(%s\\m\\)\\|\\(%s\\m\\)\\|\\(%s\\m\\)",
14880 spat, epat, mpat);
14881 if (flags & SP_START0x10)
14882 options |= SEARCH_START0x100;
14883
14884 save_cursor = curwin->w_cursor;
14885 pos = curwin->w_cursor;
14886 clearpos(&firstpos){(&firstpos)->lnum = 0; (&firstpos)->col = 0; (
&firstpos)->coladd = 0; };
14887 clearpos(&foundpos){(&foundpos)->lnum = 0; (&foundpos)->col = 0; (
&foundpos)->coladd = 0; };
14888 pat = pat3;
14889 for (;; ) {
14890 n = searchit(curwin, curbuf, &pos, dir, pat, 1L,
14891 options, RE_SEARCH0, lnum_stop, &tm);
14892 if (n == FAIL0 || (firstpos.lnum != 0 && equalpos(pos, firstpos)(((pos).lnum == (firstpos).lnum) && ((pos).col == (firstpos
).col) && ((pos).coladd == (firstpos).coladd))))
14893 /* didn't find it or found the first match again: FAIL */
14894 break;
14895
14896 if (firstpos.lnum == 0)
14897 firstpos = pos;
14898 if (equalpos(pos, foundpos)(((pos).lnum == (foundpos).lnum) && ((pos).col == (foundpos
).col) && ((pos).coladd == (foundpos).coladd))) {
14899 /* Found the same position again. Can happen with a pattern that
14900 * has "\zs" at the end and searching backwards. Advance one
14901 * character and try again. */
14902 if (dir == BACKWARD(-1))
14903 decl(&pos);
14904 else
14905 incl(&pos);
14906 }
14907 foundpos = pos;
14908
14909 /* clear the start flag to avoid getting stuck here */
14910 options &= ~SEARCH_START0x100;
14911
14912 /* If the skip pattern matches, ignore this match. */
14913 if (*skip != NUL'\000') {
14914 save_pos = curwin->w_cursor;
14915 curwin->w_cursor = pos;
14916 r = eval_to_bool(skip, &err, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
14917 curwin->w_cursor = save_pos;
14918 if (err) {
14919 /* Evaluating {skip} caused an error, break here. */
14920 curwin->w_cursor = save_cursor;
14921 retval = -1;
14922 break;
14923 }
14924 if (r)
14925 continue;
14926 }
14927
14928 if ((dir == BACKWARD(-1) && n == 3) || (dir == FORWARD1 && n == 2)) {
14929 /* Found end when searching backwards or start when searching
14930 * forward: nested pair. */
14931 ++nest;
14932 pat = pat2; /* nested, don't search for middle */
14933 } else {
14934 /* Found end when searching forward or start when searching
14935 * backward: end of (nested) pair; or found middle in outer pair. */
14936 if (--nest == 1)
14937 pat = pat3; /* outer level, search for middle */
14938 }
14939
14940 if (nest == 0) {
14941 /* Found the match: return matchcount or line number. */
14942 if (flags & SP_RETCOUNT0x04)
14943 ++retval;
14944 else
14945 retval = pos.lnum;
14946 if (flags & SP_SETPCMARK0x08)
14947 setpcmark();
14948 curwin->w_cursor = pos;
14949 if (!(flags & SP_REPEAT0x02))
14950 break;
14951 nest = 1; /* search for next unmatched */
14952 }
14953 }
14954
14955 if (match_pos != NULL((void*)0)) {
14956 /* Store the match cursor position */
14957 match_pos->lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
14958 match_pos->col = curwin->w_cursor.col + 1;
14959 }
14960
14961 /* If 'n' flag is used or search failed: restore cursor position. */
14962 if ((flags & SP_NOMOVE0x01) || retval == 0)
14963 curwin->w_cursor = save_cursor;
14964
14965 xfree(pat2);
14966 xfree(pat3);
14967 if (p_cpo == empty_option)
14968 p_cpo = save_cpo;
14969 else
14970 /* Darn, evaluating the {skip} expression changed the value. */
14971 free_string_option(save_cpo);
14972
14973 return retval;
14974}
14975
14976/*
14977 * "searchpos()" function
14978 */
14979static void f_searchpos(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14980{
14981 pos_T match_pos;
14982 int lnum = 0;
14983 int col = 0;
14984 int n;
14985 int flags = 0;
14986
14987 rettv_list_alloc(rettv);
14988
14989 n = search_cmn(argvars, &match_pos, &flags);
14990 if (n > 0) {
14991 lnum = match_pos.lnum;
14992 col = match_pos.col;
14993 }
14994
14995 list_append_number(rettv->vval.v_list, (varnumber_T)lnum);
14996 list_append_number(rettv->vval.v_list, (varnumber_T)col);
14997 if (flags & SP_SUBPAT0x20)
14998 list_append_number(rettv->vval.v_list, (varnumber_T)n);
14999}
15000
15001/// "serverlist()" function
15002static void f_serverlist(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
15003{
15004 size_t n;
15005 char **addrs = server_address_list(&n);
15006
15007 // Copy addrs into a linked list.
15008 list_T *l = rettv_list_alloc(rettv);
15009 for (size_t i = 0; i < n; i++) {
15010 listitem_T *li = listitem_alloc();
15011 li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
15012 li->li_tv.v_lock = 0;
15013 li->li_tv.vval.v_string = (char_u *) addrs[i];
15014 list_append(l, li);
15015 }
15016 xfree(addrs);
15017}
15018
15019/// "serverstart()" function
15020static void f_serverstart(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
15021{
15022 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
15023 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0); // Address of the new server
15024
15025 if (check_restricted() || check_secure()) {
15026 return;
15027 }
15028
15029 // If the user supplied an address, use it, otherwise use a temp.
15030 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
15031 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_STRING2) {
15032 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
15033 return;
15034 } else {
15035 rettv->vval.v_string = vim_strsave(get_tv_string(argvars));
15036 }
15037 } else {
15038 rettv->vval.v_string = (char_u *)server_address_new();
15039 }
15040
15041 int result = server_start((char *) rettv->vval.v_string);
15042 if (result != 0) {
15043 EMSG2("Failed to start server: %s", uv_strerror(result))emsg2((char_u *)("Failed to start server: %s"), (char_u *)(uv_strerror
(result)));
15044 }
15045}
15046
15047/// "serverstop()" function
15048static void f_serverstop(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
15049{
15050 if (check_restricted() || check_secure()) {
15051 return;
15052 }
15053
15054 if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0 || argvars[0].v_type != VAR_STRING2) {
15055 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
15056 return;
15057 }
15058
15059 if (argvars[0].vval.v_string) {
15060 server_stop((char *) argvars[0].vval.v_string);
15061 }
15062}
15063
15064/*
15065 * "setbufvar()" function
15066 */
