17762 * Advance "arg" to the first character after the name.
17763 * Return 0 for error.
17764 */
17765static int get_env_len(char_u **arg)
17766{
17767 char_u *p;
17768 int len;
17769
17770 for (p = *arg; vim_isIDc(*p); ++p)
17771 ;
17772 if (p == *arg) /* no name found */
17773 return 0;
17774
17775 len = (int)(p - *arg);
17776 *arg = p;
17777 return len;
17778}
17779
17780/*
17781 * Get the length of the name of a function or internal variable.
17782 * "arg" is advanced to the first non-white character after the name.
17783 * Return 0 if something is wrong.
17784 */
17785static int get_id_len(char_u **arg)
17786{
17787 char_u *p;
17788 int len;
17789
17790 /* Find the end of the name. */
17791 for (p = *arg; eval_isnamec(*p); ++p)
17792 ;
17793 if (p == *arg) /* no name found */
17794 return 0;
17795
17796 len = (int)(p - *arg);
17797 *arg = skipwhite(p);
17798
17799 return len;
17800}
17801
17802/*
17803 * Get the length of the name of a variable or function.
17804 * Only the name is recognized, does not handle ".key" or "[idx]".
17805 * "arg" is advanced to the first non-white character after the name.
17806 * Return -1 if curly braces expansion failed.
17807 * Return 0 if something else is wrong.
17808 * If the name contains 'magic' {}'s, expand them and return the
17809 * expanded name in an allocated string via 'alias' - caller must free.
17810 */
17811static int get_name_len(char_u **arg, char_u **alias, int evaluate, int verbose)
17812{
17813 int len;
17814 char_u *p;
17815 char_u *expr_start;
17816 char_u *expr_end;
17817
17818 *alias = NULL((void*)0); /* default to no alias */
17819
17820 if ((*arg)[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80) && (*arg)[1] == KS_EXTRA253
17821 && (*arg)[2] == (int)KE_SNR) {
17822 /* hard coded <SNR>, already translated */
17823 *arg += 3;
17824 return get_id_len(arg) + 3;
17825 }
17826 len = eval_fname_script(*arg);
17827 if (len > 0) {
17828 /* literal "<SID>", "s:" or "<SNR>" */
17829 *arg += len;
17830 }
17831
17832 /*
17833 * Find the end of the name; check for {} construction.
17834 */
17835 p = find_name_end(*arg, &expr_start, &expr_end,
17836 len > 0 ? 0 : FNE_CHECK_START2);
17837 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0)) {
17838 char_u *temp_string;
17839
17840 if (!evaluate) {
17841 len += (int)(p - *arg);
17842 *arg = skipwhite(p);
17843 return len;
17844 }
17845
17846 /*
17847 * Include any <SID> etc in the expanded string:
17848 * Thus the -len here.
17849 */
17850 temp_string = make_expanded_name(*arg - len, expr_start, expr_end, p);
17851 if (temp_string == NULL((void*)0))
17852 return -1;
17853 *alias = temp_string;
17854 *arg = skipwhite(p);
17855 return (int)STRLEN(temp_string)strlen((char *)(temp_string));
17856 }
17857
17858 len += get_id_len(arg);
17859 if (len == 0 && verbose)
17860 EMSG2(_(e_invexpr2), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2))), (char_u *)(*
arg));
17861
17862 return len;
17863}
17864
17865/*
17866 * Find the end of a variable or function name, taking care of magic braces.
17867 * If "expr_start" is not NULL then "expr_start" and "expr_end" are set to the
17868 * start and end of the first magic braces item.
17869 * "flags" can have FNE_INCL_BR and FNE_CHECK_START.
17870 * Return a pointer to just after the name. Equal to "arg" if there is no
17871 * valid name.
17872 */
17873static char_u *find_name_end(char_u *arg, char_u **expr_start, char_u **expr_end, int flags)
17874{
17875 int mb_nest = 0;
17876 int br_nest = 0;
17877 char_u *p;
17878
17879 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0)) {
17880 *expr_start = NULL((void*)0);
17881 *expr_end = NULL((void*)0);
17882 }
17883
17884 /* Quick check for valid starting character. */
17885 if ((flags & FNE_CHECK_START2) && !eval_isnamec1(*arg) && *arg != '{')
17886 return arg;
17887
17888 for (p = arg; *p != NUL'\000'
17889 && (eval_isnamec(*p)
17890 || *p == '{'
17891 || ((flags & FNE_INCL_BR1) && (*p == '[' || *p == '.'))
17892 || mb_nest != 0
17893 || br_nest != 0); mb_ptr_adv(p)(p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)((char_u *)p) : 1)) {
17894 if (*p == '\'') {
17895 /* skip over 'string' to avoid counting [ and ] inside it. */
17896 for (p = p + 1; *p != NUL'\000' && *p != '\''; mb_ptr_adv(p)(p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)((char_u *)p) : 1))
17897 ;
17898 if (*p == NUL'\000')
17899 break;
17900 } else if (*p == '"') {
17901 /* skip over "str\"ing" to avoid counting [ and ] inside it. */
17902 for (p = p + 1; *p != NUL'\000' && *p != '"'; mb_ptr_adv(p)(p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)((char_u *)p) : 1))
17903 if (*p == '\\' && p[1] != NUL'\000')
17904 ++p;
17905 if (*p == NUL'\000')
17906 break;
17907 }
17908
17909 if (mb_nest == 0) {
17910 if (*p == '[')
17911 ++br_nest;
17912 else if (*p == ']')
17913 --br_nest;
17914 }
17915
17916 if (br_nest == 0) {
17917 if (*p == '{') {
17918 mb_nest++;
17919 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0) && *expr_start == NULL((void*)0))
17920 *expr_start = p;
17921 } else if (*p == '}') {
17922 mb_nest--;
17923 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0) && mb_nest == 0 && *expr_end == NULL((void*)0))
17924 *expr_end = p;
17925 }
17926 }
17927 }
17928
17929 return p;
17930}
17931
17932/*
17933 * Expands out the 'magic' {}'s in a variable/function name.
17934 * Note that this can call itself recursively, to deal with
17935 * constructs like foo{bar}{baz}{bam}
17936 * The four pointer arguments point to "foo{expre}ss{ion}bar"
17937 * "in_start" ^
17938 * "expr_start" ^
17939 * "expr_end" ^
17940 * "in_end" ^
17941 *
17942 * Returns a new allocated string, which the caller must free.
17943 * Returns NULL for failure.
17944 */
17945static char_u *make_expanded_name(char_u *in_start, char_u *expr_start, char_u *expr_end, char_u *in_end)
17946{
17947 char_u c1;
17948 char_u *retval = NULL((void*)0);
17949 char_u *temp_result;
17950 char_u *nextcmd = NULL((void*)0);
17951
17952 if (expr_end == NULL((void*)0) || in_end == NULL((void*)0))
17953 return NULL((void*)0);
17954 *expr_start = NUL'\000';
17955 *expr_end = NUL'\000';
17956 c1 = *in_end;
17957 *in_end = NUL'\000';
17958
17959 temp_result = eval_to_string(expr_start + 1, &nextcmd, FALSE0);
17960 if (temp_result != NULL((void*)0) && nextcmd == NULL((void*)0)) {
17961 retval = xmalloc(STRLEN(temp_result)strlen((char *)(temp_result)) + (expr_start - in_start)
17962 + (in_end - expr_end) + 1);
17963 STRCPY(retval, in_start)strcpy((char *)(retval), (char *)(in_start));
17964 STRCAT(retval, temp_result)strcat((char *)(retval), (char *)(temp_result));
17965 STRCAT(retval, expr_end + 1)strcat((char *)(retval), (char *)(expr_end + 1));
17966 }
17967 xfree(temp_result);
17968
17969 *in_end = c1; /* put char back for error messages */
17970 *expr_start = '{';
17971 *expr_end = '}';
17972
17973 if (retval != NULL((void*)0)) {
17974 temp_result = find_name_end(retval, &expr_start, &expr_end, 0);
17975 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0)) {
17976 /* Further expansion! */
17977 temp_result = make_expanded_name(retval, expr_start,
17978 expr_end, temp_result);
17979 xfree(retval);
17980 retval = temp_result;
17981 }
17982 }
17983
17984 return retval;
17985}
17986
17987/*
17988 * Return TRUE if character "c" can be used in a variable or function name.
17989 * Does not include '{' or '}' for magic braces.
17990 */
17991static int eval_isnamec(int c)
17992{
17993 return ASCII_ISALNUM(c)((((unsigned)(c) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(c) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(c) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(c) <= 'z'
)) || ascii_isdigit(c)) || c == '_' || c == ':' || c == AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#';
17994}
17995
17996/*
17997 * Return TRUE if character "c" can be used as the first character in a
17998 * variable or function name (excluding '{' and '}').
17999 */
18000static int eval_isnamec1(int c)
18001{
18002 return ASCII_ISALPHA(c)(((unsigned)(c) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(c) <= 'Z')
|| ((unsigned)(c) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(c) <= 'z'
)) || c == '_';
18003}
18004
18005/*
18006 * Set number v: variable to "val".
18007 */
18008void set_vim_var_nr(int idx, long val)
18009{
18010 vimvars[idx].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = val;
18011}
18012
18013/*
18014 * Get number v: variable value.
18015 */
18016long get_vim_var_nr(int idx) FUNC_ATTR_PURE
18017{
18018 return vimvars[idx].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number;
18019}
18020
18021/*
18022 * Get string v: variable value. Uses a static buffer, can only be used once.
18023 */
18024char_u *get_vim_var_str(int idx) FUNC_ATTR_PURE FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
18025{
18026 return get_tv_string(&vimvars[idx].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv);
18027}
18028
18029/*
18030 * Get List v: variable value. Caller must take care of reference count when
18031 * needed.
18032 */
18033list_T *get_vim_var_list(int idx) FUNC_ATTR_PURE
18034{
18035 return vimvars[idx].vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list;
18036}
18037
18038/// Get Dictionary v: variable value. Caller must take care of reference count
18039/// when needed.
18040dict_T *get_vim_var_dict(int idx) FUNC_ATTR_PURE
18041{
18042 return vimvars[idx].vv_dictvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_dict;
18043}
18044
18045/*
18046 * Set v:char to character "c".
18047 */
18048void set_vim_var_char(int c)
18049{
18050 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
18051
18052 if (has_mbyte)
18053 buf[(*mb_char2bytes)(c, buf)] = NUL'\000';
18054 else {
18055 buf[0] = c;
18056 buf[1] = NUL'\000';
18057 }
18058 set_vim_var_string(VV_CHAR, buf, -1);
18059}
18060
18061/*
18062 * Set v:count to "count" and v:count1 to "count1".
18063 * When "set_prevcount" is TRUE first set v:prevcount from v:count.
18064 */
18065void set_vcount(long count, long count1, int set_prevcount)
18066{
18067 if (set_prevcount)
18068 vimvars[VV_PREVCOUNT].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = vimvars[VV_COUNT].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number;
18069 vimvars[VV_COUNT].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = count;
18070 vimvars[VV_COUNT1].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = count1;
18071}
18072
18073/*
18074 * Set string v: variable to a copy of "val".
18075 */
18076void set_vim_var_string (
18077 int idx,
18078 char_u *val,
18079 int len /* length of "val" to use or -1 (whole string) */
18080)
18081{
18082 /* Need to do this (at least) once, since we can't initialize a union.
18083 * Will always be invoked when "v:progname" is set. */
18084 vimvars[VV_VERSION].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = VIM_VERSION_100(7 * 100 + 4);
18085
18086 xfree(vimvars[idx].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string);
18087 if (val == NULL((void*)0))
18088 vimvars[idx].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
18089 else if (len == -1)
18090 vimvars[idx].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = vim_strsave(val);
18091 else
18092 vimvars[idx].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = vim_strnsave(val, len);
18093}
18094
18095/*
18096 * Set List v: variable to "val".
18097 */
18098void set_vim_var_list(int idx, list_T *val)
18099{
18100 list_unref(vimvars[idx].vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list);
18101 vimvars[idx].vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list = val;
18102 if (val != NULL((void*)0))
18103 ++val->lv_refcount;
18104}
18105
18106/// Set Dictionary v: variable to "val".
18107void set_vim_var_dict(int idx, dict_T *val) FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
18108{
18109 dict_unref(vimvars[idx].vv_dictvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_dict);
18110
18111 // Set readonly
18112 int todo = (int)val->dv_hashtab.ht_used;
18113 for (hashitem_T *hi = val->dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0 ; ++hi) {
18114 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
18115 continue;
18116 }
18117
18118 --todo;
18119 HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)))->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
18120 }
18121
18122 vimvars[idx].vv_dictvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_dict = val;
18123 ++val->dv_refcount;
18124}
18125
18126/*
18127 * Set v:register if needed.
18128 */
18129void set_reg_var(int c)
18130{
18131 char_u regname;
18132
18133 if (c == 0 || c == ' ')
18134 regname = '"';
18135 else
18136 regname = c;
18137 /* Avoid free/alloc when the value is already right. */
18138 if (vimvars[VV_REG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0) || vimvars[VV_REG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string[0] != c)
18139 set_vim_var_string(VV_REG, &regname, 1);
18140}
18141
18142/*
18143 * Get or set v:exception. If "oldval" == NULL, return the current value.
18144 * Otherwise, restore the value to "oldval" and return NULL.
18145 * Must always be called in pairs to save and restore v:exception! Does not
18146 * take care of memory allocations.
18147 */
18148char_u *v_exception(char_u *oldval)
18149{
18150 if (oldval == NULL((void*)0))
18151 return vimvars[VV_EXCEPTION].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string;
18152
18153 vimvars[VV_EXCEPTION].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = oldval;
18154 return NULL((void*)0);
18155}
18156
18157/*
18158 * Get or set v:throwpoint. If "oldval" == NULL, return the current value.
18159 * Otherwise, restore the value to "oldval" and return NULL.
18160 * Must always be called in pairs to save and restore v:throwpoint! Does not
18161 * take care of memory allocations.
18162 */
18163char_u *v_throwpoint(char_u *oldval)
18164{
18165 if (oldval == NULL((void*)0))
18166 return vimvars[VV_THROWPOINT].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string;
18167
18168 vimvars[VV_THROWPOINT].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = oldval;
18169 return NULL((void*)0);
18170}
18171
18172/*
18173 * Set v:cmdarg.
18174 * If "eap" != NULL, use "eap" to generate the value and return the old value.
18175 * If "oldarg" != NULL, restore the value to "oldarg" and return NULL.
18176 * Must always be called in pairs!
18177 */
18178char_u *set_cmdarg(exarg_T *eap, char_u *oldarg)
18179{
18180 char_u *oldval;
18181 char_u *newval;
18182
18183 oldval = vimvars[VV_CMDARG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string;
18184 if (eap == NULL((void*)0)) {
18185 xfree(oldval);
18186 vimvars[VV_CMDARG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = oldarg;
18187 return NULL((void*)0);
18188 }
18189
18190 size_t len = 0;
18191 if (eap->force_bin == FORCE_BIN1)
18192 len = 6;
18193 else if (eap->force_bin == FORCE_NOBIN2)
18194 len = 8;
18195
18196 if (eap->read_edit)
18197 len += 7;
18198
18199 if (eap->force_ff != 0)
18200 len += STRLEN(eap->cmd + eap->force_ff)strlen((char *)(eap->cmd + eap->force_ff)) + 6;
18201 if (eap->force_enc != 0)
18202 len += STRLEN(eap->cmd + eap->force_enc)strlen((char *)(eap->cmd + eap->force_enc)) + 7;
18203 if (eap->bad_char != 0)
18204 len += 7 + 4; /* " ++bad=" + "keep" or "drop" */
18205
18206 newval = xmalloc(len + 1);
18207
18208 if (eap->force_bin == FORCE_BIN1)
18209 sprintf((char *)newval, " ++bin");
18210 else if (eap->force_bin == FORCE_NOBIN2)
18211 sprintf((char *)newval, " ++nobin");
18212 else
18213 *newval = NUL'\000';
18214
18215 if (eap->read_edit)
18216 STRCAT(newval, " ++edit")strcat((char *)(newval), (char *)(" ++edit"));
18217
18218 if (eap->force_ff != 0)
18219 sprintf((char *)newval + STRLEN(newval)strlen((char *)(newval)), " ++ff=%s",
18220 eap->cmd + eap->force_ff);
18221 if (eap->force_enc != 0)
18222 sprintf((char *)newval + STRLEN(newval)strlen((char *)(newval)), " ++enc=%s",
18223 eap->cmd + eap->force_enc);
18224 if (eap->bad_char == BAD_KEEP-1)
18225 STRCPY(newval + STRLEN(newval), " ++bad=keep")strcpy((char *)(newval + strlen((char *)(newval))), (char *)(
" ++bad=keep"));
18226 else if (eap->bad_char == BAD_DROP-2)
18227 STRCPY(newval + STRLEN(newval), " ++bad=drop")strcpy((char *)(newval + strlen((char *)(newval))), (char *)(
" ++bad=drop"));
18228 else if (eap->bad_char != 0)
18229 sprintf((char *)newval + STRLEN(newval)strlen((char *)(newval)), " ++bad=%c", eap->bad_char);
18230 vimvars[VV_CMDARG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = newval;
18231 return oldval;
18232}
18233
18234/*
18235 * Get the value of internal variable "name".
18236 * Return OK or FAIL.
18237 */
18238static int
18239get_var_tv (
18240 char_u *name,
18241 int len, // length of "name"
18242 typval_T *rettv, // NULL when only checking existence
18243 dictitem_T **dip, // non-NULL when typval's dict item is needed
18244 int verbose, // may give error message
18245 int no_autoload // do not use script autoloading
18246)
18247{
18248 int ret = OK1;
18249 typval_T *tv = NULL((void*)0);
18250 typval_T atv;
18251 dictitem_T *v;
18252 int cc;
18253
18254 /* truncate the name, so that we can use strcmp() */
18255 cc = name[len];
18256 name[len] = NUL'\000';
18257
18258 /*
18259 * Check for "b:changedtick".
18260 */
18261 if (STRCMP(name, "b:changedtick")strcmp((char *)(name), (char *)("b:changedtick")) == 0) {
18262 atv.v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
18263 atv.vval.v_number = curbuf->b_changedtick;
18264 tv = &atv;
18265 }
18266 /*
18267 * Check for user-defined variables.
18268 */
18269 else {
18270 v = find_var(name, NULL((void*)0), no_autoload);
18271 if (v != NULL((void*)0)) {
18272 tv = &v->di_tv;
18273 if (dip != NULL((void*)0)) {
18274 *dip = v;
18275 }
18276 }
18277 }
18278
18279 if (tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
18280 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0) && verbose)
18281 EMSG2(_(e_undefvar), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_undefvar))), (char_u *)(name
));
18282 ret = FAIL0;
18283 } else if (rettv != NULL((void*)0))
18284 copy_tv(tv, rettv);
18285
18286 name[len] = cc;
18287
18288 return ret;
18289}
18290
18291/*
18292 * Handle expr[expr], expr[expr:expr] subscript and .name lookup.
18293 * Also handle function call with Funcref variable: func(expr)
18294 * Can all be combined: dict.func(expr)[idx]['func'](expr)
18295 */
18296static int
18297handle_subscript (
18298 char_u **arg,
18299 typval_T *rettv,
18300 int evaluate, /* do more than finding the end */
18301 int verbose /* give error messages */
18302)
18303{
18304 int ret = OK1;
18305 dict_T *selfdict = NULL((void*)0);
18306 char_u *s;
18307 int len;
18308 typval_T functv;
18309
18310 while (ret == OK1
18311 && (**arg == '['
18312 || (**arg == '.' && rettv->v_type == VAR_DICT5)
18313 || (**arg == '(' && (!evaluate || rettv->v_type == VAR_FUNC3)))
18314 && !ascii_iswhite(*(*arg - 1))) {
18315 if (**arg == '(') {
18316 /* need to copy the funcref so that we can clear rettv */
18317 if (evaluate) {
18318 functv = *rettv;
18319 rettv->v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0;
18320
18321 /* Invoke the function. Recursive! */
18322 s = functv.vval.v_string;
18323 } else
18324 s = (char_u *)"";
18325 ret = get_func_tv(s, (int)STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s)), rettv, arg,
18326 curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
18327 &len, evaluate, selfdict);
18328
18329 /* Clear the funcref afterwards, so that deleting it while
18330 * evaluating the arguments is possible (see test55). */
18331 if (evaluate)
18332 clear_tv(&functv);
18333
18334 /* Stop the expression evaluation when immediately aborting on
18335 * error, or when an interrupt occurred or an exception was thrown
18336 * but not caught. */
18337 if (aborting()) {
18338 if (ret == OK1)
18339 clear_tv(rettv);
18340 ret = FAIL0;
18341 }
18342 dict_unref(selfdict);
18343 selfdict = NULL((void*)0);
18344 } else { /* **arg == '[' || **arg == '.' */
18345 dict_unref(selfdict);
18346 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_DICT5) {
18347 selfdict = rettv->vval.v_dict;
18348 if (selfdict != NULL((void*)0))
18349 ++selfdict->dv_refcount;
18350 } else
18351 selfdict = NULL((void*)0);
18352 if (eval_index(arg, rettv, evaluate, verbose) == FAIL0) {
18353 clear_tv(rettv);
18354 ret = FAIL0;
18355 }
18356 }
18357 }
18358 dict_unref(selfdict);
18359 return ret;
18360}
18361
18362/*
18363 * Free the memory for a variable type-value.
18364 */
18365void free_tv(typval_T *varp)
18366{
18367 if (varp != NULL((void*)0)) {
18368 switch (varp->v_type) {
18369 case VAR_FUNC3:
18370 func_unref(varp->vval.v_string);
18371 /*FALLTHROUGH*/
18372 case VAR_STRING2:
18373 xfree(varp->vval.v_string);
18374 break;
18375 case VAR_LIST4:
18376 list_unref(varp->vval.v_list);
18377 break;
18378 case VAR_DICT5:
18379 dict_unref(varp->vval.v_dict);
18380 break;
18381 case VAR_NUMBER1:
18382 case VAR_FLOAT6:
18383 case VAR_UNKNOWN0:
18384 break;
18385 default:
18386 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "free_tv()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("free_tv()"
));
18387 break;
18388 }
18389 xfree(varp);
18390 }
18391}
18392
18393/*
18394 * Free the memory for a variable value and set the value to NULL or 0.
18395 */
18396void clear_tv(typval_T *varp)
18397{
18398 if (varp != NULL((void*)0)) {
18399 switch (varp->v_type) {
18400 case VAR_FUNC3:
18401 func_unref(varp->vval.v_string);
18402 if (varp->vval.v_string != empty_string) {
18403 xfree(varp->vval.v_string);
18404 }
18405 varp->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
18406 break;
18407 case VAR_STRING2:
18408 xfree(varp->vval.v_string);
18409 varp->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
18410 break;
18411 case VAR_LIST4:
18412 list_unref(varp->vval.v_list);
18413 varp->vval.v_list = NULL((void*)0);
18414 break;
18415 case VAR_DICT5:
18416 dict_unref(varp->vval.v_dict);
18417 varp->vval.v_dict = NULL((void*)0);
18418 break;
18419 case VAR_NUMBER1:
18420 varp->vval.v_number = 0;
18421 break;
18422 case VAR_FLOAT6:
18423 varp->vval.v_float = 0.0;
18424 break;
18425 case VAR_UNKNOWN0:
18426 break;
18427 default:
18428 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "clear_tv()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("clear_tv()"
));
18429 }
18430 varp->v_lock = 0;
18431 }
18432}
18433
18434/*
18435 * Set the value of a variable to NULL without freeing items.
18436 */
18437static void init_tv(typval_T *varp)
18438{
18439 if (varp != NULL((void*)0))
18440 memset(varp, 0, sizeof(typval_T));
18441}
18442
18443/*
18444 * Get the number value of a variable.
18445 * If it is a String variable, uses vim_str2nr().
18446 * For incompatible types, return 0.
18447 * get_tv_number_chk() is similar to get_tv_number(), but informs the
18448 * caller of incompatible types: it sets *denote to TRUE if "denote"
18449 * is not NULL or returns -1 otherwise.
18450 */
18451static long get_tv_number(typval_T *varp)
18452{
18453 int error = FALSE0;
18454
18455 return get_tv_number_chk(varp, &error); /* return 0L on error */
18456}
18457
18458long get_tv_number_chk(typval_T *varp, int *denote)
18459{
18460 long n = 0L;
18461
18462 switch (varp->v_type) {
18463 case VAR_NUMBER1:
18464 return (long)(varp->vval.v_number);
18465 case VAR_FLOAT6:
18466 EMSG(_("E805: Using a Float as a Number"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E805: Using a Float as a Number"
))));
18467 break;
18468 case VAR_FUNC3:
18469 EMSG(_("E703: Using a Funcref as a Number"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E703: Using a Funcref as a Number"
))));
18470 break;
18471 case VAR_STRING2:
18472 if (varp->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)) {
18473 vim_str2nr(varp->vval.v_string, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0),
18474 STR2NR_ALL(1 + 2 + 4), &n, NULL((void*)0), 0);
18475 }
18476 return n;
18477 case VAR_LIST4:
18478 EMSG(_("E745: Using a List as a Number"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E745: Using a List as a Number"
))));
18479 break;
18480 case VAR_DICT5:
18481 EMSG(_("E728: Using a Dictionary as a Number"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E728: Using a Dictionary as a Number"
))));
18482 break;
18483 default:
18484 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "get_tv_number()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("get_tv_number()"
));
18485 break;
18486 }
18487 if (denote == NULL((void*)0)) {
18488 // useful for values that must be unsigned
18489 n = -1;
18490 } else {
18491 *denote = true1;
18492 }
18493 return n;
18494}
18495
18496/*
18497 * Get the lnum from the first argument.
18498 * Also accepts ".", "$", etc., but that only works for the current buffer.
18499 * Returns -1 on error.
18500 */
18501static linenr_T get_tv_lnum(typval_T *argvars)
18502{
18503 typval_T rettv;
18504 linenr_T lnum;
18505
18506 lnum = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0));
18507 if (lnum == 0) { /* no valid number, try using line() */
18508 rettv.v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
18509 f_line(argvars, &rettv);
18510 lnum = rettv.vval.v_number;
18511 clear_tv(&rettv);
18512 }
18513 return lnum;
18514}
18515
18516/*
18517 * Get the lnum from the first argument.
18518 * Also accepts "$", then "buf" is used.
18519 * Returns 0 on error.
18520 */
18521static linenr_T get_tv_lnum_buf(typval_T *argvars, buf_T *buf)
18522{
18523 if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_STRING2
18524 && argvars[0].vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)
18525 && argvars[0].vval.v_string[0] == '$'
18526 && buf != NULL((void*)0))
18527 return buf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
18528 return get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0));
18529}
18530
18531/*
18532 * Get the string value of a variable.
18533 * If it is a Number variable, the number is converted into a string.
18534 * get_tv_string() uses a single, static buffer. YOU CAN ONLY USE IT ONCE!
18535 * get_tv_string_buf() uses a given buffer.
18536 * If the String variable has never been set, return an empty string.
18537 * Never returns NULL;
18538 * get_tv_string_chk() and get_tv_string_buf_chk() are similar, but return
18539 * NULL on error.
18540 */
18541static char_u *get_tv_string(const typval_T *varp)
18542 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
18543{
18544 static char_u mybuf[NUMBUFLEN65];
18545
18546 return get_tv_string_buf(varp, mybuf);
18547}
18548
18549static char_u *get_tv_string_buf(const typval_T *varp, char_u *buf)
18550 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
18551{
18552 char_u *res = get_tv_string_buf_chk(varp, buf);
18553
18554 return res != NULL((void*)0) ? res : (char_u *)"";
18555}
18556
18557/// Careful: This uses a single, static buffer. YOU CAN ONLY USE IT ONCE!
18558char_u *get_tv_string_chk(const typval_T *varp)
18559 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
18560{
18561 static char_u mybuf[NUMBUFLEN65];
18562
18563 return get_tv_string_buf_chk(varp, mybuf);
18564}
18565
18566static char_u *get_tv_string_buf_chk(const typval_T *varp, char_u *buf)
18567 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
18568{
18569 switch (varp->v_type) {
18570 case VAR_NUMBER1:
18571 sprintf((char *)buf, "%" PRId64"l" "d", (int64_t)varp->vval.v_number);
18572 return buf;
18573 case VAR_FUNC3:
18574 EMSG(_("E729: using Funcref as a String"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E729: using Funcref as a String"
))));
18575 break;
18576 case VAR_LIST4:
18577 EMSG(_("E730: using List as a String"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E730: using List as a String"
))));
18578 break;
18579 case VAR_DICT5:
18580 EMSG(_("E731: using Dictionary as a String"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E731: using Dictionary as a String"
))));
18581 break;
18582 case VAR_FLOAT6:
18583 EMSG(_(e_float_as_string))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_float_as_string))));
18584 break;
18585 case VAR_STRING2:
18586 if (varp->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0))
18587 return varp->vval.v_string;
18588 return (char_u *)"";
18589 default:
18590 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "get_tv_string_buf()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("get_tv_string_buf()"
));
18591 break;
18592 }
18593 return NULL((void*)0);
18594}
18595
18596/*
18597 * Find variable "name" in the list of variables.
18598 * Return a pointer to it if found, NULL if not found.
18599 * Careful: "a:0" variables don't have a name.
18600 * When "htp" is not NULL we are writing to the variable, set "htp" to the
18601 * hashtab_T used.
18602 */
18603static dictitem_T *find_var(char_u *name, hashtab_T **htp, int no_autoload)
18604{
18605 char_u *varname;
18606 hashtab_T *ht;
18607
18608 ht = find_var_ht(name, &varname);
18609 if (htp != NULL((void*)0))
18610 *htp = ht;
18611 if (ht == NULL((void*)0))
18612 return NULL((void*)0);
18613 return find_var_in_ht(ht, *name, varname, no_autoload || htp != NULL((void*)0));
18614}
18615
18616/*
18617 * Find variable "varname" in hashtab "ht" with name "htname".
18618 * Returns NULL if not found.
18619 */
18620static dictitem_T *find_var_in_ht(hashtab_T *ht, int htname, char_u *varname, int no_autoload)
18621{
18622 hashitem_T *hi;
18623
18624 if (*varname == NUL'\000') {
18625 /* Must be something like "s:", otherwise "ht" would be NULL. */
18626 switch (htname) {
18627 case 's': return &SCRIPT_SV(current_SID)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(current_SID) - 1])->sv_var;
18628 case 'g': return &globvars_var;
18629 case 'v': return &vimvars_var;
18630 case 'b': return &curbuf->b_bufvar;
18631 case 'w': return &curwin->w_winvar;
18632 case 't': return &curtab->tp_winvar;
18633 case 'l': return current_funccal == NULL((void*)0)
18634 ? NULL((void*)0) : &current_funccal->l_vars_var;
18635 case 'a': return current_funccal == NULL((void*)0)
18636 ? NULL((void*)0) : &current_funccal->l_avars_var;
18637 }
18638 return NULL((void*)0);
18639 }
18640
18641 hi = hash_find(ht, varname);
18642 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
18643 /* For global variables we may try auto-loading the script. If it
18644 * worked find the variable again. Don't auto-load a script if it was
18645 * loaded already, otherwise it would be loaded every time when
18646 * checking if a function name is a Funcref variable. */
18647 if (ht == &globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab && !no_autoload) {
18648 /* Note: script_autoload() may make "hi" invalid. It must either
18649 * be obtained again or not used. */
18650 if (!script_autoload(varname, FALSE0) || aborting())
18651 return NULL((void*)0);
18652 hi = hash_find(ht, varname);
18653 }
18654 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
18655 return NULL((void*)0);
18656 }
18657 return HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
18658}
18659
18660// Find the dict and hashtable used for a variable name. Set "varname" to the
18661// start of name without ':'.
18662static hashtab_T *find_var_ht_dict(char_u *name, uint8_t **varname, dict_T **d)
18663{
18664 hashitem_T *hi;
18665 *d = NULL((void*)0);
18666
18667 if (name[0] == NUL'\000') {
18668 return NULL((void*)0);
18669 }
18670 if (name[1] != ':') {
18671 // name has implicit scope
18672 if (name[0] == ':' || name[0] == AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') {
18673 // The name must not start with a colon or #.
18674 return NULL((void*)0);
18675 }
18676 *varname = name;
18677
18678 // "version" is "v:version" in all scopes
18679 hi = hash_find(&compat_hashtab, name);
18680 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
18681 return &compat_hashtab;
18682 }
18683
18684 *d = current_funccal ? &current_funccal->l_vars : &globvardict;
18685 goto end;
18686 }
18687
18688 *varname = name + 2;
18689 if (*name == 'g') { // global variable
18690 *d = &globvardict;
18691 } else if (vim_strchr(name + 2, ':') != NULL((void*)0)
18692 || vim_strchr(name + 2, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') != NULL((void*)0)) {
18693 // There must be no ':' or '#' in the rest of the name if g: was not used
18694 return NULL((void*)0);
18695 }
18696
18697 if (*name == 'b') { // buffer variable
18698 *d = curbuf->b_vars;
18699 } else if (*name == 'w') { // window variable
18700 *d = curwin->w_vars;
18701 } else if (*name == 't') { // tab page variable
18702 *d = curtab->tp_vars;
18703 } else if (*name == 'v') { // v: variable
18704 *d = &vimvardict;
18705 } else if (*name == 'a' && current_funccal != NULL((void*)0)) { // function argument
18706 *d = &current_funccal->l_avars;
18707 } else if (*name == 'l' && current_funccal != NULL((void*)0)) { // local variable
18708 *d = &current_funccal->l_vars;
18709 } else if (*name == 's' // script variable
18710 && current_SID > 0 && current_SID <= ga_scripts.ga_len) {
18711 *d = &SCRIPT_SV(current_SID)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(current_SID) - 1])->sv_dict;
18712 }
18713
18714end:
18715 return *d ? &(*d)->dv_hashtab : NULL((void*)0);
18716}
18717
18718// Find the hashtab used for a variable name.
18719// Return NULL if the name is not valid.
18720// Set "varname" to the start of name without ':'.
18721static hashtab_T *find_var_ht(uint8_t *name, uint8_t **varname)
18722{
18723 dict_T *d;
18724 return find_var_ht_dict(name, varname, &d);
18725}
18726
18727/*
18728 * Get the string value of a (global/local) variable.
18729 * Note: see get_tv_string() for how long the pointer remains valid.
18730 * Returns NULL when it doesn't exist.
18731 */
18732char_u *get_var_value(char_u *name)
18733{
18734 dictitem_T *v;
18735
18736 v = find_var(name, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
18737 if (v == NULL((void*)0))
18738 return NULL((void*)0);
18739 return get_tv_string(&v->di_tv);
18740}
18741
18742/*
18743 * Allocate a new hashtab for a sourced script. It will be used while
18744 * sourcing this script and when executing functions defined in the script.
18745 */
18746void new_script_vars(scid_T id)
18747{
18748 hashtab_T *ht;
18749 scriptvar_T *sv;
18750
18751 ga_grow(&ga_scripts, (int)(id - ga_scripts.ga_len));
18752 {
18753 /* Re-allocating ga_data means that an ht_array pointing to
18754 * ht_smallarray becomes invalid. We can recognize this: ht_mask is
18755 * at its init value. Also reset "v_dict", it's always the same. */
18756 for (int i = 1; i <= ga_scripts.ga_len; ++i) {
18757 ht = &SCRIPT_VARS(i)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1])->sv_dict.
dv_hashtab);
18758 if (ht->ht_mask == HT_INIT_SIZE16 - 1)
18759 ht->ht_array = ht->ht_smallarray;
18760 sv = SCRIPT_SV(i)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1]);
18761 sv->sv_var.di_tv.vval.v_dict = &sv->sv_dict;
18762 }
18763
18764 while (ga_scripts.ga_len < id) {
18765 sv = SCRIPT_SV(ga_scripts.ga_len + 1)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(ga_scripts.ga_len + 1)
- 1]) = xcalloc(1, sizeof(scriptvar_T));
18766 init_var_dict(&sv->sv_dict, &sv->sv_var, VAR_SCOPE1);
18767 ++ga_scripts.ga_len;
18768 }
18769 }
18770}
18771
18772/*
18773 * Initialize dictionary "dict" as a scope and set variable "dict_var" to
18774 * point to it.
18775 */
18776void init_var_dict(dict_T *dict, dictitem_T *dict_var, int scope)
18777{
18778 hash_init(&dict->dv_hashtab);
18779 dict->dv_lock = 0;
18780 dict->dv_scope = scope;
18781 dict->dv_refcount = DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999;
18782 dict->dv_copyID = 0;
18783 dict_var->di_tv.vval.v_dict = dict;
18784 dict_var->di_tv.v_type = VAR_DICT5;
18785 dict_var->di_tv.v_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
18786 dict_var->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
18787 dict_var->di_key[0] = NUL'\000';
18788 QUEUE_INIT(&dict->watchers)do { (*(QUEUE **) &((*(&dict->watchers))[0])) = (&
dict->watchers); (*(QUEUE **) &((*(&dict->watchers
))[1])) = (&dict->watchers); } while (0);
18789}
18790
18791/*
18792 * Unreference a dictionary initialized by init_var_dict().
18793 */
18794void unref_var_dict(dict_T *dict)
18795{
18796 /* Now the dict needs to be freed if no one else is using it, go back to
18797 * normal reference counting. */
18798 dict->dv_refcount -= DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999 - 1;
18799 dict_unref(dict);
18800}
18801
18802/*
18803 * Clean up a list of internal variables.
18804 * Frees all allocated variables and the value they contain.
18805 * Clears hashtab "ht", does not free it.
18806 */
18807void vars_clear(hashtab_T *ht)
18808{
18809 vars_clear_ext(ht, TRUE1);
18810}
18811
18812/*
18813 * Like vars_clear(), but only free the value if "free_val" is TRUE.
18814 */
18815static void vars_clear_ext(hashtab_T *ht, int free_val)
18816{
18817 int todo;
18818 hashitem_T *hi;
18819 dictitem_T *v;
18820
18821 hash_lock(ht);
18822 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
18823 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
18824 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
18825 --todo;
18826
18827 // Free the variable. Don't remove it from the hashtab,
18828 // ht_array might change then. hash_clear() takes care of it
18829 // later.
18830 v = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
18831 if (free_val) {
18832 clear_tv(&v->di_tv);
18833 }
18834 if (v->di_flags & DI_FLAGS_ALLOC16) {
18835 xfree(v);
18836 }
18837 }
18838 }
18839 hash_clear(ht);
18840 ht->ht_used = 0;
18841}
18842
18843/*
18844 * Delete a variable from hashtab "ht" at item "hi".
18845 * Clear the variable value and free the dictitem.
18846 */
18847static void delete_var(hashtab_T *ht, hashitem_T *hi)
18848{
18849 dictitem_T *di = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
18850
18851 hash_remove(ht, hi);
18852 clear_tv(&di->di_tv);
18853 xfree(di);
18854}
18855
18856/*
18857 * List the value of one internal variable.
18858 */
18859static void list_one_var(dictitem_T *v, char_u *prefix, int *first)
18860{
18861 char_u *s = (char_u *) echo_string(&v->di_tv, NULL((void*)0));
18862 list_one_var_a(prefix, v->di_key, v->di_tv.v_type,
18863 s == NULL((void*)0) ? (char_u *)"" : s, first);
18864 xfree(s);
18865}
18866
18867static void
18868list_one_var_a (
18869 char_u *prefix,
18870 char_u *name,
18871 int type,
18872 char_u *string,
18873 int *first /* when TRUE clear rest of screen and set to FALSE */
18874)
18875{
18876 /* don't use msg() or msg_attr() to avoid overwriting "v:statusmsg" */
18877 msg_start();
18878 msg_puts(prefix);
18879 if (name != NULL((void*)0)) /* "a:" vars don't have a name stored */
18880 msg_puts(name);
18881 msg_putchar(' ');
18882 msg_advance(22);
18883 if (type == VAR_NUMBER1)
18884 msg_putchar('#');
18885 else if (type == VAR_FUNC3)
18886 msg_putchar('*');
18887 else if (type == VAR_LIST4) {
18888 msg_putchar('[');
18889 if (*string == '[')
18890 ++string;
18891 } else if (type == VAR_DICT5) {
18892 msg_putchar('{');
18893 if (*string == '{')
18894 ++string;
18895 } else
18896 msg_putchar(' ');
18897
18898 msg_outtrans(string);
18899
18900 if (type == VAR_FUNC3)
18901 msg_puts((char_u *)"()");
18902 if (*first) {
18903 msg_clr_eos();
18904 *first = FALSE0;
18905 }
18906}
18907
18908/*
18909 * Set variable "name" to value in "tv".
18910 * If the variable already exists, the value is updated.
18911 * Otherwise the variable is created.
18912 */
18913static void
18914set_var (
18915 char_u *name,
18916 typval_T *tv,
18917 int copy /* make copy of value in "tv" */
18918)
18919{
18920 dictitem_T *v;
18921 char_u *varname;
18922 hashtab_T *ht;
18923 typval_T oldtv;
18924 dict_T *dict;
18925
18926 ht = find_var_ht_dict(name, &varname, &dict);
18927 bool_Bool watched = is_watched(dict);
18928
18929 if (watched) {
18930 init_tv(&oldtv);
18931 }
18932
18933 if (ht == NULL((void*)0) || *varname == NUL'\000') {
18934 EMSG2(_(e_illvar), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_illvar))), (char_u *)(name
));
18935 return;
18936 }
18937 v = find_var_in_ht(ht, 0, varname, TRUE1);
18938
18939 if (tv->v_type == VAR_FUNC3 && var_check_func_name(name, v == NULL((void*)0)))
18940 return;
18941
18942 if (v != NULL((void*)0)) {
18943 // existing variable, need to clear the value
18944 if (var_check_ro(v->di_flags, name, false0)
18945 || tv_check_lock(v->di_tv.v_lock, name, false0)) {
18946 return;
18947 }
18948 if (v->di_tv.v_type != tv->v_type
18949 && !((v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2
18950 || v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER1)
18951 && (tv->v_type == VAR_STRING2
18952 || tv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER1))
18953 && !((v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER1
18954 || v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
18955 && (tv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER1
18956 || tv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6))
18957 ) {
18958 EMSG2(_("E706: Variable type mismatch for: %s"), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E706: Variable type mismatch for: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name));
18959 return;
18960 }
18961
18962 // Handle setting internal v: variables separately where needed to
18963 // prevent changing the type.
18964 if (ht == &vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab) {
18965 if (v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2) {
18966 xfree(v->di_tv.vval.v_string);
18967 if (copy || tv->v_type != VAR_STRING2)
18968 v->di_tv.vval.v_string = vim_strsave(get_tv_string(tv));
18969 else {
18970 /* Take over the string to avoid an extra alloc/free. */
18971 v->di_tv.vval.v_string = tv->vval.v_string;
18972 tv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
18973 }
18974 return;
18975 } else if (v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER1) {
18976 v->di_tv.vval.v_number = get_tv_number(tv);
18977 if (STRCMP(varname, "searchforward")strcmp((char *)(varname), (char *)("searchforward")) == 0)
18978 set_search_direction(v->di_tv.vval.v_number ? '/' : '?');
18979 else if (STRCMP(varname, "hlsearch")strcmp((char *)(varname), (char *)("hlsearch")) == 0) {
18980 no_hlsearch = !v->di_tv.vval.v_number;
18981 redraw_all_later(SOME_VALID35);
18982 }
18983 return;
18984 } else if (v->di_tv.v_type != tv->v_type) {
18985 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "set_var()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("set_var()"
));
18986 }
18987 }
18988
18989 if (watched) {
18990 copy_tv(&v->di_tv, &oldtv);
18991 }
18992 clear_tv(&v->di_tv);
18993 } else { /* add a new variable */
18994 /* Can't add "v:" variable. */
18995 if (ht == &vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab) {
18996 EMSG2(_(e_illvar), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_illvar))), (char_u *)(name
));
18997 return;
18998 }
18999
19000 /* Make sure the variable name is valid. */
19001 if (!valid_varname(varname))
19002 return;
19003
19004 v = xmalloc(sizeof(dictitem_T) + STRLEN(varname)strlen((char *)(varname)));
19005 STRCPY(v->di_key, varname)strcpy((char *)(v->di_key), (char *)(varname));
19006 if (hash_add(ht, DI2HIKEY(v)((v)->di_key)) == FAIL0) {
19007 xfree(v);
19008 return;
19009 }
19010 v->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_ALLOC16;
19011 }
19012
19013 if (copy || tv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER1 || tv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
19014 copy_tv(tv, &v->di_tv);
19015 } else {
19016 v->di_tv = *tv;
19017 v->di_tv.v_lock = 0;
19018 init_tv(tv);
19019 }
19020
19021 if (watched) {
19022 if (oldtv.v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
19023 dictwatcher_notify(dict, (char *)v->di_key, &v->di_tv, NULL((void*)0));
19024 } else {
19025 dictwatcher_notify(dict, (char *)v->di_key, &v->di_tv, &oldtv);
19026 clear_tv(&oldtv);
19027 }
19028 }
19029}
19030
19031// Return true if di_flags "flags" indicates variable "name" is read-only.
19032// Also give an error message.
19033static bool_Bool var_check_ro(int flags, char_u *name, bool_Bool use_gettext)
19034{
19035 if (flags & DI_FLAGS_RO1) {
19036 EMSG2(_(e_readonlyvar), use_gettext ? (char_u *)_(name) : name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_readonlyvar))), (char_u *
)(use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name)) : name));
19037 return true1;
19038 }
19039 if ((flags & DI_FLAGS_RO_SBX2) && sandbox) {
19040 EMSG2(_(e_readonlysbx), use_gettext ? (char_u *)_(name) : name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_readonlysbx))), (char_u *
)(use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name)) : name));
19041 return true1;
19042 }
19043 return false0;
19044}
19045
19046// Return true if di_flags "flags" indicates variable "name" is fixed.
19047// Also give an error message.
19048static bool_Bool var_check_fixed(int flags, char_u *name, bool_Bool use_gettext)
19049{
19050 if (flags & DI_FLAGS_FIX4) {
19051 EMSG2(_("E795: Cannot delete variable %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E795: Cannot delete variable %s"
))), (char_u *)(use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name
)) : name))
19052 use_gettext ? (char_u *)_(name) : name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E795: Cannot delete variable %s"
))), (char_u *)(use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name
)) : name));
19053 return true1;
19054 }
19055 return false0;
19056}
19057
19058/*
19059 * Check if a funcref is assigned to a valid variable name.
19060 * Return TRUE and give an error if not.
19061 */
19062static int
19063var_check_func_name (
19064 char_u *name, /* points to start of variable name */
19065 int new_var /* TRUE when creating the variable */
19066)
19067{
19068 // Allow for w: b: s: and t:.
19069 if (!(vim_strchr((char_u *)"wbst", name[0]) != NULL((void*)0) && name[1] == ':')
19070 && !ASCII_ISUPPER((name[0] != NUL && name[1] == ':') ? name[2]((unsigned)((name[0] != '\000' && name[1] == ':') ? name
[2] : name[0]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)((name[0] != '\000'
&& name[1] == ':') ? name[2] : name[0]) <= 'Z')
19071 : name[0])((unsigned)((name[0] != '\000' && name[1] == ':') ? name
[2] : name[0]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)((name[0] != '\000'
&& name[1] == ':') ? name[2] : name[0]) <= 'Z')) {
19072 EMSG2(_("E704: Funcref variable name must start with a capital: %s"), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E704: Funcref variable name must start with a capital: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name));
19073 return TRUE1;
19074 }
19075 /* Don't allow hiding a function. When "v" is not NULL we might be
19076 * assigning another function to the same var, the type is checked
19077 * below. */
19078 if (new_var && function_exists(name)) {
19079 EMSG2(_("E705: Variable name conflicts with existing function: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E705: Variable name conflicts with existing function: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name))
19080 name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E705: Variable name conflicts with existing function: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name));
19081 return TRUE1;
19082 }
19083 return FALSE0;
19084}
19085
19086/*
19087 * Check if a variable name is valid.
19088 * Return FALSE and give an error if not.
19089 */
19090static int valid_varname(char_u *varname)
19091{
19092 char_u *p;
19093
19094 for (p = varname; *p != NUL'\000'; ++p)
19095 if (!eval_isnamec1(*p) && (p == varname || !ascii_isdigit(*p))
19096 && *p != AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') {
19097 EMSG2(_(e_illvar), varname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_illvar))), (char_u *)(varname
));
19098 return FALSE0;
19099 }
19100 return TRUE1;
19101}
19102
19103// Return true if typeval "tv" is set to be locked (immutable).
19104// Also give an error message, using "name" or _("name") when use_gettext is
19105// true.
19106static bool_Bool tv_check_lock(int lock, char_u *name, bool_Bool use_gettext)
19107{
19108 if (lock & VAR_LOCKED1) {
19109 EMSG2(_("E741: Value is locked: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E741: Value is locked: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name
)) : name))
19110 name == NULLemsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E741: Value is locked: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name
)) : name))
19111 ? (char_u *)_("Unknown")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E741: Value is locked: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name
)) : name))
19112 : use_gettext ? (char_u *)_(name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E741: Value is locked: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name
)) : name))
19113 : name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E741: Value is locked: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name
)) : name));
19114 return true1;
19115 }
19116 if (lock & VAR_FIXED2) {
19117 EMSG2(_("E742: Cannot change value of %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E742: Cannot change value of %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name
)) : name))
19118 name == NULLemsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E742: Cannot change value of %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name
)) : name))
19119 ? (char_u *)_("Unknown")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E742: Cannot change value of %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name
)) : name))
19120 : use_gettext ? (char_u *)_(name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E742: Cannot change value of %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name
)) : name))
19121 : name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E742: Cannot change value of %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : use_gettext ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)(name
)) : name));
19122 return true1;
19123 }
19124 return false0;
19125}
19126
19127/*
19128 * Copy the values from typval_T "from" to typval_T "to".
19129 * When needed allocates string or increases reference count.
19130 * Does not make a copy of a list or dict but copies the reference!
19131 * It is OK for "from" and "to" to point to the same item. This is used to
19132 * make a copy later.
19133 */
19134void copy_tv(typval_T *from, typval_T *to)
19135{
19136 to->v_type = from->v_type;
19137 to->v_lock = 0;
19138 switch (from->v_type) {
19139 case VAR_NUMBER1:
19140 to->vval.v_number = from->vval.v_number;
19141 break;
19142 case VAR_FLOAT6:
19143 to->vval.v_float = from->vval.v_float;
19144 break;
19145 case VAR_STRING2:
19146 case VAR_FUNC3:
19147 if (from->vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0))
19148 to->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
19149 else {
19150 to->vval.v_string = vim_strsave(from->vval.v_string);
19151 if (from->v_type == VAR_FUNC3)
19152 func_ref(to->vval.v_string);
19153 }
19154 break;
19155 case VAR_LIST4:
19156 if (from->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0))
19157 to->vval.v_list = NULL((void*)0);
19158 else {
19159 to->vval.v_list = from->vval.v_list;
19160 ++to->vval.v_list->lv_refcount;
19161 }
19162 break;
19163 case VAR_DICT5:
19164 if (from->vval.v_dict == NULL((void*)0))
19165 to->vval.v_dict = NULL((void*)0);
19166 else {
19167 to->vval.v_dict = from->vval.v_dict;
19168 ++to->vval.v_dict->dv_refcount;
19169 }
19170 break;
19171 default:
19172 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "copy_tv()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("copy_tv()"
));
19173 break;
19174 }
19175}
19176
19177/// Make a copy of an item
19178///
19179/// Lists and Dictionaries are also copied.
19180///
19181/// @param[in] conv If not NULL, convert all copied strings.
19182/// @param[in] from Value to copy.
19183/// @param[out] to Location where to copy to.
19184/// @param[in] deep If true, use copy the container and all of the contained
19185/// containers (nested).
19186/// @param[in] copyID If non-zero then when container is referenced more then
19187/// once then copy of it that was already done is used. E.g.
19188/// when copying list `list = [list2, list2]` (`list[0] is
19189/// list[1]`) var_item_copy with zero copyID will emit
19190/// a copy with (`copy[0] isnot copy[1]`), with non-zero it
19191/// will emit a copy with (`copy[0] is copy[1]`) like in the
19192/// original list. Not use when deep is false.
19193int var_item_copy(const vimconv_T *const conv,
19194 typval_T *const from,
19195 typval_T *const to,
19196 const bool_Bool deep,
19197 const int copyID)
19198 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(2, 3)
19199{
19200 static int recurse = 0;
19201 int ret = OK1;
19202
19203 if (recurse >= DICT_MAXNEST100) {
19204 EMSG(_("E698: variable nested too deep for making a copy"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E698: variable nested too deep for making a copy"
))));
19205 return FAIL0;
19206 }
19207 ++recurse;
19208
19209 switch (from->v_type) {
19210 case VAR_NUMBER1:
19211 case VAR_FLOAT6:
19212 case VAR_FUNC3:
19213 copy_tv(from, to);
19214 break;
19215 case VAR_STRING2:
19216 if (conv == NULL((void*)0) || conv->vc_type == CONV_NONE0) {
19217 copy_tv(from, to);
19218 } else {
19219 to->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
19220 to->v_lock = 0;
19221 if ((to->vval.v_string = string_convert((vimconv_T *)conv,
19222 from->vval.v_string,
19223 NULL((void*)0)))
19224 == NULL((void*)0)) {
19225 to->vval.v_string = (char_u *) xstrdup((char *) from->vval.v_string);
19226 }
19227 }
19228 break;
19229 case VAR_LIST4:
19230 to->v_type = VAR_LIST4;
19231 to->v_lock = 0;
19232 if (from->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0))
19233 to->vval.v_list = NULL((void*)0);
19234 else if (copyID != 0 && from->vval.v_list->lv_copyID == copyID) {
19235 /* use the copy made earlier */
19236 to->vval.v_list = from->vval.v_list->lv_copylist;
19237 ++to->vval.v_list->lv_refcount;
19238 } else {
19239 to->vval.v_list = list_copy(conv, from->vval.v_list, deep, copyID);
19240 }
19241 if (to->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0))
19242 ret = FAIL0;
19243 break;
19244 case VAR_DICT5:
19245 to->v_type = VAR_DICT5;
19246 to->v_lock = 0;
19247 if (from->vval.v_dict == NULL((void*)0))
19248 to->vval.v_dict = NULL((void*)0);
19249 else if (copyID != 0 && from->vval.v_dict->dv_copyID == copyID) {
19250 /* use the copy made earlier */
19251 to->vval.v_dict = from->vval.v_dict->dv_copydict;
19252 ++to->vval.v_dict->dv_refcount;
19253 } else {
19254 to->vval.v_dict = dict_copy(conv, from->vval.v_dict, deep, copyID);
19255 }
19256 if (to->vval.v_dict == NULL((void*)0))
19257 ret = FAIL0;
19258 break;
19259 default:
19260 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "var_item_copy()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("var_item_copy()"
));
19261 ret = FAIL0;
19262 }
19263 --recurse;
19264 return ret;
19265}
19266
19267/*
19268 * ":echo expr1 ..." print each argument separated with a space, add a
19269 * newline at the end.
19270 * ":echon expr1 ..." print each argument plain.
19271 */
19272void ex_echo(exarg_T *eap)
19273{
19274 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
19275 typval_T rettv;
19276 char_u *p;
19277 bool_Bool needclr = true1;
19278 bool_Bool atstart = true1;
19279
19280 if (eap->skip)
19281 ++emsg_skip;
19282 while (*arg != NUL'\000' && *arg != '|' && *arg != '\n' && !got_int) {
19283 /* If eval1() causes an error message the text from the command may
19284 * still need to be cleared. E.g., "echo 22,44". */
19285 need_clr_eos = needclr;
19286
19287 p = arg;
19288 if (eval1(&arg, &rettv, !eap->skip) == FAIL0) {
19289 /*
19290 * Report the invalid expression unless the expression evaluation
19291 * has been cancelled due to an aborting error, an interrupt, or an
19292 * exception.
19293 */
19294 if (!aborting())
19295 EMSG2(_(e_invexpr2), p)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2))), (char_u *)(p
));
19296 need_clr_eos = FALSE0;
19297 break;
19298 }
19299 need_clr_eos = FALSE0;
19300
19301 if (!eap->skip) {
19302 if (atstart) {
19303 atstart = false0;
19304 /* Call msg_start() after eval1(), evaluating the expression
19305 * may cause a message to appear. */
19306 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echo) {
19307 /* Mark the saved text as finishing the line, so that what
19308 * follows is displayed on a new line when scrolling back
19309 * at the more prompt. */
19310 msg_sb_eol();
19311 msg_start();
19312 }
19313 } else if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echo)
19314 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)" ", echo_attr);
19315 char_u *tofree = p = (char_u *) echo_string(&rettv, NULL((void*)0));
19316 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
19317 for (; *p != NUL'\000' && !got_int; ++p) {
19318 if (*p == '\n' || *p == '\r' || *p == TAB'\011') {
19319 if (*p != TAB'\011' && needclr) {
19320 /* remove any text still there from the command */
19321 msg_clr_eos();
19322 needclr = false0;
19323 }
19324 msg_putchar_attr(*p, echo_attr);
19325 } else {
19326 if (has_mbyte) {
19327 int i = (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
19328
19329 (void)msg_outtrans_len_attr(p, i, echo_attr);
19330 p += i - 1;
19331 } else
19332 (void)msg_outtrans_len_attr(p, 1, echo_attr);
19333 }
19334 }
19335 }
19336 xfree(tofree);
19337 }
19338 clear_tv(&rettv);
19339 arg = skipwhite(arg);
19340 }
19341 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
19342
19343 if (eap->skip)
19344 --emsg_skip;
19345 else {
19346 /* remove text that may still be there from the command */
19347 if (needclr)
19348 msg_clr_eos();
19349 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echo)
19350 msg_end();
19351 }
19352}
19353
19354/*
19355 * ":echohl {name}".
19356 */
19357void ex_echohl(exarg_T *eap)
19358{
19359 int id;
19360
19361 id = syn_name2id(eap->arg);
19362 if (id == 0)
19363 echo_attr = 0;
19364 else
19365 echo_attr = syn_id2attr(id);
19366}
19367
19368/*
19369 * ":execute expr1 ..." execute the result of an expression.
19370 * ":echomsg expr1 ..." Print a message
19371 * ":echoerr expr1 ..." Print an error
19372 * Each gets spaces around each argument and a newline at the end for
19373 * echo commands
19374 */
19375void ex_execute(exarg_T *eap)
19376{
19377 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
19378 typval_T rettv;
19379 int ret = OK1;
19380 char_u *p;
19381 garray_T ga;
19382 int len;
19383 int save_did_emsg;
19384
19385 ga_init(&ga, 1, 80);
19386
19387 if (eap->skip)
19388 ++emsg_skip;
19389 while (*arg != NUL'\000' && *arg != '|' && *arg != '\n') {
19390 p = arg;
19391 if (eval1(&arg, &rettv, !eap->skip) == FAIL0) {
19392 /*
19393 * Report the invalid expression unless the expression evaluation
19394 * has been cancelled due to an aborting error, an interrupt, or an
19395 * exception.
19396 */
19397 if (!aborting())
19398 EMSG2(_(e_invexpr2), p)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2))), (char_u *)(p
));
19399 ret = FAIL0;
19400 break;
19401 }
19402
19403 if (!eap->skip) {
19404 p = get_tv_string(&rettv);
19405 len = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
19406 ga_grow(&ga, len + 2);
19407 if (!GA_EMPTY(&ga)((&ga)->ga_len <= 0))
19408 ((char_u *)(ga.ga_data))[ga.ga_len++] = ' ';
19409 STRCPY((char_u *)(ga.ga_data) + ga.ga_len, p)strcpy((char *)((char_u *)(ga.ga_data) + ga.ga_len), (char *)
(p));
19410 ga.ga_len += len;
19411 }
19412
19413 clear_tv(&rettv);
19414 arg = skipwhite(arg);
19415 }
19416
19417 if (ret != FAIL0 && ga.ga_data != NULL((void*)0)) {
19418 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echomsg) {
19419 MSG_ATTR(ga.ga_data, echo_attr)msg_attr((char_u *)(ga.ga_data), (echo_attr));
19420 ui_flush();
19421 } else if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echoerr) {
19422 /* We don't want to abort following commands, restore did_emsg. */
19423 save_did_emsg = did_emsg;
19424 EMSG((char_u *)ga.ga_data)emsg((char_u *)((char_u *)ga.ga_data));
19425 if (!force_abort)
19426 did_emsg = save_did_emsg;
19427 } else if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_execute)
19428 do_cmdline((char_u *)ga.ga_data,
19429 eap->getline, eap->cookie, DOCMD_NOWAIT0x02|DOCMD_VERBOSE0x01);
19430 }
19431
19432 ga_clear(&ga);
19433
19434 if (eap->skip)
19435 --emsg_skip;
19436
19437 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
19438}
19439
19440/*
19441 * Skip over the name of an option: "&option", "&g:option" or "&l:option".
19442 * "arg" points to the "&" or '+' when called, to "option" when returning.
19443 * Returns NULL when no option name found. Otherwise pointer to the char
19444 * after the option name.
19445 */
19446static char_u *find_option_end(char_u **arg, int *opt_flags)
19447{
19448 char_u *p = *arg;
19449
19450 ++p;
19451 if (*p == 'g' && p[1] == ':') {
19452 *opt_flags = OPT_GLOBAL2;
19453 p += 2;
19454 } else if (*p == 'l' && p[1] == ':') {
19455 *opt_flags = OPT_LOCAL4;
19456 p += 2;
19457 } else
19458 *opt_flags = 0;
19459
19460 if (!ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z')))
19461 return NULL((void*)0);
19462 *arg = p;
19463
19464 if (p[0] == 't' && p[1] == '_' && p[2] != NUL'\000' && p[3] != NUL'\000')
19465 p += 4; /* termcap option */
19466 else
19467 while (ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z')))
19468 ++p;
19469 return p;
19470}
19471
19472/*
19473 * ":function"
19474 */
19475void ex_function(exarg_T *eap)
19476{
19477 char_u *theline;
19478 int c;
19479 int saved_did_emsg;
19480 int saved_wait_return = need_wait_return;
19481 char_u *name = NULL((void*)0);
19482 char_u *p;
19483 char_u *arg;
19484 char_u *line_arg = NULL((void*)0);
19485 garray_T newargs;
19486 garray_T newlines;
19487 int varargs = FALSE0;
19488 int mustend = FALSE0;
19489 int flags = 0;
19490 ufunc_T *fp;
19491 int indent;
19492 int nesting;
19493 char_u *skip_until = NULL((void*)0);
19494 dictitem_T *v;
19495 funcdict_T fudi;
19496 static int func_nr = 0; /* number for nameless function */
19497 int paren;
19498 hashtab_T *ht;
19499 int todo;
19500 hashitem_T *hi;
19501 int sourcing_lnum_off;
19502
19503 /*
19504 * ":function" without argument: list functions.
19505 */
19506 if (ends_excmd(*eap->arg)) {
19507 if (!eap->skip) {
19508 todo = (int)func_hashtab.ht_used;
19509 for (hi = func_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi) {
19510 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
19511 --todo;
19512 fp = HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf)));
19513 if (!isdigit(*fp->uf_name)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*fp->uf_name))] & (unsigned
short int) _ISdigit))
19514 list_func_head(fp, FALSE0);
19515 }
19516 }
19517 }
19518 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(eap->arg);
19519 return;
19520 }
19521
19522 /*
19523 * ":function /pat": list functions matching pattern.
19524 */
19525 if (*eap->arg == '/') {
19526 p = skip_regexp(eap->arg + 1, '/', TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
19527 if (!eap->skip) {
19528 regmatch_T regmatch;
19529
19530 c = *p;
19531 *p = NUL'\000';
19532 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(eap->arg + 1, RE_MAGIC1);
19533 *p = c;
19534 if (regmatch.regprog != NULL((void*)0)) {
19535 regmatch.rm_ic = p_ic;
19536
19537 todo = (int)func_hashtab.ht_used;
19538 for (hi = func_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi) {
19539 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
19540 --todo;
19541 fp = HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf)));
19542 if (!isdigit(*fp->uf_name)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*fp->uf_name))] & (unsigned
short int) _ISdigit)
19543 && vim_regexec(&regmatch, fp->uf_name, 0))
19544 list_func_head(fp, FALSE0);
19545 }
19546 }
19547 vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
19548 }
19549 }
19550 if (*p == '/')
19551 ++p;
19552 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(p);
19553 return;
19554 }
19555
19556 // Get the function name. There are these situations:
19557 // func function name
19558 // "name" == func, "fudi.fd_dict" == NULL
19559 // dict.func new dictionary entry
19560 // "name" == NULL, "fudi.fd_dict" set,
19561 // "fudi.fd_di" == NULL, "fudi.fd_newkey" == func
19562 // dict.func existing dict entry with a Funcref
19563 // "name" == func, "fudi.fd_dict" set,
19564 // "fudi.fd_di" set, "fudi.fd_newkey" == NULL
19565 // dict.func existing dict entry that's not a Funcref
19566 // "name" == NULL, "fudi.fd_dict" set,
19567 // "fudi.fd_di" set, "fudi.fd_newkey" == NULL
19568 // s:func script-local function name
19569 // g:func global function name, same as "func"
19570 p = eap->arg;
19571 name = trans_function_name(&p, eap->skip, 0, &fudi);
19572 paren = (vim_strchr(p, '(') != NULL((void*)0));
19573 if (name == NULL((void*)0) && (fudi.fd_dict == NULL((void*)0) || !paren) && !eap->skip) {
19574 /*
19575 * Return on an invalid expression in braces, unless the expression
19576 * evaluation has been cancelled due to an aborting error, an
19577 * interrupt, or an exception.
19578 */
19579 if (!aborting()) {
19580 if (!eap->skip && fudi.fd_newkey != NULL((void*)0))
19581 EMSG2(_(e_dictkey), fudi.fd_newkey)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictkey))), (char_u *)(fudi
.fd_newkey));
19582 xfree(fudi.fd_newkey);
19583 return;
19584 } else
19585 eap->skip = TRUE1;
19586 }
19587
19588 /* An error in a function call during evaluation of an expression in magic
19589 * braces should not cause the function not to be defined. */
19590 saved_did_emsg = did_emsg;
19591 did_emsg = FALSE0;
19592
19593 /*
19594 * ":function func" with only function name: list function.
19595 */
19596 if (!paren) {
19597 if (!ends_excmd(*skipwhite(p))) {
19598 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
19599 goto ret_free;
19600 }
19601 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(p);
19602 if (eap->nextcmd != NULL((void*)0))
19603 *p = NUL'\000';
19604 if (!eap->skip && !got_int) {
19605 fp = find_func(name);
19606 if (fp != NULL((void*)0)) {
19607 list_func_head(fp, TRUE1);
19608 for (int j = 0; j < fp->uf_lines.ga_len && !got_int; ++j) {
19609 if (FUNCLINE(fp, j)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[j] == NULL((void*)0))
19610 continue;
19611 msg_putchar('\n');
19612 msg_outnum((long)(j + 1));
19613 if (j < 9)
19614 msg_putchar(' ');
19615 if (j < 99)
19616 msg_putchar(' ');
19617 msg_prt_line(FUNCLINE(fp, j)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[j], FALSE0);
19618 ui_flush(); /* show a line at a time */
19619 os_breakcheck();
19620 }
19621 if (!got_int) {
19622 msg_putchar('\n');
19623 msg_puts((char_u *)" endfunction");
19624 }
19625 } else
19626 emsg_funcname(N_("E123: Undefined function: %s")"E123: Undefined function: %s", name);
19627 }
19628 goto ret_free;
19629 }
19630
19631 /*
19632 * ":function name(arg1, arg2)" Define function.
19633 */
19634 p = skipwhite(p);
19635 if (*p != '(') {
19636 if (!eap->skip) {
19637 EMSG2(_("E124: Missing '(': %s"), eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E124: Missing '(': %s"))),
(char_u *)(eap->arg));
19638 goto ret_free;
19639 }
19640 /* attempt to continue by skipping some text */
19641 if (vim_strchr(p, '(') != NULL((void*)0))
19642 p = vim_strchr(p, '(');
19643 }
19644 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
19645
19646 ga_init(&newargs, (int)sizeof(char_u *), 3);
19647 ga_init(&newlines, (int)sizeof(char_u *), 3);
19648
19649 if (!eap->skip) {
19650 /* Check the name of the function. Unless it's a dictionary function
19651 * (that we are overwriting). */
19652 if (name != NULL((void*)0))
19653 arg = name;
19654 else
19655 arg = fudi.fd_newkey;
19656 if (arg != NULL((void*)0) && (fudi.fd_di == NULL((void*)0)
19657 || fudi.fd_di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_FUNC3)) {
19658 int j = (*arg == K_SPECIAL(0x80)) ? 3 : 0;
19659 while (arg[j] != NUL'\000' && (j == 0 ? eval_isnamec1(arg[j])
19660 : eval_isnamec(arg[j])))
19661 ++j;
19662 if (arg[j] != NUL'\000')
19663 emsg_funcname((char *)e_invarg2, arg);
19664 }
19665 /* Disallow using the g: dict. */
19666 if (fudi.fd_dict != NULL((void*)0) && fudi.fd_dict->dv_scope == VAR_DEF_SCOPE2)
19667 EMSG(_("E862: Cannot use g: here"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E862: Cannot use g: here"))
));
19668 }
19669
19670 /*
19671 * Isolate the arguments: "arg1, arg2, ...)"
19672 */
19673 while (*p != ')') {
19674 if (p[0] == '.' && p[1] == '.' && p[2] == '.') {
19675 varargs = TRUE1;
19676 p += 3;
19677 mustend = TRUE1;
19678 } else {
19679 arg = p;
19680 while (ASCII_ISALNUM(*p)((((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z')) || ascii_isdigit(*p)) || *p == '_')
19681 ++p;
19682 if (arg == p || isdigit(*arg)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*arg))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISdigit)
19683 || (p - arg == 9 && STRNCMP(arg, "firstline", 9)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("firstline"), (size_t)(9)) == 0)
19684 || (p - arg == 8 && STRNCMP(arg, "lastline", 8)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("lastline"), (size_t)(8)) == 0)) {
19685 if (!eap->skip)
19686 EMSG2(_("E125: Illegal argument: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E125: Illegal argument: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
19687 break;
19688 }
19689 ga_grow(&newargs, 1);
19690 c = *p;
19691 *p = NUL'\000';
19692 arg = vim_strsave(arg);
19693
19694 /* Check for duplicate argument name. */
19695 for (int i = 0; i < newargs.ga_len; ++i)
19696 if (STRCMP(((char_u **)(newargs.ga_data))[i], arg)strcmp((char *)(((char_u **)(newargs.ga_data))[i]), (char *)(
arg)) == 0) {
19697 EMSG2(_("E853: Duplicate argument name: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E853: Duplicate argument name: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
19698 xfree(arg);
19699 goto erret;
19700 }
19701
19702 ((char_u **)(newargs.ga_data))[newargs.ga_len] = arg;
19703 *p = c;
19704 newargs.ga_len++;
19705 if (*p == ',')
19706 ++p;
19707 else
19708 mustend = TRUE1;
19709 }
19710 p = skipwhite(p);
19711 if (mustend && *p != ')') {
19712 if (!eap->skip)
19713 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(eap
->arg));
19714 break;
19715 }
19716 }
19717 if (*p != ')') {
19718 goto erret;
19719 }
19720 ++p; // skip the ')'
19721
19722 /* find extra arguments "range", "dict" and "abort" */
19723 for (;; ) {
19724 p = skipwhite(p);
19725 if (STRNCMP(p, "range", 5)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("range"), (size_t)(5)) == 0) {
19726 flags |= FC_RANGE2;
19727 p += 5;
19728 } else if (STRNCMP(p, "dict", 4)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("dict"), (size_t)(4)) == 0) {
19729 flags |= FC_DICT4;
19730 p += 4;
19731 } else if (STRNCMP(p, "abort", 5)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("abort"), (size_t)(5)) == 0) {
19732 flags |= FC_ABORT1;
19733 p += 5;
19734 } else
19735 break;
19736 }
19737
19738 /* When there is a line break use what follows for the function body.
19739 * Makes 'exe "func Test()\n...\nendfunc"' work. */
19740 if (*p == '\n')
19741 line_arg = p + 1;
19742 else if (*p != NUL'\000' && *p != '"' && !eap->skip && !did_emsg)
19743 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
19744
19745 /*
19746 * Read the body of the function, until ":endfunction" is found.
19747 */
19748 if (KeyTyped) {
19749 /* Check if the function already exists, don't let the user type the
19750 * whole function before telling him it doesn't work! For a script we
19751 * need to skip the body to be able to find what follows. */
19752 if (!eap->skip && !eap->forceit) {
19753 if (fudi.fd_dict != NULL((void*)0) && fudi.fd_newkey == NULL((void*)0))
19754 EMSG(_(e_funcdict))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_funcdict))));
19755 else if (name != NULL((void*)0) && find_func(name) != NULL((void*)0))
19756 emsg_funcname(e_funcexts, name);
19757 }
19758
19759 if (!eap->skip && did_emsg)
19760 goto erret;
19761
19762 msg_putchar('\n'); /* don't overwrite the function name */
19763 cmdline_row = msg_row;
19764 }
19765
19766 indent = 2;
19767 nesting = 0;
19768 for (;; ) {
19769 if (KeyTyped) {
19770 msg_scroll = TRUE1;
19771 saved_wait_return = FALSE0;
19772 }
19773 need_wait_return = FALSE0;
19774 sourcing_lnum_off = sourcing_lnum;
19775
19776 if (line_arg != NULL((void*)0)) {
19777 /* Use eap->arg, split up in parts by line breaks. */
19778 theline = line_arg;
19779 p = vim_strchr(theline, '\n');
19780 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
19781 line_arg += STRLEN(line_arg)strlen((char *)(line_arg));
19782 else {
19783 *p = NUL'\000';
19784 line_arg = p + 1;
19785 }
19786 } else if (eap->getline == NULL((void*)0))
19787 theline = getcmdline(':', 0L, indent);
19788 else
19789 theline = eap->getline(':', eap->cookie, indent);
19790 if (KeyTyped)
19791 lines_left = Rows - 1;
19792 if (theline == NULL((void*)0)) {
19793 EMSG(_("E126: Missing :endfunction"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E126: Missing :endfunction"
))));
19794 goto erret;
19795 }
19796
19797 /* Detect line continuation: sourcing_lnum increased more than one. */
19798 if (sourcing_lnum > sourcing_lnum_off + 1)
19799 sourcing_lnum_off = sourcing_lnum - sourcing_lnum_off - 1;
19800 else
19801 sourcing_lnum_off = 0;
19802
19803 if (skip_until != NULL((void*)0)) {
19804 /* between ":append" and "." and between ":python <<EOF" and "EOF"
19805 * don't check for ":endfunc". */
19806 if (STRCMP(theline, skip_until)strcmp((char *)(theline), (char *)(skip_until)) == 0) {
19807 xfree(skip_until);
19808 skip_until = NULL((void*)0);
19809 }
19810 } else {
19811 /* skip ':' and blanks*/
19812 for (p = theline; ascii_iswhite(*p) || *p == ':'; ++p)
19813 ;
19814
19815 /* Check for "endfunction". */
19816 if (checkforcmd(&p, "endfunction", 4) && nesting-- == 0) {
19817 if (line_arg == NULL((void*)0))
19818 xfree(theline);
19819 break;
19820 }
19821
19822 /* Increase indent inside "if", "while", "for" and "try", decrease
19823 * at "end". */
19824 if (indent > 2 && STRNCMP(p, "end", 3)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("end"), (size_t)(3)) == 0)
19825 indent -= 2;
19826 else if (STRNCMP(p, "if", 2)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("if"), (size_t)(2)) == 0
19827 || STRNCMP(p, "wh", 2)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("wh"), (size_t)(2)) == 0
19828 || STRNCMP(p, "for", 3)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("for"), (size_t)(3)) == 0
19829 || STRNCMP(p, "try", 3)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("try"), (size_t)(3)) == 0)
19830 indent += 2;
19831
19832 /* Check for defining a function inside this function. */
19833 if (checkforcmd(&p, "function", 2)) {
19834 if (*p == '!') {
19835 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
19836 }
19837 p += eval_fname_script(p);
19838 xfree(trans_function_name(&p, TRUE1, 0, NULL((void*)0)));
19839 if (*skipwhite(p) == '(') {
19840 nesting++;
19841 indent += 2;
19842 }
19843 }
19844
19845 /* Check for ":append" or ":insert". */
19846 p = skip_range(p, NULL((void*)0));
19847 if ((p[0] == 'a' && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[1])(((unsigned)(p[1]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(p[1]) <=
'Z') || ((unsigned)(p[1]) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(p[
1]) <= 'z')) || p[1] == 'p'))
19848 || (p[0] == 'i'
19849 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[1])(((unsigned)(p[1]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(p[1]) <=
'Z') || ((unsigned)(p[1]) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(p[
1]) <= 'z')) || (p[1] == 'n'
19850 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[2])(((unsigned)(p[2]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(p[2]) <=
'Z') || ((unsigned)(p[2]) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(p[
2]) <= 'z')) ||
19851 (p[2] == 's'))))))
19852 skip_until = vim_strsave((char_u *)".");
19853
19854 // Check for ":python <<EOF", ":lua <<EOF", etc.
19855 arg = skipwhite(skiptowhite(p));
19856 if (arg[0] == '<' && arg[1] =='<'
19857 && ((p[0] == 'p' && p[1] == 'y'
19858 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[2])(((unsigned)(p[2]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(p[2]) <=
'Z') || ((unsigned)(p[2]) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(p[
2]) <= 'z')) || p[2] == 't'))
19859 || (p[0] == 'p' && p[1] == 'e'
19860 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[2])(((unsigned)(p[2]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(p[2]) <=
'Z') || ((unsigned)(p[2]) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(p[
2]) <= 'z')) || p[2] == 'r'))
19861 || (p[0] == 't' && p[1] == 'c'
19862 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[2])(((unsigned)(p[2]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(p[2]) <=
'Z') || ((unsigned)(p[2]) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(p[
2]) <= 'z')) || p[2] == 'l'))
19863 || (p[0] == 'l' && p[1] == 'u' && p[2] == 'a'
19864 && !ASCII_ISALPHA(p[3])(((unsigned)(p[3]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(p[3]) <=
'Z') || ((unsigned)(p[3]) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(p[
3]) <= 'z')))
19865 || (p[0] == 'r' && p[1] == 'u' && p[2] == 'b'
19866 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[3])(((unsigned)(p[3]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(p[3]) <=
'Z') || ((unsigned)(p[3]) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(p[
3]) <= 'z')) || p[3] == 'y'))
19867 || (p[0] == 'm' && p[1] == 'z'
19868 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[2])(((unsigned)(p[2]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(p[2]) <=
'Z') || ((unsigned)(p[2]) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(p[
2]) <= 'z')) || p[2] == 's'))
19869 )) {
19870 /* ":python <<" continues until a dot, like ":append" */
19871 p = skipwhite(arg + 2);
19872 if (*p == NUL'\000')
19873 skip_until = vim_strsave((char_u *)".");
19874 else
19875 skip_until = vim_strsave(p);
19876 }
19877 }
19878
19879 /* Add the line to the function. */
19880 ga_grow(&newlines, 1 + sourcing_lnum_off);
19881
19882 /* Copy the line to newly allocated memory. get_one_sourceline()
19883 * allocates 250 bytes per line, this saves 80% on average. The cost
19884 * is an extra alloc/free. */
19885 p = vim_strsave(theline);
19886 if (line_arg == NULL((void*)0))
19887 xfree(theline);
19888 theline = p;
19889
19890 ((char_u **)(newlines.ga_data))[newlines.ga_len++] = theline;
19891
19892 /* Add NULL lines for continuation lines, so that the line count is
19893 * equal to the index in the growarray. */
19894 while (sourcing_lnum_off-- > 0)
19895 ((char_u **)(newlines.ga_data))[newlines.ga_len++] = NULL((void*)0);
19896
19897 /* Check for end of eap->arg. */
19898 if (line_arg != NULL((void*)0) && *line_arg == NUL'\000')
19899 line_arg = NULL((void*)0);
19900 }
19901
19902 /* Don't define the function when skipping commands or when an error was
19903 * detected. */
19904 if (eap->skip || did_emsg)
19905 goto erret;
19906
19907 /*
19908 * If there are no errors, add the function
19909 */
19910 if (fudi.fd_dict == NULL((void*)0)) {
19911 v = find_var(name, &ht, FALSE0);
19912 if (v != NULL((void*)0) && v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FUNC3) {
19913 emsg_funcname(N_("E707: Function name conflicts with variable: %s")"E707: Function name conflicts with variable: %s",
19914 name);
19915 goto erret;
19916 }
19917
19918 fp = find_func(name);
19919 if (fp != NULL((void*)0)) {
19920 if (!eap->forceit) {
19921 emsg_funcname(e_funcexts, name);
19922 goto erret;
19923 }
19924 if (fp->uf_refcount > 1 || fp->uf_calls > 0) {
19925 emsg_funcname(N_("E127: Cannot redefine function %s: It is in use")"E127: Cannot redefine function %s: It is in use",
19926 name);
19927 goto erret;
19928 }
19929 /* redefine existing function */
19930 ga_clear_strings(&(fp->uf_args));
19931 ga_clear_strings(&(fp->uf_lines));
19932 xfree(name);
19933 name = NULL((void*)0);
19934 }
19935 } else {
19936 char numbuf[20];
19937
19938 fp = NULL((void*)0);
19939 if (fudi.fd_newkey == NULL((void*)0) && !eap->forceit) {
19940 EMSG(_(e_funcdict))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_funcdict))));
19941 goto erret;
19942 }
19943 if (fudi.fd_di == NULL((void*)0)) {
19944 if (tv_check_lock(fudi.fd_dict->dv_lock, eap->arg, false0)) {
19945 // Can't add a function to a locked dictionary
19946 goto erret;
19947 }
19948 } else if (tv_check_lock(fudi.fd_di->di_tv.v_lock, eap->arg, false0)) {
19949 // Can't change an existing function if it is locked
19950 goto erret;
19951 }
19952
19953 /* Give the function a sequential number. Can only be used with a
19954 * Funcref! */
19955 xfree(name);
19956 sprintf(numbuf, "%d", ++func_nr);
19957 name = vim_strsave((char_u *)numbuf);
19958 }
19959
19960 if (fp == NULL((void*)0)) {
19961 if (fudi.fd_dict == NULL((void*)0) && vim_strchr(name, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') != NULL((void*)0)) {
19962 int slen, plen;
19963 char_u *scriptname;
19964
19965 /* Check that the autoload name matches the script name. */
19966 int j = FAIL0;
19967 if (sourcing_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
19968 scriptname = autoload_name(name);
19969 p = vim_strchr(scriptname, '/');
19970 plen = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
19971 slen = (int)STRLEN(sourcing_name)strlen((char *)(sourcing_name));
19972 if (slen > plen && fnamecmp(p,vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)(sourcing_name + slen -
plen))
19973 sourcing_name + slen - plen)vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)(sourcing_name + slen -
plen)) == 0)
19974 j = OK1;
19975 xfree(scriptname);
19976 }
19977 if (j == FAIL0) {
19978 EMSG2(_(emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E746: Function name does not match script file name: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name))
19979 "E746: Function name does not match script file name: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E746: Function name does not match script file name: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name))
19980 name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E746: Function name does not match script file name: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name));
19981 goto erret;
19982 }
19983 }
19984
19985 fp = xmalloc(sizeof(ufunc_T) + STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)));
19986
19987 if (fudi.fd_dict != NULL((void*)0)) {
19988 if (fudi.fd_di == NULL((void*)0)) {
19989 /* add new dict entry */
19990 fudi.fd_di = dictitem_alloc(fudi.fd_newkey);
19991 if (dict_add(fudi.fd_dict, fudi.fd_di) == FAIL0) {
19992 xfree(fudi.fd_di);
19993 xfree(fp);
19994 goto erret;
19995 }
19996 } else
19997 /* overwrite existing dict entry */
19998 clear_tv(&fudi.fd_di->di_tv);
19999 fudi.fd_di->di_tv.v_type = VAR_FUNC3;
20000 fudi.fd_di->di_tv.v_lock = 0;
20001 fudi.fd_di->di_tv.vval.v_string = vim_strsave(name);
20002
20003 /* behave like "dict" was used */
20004 flags |= FC_DICT4;
20005 }
20006
20007 /* insert the new function in the function list */
20008 STRCPY(fp->uf_name, name)strcpy((char *)(fp->uf_name), (char *)(name));
20009 if (hash_add(&func_hashtab, UF2HIKEY(fp)((fp)->uf_name)) == FAIL0) {
20010 xfree(fp);
20011 goto erret;
20012 }
20013 }
20014 fp->uf_refcount = 1;
20015 fp->uf_args = newargs;
20016 fp->uf_lines = newlines;
20017 fp->uf_tml_count = NULL((void*)0);
20018 fp->uf_tml_total = NULL((void*)0);
20019 fp->uf_tml_self = NULL((void*)0);
20020 fp->uf_profiling = FALSE0;
20021 if (prof_def_func())
20022 func_do_profile(fp);
20023 fp->uf_varargs = varargs;
20024 fp->uf_flags = flags;
20025 fp->uf_calls = 0;
20026 fp->uf_script_ID = current_SID;
20027 goto ret_free;
20028
20029erret:
20030 ga_clear_strings(&newargs);
20031 ga_clear_strings(&newlines);
20032ret_free:
20033 xfree(skip_until);
20034 xfree(fudi.fd_newkey);
20035 xfree(name);
20036 did_emsg |= saved_did_emsg;
20037 need_wait_return |= saved_wait_return;
20038}
20039
20040/*
20041 * Get a function name, translating "<SID>" and "<SNR>".
20042 * Also handles a Funcref in a List or Dictionary.
20043 * Returns the function name in allocated memory, or NULL for failure.
20044 * flags:
20045 * TFN_INT: internal function name OK
20046 * TFN_QUIET: be quiet
