20047 * TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD: do not use script autoloading
20048 * Advances "pp" to just after the function name (if no error).
20049 */
20050static char_u *
20051trans_function_name (
20052 char_u **pp,
20053 int skip, /* only find the end, don't evaluate */
20054 int flags,
20055 funcdict_T *fdp /* return: info about dictionary used */
20056)
20057{
20058 char_u *name = NULL((void*)0);
20059 char_u *start;
20060 char_u *end;
20061 int lead;
20062 char_u sid_buf[20];
20063 int len;
20064 lval_T lv;
20065
20066 if (fdp != NULL((void*)0))
20067 memset(fdp, 0, sizeof(funcdict_T));
20068 start = *pp;
20069
20070 /* Check for hard coded <SNR>: already translated function ID (from a user
20071 * command). */
20072 if ((*pp)[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80) && (*pp)[1] == KS_EXTRA253
20073 && (*pp)[2] == (int)KE_SNR) {
20074 *pp += 3;
20075 len = get_id_len(pp) + 3;
20076 return vim_strnsave(start, len);
20077 }
20078
20079 /* A name starting with "<SID>" or "<SNR>" is local to a script. But
20080 * don't skip over "s:", get_lval() needs it for "s:dict.func". */
20081 lead = eval_fname_script(start);
20082 if (lead > 2)
20083 start += lead;
20084
20085 /* Note that TFN_ flags use the same values as GLV_ flags. */
20086 end = get_lval(start, NULL((void*)0), &lv, FALSE0, skip, flags,
20087 lead > 2 ? 0 : FNE_CHECK_START2);
20088 if (end == start) {
20089 if (!skip)
20090 EMSG(_("E129: Function name required"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E129: Function name required"
))));
20091 goto theend;
20092 }
20093 if (end == NULL((void*)0) || (lv.ll_tv != NULL((void*)0) && (lead > 2 || lv.ll_range))) {
20094 /*
20095 * Report an invalid expression in braces, unless the expression
20096 * evaluation has been cancelled due to an aborting error, an
20097 * interrupt, or an exception.
20098 */
20099 if (!aborting()) {
20100 if (end != NULL((void*)0))
20101 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(start
));
20102 } else
20103 *pp = find_name_end(start, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FNE_INCL_BR1);
20104 goto theend;
20105 }
20106
20107 if (lv.ll_tv != NULL((void*)0)) {
20108 if (fdp != NULL((void*)0)) {
20109 fdp->fd_dict = lv.ll_dict;
20110 fdp->fd_newkey = lv.ll_newkey;
20111 lv.ll_newkey = NULL((void*)0);
20112 fdp->fd_di = lv.ll_di;
20113 }
20114 if (lv.ll_tv->v_type == VAR_FUNC3 && lv.ll_tv->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)) {
20115 name = vim_strsave(lv.ll_tv->vval.v_string);
20116 *pp = end;
20117 } else {
20118 if (!skip && !(flags & TFN_QUIET2) && (fdp == NULL((void*)0)
20119 || lv.ll_dict == NULL((void*)0) ||
20120 fdp->fd_newkey == NULL((void*)0)))
20121 EMSG(_(e_funcref))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_funcref))));
20122 else
20123 *pp = end;
20124 name = NULL((void*)0);
20125 }
20126 goto theend;
20127 }
20128
20129 if (lv.ll_name == NULL((void*)0)) {
20130 /* Error found, but continue after the function name. */
20131 *pp = end;
20132 goto theend;
20133 }
20134
20135 /* Check if the name is a Funcref. If so, use the value. */
20136 if (lv.ll_exp_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
20137 len = (int)STRLEN(lv.ll_exp_name)strlen((char *)(lv.ll_exp_name));
20138 name = deref_func_name(lv.ll_exp_name, &len, flags & TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD4);
20139 if (name == lv.ll_exp_name)
20140 name = NULL((void*)0);
20141 } else {
20142 len = (int)(end - *pp);
20143 name = deref_func_name(*pp, &len, flags & TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD4);
20144 if (name == *pp)
20145 name = NULL((void*)0);
20146 }
20147 if (name != NULL((void*)0)) {
20148 name = vim_strsave(name);
20149 *pp = end;
20150 if (strncmp((char *)name, "<SNR>", 5) == 0) {
20151 // Change "<SNR>" to the byte sequence.
20152 name[0] = K_SPECIAL(0x80);
20153 name[1] = KS_EXTRA253;
20154 name[2] = (int)KE_SNR;
20155 memmove(name + 3, name + 5, strlen((char *)name + 5) + 1);
20156 }
20157 goto theend;
20158 }
20159
20160 if (lv.ll_exp_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
20161 len = (int)STRLEN(lv.ll_exp_name)strlen((char *)(lv.ll_exp_name));
20162 if (lead <= 2 && lv.ll_name == lv.ll_exp_name
20163 && STRNCMP(lv.ll_name, "s:", 2)strncmp((char *)(lv.ll_name), (char *)("s:"), (size_t)(2)) == 0) {
20164 /* When there was "s:" already or the name expanded to get a
20165 * leading "s:" then remove it. */
20166 lv.ll_name += 2;
20167 len -= 2;
20168 lead = 2;
20169 }
20170 } else {
20171 // Skip over "s:" and "g:".
20172 if (lead == 2 || (lv.ll_name[0] == 'g' && lv.ll_name[1] == ':')) {
20173 lv.ll_name += 2;
20174 }
20175 len = (int)(end - lv.ll_name);
20176 }
20177
20178 /*
20179 * Copy the function name to allocated memory.
20180 * Accept <SID>name() inside a script, translate into <SNR>123_name().
20181 * Accept <SNR>123_name() outside a script.
20182 */
20183 if (skip)
20184 lead = 0; /* do nothing */
20185 else if (lead > 0) {
20186 lead = 3;
20187 if ((lv.ll_exp_name != NULL((void*)0) && eval_fname_sid(lv.ll_exp_name))
20188 || eval_fname_sid(*pp)) {
20189 /* It's "s:" or "<SID>" */
20190 if (current_SID <= 0) {
20191 EMSG(_(e_usingsid))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_usingsid))));
20192 goto theend;
20193 }
20194 sprintf((char *)sid_buf, "%" PRId64"l" "d" "_", (int64_t)current_SID);
20195 lead += (int)STRLEN(sid_buf)strlen((char *)(sid_buf));
20196 }
20197 } else if (!(flags & TFN_INT1) && builtin_function(lv.ll_name, len)) {
20198 EMSG2(_("E128: Function name must start with a capital or \"s:\": %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E128: Function name must start with a capital or \"s:\": %s"
))), (char_u *)(start))
20199 start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E128: Function name must start with a capital or \"s:\": %s"
))), (char_u *)(start));
20200 goto theend;
20201 }
20202
20203 if (!skip && !(flags & TFN_QUIET2)) {
20204 char_u *cp = vim_strchr(lv.ll_name, ':');
20205
20206 if (cp != NULL((void*)0) && cp < end) {
20207 EMSG2(_("E884: Function name cannot contain a colon: %s"), start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E884: Function name cannot contain a colon: %s"
))), (char_u *)(start));
20208 goto theend;
20209 }
20210 }
20211
20212 name = xmalloc(len + lead + 1);
20213 if (lead > 0){
20214 name[0] = K_SPECIAL(0x80);
20215 name[1] = KS_EXTRA253;
20216 name[2] = (int)KE_SNR;
20217 if (lead > 3) /* If it's "<SID>" */
20218 STRCPY(name + 3, sid_buf)strcpy((char *)(name + 3), (char *)(sid_buf));
20219 }
20220 memmove(name + lead, lv.ll_name, (size_t)len);
20221 name[lead + len] = NUL'\000';
20222 *pp = end;
20223
20224theend:
20225 clear_lval(&lv);
20226 return name;
20227}
20228
20229/*
20230 * Return 5 if "p" starts with "<SID>" or "<SNR>" (ignoring case).
20231 * Return 2 if "p" starts with "s:".
20232 * Return 0 otherwise.
20233 */
20234static int eval_fname_script(char_u *p)
20235{
20236 if (p[0] == '<' && (STRNICMP(p + 1, "SID>", 4)strncasecmp((char *)(p + 1), (char *)("SID>"), (size_t)(4)
) == 0
20237 || STRNICMP(p + 1, "SNR>", 4)strncasecmp((char *)(p + 1), (char *)("SNR>"), (size_t)(4)
) == 0))
20238 return 5;
20239 if (p[0] == 's' && p[1] == ':')
20240 return 2;
20241 return 0;
20242}
20243
20244/*
20245 * Return TRUE if "p" starts with "<SID>" or "s:".
20246 * Only works if eval_fname_script() returned non-zero for "p"!
20247 */
20248static int eval_fname_sid(char_u *p)
20249{
20250 return *p == 's' || TOUPPER_ASC(p[2])(((p[2]) < 'a' || (p[2]) > 'z') ? (p[2]) : (p[2]) - ('a'
- 'A')) == 'I';
20251}
20252
20253/*
20254 * List the head of the function: "name(arg1, arg2)".
20255 */
20256static void list_func_head(ufunc_T *fp, int indent)
20257{
20258 msg_start();
20259 if (indent)
20260 MSG_PUTS(" ")msg_puts((char_u *)(" "));
20261 MSG_PUTS("function ")msg_puts((char_u *)("function "));
20262 if (fp->uf_name[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80)) {
20263 MSG_PUTS_ATTR("<SNR>", hl_attr(HLF_8))msg_puts_attr((char_u *)("<SNR>"), (highlight_attr[(int
)(HLF_8)]));
20264 msg_puts(fp->uf_name + 3);
20265 } else
20266 msg_puts(fp->uf_name);
20267 msg_putchar('(');
20268 int j;
20269 for (j = 0; j < fp->uf_args.ga_len; ++j) {
20270 if (j)
20271 MSG_PUTS(", ")msg_puts((char_u *)(", "));
20272 msg_puts(FUNCARG(fp, j)((char_u **)(fp->uf_args.ga_data))[j]);
20273 }
20274 if (fp->uf_varargs) {
20275 if (j)
20276 MSG_PUTS(", ")msg_puts((char_u *)(", "));
20277 MSG_PUTS("...")msg_puts((char_u *)("..."));
20278 }
20279 msg_putchar(')');
20280 if (fp->uf_flags & FC_ABORT1)
20281 MSG_PUTS(" abort")msg_puts((char_u *)(" abort"));
20282 if (fp->uf_flags & FC_RANGE2)
20283 MSG_PUTS(" range")msg_puts((char_u *)(" range"));
20284 if (fp->uf_flags & FC_DICT4)
20285 MSG_PUTS(" dict")msg_puts((char_u *)(" dict"));
20286 msg_clr_eos();
20287 if (p_verbose > 0)
20288 last_set_msg(fp->uf_script_ID);
20289}
20290
20291/*
20292 * Find a function by name, return pointer to it in ufuncs.
20293 * Return NULL for unknown function.
20294 */
20295static ufunc_T *find_func(char_u *name)
20296{
20297 hashitem_T *hi;
20298
20299 hi = hash_find(&func_hashtab, name);
20300 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
20301 return HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf)));
20302 return NULL((void*)0);
20303}
20304
20305#if defined(EXITFREE)
20306void free_all_functions(void)
20307{
20308 hashitem_T *hi;
20309
20310 /* Need to start all over every time, because func_free() may change the
20311 * hash table. */
20312 while (func_hashtab.ht_used > 0)
20313 for (hi = func_hashtab.ht_array;; ++hi)
20314 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
20315 func_free(HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf))));
20316 break;
20317 }
20318}
20319
20320#endif
20321
20322int translated_function_exists(char_u *name)
20323{
20324 if (builtin_function(name, -1)) {
20325 return find_internal_func(name) >= 0;
20326 }
20327 return find_func(name) != NULL((void*)0);
20328}
20329
20330/*
20331 * Return TRUE if a function "name" exists.
20332 */
20333static int function_exists(char_u *name)
20334{
20335 char_u *nm = name;
20336 char_u *p;
20337 int n = FALSE0;
20338
20339 p = trans_function_name(&nm, FALSE0, TFN_INT1|TFN_QUIET2|TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD4,
20340 NULL((void*)0));
20341 nm = skipwhite(nm);
20342
20343 /* Only accept "funcname", "funcname ", "funcname (..." and
20344 * "funcname(...", not "funcname!...". */
20345 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && (*nm == NUL'\000' || *nm == '('))
20346 n = translated_function_exists(p);
20347 xfree(p);
20348 return n;
20349}
20350
20351/// Return TRUE if "name" looks like a builtin function name: starts with a
20352/// lower case letter and doesn't contain AUTOLOAD_CHAR.
20353/// "len" is the length of "name", or -1 for NUL terminated.
20354static bool_Bool builtin_function(char_u *name, int len)
20355{
20356 if (!ASCII_ISLOWER(name[0])((unsigned)(name[0]) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(name[0])
<= 'z')) {
20357 return FALSE0;
20358 }
20359
20360 char_u *p = vim_strchr(name, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#');
20361
20362 return p == NULL((void*)0)
20363 || (len > 0 && p > name + len);
20364}
20365
20366/*
20367 * Start profiling function "fp".
20368 */
20369static void func_do_profile(ufunc_T *fp)
20370{
20371 int len = fp->uf_lines.ga_len;
20372
20373 if (len == 0)
20374 len = 1; /* avoid getting error for allocating zero bytes */
20375 fp->uf_tm_count = 0;
20376 fp->uf_tm_self = profile_zero();
20377 fp->uf_tm_total = profile_zero();
20378
20379 if (fp->uf_tml_count == NULL((void*)0)) {
20380 fp->uf_tml_count = xcalloc(len, sizeof(int));
20381 }
20382
20383 if (fp->uf_tml_total == NULL((void*)0)) {
20384 fp->uf_tml_total = xcalloc(len, sizeof(proftime_T));
20385 }
20386
20387 if (fp->uf_tml_self == NULL((void*)0)) {
20388 fp->uf_tml_self = xcalloc(len, sizeof(proftime_T));
20389 }
20390
20391 fp->uf_tml_idx = -1;
20392
20393 fp->uf_profiling = TRUE1;
20394}
20395
20396/*
20397 * Dump the profiling results for all functions in file "fd".
20398 */
20399void func_dump_profile(FILE *fd)
20400{
20401 hashitem_T *hi;
20402 int todo;
20403 ufunc_T *fp;
20404 ufunc_T **sorttab;
20405 int st_len = 0;
20406
20407 todo = (int)func_hashtab.ht_used;
20408 if (todo == 0)
20409 return; /* nothing to dump */
20410
20411 sorttab = xmalloc(sizeof(ufunc_T *) * todo);
20412
20413 for (hi = func_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
20414 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
20415 --todo;
20416 fp = HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf)));
20417 if (fp->uf_profiling) {
20418 sorttab[st_len++] = fp;
20419
20420 if (fp->uf_name[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80))
20421 fprintf(fd, "FUNCTION <SNR>%s()\n", fp->uf_name + 3);
20422 else
20423 fprintf(fd, "FUNCTION %s()\n", fp->uf_name);
20424 if (fp->uf_tm_count == 1)
20425 fprintf(fd, "Called 1 time\n");
20426 else
20427 fprintf(fd, "Called %d times\n", fp->uf_tm_count);
20428 fprintf(fd, "Total time: %s\n", profile_msg(fp->uf_tm_total));
20429 fprintf(fd, " Self time: %s\n", profile_msg(fp->uf_tm_self));
20430 fprintf(fd, "\n");
20431 fprintf(fd, "count total (s) self (s)\n");
20432
20433 for (int i = 0; i < fp->uf_lines.ga_len; ++i) {
20434 if (FUNCLINE(fp, i)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[i] == NULL((void*)0))
20435 continue;
20436 prof_func_line(fd, fp->uf_tml_count[i],
20437 &fp->uf_tml_total[i], &fp->uf_tml_self[i], TRUE1);
20438 fprintf(fd, "%s\n", FUNCLINE(fp, i)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[i]);
20439 }
20440 fprintf(fd, "\n");
20441 }
20442 }
20443 }
20444
20445 if (st_len > 0) {
20446 qsort((void *)sorttab, (size_t)st_len, sizeof(ufunc_T *),
20447 prof_total_cmp);
20448 prof_sort_list(fd, sorttab, st_len, "TOTAL", FALSE0);
20449 qsort((void *)sorttab, (size_t)st_len, sizeof(ufunc_T *),
20450 prof_self_cmp);
20451 prof_sort_list(fd, sorttab, st_len, "SELF", TRUE1);
20452 }
20453
20454 xfree(sorttab);
20455}
20456
20457static void
20458prof_sort_list (
20459 FILE *fd,
20460 ufunc_T **sorttab,
20461 int st_len,
20462 char *title,
20463 int prefer_self /* when equal print only self time */
20464)
20465{
20466 int i;
20467 ufunc_T *fp;
20468
20469 fprintf(fd, "FUNCTIONS SORTED ON %s TIME\n", title);
20470 fprintf(fd, "count total (s) self (s) function\n");
20471 for (i = 0; i < 20 && i < st_len; ++i) {
20472 fp = sorttab[i];
20473 prof_func_line(fd, fp->uf_tm_count, &fp->uf_tm_total, &fp->uf_tm_self,
20474 prefer_self);
20475 if (fp->uf_name[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80))
20476 fprintf(fd, " <SNR>%s()\n", fp->uf_name + 3);
20477 else
20478 fprintf(fd, " %s()\n", fp->uf_name);
20479 }
20480 fprintf(fd, "\n");
20481}
20482
20483/*
20484 * Print the count and times for one function or function line.
20485 */
20486static void prof_func_line(
20487 FILE *fd,
20488 int count,
20489 proftime_T *total,
20490 proftime_T *self,
20491 int prefer_self /* when equal print only self time */
20492 )
20493{
20494 if (count > 0) {
20495 fprintf(fd, "%5d ", count);
20496 if (prefer_self && profile_equal(*total, *self))
20497 fprintf(fd, " ");
20498 else
20499 fprintf(fd, "%s ", profile_msg(*total));
20500 if (!prefer_self && profile_equal(*total, *self))
20501 fprintf(fd, " ");
20502 else
20503 fprintf(fd, "%s ", profile_msg(*self));
20504 } else
20505 fprintf(fd, " ");
20506}
20507
20508/*
20509 * Compare function for total time sorting.
20510 */
20511static int prof_total_cmp(const void *s1, const void *s2)
20512{
20513 ufunc_T *p1 = *(ufunc_T **)s1;
20514 ufunc_T *p2 = *(ufunc_T **)s2;
20515 return profile_cmp(p1->uf_tm_total, p2->uf_tm_total);
20516}
20517
20518/*
20519 * Compare function for self time sorting.
20520 */
20521static int prof_self_cmp(const void *s1, const void *s2)
20522{
20523 ufunc_T *p1 = *(ufunc_T **)s1;
20524 ufunc_T *p2 = *(ufunc_T **)s2;
20525 return profile_cmp(p1->uf_tm_self, p2->uf_tm_self);
20526}
20527
20528
20529/*
20530 * If "name" has a package name try autoloading the script for it.
20531 * Return TRUE if a package was loaded.
20532 */
20533static int
20534script_autoload (
20535 char_u *name,
20536 int reload /* load script again when already loaded */
20537)
20538{
20539 char_u *p;
20540 char_u *scriptname, *tofree;
20541 int ret = FALSE0;
20542 int i;
20543
20544 /* If there is no '#' after name[0] there is no package name. */
20545 p = vim_strchr(name, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#');
20546 if (p == NULL((void*)0) || p == name)
20547 return FALSE0;
20548
20549 tofree = scriptname = autoload_name(name);
20550
20551 /* Find the name in the list of previously loaded package names. Skip
20552 * "autoload/", it's always the same. */
20553 for (i = 0; i < ga_loaded.ga_len; ++i)
20554 if (STRCMP(((char_u **)ga_loaded.ga_data)[i] + 9, scriptname + 9)strcmp((char *)(((char_u **)ga_loaded.ga_data)[i] + 9), (char
*)(scriptname + 9)) == 0)
20555 break;
20556 if (!reload && i < ga_loaded.ga_len)
20557 ret = FALSE0; /* was loaded already */
20558 else {
20559 /* Remember the name if it wasn't loaded already. */
20560 if (i == ga_loaded.ga_len) {
20561 GA_APPEND(char_u *, &ga_loaded, scriptname)do { ga_grow(&ga_loaded, 1); ((char_u * *)(&ga_loaded
)->ga_data)[(&ga_loaded)->ga_len++] = (scriptname);
} while (0);
20562 tofree = NULL((void*)0);
20563 }
20564
20565 /* Try loading the package from $VIMRUNTIME/autoload/<name>.vim */
20566 if (source_runtime(scriptname, FALSE0) == OK1)
20567 ret = TRUE1;
20568 }
20569
20570 xfree(tofree);
20571 return ret;
20572}
20573
20574/*
20575 * Return the autoload script name for a function or variable name.
20576 */
20577static char_u *autoload_name(char_u *name)
20578{
20579 /* Get the script file name: replace '#' with '/', append ".vim". */
20580 char_u *scriptname = xmalloc(STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)) + 14);
20581 STRCPY(scriptname, "autoload/")strcpy((char *)(scriptname), (char *)("autoload/"));
20582 STRCAT(scriptname, name)strcat((char *)(scriptname), (char *)(name));
20583 *vim_strrchr(scriptname, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') = NUL'\000';
20584 STRCAT(scriptname, ".vim")strcat((char *)(scriptname), (char *)(".vim"));
20585
20586 char_u *p;
20587 while ((p = vim_strchr(scriptname, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#')) != NULL((void*)0))
20588 *p = '/';
20589
20590 return scriptname;
20591}
20592
20593
20594/*
20595 * Function given to ExpandGeneric() to obtain the list of user defined
20596 * function names.
20597 */
20598char_u *get_user_func_name(expand_T *xp, int idx)
20599{
20600 static size_t done;
20601 static hashitem_T *hi;
20602 ufunc_T *fp;
20603
20604 if (idx == 0) {
20605 done = 0;
20606 hi = func_hashtab.ht_array;
20607 }
20608 assert(hi)((hi) ? (void) (0) : __assert_fail ("hi", "/home/travis/build/neovim/bot-ci/build/neovim/src/nvim/eval.c"
, 20608, __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
20609 if (done < func_hashtab.ht_used) {
20610 if (done++ > 0)
20611 ++hi;
20612 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
20613 ++hi;
20614 fp = HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf)));
20615
20616 if (fp->uf_flags & FC_DICT4)
20617 return (char_u *)""; /* don't show dict functions */
20618
20619 if (STRLEN(fp->uf_name)strlen((char *)(fp->uf_name)) + 4 >= IOSIZE(1024+1))
20620 return fp->uf_name; /* prevents overflow */
20621
20622 cat_func_name(IObuff, fp);
20623 if (xp->xp_context != EXPAND_USER_FUNC) {
20624 STRCAT(IObuff, "(")strcat((char *)(IObuff), (char *)("("));
20625 if (!fp->uf_varargs && GA_EMPTY(&fp->uf_args)((&fp->uf_args)->ga_len <= 0))
20626 STRCAT(IObuff, ")")strcat((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(")"));
20627 }
20628 return IObuff;
20629 }
20630 return NULL((void*)0);
20631}
20632
20633
20634/*
20635 * Copy the function name of "fp" to buffer "buf".
20636 * "buf" must be able to hold the function name plus three bytes.
20637 * Takes care of script-local function names.
20638 */
20639static void cat_func_name(char_u *buf, ufunc_T *fp)
20640{
20641 if (fp->uf_name[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80)) {
20642 STRCPY(buf, "<SNR>")strcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)("<SNR>"));
20643 STRCAT(buf, fp->uf_name + 3)strcat((char *)(buf), (char *)(fp->uf_name + 3));
20644 } else
20645 STRCPY(buf, fp->uf_name)strcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)(fp->uf_name));
20646}
20647
20648/*
20649 * ":delfunction {name}"
20650 */
20651void ex_delfunction(exarg_T *eap)
20652{
20653 ufunc_T *fp = NULL((void*)0);
20654 char_u *p;
20655 char_u *name;
20656 funcdict_T fudi;
20657
20658 p = eap->arg;
20659 name = trans_function_name(&p, eap->skip, 0, &fudi);
20660 xfree(fudi.fd_newkey);
20661 if (name == NULL((void*)0)) {
20662 if (fudi.fd_dict != NULL((void*)0) && !eap->skip)
20663 EMSG(_(e_funcref))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_funcref))));
20664 return;
20665 }
20666 if (!ends_excmd(*skipwhite(p))) {
20667 xfree(name);
20668 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
20669 return;
20670 }
20671 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(p);
20672 if (eap->nextcmd != NULL((void*)0))
20673 *p = NUL'\000';
20674
20675 if (!eap->skip)
20676 fp = find_func(name);
20677 xfree(name);
20678
20679 if (!eap->skip) {
20680 if (fp == NULL((void*)0)) {
20681 EMSG2(_(e_nofunc), eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_nofunc))), (char_u *)(eap
->arg));
20682 return;
20683 }
20684 if (fp->uf_calls > 0) {
20685 EMSG2(_("E131: Cannot delete function %s: It is in use"), eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E131: Cannot delete function %s: It is in use"
))), (char_u *)(eap->arg));
20686 return;
20687 }
20688 // check `uf_refcount > 2` because deleting a function should also reduce
20689 // the reference count, and 1 is the initial refcount.
20690 if (fp->uf_refcount > 2) {
20691 EMSG2(_("Cannot delete function %s: It is being used internally"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("Cannot delete function %s: It is being used internally"
))), (char_u *)(eap->arg))
20692 eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("Cannot delete function %s: It is being used internally"
))), (char_u *)(eap->arg));
20693 return;
20694 }
20695
20696 if (fudi.fd_dict != NULL((void*)0)) {
20697 /* Delete the dict item that refers to the function, it will
20698 * invoke func_unref() and possibly delete the function. */
20699 dictitem_remove(fudi.fd_dict, fudi.fd_di);
20700 } else
20701 func_free(fp);
20702 }
20703}
20704
20705/*
20706 * Free a function and remove it from the list of functions.
20707 */
20708static void func_free(ufunc_T *fp)
20709{
20710 hashitem_T *hi;
20711
20712 /* clear this function */
20713 ga_clear_strings(&(fp->uf_args));
20714 ga_clear_strings(&(fp->uf_lines));
20715 xfree(fp->uf_tml_count);
20716 xfree(fp->uf_tml_total);
20717 xfree(fp->uf_tml_self);
20718
20719 /* remove the function from the function hashtable */
20720 hi = hash_find(&func_hashtab, UF2HIKEY(fp)((fp)->uf_name));
20721 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
20722 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "func_free()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("func_free()"
));
20723 else
20724 hash_remove(&func_hashtab, hi);
20725
20726 xfree(fp);
20727}
20728
20729/*
20730 * Unreference a Function: decrement the reference count and free it when it
20731 * becomes zero. Only for numbered functions.
20732 */
20733void func_unref(char_u *name)
20734{
20735 ufunc_T *fp;
20736
20737 if (name != NULL((void*)0) && isdigit(*name)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*name))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISdigit)) {
20738 fp = find_func(name);
20739 if (fp == NULL((void*)0)) {
20740 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "func_unref()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("func_unref()"
));
20741 } else {
20742 user_func_unref(fp);
20743 }
20744 }
20745}
20746
20747static void user_func_unref(ufunc_T *fp)
20748{
20749 if (--fp->uf_refcount <= 0) {
20750 // Only delete it when it's not being used. Otherwise it's done
20751 // when "uf_calls" becomes zero.
20752 if (fp->uf_calls == 0) {
20753 func_free(fp);
20754 }
20755 }
20756}
20757
20758/*
20759 * Count a reference to a Function.
20760 */
20761void func_ref(char_u *name)
20762{
20763 ufunc_T *fp;
20764
20765 if (name != NULL((void*)0) && isdigit(*name)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*name))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISdigit)) {
20766 fp = find_func(name);
20767 if (fp == NULL((void*)0))
20768 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "func_ref()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("func_ref()"
));
20769 else
20770 ++fp->uf_refcount;
20771 }
20772}
20773
20774/*
20775 * Call a user function.
20776 */
20777static void
20778call_user_func (
20779 ufunc_T *fp, /* pointer to function */
20780 int argcount, /* nr of args */
20781 typval_T *argvars, /* arguments */
20782 typval_T *rettv, /* return value */
20783 linenr_T firstline, /* first line of range */
20784 linenr_T lastline, /* last line of range */
20785 dict_T *selfdict /* Dictionary for "self" */
20786)
20787{
20788 char_u *save_sourcing_name;
20789 linenr_T save_sourcing_lnum;
20790 scid_T save_current_SID;
20791 funccall_T *fc;
20792 int save_did_emsg;
20793 static int depth = 0;
20794 dictitem_T *v;
20795 int fixvar_idx = 0; /* index in fixvar[] */
20796 int ai;
20797 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN65];
20798 char_u *name;
20799 proftime_T wait_start;
20800 proftime_T call_start;
20801 bool_Bool did_save_redo = false0;
20802
20803 /* If depth of calling is getting too high, don't execute the function */
20804 if (depth >= p_mfd) {
20805 EMSG(_("E132: Function call depth is higher than 'maxfuncdepth'"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E132: Function call depth is higher than 'maxfuncdepth'"
))));
20806 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
20807 rettv->vval.v_number = -1;
20808 return;
20809 }
20810 ++depth;
20811 // Save search patterns and redo buffer.
20812 save_search_patterns();
20813 if (!ins_compl_active()) {
20814 saveRedobuff();
20815 did_save_redo = true1;
20816 }
20817 ++fp->uf_calls;
20818 // check for CTRL-C hit
20819 line_breakcheck();
20820 // prepare the funccall_T structure
20821 fc = xmalloc(sizeof(funccall_T));
20822 fc->caller = current_funccal;
20823 current_funccal = fc;
20824 fc->func = fp;
20825 fc->rettv = rettv;
20826 rettv->vval.v_number = 0;
20827 fc->linenr = 0;
20828 fc->returned = FALSE0;
20829 fc->level = ex_nesting_level;
20830 /* Check if this function has a breakpoint. */
20831 fc->breakpoint = dbg_find_breakpoint(FALSE0, fp->uf_name, (linenr_T)0);
20832 fc->dbg_tick = debug_tick;
20833
20834 /*
20835 * Note about using fc->fixvar[]: This is an array of FIXVAR_CNT variables
20836 * with names up to VAR_SHORT_LEN long. This avoids having to alloc/free
20837 * each argument variable and saves a lot of time.
20838 */
20839 /*
20840 * Init l: variables.
20841 */
20842 init_var_dict(&fc->l_vars, &fc->l_vars_var, VAR_DEF_SCOPE2);
20843 if (selfdict != NULL((void*)0)) {
20844 /* Set l:self to "selfdict". Use "name" to avoid a warning from
20845 * some compiler that checks the destination size. */
20846 v = &fc->fixvar[fixvar_idx++].var;
20847#ifndef __clang_analyzer__1
20848 name = v->di_key;
20849 STRCPY(name, "self")strcpy((char *)(name), (char *)("self"));
20850#endif
20851 v->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 + DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
20852 hash_add(&fc->l_vars.dv_hashtab, DI2HIKEY(v)((v)->di_key));
20853 v->di_tv.v_type = VAR_DICT5;
20854 v->di_tv.v_lock = 0;
20855 v->di_tv.vval.v_dict = selfdict;
20856 ++selfdict->dv_refcount;
20857 }
20858
20859 /*
20860 * Init a: variables.
20861 * Set a:0 to "argcount".
20862 * Set a:000 to a list with room for the "..." arguments.
20863 */
20864 init_var_dict(&fc->l_avars, &fc->l_avars_var, VAR_SCOPE1);
20865 add_nr_var(&fc->l_avars, &fc->fixvar[fixvar_idx++].var, "0",
20866 (varnumber_T)(argcount - fp->uf_args.ga_len));
20867 /* Use "name" to avoid a warning from some compiler that checks the
20868 * destination size. */
20869 v = &fc->fixvar[fixvar_idx++].var;
20870#ifndef __clang_analyzer__1
20871 name = v->di_key;
20872 STRCPY(name, "000")strcpy((char *)(name), (char *)("000"));
20873#endif
20874 v->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
20875 hash_add(&fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab, DI2HIKEY(v)((v)->di_key));
20876 v->di_tv.v_type = VAR_LIST4;
20877 v->di_tv.v_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
20878 v->di_tv.vval.v_list = &fc->l_varlist;
20879 memset(&fc->l_varlist, 0, sizeof(list_T));
20880 fc->l_varlist.lv_refcount = DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999;
20881 fc->l_varlist.lv_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
20882
20883 /*
20884 * Set a:firstline to "firstline" and a:lastline to "lastline".
20885 * Set a:name to named arguments.
20886 * Set a:N to the "..." arguments.
20887 */
20888 add_nr_var(&fc->l_avars, &fc->fixvar[fixvar_idx++].var, "firstline",
20889 (varnumber_T)firstline);
20890 add_nr_var(&fc->l_avars, &fc->fixvar[fixvar_idx++].var, "lastline",
20891 (varnumber_T)lastline);
20892 for (int i = 0; i < argcount; ++i) {
20893 ai = i - fp->uf_args.ga_len;
20894 if (ai < 0)
20895 /* named argument a:name */
20896 name = FUNCARG(fp, i)((char_u **)(fp->uf_args.ga_data))[i];
20897 else {
20898 /* "..." argument a:1, a:2, etc. */
20899 sprintf((char *)numbuf, "%d", ai + 1);
20900 name = numbuf;
20901 }
20902 if (fixvar_idx < FIXVAR_CNT12 && STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)) <= VAR_SHORT_LEN20) {
20903 v = &fc->fixvar[fixvar_idx++].var;
20904 v->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
20905 } else {
20906 v = xmalloc(sizeof(dictitem_T) + STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)));
20907 v->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4 | DI_FLAGS_ALLOC16;
20908 }
20909 STRCPY(v->di_key, name)strcpy((char *)(v->di_key), (char *)(name));
20910 hash_add(&fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab, DI2HIKEY(v)((v)->di_key));
20911
20912 /* Note: the values are copied directly to avoid alloc/free.
20913 * "argvars" must have VAR_FIXED for v_lock. */
20914 v->di_tv = argvars[i];
20915 v->di_tv.v_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
20916
20917 if (ai >= 0 && ai < MAX_FUNC_ARGS20) {
20918 list_append(&fc->l_varlist, &fc->l_listitems[ai]);
20919 fc->l_listitems[ai].li_tv = argvars[i];
20920 fc->l_listitems[ai].li_tv.v_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
20921 }
20922 }
20923
20924 /* Don't redraw while executing the function. */
20925 ++RedrawingDisabled;
20926 save_sourcing_name = sourcing_name;
20927 save_sourcing_lnum = sourcing_lnum;
20928 sourcing_lnum = 1;
20929 sourcing_name = xmalloc((save_sourcing_name == NULL((void*)0) ? 0 : STRLEN(save_sourcing_name)strlen((char *)(save_sourcing_name)))
20930 + STRLEN(fp->uf_name)strlen((char *)(fp->uf_name)) + 13);
20931 {
20932 if (save_sourcing_name != NULL((void*)0)
20933 && STRNCMP(save_sourcing_name, "function ", 9)strncmp((char *)(save_sourcing_name), (char *)("function "), (
size_t)(9)) == 0)
20934 sprintf((char *)sourcing_name, "%s..", save_sourcing_name);
20935 else
20936 STRCPY(sourcing_name, "function ")strcpy((char *)(sourcing_name), (char *)("function "));
20937 cat_func_name(sourcing_name + STRLEN(sourcing_name)strlen((char *)(sourcing_name)), fp);
20938
20939 if (p_verbose >= 12) {
20940 ++no_wait_return;
20941 verbose_enter_scroll();
20942
20943 smsg(_("calling %s")gettext((char *)("calling %s")), sourcing_name);
20944 if (p_verbose >= 14) {
20945 char_u buf[MSG_BUF_LEN480];
20946
20947 msg_puts((char_u *)"(");
20948 for (int i = 0; i < argcount; ++i) {
20949 if (i > 0) {
20950 msg_puts((char_u *)", ");
20951 }
20952 if (argvars[i].v_type == VAR_NUMBER1) {
20953 msg_outnum((long)argvars[i].vval.v_number);
20954 } else {
20955 // Do not want errors such as E724 here.
20956 ++emsg_off;
20957 char_u *s = (char_u *) tv2string(&argvars[i], NULL((void*)0));
20958 char_u *tofree = s;
20959 --emsg_off;
20960 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
20961 if (vim_strsize(s) > MSG_BUF_CLEN(480 / 6)) {
20962 trunc_string(s, buf, MSG_BUF_CLEN(480 / 6), MSG_BUF_LEN480);
20963 s = buf;
20964 }
20965 msg_puts(s);
20966 xfree(tofree);
20967 }
20968 }
20969 }
20970 msg_puts((char_u *)")");
20971 }
20972 msg_puts((char_u *)"\n"); /* don't overwrite this either */
20973
20974 verbose_leave_scroll();
20975 --no_wait_return;
20976 }
20977 }
20978
20979 bool_Bool func_not_yet_profiling_but_should =
20980 do_profiling == PROF_YES1
20981 && !fp->uf_profiling && has_profiling(FALSE0, fp->uf_name, NULL((void*)0));
20982
20983 if (func_not_yet_profiling_but_should)
20984 func_do_profile(fp);
20985
20986 bool_Bool func_or_func_caller_profiling =
20987 do_profiling == PROF_YES1
20988 && (fp->uf_profiling
20989 || (fc->caller != NULL((void*)0) && fc->caller->func->uf_profiling));
20990
20991 if (func_or_func_caller_profiling) {
20992 ++fp->uf_tm_count;
20993 call_start = profile_start();
20994 fp->uf_tm_children = profile_zero();
20995 }
20996
20997 if (do_profiling == PROF_YES1) {
20998 script_prof_save(&wait_start);
20999 }
21000
21001 save_current_SID = current_SID;
21002 current_SID = fp->uf_script_ID;
21003 save_did_emsg = did_emsg;
21004 did_emsg = FALSE0;
21005
21006 /* call do_cmdline() to execute the lines */
21007 do_cmdline(NULL((void*)0), get_func_line, (void *)fc,
21008 DOCMD_NOWAIT0x02|DOCMD_VERBOSE0x01|DOCMD_REPEAT0x04);
21009
21010 --RedrawingDisabled;
21011
21012 /* when the function was aborted because of an error, return -1 */
21013 if ((did_emsg &&
21014 (fp->uf_flags & FC_ABORT1)) || rettv->v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
21015 clear_tv(rettv);
21016 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
21017 rettv->vval.v_number = -1;
21018 }
21019
21020 if (func_or_func_caller_profiling) {
21021 call_start = profile_end(call_start);
21022 call_start = profile_sub_wait(wait_start, call_start);
21023 fp->uf_tm_total = profile_add(fp->uf_tm_total, call_start);
21024 fp->uf_tm_self = profile_self(fp->uf_tm_self, call_start,
21025 fp->uf_tm_children);
21026 if (fc->caller != NULL((void*)0) && fc->caller->func->uf_profiling) {
21027 fc->caller->func->uf_tm_children =
21028 profile_add(fc->caller->func->uf_tm_children, call_start);
21029 fc->caller->func->uf_tml_children =
21030 profile_add(fc->caller->func->uf_tml_children, call_start);
21031 }
21032 }
21033
21034 /* when being verbose, mention the return value */
21035 if (p_verbose >= 12) {
21036 ++no_wait_return;
21037 verbose_enter_scroll();
21038
21039 if (aborting())
21040 smsg(_("%s aborted")gettext((char *)("%s aborted")), sourcing_name);
21041 else if (fc->rettv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER1)
21042 smsg(_("%s returning #%" PRId64 "")gettext((char *)("%s returning #%" "l" "d" "")),
21043 sourcing_name, (int64_t)fc->rettv->vval.v_number);
21044 else {
21045 char_u buf[MSG_BUF_LEN480];
21046
21047 // The value may be very long. Skip the middle part, so that we
21048 // have some idea how it starts and ends. smsg() would always
21049 // truncate it at the end. Don't want errors such as E724 here.
21050 ++emsg_off;
21051 char_u *s = (char_u *) tv2string(fc->rettv, NULL((void*)0));
21052 char_u *tofree = s;
21053 --emsg_off;
21054 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
21055 if (vim_strsize(s) > MSG_BUF_CLEN(480 / 6)) {
21056 trunc_string(s, buf, MSG_BUF_CLEN(480 / 6), MSG_BUF_LEN480);
21057 s = buf;
21058 }
21059 smsg(_("%s returning %s")gettext((char *)("%s returning %s")), sourcing_name, s);
21060 xfree(tofree);
21061 }
21062 }
21063 msg_puts((char_u *)"\n"); /* don't overwrite this either */
21064
21065 verbose_leave_scroll();
21066 --no_wait_return;
21067 }
21068
21069 xfree(sourcing_name);
21070 sourcing_name = save_sourcing_name;
21071 sourcing_lnum = save_sourcing_lnum;
21072 current_SID = save_current_SID;
21073 if (do_profiling == PROF_YES1)
21074 script_prof_restore(&wait_start);
21075
21076 if (p_verbose >= 12 && sourcing_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
21077 ++no_wait_return;
21078 verbose_enter_scroll();
21079
21080 smsg(_("continuing in %s")gettext((char *)("continuing in %s")), sourcing_name);
21081 msg_puts((char_u *)"\n"); /* don't overwrite this either */
21082
21083 verbose_leave_scroll();
21084 --no_wait_return;
21085 }
21086
21087 did_emsg |= save_did_emsg;
21088 current_funccal = fc->caller;
21089 --depth;
21090
21091 /* If the a:000 list and the l: and a: dicts are not referenced we can
21092 * free the funccall_T and what's in it. */
21093 if (fc->l_varlist.lv_refcount == DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999
21094 && fc->l_vars.dv_refcount == DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999
21095 && fc->l_avars.dv_refcount == DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999) {
21096 free_funccal(fc, FALSE0);
21097 } else {
21098 hashitem_T *hi;
21099 listitem_T *li;
21100 int todo;
21101
21102 /* "fc" is still in use. This can happen when returning "a:000" or
21103 * assigning "l:" to a global variable.
21104 * Link "fc" in the list for garbage collection later. */
21105 fc->caller = previous_funccal;
21106 previous_funccal = fc;
21107
21108 /* Make a copy of the a: variables, since we didn't do that above. */
21109 todo = (int)fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab.ht_used;
21110 for (hi = fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
21111 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
21112 --todo;
21113 v = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
21114 copy_tv(&v->di_tv, &v->di_tv);
21115 }
21116 }
21117
21118 /* Make a copy of the a:000 items, since we didn't do that above. */
21119 for (li = fc->l_varlist.lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0); li = li->li_next)
21120 copy_tv(&li->li_tv, &li->li_tv);
21121 }
21122
21123 if (--fp->uf_calls <= 0 && isdigit(*fp->uf_name)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*fp->uf_name))] & (unsigned
short int) _ISdigit) && fp->uf_refcount <= 0) {
21124 // Function was unreferenced while being used, free it now.
21125 func_free(fp);
21126 }
21127 // restore search patterns and redo buffer
21128 if (did_save_redo) {
21129 restoreRedobuff();
21130 }
21131 restore_search_patterns();
21132}
21133
21134/*
21135 * Return TRUE if items in "fc" do not have "copyID". That means they are not
21136 * referenced from anywhere that is in use.
21137 */
21138static int can_free_funccal(funccall_T *fc, int copyID)
21139{
21140 return fc->l_varlist.lv_copyID != copyID
21141 && fc->l_vars.dv_copyID != copyID
21142 && fc->l_avars.dv_copyID != copyID;
21143}
21144
21145/*
21146 * Free "fc" and what it contains.
21147 */
21148static void
21149free_funccal (
21150 funccall_T *fc,
21151 int free_val /* a: vars were allocated */
21152)
21153{
21154 listitem_T *li;
21155
21156 /* The a: variables typevals may not have been allocated, only free the
21157 * allocated variables. */
21158 vars_clear_ext(&fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab, free_val);
21159
21160 /* free all l: variables */
21161 vars_clear(&fc->l_vars.dv_hashtab);
21162
21163 /* Free the a:000 variables if they were allocated. */
21164 if (free_val)
21165 for (li = fc->l_varlist.lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0); li = li->li_next)
21166 clear_tv(&li->li_tv);
21167
21168 xfree(fc);
21169}
21170
21171/*
21172 * Add a number variable "name" to dict "dp" with value "nr".
21173 */
21174static void add_nr_var(dict_T *dp, dictitem_T *v, char *name, varnumber_T nr)
21175{
21176#ifndef __clang_analyzer__1
21177 STRCPY(v->di_key, name)strcpy((char *)(v->di_key), (char *)(name));
21178#endif
21179 v->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
21180 hash_add(&dp->dv_hashtab, DI2HIKEY(v)((v)->di_key));
21181 v->di_tv.v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
21182 v->di_tv.v_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
21183 v->di_tv.vval.v_number = nr;
21184}
21185
21186/*
21187 * ":return [expr]"
21188 */
21189void ex_return(exarg_T *eap)
21190{
21191 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
21192 typval_T rettv;
21193 int returning = FALSE0;
21194
21195 if (current_funccal == NULL((void*)0)) {
21196 EMSG(_("E133: :return not inside a function"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E133: :return not inside a function"
))));
21197 return;
21198 }
21199
21200 if (eap->skip)
21201 ++emsg_skip;
21202
21203 eap->nextcmd = NULL((void*)0);
21204 if ((*arg != NUL'\000' && *arg != '|' && *arg != '\n')
21205 && eval0(arg, &rettv, &eap->nextcmd, !eap->skip) != FAIL0) {
21206 if (!eap->skip)
21207 returning = do_return(eap, FALSE0, TRUE1, &rettv);
21208 else
21209 clear_tv(&rettv);
21210 }
21211 /* It's safer to return also on error. */
21212 else if (!eap->skip) {
21213 /*
21214 * Return unless the expression evaluation has been cancelled due to an
21215 * aborting error, an interrupt, or an exception.
21216 */
21217 if (!aborting())
21218 returning = do_return(eap, FALSE0, TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
21219 }
21220
21221 /* When skipping or the return gets pending, advance to the next command
21222 * in this line (!returning). Otherwise, ignore the rest of the line.
21223 * Following lines will be ignored by get_func_line(). */
21224 if (returning)
21225 eap->nextcmd = NULL((void*)0);
21226 else if (eap->nextcmd == NULL((void*)0)) /* no argument */
21227 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
21228
21229 if (eap->skip)
21230 --emsg_skip;
21231}
21232
21233/*
21234 * Return from a function. Possibly makes the return pending. Also called
21235 * for a pending return at the ":endtry" or after returning from an extra
21236 * do_cmdline(). "reanimate" is used in the latter case. "is_cmd" is set
21237 * when called due to a ":return" command. "rettv" may point to a typval_T
21238 * with the return rettv. Returns TRUE when the return can be carried out,
21239 * FALSE when the return gets pending.
21240 */
21241int do_return(exarg_T *eap, int reanimate, int is_cmd, void *rettv)
21242{
21243 int idx;
21244 struct condstack *cstack = eap->cstack;
21245
21246 if (reanimate)
21247 /* Undo the return. */
21248 current_funccal->returned = FALSE0;
21249
21250 /*
21251 * Cleanup (and inactivate) conditionals, but stop when a try conditional
21252 * not in its finally clause (which then is to be executed next) is found.
21253 * In this case, make the ":return" pending for execution at the ":endtry".
21254 * Otherwise, return normally.
21255 */
21256 idx = cleanup_conditionals(eap->cstack, 0, TRUE1);
21257 if (idx >= 0) {
21258 cstack->cs_pending[idx] = CSTP_RETURN24;
21259
21260 if (!is_cmd && !reanimate)
21261 /* A pending return again gets pending. "rettv" points to an
21262 * allocated variable with the rettv of the original ":return"'s
21263 * argument if present or is NULL else. */
21264 cstack->cs_rettvcs_pend.csp_rv[idx] = rettv;
21265 else {
21266 /* When undoing a return in order to make it pending, get the stored
21267 * return rettv. */
21268 if (reanimate) {
21269 assert(current_funccal->rettv)((current_funccal->rettv) ? (void) (0) : __assert_fail ("current_funccal->rettv"
, "/home/travis/build/neovim/bot-ci/build/neovim/src/nvim/eval.c"
, 21269, __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
21270 rettv = current_funccal->rettv;
21271 }
21272
21273 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0)) {
21274 /* Store the value of the pending return. */
21275 cstack->cs_rettvcs_pend.csp_rv[idx] = xcalloc(1, sizeof(typval_T));
21276 *(typval_T *)cstack->cs_rettvcs_pend.csp_rv[idx] = *(typval_T *)rettv;
21277 } else
21278 cstack->cs_rettvcs_pend.csp_rv[idx] = NULL((void*)0);
21279
21280 if (reanimate) {
21281 /* The pending return value could be overwritten by a ":return"
21282 * without argument in a finally clause; reset the default
21283 * return value. */
21284 current_funccal->rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
21285 current_funccal->rettv->vval.v_number = 0;
21286 }
21287 }
21288 report_make_pending(CSTP_RETURN24, rettv);
21289 } else {
21290 current_funccal->returned = TRUE1;
21291
21292 /* If the return is carried out now, store the return value. For
21293 * a return immediately after reanimation, the value is already
21294 * there. */
21295 if (!reanimate && rettv != NULL((void*)0)) {
21296 clear_tv(current_funccal->rettv);
21297 *current_funccal->rettv = *(typval_T *)rettv;
21298 if (!is_cmd)
21299 xfree(rettv);
21300 }
21301 }
21302
21303 return idx < 0;
21304}
21305
21306/*
21307 * Free the variable with a pending return value.
21308 */
21309void discard_pending_return(void *rettv)
21310{
21311 free_tv((typval_T *)rettv);
21312}
21313
21314/*
21315 * Generate a return command for producing the value of "rettv". The result
21316 * is an allocated string. Used by report_pending() for verbose messages.
21317 */
21318char_u *get_return_cmd(void *rettv)
21319{
21320 char_u *s = NULL((void*)0);
21321 char_u *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
21322
21323 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0)) {
21324 tofree = s = (char_u *) echo_string((typval_T *) rettv, NULL((void*)0));
21325 }
21326 if (s == NULL((void*)0)) {
21327 s = (char_u *)"";
21328 }
21329
21330 STRCPY(IObuff, ":return ")strcpy((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(":return "));
21331 STRNCPY(IObuff + 8, s, IOSIZE - 8)strncpy((char *)(IObuff + 8), (char *)(s), (size_t)((1024+1) -
8));
21332 if (STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s)) + 8 >= IOSIZE(1024+1))
21333 STRCPY(IObuff + IOSIZE - 4, "...")strcpy((char *)(IObuff + (1024+1) - 4), (char *)("..."));
21334 xfree(tofree);
21335 return vim_strsave(IObuff);
21336}
21337
21338/*
21339 * Get next function line.
21340 * Called by do_cmdline() to get the next line.
21341 * Returns allocated string, or NULL for end of function.
21342 */
21343char_u *get_func_line(int c, void *cookie, int indent)
21344{
21345 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
21346 ufunc_T *fp = fcp->func;
21347 char_u *retval;
21348 garray_T *gap; /* growarray with function lines */
21349
21350 /* If breakpoints have been added/deleted need to check for it. */
21351 if (fcp->dbg_tick != debug_tick) {
21352 fcp->breakpoint = dbg_find_breakpoint(FALSE0, fp->uf_name,
21353 sourcing_lnum);
21354 fcp->dbg_tick = debug_tick;
21355 }
21356 if (do_profiling == PROF_YES1)
21357 func_line_end(cookie);
21358
21359 gap = &fp->uf_lines;
21360 if (((fp->uf_flags & FC_ABORT1) && did_emsg && !aborted_in_try())
21361 || fcp->returned)
21362 retval = NULL((void*)0);
21363 else {
21364 /* Skip NULL lines (continuation lines). */
21365 while (fcp->linenr < gap->ga_len
21366 && ((char_u **)(gap->ga_data))[fcp->linenr] == NULL((void*)0))
21367 ++fcp->linenr;
21368 if (fcp->linenr >= gap->ga_len)
21369 retval = NULL((void*)0);
21370 else {
21371 retval = vim_strsave(((char_u **)(gap->ga_data))[fcp->linenr++]);
21372 sourcing_lnum = fcp->linenr;
21373 if (do_profiling == PROF_YES1)
21374 func_line_start(cookie);
21375 }
21376 }
21377
21378 /* Did we encounter a breakpoint? */
21379 if (fcp->breakpoint != 0 && fcp->breakpoint <= sourcing_lnum) {
21380 dbg_breakpoint(fp->uf_name, sourcing_lnum);
21381 /* Find next breakpoint. */
21382 fcp->breakpoint = dbg_find_breakpoint(FALSE0, fp->uf_name,
21383 sourcing_lnum);
21384 fcp->dbg_tick = debug_tick;
21385 }
21386
21387 return retval;
21388}
21389
21390/*
21391 * Called when starting to read a function line.
21392 * "sourcing_lnum" must be correct!
21393 * When skipping lines it may not actually be executed, but we won't find out
21394 * until later and we need to store the time now.
21395 */
21396void func_line_start(void *cookie)
21397{
21398 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
21399 ufunc_T *fp = fcp->func;
21400
21401 if (fp->uf_profiling && sourcing_lnum >= 1
21402 && sourcing_lnum <= fp->uf_lines.ga_len) {
21403 fp->uf_tml_idx = sourcing_lnum - 1;
21404 /* Skip continuation lines. */
21405 while (fp->uf_tml_idx > 0 && FUNCLINE(fp, fp->uf_tml_idx)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[fp->uf_tml_idx] == NULL((void*)0))
21406 --fp->uf_tml_idx;
21407 fp->uf_tml_execed = FALSE0;
21408 fp->uf_tml_start = profile_start();
21409 fp->uf_tml_children = profile_zero();
21410 fp->uf_tml_wait = profile_get_wait();
21411 }
21412}
21413
21414/*
21415 * Called when actually executing a function line.
21416 */
21417void func_line_exec(void *cookie)
21418{
21419 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
21420 ufunc_T *fp = fcp->func;
21421
21422 if (fp->uf_profiling && fp->uf_tml_idx >= 0)
21423 fp->uf_tml_execed = TRUE1;
21424}
21425
21426/*
21427 * Called when done with a function line.
21428 */
21429void func_line_end(void *cookie)
21430{
21431 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
21432 ufunc_T *fp = fcp->func;
21433
21434 if (fp->uf_profiling && fp->uf_tml_idx >= 0) {
21435 if (fp->uf_tml_execed) {
21436 ++fp->uf_tml_count[fp->uf_tml_idx];
21437 fp->uf_tml_start = profile_end(fp->uf_tml_start);
21438 fp->uf_tml_start = profile_sub_wait(fp->uf_tml_wait, fp->uf_tml_start);
21439 fp->uf_tml_total[fp->uf_tml_idx] =
21440 profile_add(fp->uf_tml_total[fp->uf_tml_idx], fp->uf_tml_start);
21441 fp->uf_tml_self[fp->uf_tml_idx] =
21442 profile_self(fp->uf_tml_self[fp->uf_tml_idx], fp->uf_tml_start,
21443 fp->uf_tml_children);
21444 }
21445 fp->uf_tml_idx = -1;
21446 }
21447}
21448
21449/*
21450 * Return TRUE if the currently active function should be ended, because a
21451 * return was encountered or an error occurred. Used inside a ":while".
21452 */
21453int func_has_ended(void *cookie)
21454{
21455 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
21456
21457 /* Ignore the "abort" flag if the abortion behavior has been changed due to
21458 * an error inside a try conditional. */
21459 return ((fcp->func->uf_flags & FC_ABORT1) && did_emsg && !aborted_in_try())
21460 || fcp->returned;
21461}
21462
21463/*
21464 * return TRUE if cookie indicates a function which "abort"s on errors.
21465 */
21466int func_has_abort(void *cookie)
21467{
21468 return ((funccall_T *)cookie)->func->uf_flags & FC_ABORT1;
21469}
21470
21471static var_flavour_T var_flavour(char_u *varname)
21472{
21473 char_u *p = varname;
21474
21475 if (ASCII_ISUPPER(*p)((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
)) {
21476 while (*(++p))
21477 if (ASCII_ISLOWER(*p)((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'z'
)) {
21478 return VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION;
21479 }
21480 return VAR_FLAVOUR_SHADA;
21481 } else {
21482 return VAR_FLAVOUR_DEFAULT;
21483 }
21484}
21485
21486/// Iterate over global variables
21487///
21488/// @warning No modifications to global variable dictionary must be performed
21489/// while iteration is in progress.
21490///
21491/// @param[in] iter Iterator. Pass NULL to start iteration.
21492/// @param[out] name Variable name.
21493/// @param[out] rettv Variable value.
21494///
21495/// @return Pointer that needs to be passed to next `var_shada_iter` invocation
21496/// or NULL to indicate that iteration is over.
21497const void *var_shada_iter(const void *const iter, const char **const name,
21498 typval_T *rettv)
21499 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(2, 3)
21500{
21501 const hashitem_T *hi;
21502 const hashitem_T *hifirst = globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_array;
21503 const size_t hinum = (size_t) globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_mask + 1;
21504 *name = NULL((void*)0);
21505 if (iter == NULL((void*)0)) {
21506 hi = globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_array;
21507 while ((size_t) (hi - hifirst) < hinum
21508 && (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)
21509 || var_flavour(HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)))->di_key) != VAR_FLAVOUR_SHADA)) {
21510 hi++;
21511 }
21512 if ((size_t) (hi - hifirst) == hinum) {
21513 return NULL((void*)0);
21514 }
21515 } else {
21516 hi = (const hashitem_T *) iter;
21517 }
21518 *name = (char *) HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)))->di_key;
21519 copy_tv(&(HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)))->di_tv), rettv);
21520 while ((size_t) (++hi - hifirst) < hinum) {
21521 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)
21522 && var_flavour(HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)))->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SHADA) {
21523 return hi;
21524 }
21525 }
21526 return NULL((void*)0);
21527}
21528
21529void var_set_global(const char *const name, typval_T vartv)
21530{
21531 funccall_T *const saved_current_funccal = current_funccal;
21532 current_funccal = NULL((void*)0);
21533 set_var((char_u *) name, &vartv, false0);
21534 current_funccal = saved_current_funccal;
21535}
21536
21537int store_session_globals(FILE *fd)
21538{
21539 hashitem_T *hi;
21540 dictitem_T *this_var;
21541 int todo;
21542 char_u *p, *t;
21543
21544 todo = (int)globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_used;
21545 for (hi = globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
21546 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
21547 --todo;
21548 this_var = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
21549 if ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER1
21550 || this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2)
21551 && var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION) {
21552 /* Escape special characters with a backslash. Turn a LF and
21553 * CR into \n and \r. */
21554 p = vim_strsave_escaped(get_tv_string(&this_var->di_tv),
21555 (char_u *)"\\\"\n\r");
21556 for (t = p; *t != NUL'\000'; ++t)
21557 if (*t == '\n')
21558 *t = 'n';
21559 else if (*t == '\r')
21560 *t = 'r';
21561 if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%s%c",
21562 this_var->di_key,
21563 (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2) ? '"'
21564 : ' ',
21565 p,
21566 (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2) ? '"'
21567 : ' ') < 0)
21568 || put_eol(fd) == FAIL0) {
21569 xfree(p);
21570 return FAIL0;
21571 }
21572 xfree(p);
21573 } else if (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6
21574 && var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION) {
21575 float_T f = this_var->di_tv.vval.v_float;
21576 int sign = ' ';
21577
21578 if (f < 0) {
21579 f = -f;
21580 sign = '-';
21581 }
21582 if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%f",
21583 this_var->di_key, sign, f) < 0)
21584 || put_eol(fd) == FAIL0)
21585 return FAIL0;
21586 }
21587 }
21588 }
21589 return OK1;
21590}
21591
21592/*
21593 * Display script name where an item was last set.
21594 * Should only be invoked when 'verbose' is non-zero.
21595 */
21596void last_set_msg(scid_T scriptID)
21597{
21598 if (scriptID != 0) {
21599 char_u *p = home_replace_save(NULL((void*)0), get_scriptname(scriptID));
21600 verbose_enter();
21601 MSG_PUTS(_("\n\tLast set from "))msg_puts((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("\n\tLast set from "))));
21602 MSG_PUTS(p)msg_puts((char_u *)(p));
21603 xfree(p);
21604 verbose_leave();
21605 }
21606}
21607
21608/*
21609 * List v:oldfiles in a nice way.
21610 */
21611void ex_oldfiles(exarg_T *eap)
21612{
21613 list_T *l = get_vim_var_list(VV_OLDFILES);
21614 listitem_T *li;
21615 long nr = 0;
21616
21617 if (l == NULL((void*)0))
21618 msg((char_u *)_("No old files")gettext((char *)("No old files")));
21619 else {
21620 msg_start();
21621 msg_scroll = TRUE1;
21622 for (li = l->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0) && !got_int; li = li->li_next) {
21623 msg_outnum(++nr);
21624 MSG_PUTS(": ")msg_puts((char_u *)(": "));
21625 msg_outtrans(get_tv_string(&li->li_tv));
21626 msg_putchar('\n');
21627 ui_flush(); /* output one line at a time */
21628 os_breakcheck();
21629 }
21630 /* Assume "got_int" was set to truncate the listing. */
21631 got_int = FALSE0;
21632
21633 // File selection prompt on ":oldfiles!"
21634 if (eap->forceit) {
21635 quit_more = false0;
21636 nr = prompt_for_number(false0);
21637 msg_starthere();
21638 if (nr > 0 && nr <= l->lv_len) {
21639 char_u *p = list_find_str(l, nr);
21640 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) {
21641 return;
21642 }
21643 p = expand_env_save(p);
21644 eap->arg = p;
21645 eap->cmdidx = CMD_edit;
21646 do_exedit(eap, NULL((void*)0));
21647 xfree(p);
21648 }
21649 }
21650 }
21651}
21652
21653// reset v:option_new, v:option_old and v:option_type
21654void reset_v_option_vars(void)
21655{
21656 set_vim_var_string(VV_OPTION_NEW, NULL((void*)0), -1);
21657 set_vim_var_string(VV_OPTION_OLD, NULL((void*)0), -1);
21658 set_vim_var_string(VV_OPTION_TYPE, NULL((void*)0), -1);
21659}
21660
21661/*
21662 * Adjust a filename, according to a string of modifiers.
21663 * *fnamep must be NUL terminated when called. When returning, the length is
21664 * determined by *fnamelen.
21665 * Returns VALID_ flags or -1 for failure.
21666 * When there is an error, *fnamep is set to NULL.
21667 */
21668int
21669modify_fname (
21670 char_u *src, /* string with modifiers */
21671 size_t *usedlen, /* characters after src that are used */
21672 char_u **fnamep, /* file name so far */
21673 char_u **bufp, /* buffer for allocated file name or NULL */
21674 size_t *fnamelen /* length of fnamep */
21675)
21676{
21677 int valid = 0;
21678 char_u *tail;
21679 char_u *s, *p, *pbuf;
21680 char_u dirname[MAXPATHL4096];
21681 int c;
21682 int has_fullname = 0;
21683
21684repeat:
21685 /* ":p" - full path/file_name */
21686 if (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == 'p') {
21687 has_fullname = 1;
21688
21689 valid |= VALID_PATH1;
21690 *usedlen += 2;
21691
21692 /* Expand "~/path" for all systems and "~user/path" for Unix */
21693 if ((*fnamep)[0] == '~'
21694#if !defined(UNIX)
21695 && ((*fnamep)[1] == '/'
21696# ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
21697 || (*fnamep)[1] == '\\'
21698# endif
21699 || (*fnamep)[1] == NUL'\000')
21700
21701#endif
21702 ) {
21703 *fnamep = expand_env_save(*fnamep);
21704 xfree(*bufp); /* free any allocated file name */
21705 *bufp = *fnamep;
21706 if (*fnamep == NULL((void*)0))
21707 return -1;
21708 }
21709
21710 /* When "/." or "/.." is used: force expansion to get rid of it. */
21711 for (p = *fnamep; *p != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(p)(p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)((char_u *)p) : 1)) {
21712 if (vim_ispathsep(*p)
21713 && p[1] == '.'
21714 && (p[2] == NUL'\000'
21715 || vim_ispathsep(p[2])
21716 || (p[2] == '.'
21717 && (p[3] == NUL'\000' || vim_ispathsep(p[3])))))
21718 break;
21719 }
21720
21721 /* FullName_save() is slow, don't use it when not needed. */
21722 if (*p != NUL'\000' || !vim_isAbsName(*fnamep)) {
21723 *fnamep = (char_u *)FullName_save((char *)*fnamep, *p != NUL'\000');
21724 xfree(*bufp); /* free any allocated file name */
21725 *bufp = *fnamep;
21726 if (*fnamep == NULL((void*)0))
21727 return -1;
21728 }
21729
21730 /* Append a path separator to a directory. */
21731 if (os_isdir(*fnamep)) {
21732 /* Make room for one or two extra characters. */
21733 *fnamep = vim_strnsave(*fnamep, STRLEN(*fnamep)strlen((char *)(*fnamep)) + 2);
21734 xfree(*bufp); /* free any allocated file name */
21735 *bufp = *fnamep;
21736 if (*fnamep == NULL((void*)0))
21737 return -1;
21738 add_pathsep((char *)*fnamep);
21739 }
21740 }
21741
21742 /* ":." - path relative to the current directory */
21743 /* ":~" - path relative to the home directory */
21744 /* ":8" - shortname path - postponed till after */
21745 while (src[*usedlen] == ':'
21746 && ((c = src[*usedlen + 1]) == '.' || c == '~' || c == '8')) {
21747 *usedlen += 2;
21748 if (c == '8') {
21749 continue;
21750 }
21751 pbuf = NULL((void*)0);
21752 /* Need full path first (use expand_env() to remove a "~/") */
21753 if (!has_fullname) {
21754 if (c == '.' && **fnamep == '~')
21755 p = pbuf = expand_env_save(*fnamep);
21756 else
21757 p = pbuf = (char_u *)FullName_save((char *)*fnamep, FALSE0);
21758 } else
21759 p = *fnamep;
21760
21761 has_fullname = 0;
21762
21763 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
21764 if (c == '.') {
21765 os_dirname(dirname, MAXPATHL4096);
21766 s = path_shorten_fname(p, dirname);
21767 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
21768 *fnamep = s;
21769 if (pbuf != NULL((void*)0)) {
21770 xfree(*bufp); /* free any allocated file name */
21771 *bufp = pbuf;
21772 pbuf = NULL((void*)0);
21773 }
21774 }
21775 } else {
21776 home_replace(NULL((void*)0), p, dirname, MAXPATHL4096, TRUE1);
21777 /* Only replace it when it starts with '~' */
21778 if (*dirname == '~') {
21779 s = vim_strsave(dirname);
21780 *fnamep = s;
21781 xfree(*bufp);
21782 *bufp = s;
21783 }
21784 }
21785 xfree(pbuf);
21786 }
21787 }
21788
21789 tail = path_tail(*fnamep);
21790 *fnamelen = STRLEN(*fnamep)strlen((char *)(*fnamep));
21791
21792 /* ":h" - head, remove "/file_name", can be repeated */
21793 /* Don't remove the first "/" or "c:\" */
21794 while (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == 'h') {
21795 valid |= VALID_HEAD2;
21796 *usedlen += 2;
21797 s = get_past_head(*fnamep);
21798 while (tail > s && after_pathsep((char *)s, (char *)tail))
21799 mb_ptr_back(*fnamep, tail)(tail -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)((char_u *)*fnamep, (char_u
*)tail - 1) + 1) : 1);
21800 *fnamelen = (size_t)(tail - *fnamep);
21801 if (*fnamelen == 0) {
21802 /* Result is empty. Turn it into "." to make ":cd %:h" work. */
21803 xfree(*bufp);
21804 *bufp = *fnamep = tail = vim_strsave((char_u *)".");
21805 *fnamelen = 1;
21806 } else {
21807 while (tail > s && !after_pathsep((char *)s, (char *)tail))
21808 mb_ptr_back(*fnamep, tail)(tail -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)((char_u *)*fnamep, (char_u
*)tail - 1) + 1) : 1);
21809 }
21810 }
21811
21812 /* ":8" - shortname */
21813 if (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == '8') {
21814 *usedlen += 2;
21815 }
21816
21817
21818 /* ":t" - tail, just the basename */
21819 if (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == 't') {
21820 *usedlen += 2;
21821 *fnamelen -= (size_t)(tail - *fnamep);
21822 *fnamep = tail;
21823 }
21824
21825 /* ":e" - extension, can be repeated */
21826 /* ":r" - root, without extension, can be repeated */
21827 while (src[*usedlen] == ':'
21828 && (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'e' || src[*usedlen + 1] == 'r')) {
21829 /* find a '.' in the tail:
21830 * - for second :e: before the current fname
21831 * - otherwise: The last '.'
21832 */
21833 if (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'e' && *fnamep > tail)
21834 s = *fnamep - 2;
21835 else
21836 s = *fnamep + *fnamelen - 1;
21837 for (; s > tail; --s)
21838 if (s[0] == '.')
21839 break;
21840 if (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'e') { /* :e */
21841 if (s > tail) {
21842 *fnamelen += (size_t)(*fnamep - (s + 1));
21843 *fnamep = s + 1;
21844 } else if (*fnamep <= tail)
21845 *fnamelen = 0;
21846 } else { /* :r */
21847 if (s > tail) /* remove one extension */
21848 *fnamelen = (size_t)(s - *fnamep);
21849 }
21850 *usedlen += 2;
21851 }
21852
21853 /* ":s?pat?foo?" - substitute */
21854 /* ":gs?pat?foo?" - global substitute */
21855 if (src[*usedlen] == ':'
21856 && (src[*usedlen + 1] == 's'
21857 || (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'g' && src[*usedlen + 2] == 's'))) {
21858 char_u *str;
21859 char_u *pat;
21860 char_u *sub;
21861 int sep;
21862 char_u *flags;
21863 int didit = FALSE0;
21864
21865 flags = (char_u *)"";
21866 s = src + *usedlen + 2;
21867 if (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'g') {
21868 flags = (char_u *)"g";
21869 ++s;
21870 }
21871
21872 sep = *s++;
21873 if (sep) {
21874 /* find end of pattern */
21875 p = vim_strchr(s, sep);
21876 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
21877 pat = vim_strnsave(s, (int)(p - s));
21878 s = p + 1;
21879 /* find end of substitution */
21880 p = vim_strchr(s, sep);
21881 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
21882 sub = vim_strnsave(s, (int)(p - s));
21883 str = vim_strnsave(*fnamep, *fnamelen);
21884 *usedlen = (size_t)(p + 1 - src);
21885 s = do_string_sub(str, pat, sub, flags);
21886 *fnamep = s;
21887 *fnamelen = STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s));
21888 xfree(*bufp);
21889 *bufp = s;
21890 didit = TRUE1;
21891 xfree(sub);
21892 xfree(str);
21893 }
21894 xfree(pat);
21895 }
21896 /* after using ":s", repeat all the modifiers */
21897 if (didit)
21898 goto repeat;
21899 }
21900 }
21901
21902 if (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == 'S') {
21903 p = vim_strsave_shellescape(*fnamep, false0, false0);
21904 xfree(*bufp);
21905 *bufp = *fnamep = p;
21906 *fnamelen = STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
21907 *usedlen += 2;
21908 }
21909
21910 return valid;
21911}
21912
21913/*
21914 * Perform a substitution on "str" with pattern "pat" and substitute "sub".
21915 * "flags" can be "g" to do a global substitute.
21916 * Returns an allocated string, NULL for error.
21917 */
21918char_u *do_string_sub(char_u *str, char_u *pat, char_u *sub, char_u *flags)
21919{
21920 int sublen;
21921 regmatch_T regmatch;
21922 int do_all;
21923 char_u *tail;
21924 char_u *end;
21925 garray_T ga;
21926 char_u *save_cpo;
21927 char_u *zero_width = NULL((void*)0);
21928
21929 /* Make 'cpoptions' empty, so that the 'l' flag doesn't work here */
21930 save_cpo = p_cpo;
21931 p_cpo = empty_option;
21932
21933 ga_init(&ga, 1, 200);
21934
21935 do_all = (flags[0] == 'g');
21936
21937 regmatch.rm_ic = p_ic;
21938 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(pat, RE_MAGIC1 + RE_STRING2);
21939 if (regmatch.regprog != NULL((void*)0)) {
21940 tail = str;
21941 end = str + STRLEN(str)strlen((char *)(str));
21942 while (vim_regexec_nl(&regmatch, str, (colnr_T)(tail - str))) {
21943 /* Skip empty match except for first match. */
21944 if (regmatch.startp[0] == regmatch.endp[0]) {
21945 if (zero_width == regmatch.startp[0]) {
21946 /* avoid getting stuck on a match with an empty string */
21947 int i = MB_PTR2LEN(tail)(has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(tail) : 1);
21948 memmove((char_u *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len, tail, (size_t)i);
21949 ga.ga_len += i;
21950 tail += i;
21951 continue;
21952 }
21953 zero_width = regmatch.startp[0];
21954 }
21955
21956 /*
21957 * Get some space for a temporary buffer to do the substitution
21958 * into. It will contain:
21959 * - The text up to where the match is.
21960 * - The substituted text.
21961 * - The text after the match.
21962 */
21963 sublen = vim_regsub(&regmatch, sub, tail, FALSE0, TRUE1, FALSE0);
21964 ga_grow(&ga, (int)((end - tail) + sublen -
21965 (regmatch.endp[0] - regmatch.startp[0])));
21966
21967 /* copy the text up to where the match is */
21968 int i = (int)(regmatch.startp[0] - tail);
21969 memmove((char_u *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len, tail, (size_t)i);
21970 /* add the substituted text */
21971 (void)vim_regsub(&regmatch, sub, (char_u *)ga.ga_data
21972 + ga.ga_len + i, TRUE1, TRUE1, FALSE0);
21973 ga.ga_len += i + sublen - 1;
21974 tail = regmatch.endp[0];
21975 if (*tail == NUL'\000')
21976 break;
21977 if (!do_all)
21978 break;
21979 }
21980
21981 if (ga.ga_data != NULL((void*)0))
21982 STRCPY((char *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len, tail)strcpy((char *)((char *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len), (char *)(tail
));
21983
21984 vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
21985 }
21986
21987 char_u *ret = vim_strsave(ga.ga_data == NULL((void*)0) ? str : (char_u *)ga.ga_data);
21988 ga_clear(&ga);
21989 if (p_cpo == empty_option)
21990 p_cpo = save_cpo;
21991 else
21992 /* Darn, evaluating {sub} expression changed the value. */
21993 free_string_option(save_cpo);
21994
21995 return ret;
21996}
21997
21998static inline TerminalJobData *common_job_init(char **argv,
21999 ufunc_T *on_stdout,
22000 ufunc_T *on_stderr,
22001 ufunc_T *on_exit,
22002 dict_T *self,
22003 bool_Bool pty,
22004 bool_Bool detach)
22005{
22006 TerminalJobData *data = xcalloc(1, sizeof(TerminalJobData));
22007 data->stopped = false0;
22008 data->on_stdout = on_stdout;
22009 data->on_stderr = on_stderr;
22010 data->on_exit = on_exit;
22011 data->self = self;
22012 data->events = queue_new_child(loop.events);
22013 if (pty) {
22014 data->proc.pty = pty_process_init(&loop, data);
22015 } else {
22016 data->proc.uv = libuv_process_init(&loop, data);
22017 }
22018 Process *proc = (Process *)&data->proc;
22019 proc->argv = argv;
22020 proc->in = &data->in;
22021 proc->out = &data->out;
22022 if (!pty) {
22023 proc->err = &data->err;
22024 }
22025 proc->cb = on_process_exit;
22026 proc->events = data->events;
22027 proc->detach = detach;
22028 return data;
22029}
22030
22031/// Return true/false on success/failure.
22032static inline bool_Bool common_job_callbacks(dict_T *vopts, ufunc_T **on_stdout,
22033 ufunc_T **on_stderr, ufunc_T **on_exit)
22034{
22035 if (get_dict_callback(vopts, "on_stdout", on_stdout)
22036 && get_dict_callback(vopts, "on_stderr", on_stderr)
22037 && get_dict_callback(vopts, "on_exit", on_exit)) {
22038 vopts->dv_refcount++;
22039 return true1;
22040 }
22041 if (*on_stdout) {
22042 user_func_unref(*on_stdout);
22043 }
22044 if (*on_stderr) {
22045 user_func_unref(*on_stderr);
22046 }
22047 if (*on_exit) {
22048 user_func_unref(*on_exit);
22049 }
22050 return false0;
22051}
22052
22053static inline bool_Bool common_job_start(TerminalJobData *data, typval_T *rettv)
22054{
22055 Process *proc = (Process *)&data->proc;
22056 if (proc->type == kProcessTypePty && proc->detach) {
22057 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), "terminal/pty job cannot be detached")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)("terminal/pty job cannot be detached"
));
22058 return false0;
22059 }
22060
22061 data->refcount++;
22062 char *cmd = xstrdup(proc->argv[0]);
22063 if (!process_spawn(proc)) {
22064 EMSG2(_(e_jobspawn), cmd)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_jobspawn))), (char_u *)(cmd
));
22065 xfree(cmd);
22066 if (proc->type == kProcessTypePty) {
22067 xfree(data->proc.pty.term_name);
22068 }
22069 rettv->vval.v_number = proc->status;
22070 term_job_data_decref(data);
22071 return false0;
22072 }
22073 xfree(cmd);
22074
22075 data->id = current_job_id++;
22076 wstream_init(proc->in, 0);
22077 if (proc->out) {
22078 rstream_init(proc->out, 0);
22079 rstream_start(proc->out, on_job_stdout);
22080 }
22081 if (proc->err) {
22082 rstream_init(proc->err, 0);
22083 rstream_start(proc->err, on_job_stderr);
22084 }
22085 pmap_put(uint64_t)map_uint64_t_ptr_t_put(jobs, data->id, data);
22086 rettv->vval.v_number = data->id;
22087 return true1;
22088}
22089
22090static inline void free_term_job_data_event(void **argv)
22091{
22092 TerminalJobData *data = argv[0];
22093 if (data->on_stdout) {
22094 user_func_unref(data->on_stdout);
22095 }
22096 if (data->on_stderr) {
22097 user_func_unref(data->on_stderr);
22098 }
22099 if (data->on_exit) {
22100 user_func_unref(data->on_exit);
22101 }
22102
22103 if (data->self) {
22104 dict_unref(data->self);
22105 }
22106 queue_free(data->events);
22107 xfree(data);
22108}
22109
22110static inline void free_term_job_data(TerminalJobData *data)
22111{
22112 // data->queue may still be used after this function returns(process_wait), so
22113 // only free in the next event loop iteration
22114 queue_put(loop.fast_events, free_term_job_data_event, 1, data)queue_put_event(loop.fast_events, event_create(1, free_term_job_data_event
, 1, data));;
22115}
22116
22117// vimscript job callbacks must be executed on Nvim main loop
22118static inline void process_job_event(TerminalJobData *data, ufunc_T *callback,
22119 const char *type, char *buf, size_t count, int status)
22120{
22121 JobEvent event_data;
22122 event_data.received = NULL((void*)0);
22123 if (buf) {
22124 event_data.received = list_alloc();
22125 char *ptr = buf;
22126 size_t remaining = count;
22127 size_t off = 0;
22128
22129 while (off < remaining) {
22130 // append the line
22131 if (ptr[off] == NL'\012') {
22132 list_append_string(event_data.received, (uint8_t *)ptr, off);
22133 size_t skip = off + 1;
22134 ptr += skip;
22135 remaining -= skip;
22136 off = 0;
22137 continue;
22138 }
22139 if (ptr[off] == NUL'\000') {
22140 // Translate NUL to NL
22141 ptr[off] = NL'\012';
22142 }
22143 off++;
22144 }
22145 list_append_string(event_data.received, (uint8_t *)ptr, off);
22146 } else {
22147 event_data.status = status;
22148 }
22149 event_data.data = data;
22150 event_data.callback = callback;
22151 event_data.type = type;
22152 on_job_event(&event_data);
22153}
22154
22155static void on_job_stdout(Stream *stream, RBuffer *buf, size_t count,
22156 void *job, bool_Bool eof)
22157{
22158 TerminalJobData *data = job;
22159 on_job_output(stream, job, buf, count, eof, data->on_stdout, "stdout");
22160}
22161
22162static void on_job_stderr(Stream *stream, RBuffer *buf, size_t count,
22163 void *job, bool_Bool eof)
22164{
22165 TerminalJobData *data = job;
22166 on_job_output(stream, job, buf, count, eof, data->on_stderr, "stderr");
22167}
22168
22169static void on_job_output(Stream *stream, TerminalJobData *data, RBuffer *buf,
22170 size_t count, bool_Bool eof, ufunc_T *callback, const char *type)
22171{
22172 if (eof) {
22173 return;
22174 }
22175
22176 // stub variable, to keep reading consistent with the order of events, only
22177 // consider the count parameter.
22178 size_t r;
22179 char *ptr = rbuffer_read_ptr(buf, &r);
22180
22181 // The order here matters, the terminal must receive the data first because
22182 // process_job_event will modify the read buffer(convert NULs into NLs)
22183 if (data->term) {
22184 terminal_receive(data->term, ptr, count);
22185 }
22186
22187 if (callback) {
22188 process_job_event(data, callback, type, ptr, count, 0);
22189 }
22190
22191 rbuffer_consumed(buf, count);
22192}
22193
22194static void on_process_exit(Process *proc, int status, void *d)
22195{
22196 TerminalJobData *data = d;
22197 if (data->term && !data->exited) {
22198 data->exited = true1;
22199 char msg[22];
22200 snprintf(msg, sizeof msg, "\r\n[Process exited %d]", proc->status);
22201 terminal_close(data->term, msg);
22202 apply_autocmds(EVENT_TERMCLOSE, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), false0, curbuf);
22203 }
22204
22205 if (data->status_ptr) {
22206 *data->status_ptr = status;
22207 }
22208
22209 process_job_event(data, data->on_exit, "exit", NULL((void*)0), 0, status);
22210}
22211
22212static void term_write(char *buf, size_t size, void *d)
22213{
22214 TerminalJobData *data = d;
22215 WBuffer *wbuf = wstream_new_buffer(xmemdup(buf, size), size, 1, xfree);
22216 wstream_write(&data->in, wbuf);
22217}
22218
22219static void term_resize(uint16_t width, uint16_t height, void *d)
22220{
22221 TerminalJobData *data = d;
22222 pty_process_resize(&data->proc.pty, width, height);
22223}
22224
22225static void term_close(void *d)
22226{
22227 TerminalJobData *data = d;
22228 if (!data->exited) {
22229 data->exited = true1;
22230 process_stop((Process *)&data->proc);
22231 }
22232 terminal_destroy(data->term);
22233 term_job_data_decref(d);
22234}
22235
22236static void term_job_data_decref(TerminalJobData *data)
22237{
22238 if (!(--data->refcount)) {
22239 free_term_job_data(data);
22240 }
22241}
22242
22243static void on_job_event(JobEvent *ev)
22244{
22245 if (!ev->callback) {
22246 goto end;
22247 }
22248
22249 typval_T argv[3];
22250 int argc = ev->callback->uf_args.ga_len;
22251
22252 if (argc > 0) {
22253 argv[0].v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
22254 argv[0].v_lock = 0;
22255 argv[0].vval.v_number = ev->data->id;
22256 }
22257
22258 if (argc > 1) {
22259 if (ev->received) {
22260 argv[1].v_type = VAR_LIST4;
22261 argv[1].v_lock = 0;
22262 argv[1].vval.v_list = ev->received;
22263 argv[1].vval.v_list->lv_refcount++;
22264 } else {
22265 argv[1].v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
22266 argv[1].v_lock = 0;
22267 argv[1].vval.v_number = ev->status;
22268 }
22269 }
22270
22271 if (argc > 2) {
22272 argv[2].v_type = VAR_STRING2;
22273 argv[2].v_lock = 0;
22274 argv[2].vval.v_string = (uint8_t *)ev->type;
22275 }
22276
22277 typval_T rettv;
22278 init_tv(&rettv);
22279 call_user_func(ev->callback, argc, argv, &rettv, curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
22280 curwin->w_cursor.lnum, ev->data->self);
22281 clear_tv(&rettv);
22282
22283end:
22284 if (!ev->received) {
22285 // exit event, safe to free job data now
22286 pmap_del(uint64_t)map_uint64_t_ptr_t_del(jobs, ev->data->id);
22287 term_job_data_decref(ev->data);
22288 }
22289}
22290
22291static TerminalJobData *find_job(uint64_t id)
22292{
22293 TerminalJobData *data = pmap_get(uint64_t)map_uint64_t_ptr_t_get(jobs, id);
22294 if (!data || data->stopped) {
22295 return NULL((void*)0);
22296 }
22297 return data;
22298}
22299
22300static void script_host_eval(char *name, typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
22301{
22302 if (check_restricted() || check_secure()) {
22303 return;
22304 }
22305
22306 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_STRING2) {
22307 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
22308 }
22309
22310 list_T *args = list_alloc();
22311 list_append_string(args, argvars[0].vval.v_string, -1);
22312 *rettv = eval_call_provider(name, "eval", args);
22313}
22314
22315typval_T eval_call_provider(char *provider, char *method, list_T *arguments)
22316{
22317 char func[256];
22318 int name_len = snprintf(func, sizeof(func), "provider#%s#Call", provider);
22319
22320 // Save caller scope information
22321 struct caller_scope saved_provider_caller_scope = provider_caller_scope;
22322 provider_caller_scope = (struct caller_scope) {
22323 .SID = current_SID,
22324 .sourcing_name = sourcing_name,
22325 .sourcing_lnum = sourcing_lnum,
22326 .autocmd_fname = autocmd_fname,
22327 .autocmd_match = autocmd_match,
22328 .autocmd_fname_full = autocmd_fname_full,
22329 .autocmd_bufnr = autocmd_bufnr,
22330 .funccalp = save_funccal()
22331 };
22332 provider_call_nesting++;
22333
22334 typval_T argvars[3] = {
22335 {.v_type = VAR_STRING2, .vval.v_string = (uint8_t *)method, .v_lock = 0},
22336 {.v_type = VAR_LIST4, .vval.v_list = arguments, .v_lock = 0},
22337 {.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0}
22338 };
22339 typval_T rettv = {.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0, .v_lock = 0};
22340 arguments->lv_refcount++;
22341
22342 int dummy;
22343 (void)call_func((uint8_t *)func,
22344 name_len,
22345 &rettv,
22346 2,
22347 argvars,
22348 curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
22349 curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
22350 &dummy,
22351 true1,
22352 NULL((void*)0));
22353
22354 list_unref(arguments);
22355 // Restore caller scope information
22356 restore_funccal(provider_caller_scope.funccalp);
22357 provider_caller_scope = saved_provider_caller_scope;
22358 provider_call_nesting--;
22359
22360 return rettv;
22361}
22362
22363bool_Bool eval_has_provider(char *name)
22364{
22365
22366#define check_provider(name)if (has_name == -1) { has_name = !!find_func((uint8_t *)"provider#"
"name" "#Call"); if (!has_name) { script_autoload((uint8_t *
)"provider#" "name" "#Call", 0); has_name = !!find_func((uint8_t
*)"provider#" "name" "#Call"); } } \
22367 if (has_##name == -1) { \
22368 has_##name = !!find_func((uint8_t *)"provider#" #name "#Call"); \
22369 if (!has_##name) { \
22370 script_autoload((uint8_t *)"provider#" #name "#Call", false0); \
22371 has_##name = !!find_func((uint8_t *)"provider#" #name "#Call"); \
22372 } \
22373 }
22374
22375 static int has_clipboard = -1, has_python = -1, has_python3 = -1;
22376
22377 if (!strcmp(name, "clipboard")) {
22378 check_provider(clipboard)if (has_clipboard == -1) { has_clipboard = !!find_func((uint8_t
*)"provider#" "clipboard" "#Call"); if (!has_clipboard) { script_autoload
((uint8_t *)"provider#" "clipboard" "#Call", 0); has_clipboard
= !!find_func((uint8_t *)"provider#" "clipboard" "#Call"); }
};
22379 return has_clipboard;
22380 } else if (!strcmp(name, "python3")) {
22381 check_provider(python3)if (has_python3 == -1) { has_python3 = !!find_func((uint8_t *
)"provider#" "python3" "#Call"); if (!has_python3) { script_autoload
((uint8_t *)"provider#" "python3" "#Call", 0); has_python3 = !
!find_func((uint8_t *)"provider#" "python3" "#Call"); } };
22382 return has_python3;
22383 } else if (!strcmp(name, "python")) {
22384 check_provider(python)if (has_python == -1) { has_python = !!find_func((uint8_t *)"provider#"
"python" "#Call"); if (!has_python) { script_autoload((uint8_t
*)"provider#" "python" "#Call", 0); has_python = !!find_func
((uint8_t *)"provider#" "python" "#Call"); } };
22385 return has_python;
22386 }
22387
22388 return false0;
22389}
22390
22391// Compute the `DictWatcher` address from a QUEUE node. This only exists because
22392// ASAN doesn't handle `QUEUE_DATA` pointer arithmetic, and we blacklist this
22393// function on .asan-blacklist.
22394static DictWatcher *dictwatcher_node_data(QUEUE *q)
22395 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
22396{
22397 return QUEUE_DATA(q, DictWatcher, node)((DictWatcher *) ((char *) (q) - ((char *) &((DictWatcher
*) 0)->node)));
22398}
22399
22400// Send a change notification to all `dict` watchers that match `key`.
22401static void dictwatcher_notify(dict_T *dict, const char *key, typval_T *newtv,
22402 typval_T *oldtv)
22403 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1) FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(2)
22404{
22405 typval_T argv[3];
22406 for (size_t i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(argv)((sizeof(argv)/sizeof((argv)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(argv) %
sizeof((argv)[0]))))); i++) {
22407 init_tv(argv + i);
22408 }
22409
22410 argv[0].v_type = VAR_DICT5;
22411 argv[0].vval.v_dict = dict;
22412 argv[1].v_type = VAR_STRING2;
22413 argv[1].vval.v_string = (char_u *)xstrdup(key);
22414 argv[2].v_type = VAR_DICT5;
22415 argv[2].vval.v_dict = dict_alloc();
22416 argv[2].vval.v_dict->dv_refcount++;
22417
22418 if (newtv) {
22419 dictitem_T *v = dictitem_alloc((char_u *)"new");
22420 copy_tv(newtv, &v->di_tv);
22421 dict_add(argv[2].vval.v_dict, v);
22422 }
22423
22424 if (oldtv) {
22425 dictitem_T *v = dictitem_alloc((char_u *)"old");
22426 copy_tv(oldtv, &v->di_tv);
22427 dict_add(argv[2].vval.v_dict, v);
22428 }
22429
22430 typval_T rettv;
22431
22432 QUEUE *w;
22433 QUEUE_FOREACH(w, &dict->watchers)for ((w) = (*(QUEUE **) &((*(&dict->watchers))[0])
); (w) != (&dict->watchers); (w) = (*(QUEUE **) &(
(*(w))[0]))) {
22434 DictWatcher *watcher = dictwatcher_node_data(w);
22435 if (!watcher->busy && dictwatcher_matches(watcher, key)) {
22436 init_tv(&rettv);
22437 watcher->busy = true1;
22438 call_user_func(watcher->callback, ARRAY_SIZE(argv)((sizeof(argv)/sizeof((argv)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(argv) %
sizeof((argv)[0]))))), argv, &rettv,
22439 curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.lnum, NULL((void*)0));
22440 watcher->busy = false0;
22441 clear_tv(&rettv);
22442 }
22443 }
22444
22445 for (size_t i = 1; i < ARRAY_SIZE(argv)((sizeof(argv)/sizeof((argv)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(argv) %
sizeof((argv)[0]))))); i++) {
22446 clear_tv(argv + i);
22447 }
22448}
22449
22450// Test if `key` matches with with `watcher->key_pattern`
22451static bool_Bool dictwatcher_matches(DictWatcher *watcher, const char *key)
22452 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
22453{
22454 // For now only allow very simple globbing in key patterns: a '*' at the end
22455 // of the string means it should match everything up to the '*' instead of the
22456 // whole string.
22457 char *nul = strchr(watcher->key_pattern, NUL'\000');
22458 size_t len = nul - watcher->key_pattern;
22459 if (*(nul - 1) == '*') {
22460 return !strncmp(key, watcher->key_pattern, len - 1);
22461 } else {
22462 return !strcmp(key, watcher->key_pattern);
22463 }
22464}
22465
22466// Perform all necessary cleanup for a `DictWatcher` instance.
22467static void dictwatcher_free(DictWatcher *watcher)
22468 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
22469{
22470 user_func_unref(watcher->callback);
22471 xfree(watcher->key_pattern);
22472 xfree(watcher);
22473}
22474
22475// Check if `d` has at least one watcher.
22476static bool_Bool is_watched(dict_T *d)
22477{
22478 return d && !QUEUE_EMPTY(&d->watchers)((const QUEUE *) (&d->watchers) == (const QUEUE *) (*(
QUEUE **) &((*(&d->watchers))[0])));
22479}
22480
